train.question:
title: Just as shown
text: So very cute

title: It is very useful, and really save myself from the pain of ...
text: It is very useful, and really save myself from the pain of hitting the corner of table.... Emmm, SAVE MY LIFE...

title: My baby's favorite teethers. The three all have different the textures ...
text: My baby's favorite teethers. The three all have different the textures so he chews on different ones depending on how his mouth feels. Easy for little hands to hold.

title: More Creme than White, BUT Works Great! text: While I ended up not using it, since the color isn't really white it is more of a cream or beige color, I still decided to give it a good star rating and a review for the following reasons:

It is very thick, the material is great and it is very easy to apply. The tape is very strong so that great. I definitely don't agree with the 3 star rating someone else gave. It works very well, again the only reason why I decided to take it off is because I needed white white.. the thing is I guess that's everybody white tone, since I order white from another place with the exact same problem. Can fit on the edge of tables, door frame, counters, cabinet and a lot more.

If you don't mind the color being a little off then this will be perfect for you.

title: Gave as a gift
text: Gave as a gift

title: Perfect
text: Perfect size for corner area and sturdy

title: Satisfied
text: Good quality mirror, the straps to attach are a little tricky but once you have it in place it’s great. Mirror is large and adjustable.

title: Nice Sheets
text: These wash well (very important) and look great. I’ve got two still in crib sheets and these are nice, soft and wear well, They also don’t get tossed all over and stay where they are put. Nice to have extras because it seems they spend a lot of time in the wash. Thankfully they look like they’ll hold up for a while.

title: LOVE!
text: My daughter gets really dry scalp. We love this conditioning spray. It helps keep her hair clean and hydrated during the day. She even says she loves the smell of it. Helps keep her from digging at her scalp as the day goes on.

title: The miracle trainer cup works like a charm
text: We've been through numerous sippy cups for our one year old. We tried to find a straw cup that doesn't leak milk, but didn't have a lot of luck. The miracle trainer cup works like a charm. It doesn't leak, it's spillproof, and our son actually drinks from it. Finally, success. The only downside is a small amount of milk can get caught in the lid rim and spill if the child throws the cup on the table or floor. Overall, this is the best cup we've found for a one-year-old to successfully use to drink milk.

title: Tummy time
text: Keeps the kid busy with tummy time

title: Five Stars
text: Baby loved it. Very durable and cute

title: Very Good Balm
text: I love balms that contain natural ingredients and this balm seems to contain all natural ingredients.  I'm very particular about anything that gets put on my baby niece's skin and want nothing that isn't natural and healthy.  I feel fine applying this to her skin after bathing.  It has hardly any scent either and really seems to be a very good emollient.

title: Cute basket bag
text: This is a very cute Easter basket that looks more like a bag.  It is made out of a canvas like material with a round bottom.  It can be folded up for easy storage.  The only thing is that with folding it up, it has creases in it and it doesn't unfold as nicely so it doesn't sit nicely flat on surfaces.  It also might not stay open for little ones to easily place eggs into the bag during a fast paced egg hunt.  The sequins are color changing, but it is difficult to get the color to change from pink to silver because the sequins are a little rough on the hands.  Going from silver to pink is much easier.  The inside of the bag is lined with a yellowish material.  The bottom of the bag is round and pink.  Overall is is a cute bag that would probably be better for older kids or even for decorating purposes.

title: Great
text: Works great for my Diaper Genie

title: Nice and big text: This playpen is so big and so nice. Was easy to set up. Not sure about taking down because this one has been in the room, set up, and there's no need for me to move it around right now.
Nice and strong. Has a small door where child can get in and out easily if needed.
Plenty of room for toys and whatever.
very nice looking. Seems to be secure.

title: Works great
text: These are easy to use, work great and seem like a pretty good price. They last awhile which is nice that we don’t alway need to change.

title: ADELINE LOVES IT; GOOD SIZE; EASY TO MOVE AROUND text: The MAGDESIGNER Kids' Toy Storage is sturdy, colorful, and easy to move around, even on carpet. The baskets are bigger than expected.

We received our set elsewhere. 1 Purple / 1 Blue. Now, we grownups like them but my Granddaughter, Adeline, loves her new baskets. She started by adding her smaller stuffed animals and eventually filled up both baskets - after we were done playing. Adeline doesn't have to reach deep into the baskets like she did the toybox. We all like that she has control of her toys... It makes our playdates easier and more fun. My daughter tells me Adeline empties and refills the baskets daily.

I recommend purchasing this set from AMAZON. Delivery is much quicker.

title: Recalled for Bezene text: I bought this to avoid oxybezone.
After I used it on my kids, it was recalled for containing benzene.

title: I'm loving this pacifier holder!
text: It is great that someone created innovative product, it helps a lot to lessen the stress, especially for mom's like me. Perfectly functional as it strongly holds the pacifier! This product is a must have for every mom to keep their babies busy.

title: Soft, not too hot, not too cold
text: My kid hates blankets and always kicks it off so when it was time to buy a blanket for her first day of daycare, I was looking for something lighter but that could also qualify for a blanket. This definitely met my expectations and more. I am definitely buying a second one for her. Its muslin-like, but as a blanket. Love it

title: Great price!
text: Cute and different.  Brought for a gift for a newborn.  Great price!

title: Perfect
text: Daughter seems to like them

title: great price & product
text: I actually like these more than the name brand. Plus, my mother in-law uses them!

title: Soft and absorbent
text: [[VIDEOID:361fcd5d6bc333644a06b435a2bb9211]] I was looking for something like this to bath my baby and i am glad i foun this one. I like it is soft once i put it in the water. When it gets dry it becomes hard. It helps better than a washcloth. Until now it hasnt grow mold or had a ba smell like other sponges may get.

title: Simple and effective
text: Easy to install and very inexpensive. Works great and gives you extra security.

title: Five Stars
text: keeps the dogs out of danger

title: Love this sippy cup - perfect for independent babies and mess hating moms
text: While looking for a sippy cup that my son was able to hold himself without spilling the contents and not having to use a training sippy cup that he was frustrated with (soft silicone nippy), I came across this one. I love it and so does my son. It is small and light and perfectly designed for baby to hold it. It has an insert that acts as spill guard. I took it out for my son and spillage is minimal without it. He is able to drink independently without making much of a mess. Debating to get a 2nd one.

title: Will Peel but fixable
text: Not bad but WILL peel off. Add more or buy more adhesive once done. They should come down in price because of this.

title: Perfect
text: Works great, easy to use

title: Nice for babies
text: It's really nice on my baby's skin and it has a very mild, natural kind of scent. Doesn't make his sensitive skin break out or anything

title: Really cute
text: This is a cute sippy cup. I don’t think I under mat and the little beads around the lid. They haven’t broken off, but they worry me that they may become a choking hazard…

title: Ear protection for little ones
text: I get these for all new parents to protect their babies when in loud situations. They are awesome for keeping the little ones ears safe.

title: So hard to open and fold
text: It's so hard to open and fold this stroller. I watched and followed the video carefully but still has to fight with this stroller so much, by the time I open and fold it back I'm dripping in sweat.

title: Tiny
text: They’re so cute but so tiny, will be returning since it won’t work for my 1 year old

title: Nothing soft about it!! :(
text: Stiff and rough. I would NOT use this for my toddler's pillows!! Motel quality. Returning!!

title: Moisturizing just like Vaseline but I do not care for the “after smell” & packaging is odd
text: This works just like Vaseline and is very softening. What I do not like is the aroma as after I rub it in, it smells a bit like a burnt tire. Also, the pill bottle packaging is odd. It makes it difficult to get the entire product out of the jar. I would have preferred a small and squat jar to this one.

title: Perfect for pumping away from
text: Amazing!  The bag and drying combo are perfecting for pumping at work!  I can pack 2 sets of parts and pump 4 times at work!  The perfect size open and so compact and light when folded!  I wish I had found this sooner!

title: Healthy, good ingredients, and daughter liked it!
text: My daughter is 16m and usually isnt too much of a picky eater (at least most days lol.) She likes basically everything in the bowl on it's own so I thought she would like it as a whole. She ate about half in one sitting when we were dining at a restaurant (she likes variety) so I ended up saving the other half for another time (A resealable top could be a good feature for the bowl.) She seemed like she liked it and was trying to feed it to herself on her own (still trying to master a spoon, she thinks it works like a fork lol) the ingredients are great- healthy, organic/non-gmo, nothing artificial or processed. I'd get these again!

title: Best night time diapers!
text: They are great and really hold a lot of baby pee. :) All new parents need this for their night sanity. You’ll be thankful! I am just bummed we didn’t know about them sooner.

title: good for what you pay for
text: Works great at holding the mobile but the sound box that allows it to make noise and spin gets stuck sometimes. I would still buy it and use again.

title: Must have!
text: My daughter has the most sensitive skin, so I knew from the beginning I was going to try burts bees! Again, they never disappoint! She has 0 reaction & it works wonders!

title: Four Stars
text: Super adorable and really lights up more than we’d imagined. My kiddo loves it in her room!

title: Pocket must be flipped for use; bib contains some double-sided tape
text: There are 30 single-use disposable bibs in this package. In order to use the pocket on these bibs, it has to be flipped. There are also some double sided tape squares that can be used to affix this close to a baby's garments. The neck can be opened and taped for a close fit. These bibs work like they are supposed to but I feel this is better for travel than home use due to the expense and the fact that they are not as good as a silicone bib. The current price of $12.34 ($12.99 minus 5%) comes to $.41 cents per bib which is competitively priced.

title: Great cover for car seat.
text: This is a great cover for the car seat.  Used in the car, with the stroller frame that fits the car seat or just when you need to carry the car seat about.  So much easier than fussing with a blanket, it fastens to stay in place.

title: An adorable Lovie for your love
text: This is a very soft elephant with teethers on the feet, a head that has stuffing and two arms that are crinkly and flat, just like the torso and legs. It is easy for baby to grab and if you want to use those plastic toy clips to attach it to a stroller, bouncer or some other baby gear, it has a tab on the head where one can slide through. Baby will love how easily they can clutch this little cutie. Baby will also love chewing on the feet. There is nothing unsafe on this lovely Lovie.

title: Makes a Timer Noise text: I use a wipe warmer for my cloth wipes. I liked the look of this one. It fits my wipes well. The lid is the heating portion and it has the option to turn it off. It is water tight and doesn't leak. The top locks, as well. There is an indicator light to tell you when the warmer is on.
I don't like how this plugs in. The plug is to the top of the warmer and not the bottom, so you have a cord dangling down the back of the warmer, which isn't very convenient.
The warmer also makes a weird clicking noise, like a kitchen timer, when it is on. I'm not sure what is clicking in it, but it is a little disconcerting.
The lid gets VERY warm. So, if the warmer is full, the wipes on top are too hot to use straight out of the warmer. If you only fill it up halfway, the top wipes are fine. I just pull wipes from the middle when the warmer is full.

title: Great for baby text: I have a six week old daughter, and she really likes this mobile. It's nice for her to have something to look at when she is in her crib. Since I have three other kids, sometimes I have to put her in there for a few minutes while I run and get something for the other kids. This helps keep her entertained while I do so.

This was easy to put in. I like its different features. I like that it has a remote control so I don't have to get out of bed to start it (her crib is in my room). I like that it has the projection for the ceiling - I think that is really cute and entertaining. The little animals are colorful and cute. The music is sweet, and I like that it goes on for a full thirty minutes. Some similar products only keep the music on for a few minutes and then you have to restart it and restart it. You can also choose white noise or nature sounds.

I love how versatile this is. Most mobiles are done once the child is a little older, but this one can be used on a tabletop or even on a stroller. I think that is great and will make it last much longer than other ones.

Everything worked fine and it was easy to set up. I am happy with this product.

title: Delightful sleep trainer
text: What a cute way to teach young ones when it is time to sleep and when it is time to wake. This nightlight has a moon that turns on for nighttime and has 4 night songs to calm and help them go to sleep. You program the nightlight signals for waking and sleeping. You can use the included AC adapter or you can use 4 AA batteries. Who isn't going to want to use the ac adapter? Unless you are somewhere without electric.

title: Vibrant, Stain Free, Nicely Packaged,
text: I absolutely love these! They're perfect! I've put in ten of these suckers and it all washed right down the drain! It doesn't stain skin or the tub! The colors are so vibrant! I usually use two big ones, or a small handfull of the smaller ones. The small ones are quite a bit smaller than the big ones, I mean a big difference in size. I'd definitely reccommend this product. I think I've actually already talked a couple friends into buying this already! Totally worth every penny!

title: Bibs
text: Rubber bibs are a life saver. Not a lot of washing.

title: Beautiful high chair but a little wobbly for my comfort
text: Beautiful high chair but a little wobbly for my comfort.  The chair also didn't roll around my kitchen all that well so between that and the wobbling I returned and am now going to get the new 4moms high chair.

title: Generously sized, not too wet, good for every day clean up
text: I tried these on a whim with a coupon plus the subscribe & save discount last month and it turns out that we really like them. Each wipe is generously sized and lightly quilted so they feel soft and sturdy. We've used three packages so far and none have been too wet or too dry for our purposes. We primarily use these wipes in the car and at the barn for hand cleaning, light messes, wiping down dust covered chairs outside and wiping the worst of the mud off the dog paws before the hounds get back in the truck. I'll buy these again.

title: Great
text: Smells great. You can't tell theres a dirty diaper.

title: Awesome value!
text: I got these for putting together basket gifts for friends - two were baby gifts, another was new home, and still have 2 left for future gifts. They are nice, sturdier than anticipated, and are classy for any type of gift basket you want to make. I'm sure they'd be great for storage in a baby room, bathroom, craft room, etc.

title: Be aware before using on child
text: We love these bows but this was gross. I normally just brush things off like this but I’m a beauty business owner too and make sure to keep my own hair out of products. Otherwise great bows.

title: These diapers are great. No leaks yet or rashes and this is ...
text: These diapers are great.  No leaks yet or rashes and this is my second box.

title: Expensive, but cute
text: This mobile comes in at least one other style (owl).  It’s very cute and colorful.  The birds are made of felt.  This mobile attaches to the Halo Bassinets Swivel Sleeper only.  You can manually turn it around, but there is no automatic turning.  There is no music.  It’s really just a very plain and simple mobile.  It’s also quite expensive, for what it is, and for Made in China.  It would be “reasonable” at ten bucks.  But it does have the “cute factor”.

title: good diapers
text: These worked fine for me. Didn't cause any rash, they won't leak if you change them in a timely manner. I prefer organic diapers, but these work in a pinch.

title: Perfect to keep baby cool!
text: Love it!  Take it everywhere with us

title: These have lids that have the worst screw thread ever
text: These have lids that have the worst screw thread ever, and the tops come off with every drop.  Pretty much for kids who are too old for a sippy cup, and then to be used without the tops.

title: great for icy days
text: Got this for the winter snow. We don't get it often, but when we do, it can be pretty bad. My husband has to get out to work and using these really helps with getting on the road a lot quicker than having to wait for the windshield to defrost. We had one for a while but it finally wore out so he wanted a new one. I got this one to replace the old one.

title: Soft and Sweet!
text: Beautiful muslin swaddle blanket for babies.  The color of this is really nice - its not the typical blue, its a soft dusty blue color.  It is 100% cotton muslin, so soft and snuggly.  Beautiful blanket.

title: Review by Allyson Ware text: I wish I would have done an unboxing video of this product. Everything was packaged so perfectly. To top it all off, the story of the creators of this product brought it all together. It includes an instruction manual and a recipe book. Also, make sure to look for the little card to get your lifetime warranty!

This product is very nice. If you leave it sit too long it’s a tad difficult to clean (like anything), but it’s still pretty easy to clean. It is very easy to use, but it does take a little long to make the food. I want to say we walked away and it took about 30 minutes to finish, but we both definitely forgot we turned it on. So if you are looking for something quick, I would not purchase this product. But to make food ahead of time would work well. It is also a little tedious to look up measurements compared to grams and ML. Overall, we are looking forward to using this product more and would recommend it to any family!

title: This is really great!
text: Amazing! Having this infant pacifier makes my baby enjoy her day. She always carry this, it's her new bestfriend. Perfectly safe and durable!

title: A antimicrobial sensory experience! text: I love silicone scrubbers in general as you dont have to launder them (as you would a washcloth), nor do you need to worry about the accumulation of bacteria (as you would with a loofah/sponge). The lather factor is better than a washcloth, but not as sudsy as a sponge/loofah. The size is larger than I expected, so older kids can use it as well.

For anyone with children on the autism spectrum or for kids with sensory-integration challenges, this bath accessory is very sensory-friendly!

In the past, I have also had great success with the Babyfrida nasal respirators which are an ingenious and more effective alternative to those much-hated suction bulbs that are complimentary in every baby first aid kit lol. So I had high expectations for this product considering past impressions with the brand in general. I was not disappointed. Hope this helps.

title: Nice daily diaper cream text: This diaper cream is a daily-use sort which is to keep diaper rash from coming around in the first place. If your child already has diaper rash, and you need to get rid of it, then you will probably want to use a different product.

This product has a nice, though not overpowering, smell. It’s non-greasy and is easy to apply. (You can rub your hands with it as well!)

The price is a bit high. I’m not sure why this is so much more expensive than the baby lotion. Nonetheless, I like the product.

title: Super cute, soft, comfy
text: These head bows are adorable, soft, stretchy & comfy on baby’s head. Comes in several fashionable colors.

title: Doesn't work as titled.
text: I'm glad these were cheap. I wanted them to work. They are definitely NOT spill proof. The lid popped off every single time it was thrown on the floor. Plus, they leak through the straw. And my lo would take the straw out.

title: Cute but thin
text: Cute blanket but not as soft as I thought it was going to be and thin. However it fits the price.

title: Great product
text: Great

title: Nice nutritional profile, but less than ideal taste appeal text: This is a decent snack from a nutritional profile. It's plant-based, is baked rather than fried, and also includes a small amount of probiotics. Each pouch is a single serving, and is appropriately sized for a child's snack. However, the taste appeal was not all that strong compared with the apple & cinnamon version of the same product. The berry taste of this is quite muted, making it a rather tasteless snack for both adults and older kids.

The crunch has good appeal across the board, but there's so little berry taste that made it far less appealing than the apple & cinnamon especially among the older kids (middle school) and the adults. However, the 3 year olds took to this flavor just as well as the apple & cinnamon.

The nutritional profile earns 5 stars, but factoring the taste puts my score at 4 stars. It's a good snack, but the apple & cinnamon is the better option from this brand, especially for school-aged children.

title: Great Idea!
text: I never knew that a product like this was available. It’s a must have for babies! It can be easily heated or can be used cold too. I would suggest heating only though- my personal opinion. It has a cute design soft. Easily adjustable

title: Diaper pail
text: This was just what was needed

title: Four Stars
text: these worked perfect for my pump.  thank you amazon for having them!

title: Good price
text: Good price for what we already were using

title: I love huggies
text: I have tried many different brands of diapers over the years and I have always preferred Huggies to any other brand. They are so absorbent and I do not have leaks with them like I have with others. In my experience, if you have babies with thick thighs then Huggies work better! The amount of diapers you get in this box is amazing and well worth the cost. Its much cheaper than getting them from the super market. The snug and dry line is a step below the little snugglers line but they work just as well. We sleep in them at night just like we do during the day and we don't have any problems with them!

title: Beautiful Gift!
text: This was a gift for any friend’s baby shower and the advertisement does it no justice! It is much larger than expected and so pretty.

title: Uncompromising Quality
text: When it comes to kids you don't compromise on safety. This ktravel system delivers quality in spades. Even better it is easy to assemble asnd use. the stroller itself is attractive. the canopy is large and prvides UV portection while the storage is more than adequate. The foam wheels and all wheel suspension provides a smooth and comfy ride. the car seat is top notch. It is comes with the base and is hassle free to install. the system is light but sturdy. Safety comes first when it comes to kids and it is nice not to hae to sacrifice comfort or quality to keep your youngsters secure.

title: Smells Sooo Good text: It's incredible how this amazing smelling teether is not toxic. My daughter absolutely loves her teether, I bought it for her when she was 15 months, I thought it might be too late for a teether but she seems to enjoy it.
The design is perfect, the two sides with the two different densities and textures is great.
I will def buy again when needed.

title: Boudreaux's you can't beat it for rashes and prevention!
text: I love Boudreaux's butt paste. I didn't get the kit as described or in the photo.  But, since I love Boudreaux's butt paste so much, I will give it 4 stars anyway.  It didn't come with the red tube, but I did receive a bigger tub of the Butt paste.  I see they changed the name of it to Rash Kicking instead of butt paste, but it is what it is.

title: Great deal, great quality
text: Exactly as ordered. Great quality. Would by again.

title: Great innovation that works
text: This is an excellent lock, if you ever loose the key you can always use a regular magnet to unlock it.

title: I don't like it buy my daughter does!
text: I was hoping I could drape a light receiving blanket over it for additional shade when my toddler falls asleep, but it is too flimsy. My toddler loves it to play 'peek-a-boo' with it though! Not sure if I will keep it.

title: Diapers
text: Niece says that the diapers work great

title: DEcent diapers text: We have been using this company every since my first child 13 years ago and have always been happy.

I was pleased with these diapers. I thought they were relatively soft. They held a decent amount. No diaper is perfect and they seemed to do as well as the others. I really like that they are Hypoallergenic and Fragrance Free.

The quality was very good. They were reasonably soft and comfortable. They did a decent job preventing smell. Overall, we were pleased and would recommend them.

title: BUY THIS NOW!!!! text: I always spend HOURS trying to find the best of everything to buy: this is it, this is the one right here. I love this brand. They are reliable and I have used them through three kids over the span of 13 years and they are STILL reliable as they were back then. I have the most awkward wall spacing in my manufactured home and I knew I wasn't far off from the days of needing a baby gate, so I would browse and then fail to commit to one. Eventually my little one was mobile and I still hadn't decided, I almost bought another North States gate that would have required a also purchase an extension piece, then by accident I found this one and it's long enough to cover the entire area I needed. Big bonus, this gate was a much better price-point than having to purchase the two pieces. I ordered this immediately, it came on time, etc, etc. Installation went smoothly, and we removed two extra panels we did not need easily. The system for shaping the gate by simply loosening or tightening a plastic piece at the angles is brilliant, and foolproof. We did install it into studs for safety.

The gate is perfect. We have had it installed for about 6 months now. It has to endure a family of five, including one toddler, a 13 year old, and a 9 year old. EVERYONE SLAMS THIS THING, but it still works! My daughter hasn't learned to open this or climb it and she is 20 months. We have discovered that the gate has scratched our floors at the joint points underneath from all the slamming so beware if your floors are easily scratched.

title: Really cute
text: My granddaughter loves it!

title: Must buy
text: Perfect for our stairs!! Keeps my twins contained

title: Seems like a nice gate text: There are many pictures of this when it’s assembled and installed but I wanted to show a few of it just out of the bo

The design is standard and very comparable to other baby gates I’ve used before

Make sure this is installed correctly especially if near stairs. You’ll definitely want a professional to install this with big hardware if you’re not sure how

Overall I think it’s nice

title: Two Stars
text: can't get rid of smell on lid... use everything

title: Baby teeth friendly text: My son will turn 12 months shortly so we figured we could get some pacifiers that are sized for that age.

We had the stage two so we figured we give this one a try. The key points being that it was stage three being larger and also orthodontic with the consideration for baby teeth coming in.

The stage two we have gotten some moisture inside the nipple.
Hopefully these won't have the same issues over time.

Regardless, these are fine. They work well. He doesn't seem to be bothered by the new ones.
So good to go, either way.

title: These are so cute! I am giving them as ...
text: These are so cute!  I am giving them as a gift and the mother-to-be works in a veterinarian office and has the nursery set up with animals.  I cannot wait to see her little girl each month with these milestone stickers!

title: Eh... text: I bought this because my autistic preschooler is afraid to have his ears cleaned. I finally talked him into letting me go for the giant ball of wax in his ear and it barley removed any. It would chip away at it a teensy bit at a time and my kid was NOT having it by the 3rd go.

Also, why is this so pricey? Maybe good as a baby shower gift if you can afford it but if you are a new mum or a mum on a budget...skip it!

- Mum of 16 years

title: Good but prefer Pampers Swaddlers
text: My third baby is in diapers and these are some of the better diapers we’ve used over the years, but my favorite is still Swaddlers. While they are both comparable for protecting against leaks, the Swaddlers are softer and seem more comfy.

title: Fashion & Function
text: This is a nice product.  It gives a good fit, without chaffing.  Although it's a cute and nice design, its also a good second line of defense to keep from getting poop everywhere.  It also seems like it will last longer than you need it, and I like that only two sizes are necessary over a child's lifecycle.

title: Great for a vacation traveling by car
text: These worked like a charm when I was traveling by myself with my little granddaughter. She had to use it more than I needed to stop myself. So it was nice that you could just pull over let her do her thing and a little pad absorbed everything. I put it in the trunk and then when we stopped at a rest stop just threw it away. It was wonderful.

title: Bought another bag instead. Sold this one. Didn't like the backpack straps.
text: I bought this thinking I would like it, and didn't. Bought another bag instead and sold this one. Didn't like the backpack straps, they wouldn't stay, kepted moving.

title: Four Stars
text: I like that it is talc free

title: Then I really appreciate the fact this bag can really block the smell of my daughters waste.
text: I thought the smell was overwhelming until my daughter started solid foods.  Then I really appreciate the fact this bag can really block the smell of my daughters waste.

title: as described
text: they work as described

title: Four Stars
text: Worked well

title: Must try
text: I’ve been using this on my 2 year old who’s been having trouble going to sleep and wakes up in the middle of the night. I rolled some on her upper back, chest and behind her ears . She has no issues with it . It does tickle her a bit when i roll it on. It’s been 3 days and she has slept throughout the night without waking up and falls asleep within 10-20 mins after i have applied it on. text: Pampers Cruisers are a decent diaper, although they cost more and absorb less than the current Huggies. With these diapers he leaked constantly and got a bad rash right after we started using them.  These diapers have a cute design and good tapes but that is the only good thing I can say about them, not sure where Pampers has gone wrong but they need to make some improvements if they want to remain a premium brand.

title: Great stroller!
text: Recently purchased this to replace a smaller umbrella stroller with a much lower weight limit. Haven't used it outside yet but already really looking forward to using this and it might even end up replacing our larger stroller that was purchased as part of a "travel system". My husband is 6' 4" and can comfortably use this stroller without hunching over. (At 5' 3" the handles are almost a bit tall for me) Super easy to put together and easy to fold and unfold once you figure out exactly how to do it. Folded up, I'd compare it to the size of a folding bagged chair... definitely bigger than our standard size umbrella stroller but much easier to pack than a traditional stroller. Reclining the seat is a bit cumbersome as I almost have to kneel down to adjust it, but I like that it has multi position recline. Rear wheels have a lock on both and front wheels allow the swivel to be locked as well. The cup holder only snaps on the side next to the right handle so I could see that being accidentally knocked off if not careful. Overall, I'm really impressed with this stroller and glad I was able to find something that both my husband and I could use comfortably.

title: The lounger without the Velcro parts is okay; has some holes for small straps - 2.5 stars text: Normally I would say to avoid any type of lounger because infant sleep positioners that include a soft bolster on the sides should NEVER be used for a newborn or young baby due to a risk of Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS). Consumer Reports has done reviews on such products because deaths have been proven. Also, the FDA site lists the same warning. However, this is more like a flat liner than a lounger. In addition, the bolsters that Velcro on do not stick. They fall off immediately. This should not be used with the bolsters anyway.

There are seven strategically placed narrow holes for passing thin stroller straps through this. As long as the baby does not sleep in this unsupervised, it will offer extra cushioning for a stroller or car seat chair.

This can also be used to line a pet carrier even though it is an odd size.

Overall, it is just okay. It is thin and only lightly padded, which makes it a bit safer than the other baby loungers on the market. If this is what one is looking for, then it will do but to me it is a disappointment. Note that the bolsters are garbage. The current price of $19.99 is average.

title: Great stroller text: I am very pleased with this stroller. The first thing I noticed was how big the basket is. For us with four kids, this is a big deal. We always run out of space on the bottom of our strollers, so this is great.

it is a substantial stroller. There is a lot of room for the baby. Another feature I love is that the bottom can come up so there is a place to support the babies legs while she is sleeping. This is great because I have a baby and I always feel bad having her legs just dangling when she falls asleep in the stroller. This can be lowered for older kids, of course.

Now it is not a light/small stroller. It isn't the biggest I've seen but it is not a super light one like some of them are.

I love that it is flexible as far as the design. You can turn the seat around so that it faces you. I like this a lot...

It has a nice look. Basic black goes with most things and works for a boy or a girl.

The handle is pretty high for a stroller. My tall husband really likes this.

It seemed comfortable. All my kids tried it out and they liked it.

It pushed fine.

Overall, it is a quality stroller with a lot of nice features. At the top, in addition to cupholders, it has a little compartment you can close. I liked that. I would recommend this stroller.

title: Cute Idea But Quality Finish Work Is Lacking
text: Please note: I received this item at a discounted rate or for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I was really happy with these when I pulled them out of the packaging which was inside more packaging, which was inside more packaging. That's right they were individually wrapped, then wrapped in a plastic bag, then wrapped in a bigger plastic bag. It took a while to get them out. They would've made great gifts, but I would not buy them for friend now.  Within minutes of pulling these out and looking at them, it was evident that the manufacturing process has not been that great. The fabric is nice and soft, and the prints are adorable, but the sewing leave something to be desired. It looks like they were surged, and then never stood shut. How sad,  because these could've been a stellar product with a little quality control. Looks like four out of six of them have a hole in them. Yep, that's right, four out of six are defective. I'll have to hand so them, or run them through my sewing machine if I can. Still, my daughter likes them and thinks they're adorable. She wanted to wear them all at once.  The good news is, she hates headbands, but she's leaving meson just fine.

title: Decent backpack for the price; remains partially open due to half zipper on top; zippers okay text: At the current price of $21.90, this is a decent backpack. It is versatile as a backpack and/or diaper bag. There is one central compartment that can be opened from the back through a small zippered "access panel" or from the top of the bag. There are several pockets inside the central compartment. Also included is the waterproof changing mat.

The exterior front has one zippered pocket with three tiny bottle pockets for very small baby bottles. There are also two tiny zippered pockets on the sides of the bag. The backpack has snaps on either side of the central compartment but the top does not zipper all the way to the end. This means there's a chance things could fall out if the backpack falls upside down when the snaps are not snapped in place. However, that is most likely a rare occurrence.

The shoulder straps are not well padded at all; it only has light padding which means this is not as comfortable to carry around as it could be.

The pack seems to be made of a material that is water resistant. The zippers on all compartments glide easily but I would not consider them high quality. If the zippers were better, this pack would have received 4 stars from me. In my opinion, this can be used as a stadium backpack because the waterproof changing pad can be used to sit on to avoid cold stadium seats.

title: Excellent, sturdy product; Price/value: only time will tell
text: Economically, there are few frustrations in parenting greater than having to buy items with similar functionalities for different growth stages (car seats, strollers, clothes, of course...).  But this product solves one of such problems - the high chair.  Designed for upto 5 years, the very easy-to-assemble (about 10 min), looks and feels very sturdy, quite colorful (without being too "loud"), and very easy to clean and adjust.  The tray can be very easily removed even with a baby in hand. The more environmental-friendly materials is an added bonus...Overall, the high construction quality will give you confidence on the longevity of the product.  The listed price can give most a pause.  But, at lower price segmentation, it is unlikely to find a product with similar quality and functionality. At this price point, though, one may be able to find competing brands (Keekaroo comes to mind).  For the price, it would've been nice if at least one or two additional cushion sets with different colors included with the chair.  A very high quality product, but the price point should give you some pause on rethinking how much of a premium you place on a furniture that "grows" with your child.

title: Auto-close is awesome, good solid construction text: It closes on it's own, which is perfect for my needs. It is heavy duty construction. The wall posts can be screwed in but unlike another gate I purchased, it came with double sided tape as well. Installation was pretty easy. Auto-close works fine so far.

One note though: The gate requires you to unlatch and lift, which if you have older people in the house it may not be desirable. My mom finds is hard to use.

title: Great lightweight stroller.
text: Evenflo Aero Ultra-Lightweight Stroller, Self-Standing Compact Folding Design, 2 Mesh in-Seat Pockets, Large Storage is a great option for an affordable lightweight stroller. It really does fold down so small which is awesome! My 2 year old, 30lb son did make it more noticeable that I'd have to put more effort into pushing him, but he fit really well in it with room to go. I absolutely love the large storage basket underneath. It has a decent size hood with an extra flip out flap and a nice foot rest for him. I haven't had issues with the wheels, but if I do I will probably just oil them up and see if that helps. I did have a little difficulty raising the back rest back up with my son in the stroller from the lowest position. It comes with 1 cup holder which is pretty nice. The handle does not adjust, but seem to be at a decent height for both me (5'5") and my husband (6'0"). Overall a great, compact, lightweight option that I'd definitely recommend.

title: Superb operation text: I received this as a gift at Christmas and have been enjoying using it. Its very convenient and keeps all the cleanup contained in one bowl.

Best feature - the food processor is _very_ powerful and I don't need to strain foods b/c there are no chunks (I do strain peas to remove shells after processing).

The steamer is quick and efficient. With the steamer basket full, I make about one-week worth of single-ingredient food at a time. I peel foods and cut into chunks before I steam them. Holds about 2 small sweet potatoes or two pears or one bag of frozen peas.

I store foods frozen in silicone mini-muffin pans (much easier to remove than from an ice-cube tray).

This device can be used to defrost food - just pop the frozen food in a small heat-proof bowl first. But, unless you keep a close eye and check a few times, the food gets way too hot. Easier to use the microwave for 30 seconds, then stir well to make sure there are no hot or cold spots.

I will definitely use this when our baby starts to eat our food and it needs to be blenderized first. The blade and motor on the food processor are fabulous and better than others we have.

Cons:
- The price is way too expensive. I received it as a gift, but would not have bought it for myself.
- The spatula is useless, a small silicone spatula is much better.

title: Crippled by a dependence on a poorly-built mobile app text: I've had this for just over a year now and bought it new from a local shop.

THE GOOD: This monitor does one thing great - it has good image quality, especially at night and low light conditions.

THE OKAY: The sensors on this seem decent although the temperature reading always seems a little higher than it really is, even when placed at different locations in the room.

THE BAD: You cannot view the monitor through any other means except their mobile app, which is very unstable, and is (of this review) actually broken on phones running Android 9. This is a HUGE inconvenience. I cannot emphasize how many times over the past year I've wished for a simple desktop PC app or a way to view through my web browser. I didn't think it would be as big of a deal as it really is.

So anytime the developers don't handle an update, it means the monitor is unusable until they get around to releasing an update. As of today, its been about a week without the monitor.

Also, the company's constant answer to nearly every problem is to uninstall the app and reinstall it, which usually works, but is frustrating.

Without a working app, you can't see anything, hear anything, or interact in any way with the monitor unit. Again, a huge problem.

The speaker quality on the unit is severely lacking. I tried playing through some of the built-in lullabies once and certain ones (with lower frequencies/bass tones) just sounded literally like scratchy noise from a horror movie (great if you WANT to wake up your kid and traumatize them).

Using this for an audio monitor again means you need a phone with you with the app active and the volume turned up. If you usually mute your phone at night, you risk end up muting the monitor, too.

BOTTOM LINE: This shouldn't be anyone's ONLY monitor. At minimum you should have a separate audio monitor - we have a DECT one from Philips that has been absolutely rock-solid reliable and gives me peace of mind at night. When I hear the baby through the Philips monitor, I can check on him visually through the iBaby monitor. So it's nice but if I was going to do this all over again I would just buy a camera-only system that was more reliable.

Having two means I can have one on and one in the wash but I recommend getting 2 packages.

title: Works but looks messy text: The edges of my desk are quite sharp, which gets uncomfortable after a while of working at the desk. I often sit crunched up in my chair with my legs against the desk edge, but I couldn’t do that because the desk edge was so sharp. So I thought this silicone edge protector from Angloria would be a great option to dull the sharp edge.

I’ve been using the edge protector for a few weeks, and while it does dull the sharpness of my desk, I don’t like how it looks. The clear silicone is murky and cloudy, and actually gummy in some spots.

Dust and hair stick to the silicone, it’s not easy to clean. And I’m an adult, I can’t imagine how messy it would look if guarding the edge of a toddler play table or similar.

The adhesive is sticky and has kept the edge protector in place. But it was applied messily to the edge protector, and I can see wrinkles in the adhesive through the silicone.

You cannot use them on the "middle drawers" and I cannot use them on many of my cabinets in the kitchen, you have to be able to go around the corner with these and with the way my kitchen is set up, that simply is not possible.  they are also easy to remove if you do use the blow dryer trick and heat up the adhesive a bit before trying to remove, that way they do not take off the paint. I ended up just using them on his dresser drawers and a small side table that has a drawer, it is fine for that, but didn't need 20 and feel like the rest are wasted.

title: Snake oil? text: It seems like all the fancy bottle brands claim the same thing. "Natural feel" and "anti-colic." I'm finding that it really doesn't matter which bottle is used, we get the same results. Our son took a bottle from week 2 until about week 5 or 6 with no problems when it comes to accepting it. All of them seemed to make him colicky. So we stopped for a bit, which wasn't a big deal because we were both working at home due to the plague. Well, now we're trying to get him back on a bottle. He's not taking any, regardless of the size or shape of the nipple.

The only thing that sets this bottle apart from many of the competitors is the soft bottle. I'd say that the only bottles out there that are "harder" to clean are the MAM bottles, because of how many pieces they contain.

In the end, I think the bottles appeal more to the parent than the child. This was really expensive and did not seem the help us with our bottle feeding issues.

title: Such a clever clip.. helps with stroller and SO MUCH more!! text: Loving these- Such a cleaver idea for anyone needing a third hand or, extra space. Let’s face it- tiny newborn babies come with an insurmountable amount of baby gear!!

So easy.. I placed this onto the U-shaped handle of our baby stroller.. To do so, is simple and straightforward. Think little hinged carabiner- and supersize it.. Boom!! Works the same. NOTE: there is “click locking mechanism“ on this, once in place-

I chose to cover a small section of handle with coban medical wrap.. I didn’t want metal from the clip to scratch stroller handle AND.. it also helps keep clip in place and from slipping down the side. Part of clip I’d covered with padding.. but, they do have a tendency to turn.. not a big deal- just extra Precaution! *Hack- if you have same issue and want to protect handle; several products will work to protect/aid the handle.. I personally chose coban bc, it’s self adhering and has no sticky residue!

This set comes with 2 hooks- and placing both on the handle will keep whatever you hang- balanced. But, FYI- you can do this with one clip.. these can handle the weight no problem! (and that’s coming from someone who carries in Mary Poppins purse- aka, bigger bc, it holds a lot of things!)

TBH- baskets on strollers are not roomy, mine fits diaper bag/blanket.. leaving nowhere to put my purse. I’ve tried using a small backpack to combat the space issue- but, that can get heavy after a period of time.. and/or, obnoxious taking on and off every time you need your wallet! Ha! This clip allows you to hang purse in front for easy access.. Plus, it’s safer to keep it in your line of sight. *Note: this can be used for more then purses, of course! If, you find yourself involved in a shopping marathon- this is a great option to hold and collect your bags as you go along!
Best of all- These can be used for SO MUCH MORE than just the stroller fix! I got 2 more already.. and I’ve put them to use as, these are just so handy!! I hung x1 in the garage: it holds the handful of dog leashes.. and helps keep them organized and in x1 place- which is lifesaving!!! I put x1 in my teens bathroom- it’s perfect for securely hanging the toiletry/shaving bag for my son.. Otherwise, this would sit out on the counter and drive me crazy! My daughter who lives in college dorms, asked for a set to take back to school with her.. She wants to use to hang backpacks and such! Sooo many uses!!

Hands down, I recommend 100%.. You cannot go wrong!! The ease and convenience provided is fantastic- and the extra options are a total bonus!

I hope this info. helps.. feel free to let me know!

title: Works Awesome, Decent Smell, Harder to Get Out of Jar text: My kiddo is prone to yeastier rashes and they are blistering before you even know they have it. I've tried other creams before switching organic and natural methods. Most of the time, the other creams would reduce the redness, but wouldn't fully eliminate. By morning, this salve had completely cleared it up. You couldn't even tell the rash had been there. It has a good aroma too. It is a denser salve, so it's a little tough to dig out than other creams, but a little goes a long way, so it does ensure you don't overuse.

I was worried the little jar was too small and might not be worth the cost. I realize now with how little needed, it will last a decent while.

Happy with my purchase and happy to support the company! We tried their lotion as well. Wish we had this when my kiddo was a babe.

title: Love this bag! Amazing how much fits in it. text: I wish I had this bag long ago, it is th best diaper bag I have seen or used. No matter what I put inside there is always more room but the bag doesn't look big, infact when I got it I was sure I will be returning it, until I gave it a try.
It has 5 pockets inside which are big enough to hold diapers, many bibs, my big wallet with my phone, pecifiers (in a box), a few baby sunglasses, and more. There is also another pocket with a zipper to keep stuff you want to keep a little more secure.
With all those things in the pockets there is still A LOT of room left in the bag itself, for at least two sets of clothing for 1 year old, 2 pjs, nursing wrap, toys, blankie, small jacket, formula, baby cereal and more, it's actually amazing how much fits in there.
There are two pockets on sides of the bags (outside), one I use for wipes, the other for a large sippy cup.
Then there is the front pocket which is actually my least favorite, I wish the pockets inside this pocket where a little bigger, but for a smaller baby (less than a year) it can easily hold 3 bottles especially breastmilk bottles which are thinner. I use comotomo bottles so doesn't fit there. But I use this pocket for snacks (cookies and such) and for fruit puches, it is a thermal pocket so it doesn't keep things fresh when needed.
I highly recommend and wish I got this bag before.

title: Love this mirror
text: Love this mirror.  My head rests aren't removable, so this was my only option to see my kid in a rear facing carseat. The initial setup was a little tricky because the telescoping extension receded too far into the tube.  Would recommend a redesign with an internal stop to prevent that.  Holds position very well.  Only has a slight distortion in the mirror.

title: Baby must have!

My little was getting quite toasty in the back seat of the car, so I found this & decided I was going to attach it under her mirror on the head rest! Prefect choice, because she always chilled in the backseat! I then ordered 2 more for the stroller when we go to the ball park. Not to mention all my mommy friends have them aswell! They are AMAZING quality, battery life is great, & all around a must have!

title: Easy to use; clear screen; rather lightweight build quality text: This is a decent, but not outstanding baby scale (or pet scale if you're a fur baby parent). Operation is super simple, and the readout screen is bright and easy to read. It runs on 2 AAA batteries. Although the product listing states the batteries are included, there were no batteries with the one I received (and I looked carefully through the packaging material).

The cradle is in two pieces. While it makes it easier to store this in terms of space, it is less sturdy than my other baby scale, which has a one-piece cradle. The cradle has length markings but they are small and hard to read. It can also be used as a conventional scale if the cradle is removed. The platform is too small to use as an adult scale, but is workable for toddlers/very young children.

It comes with a tape measure that's very cheaply made. It would have been better to skip the cheap tape measure and include something more useful, such as batteries or a storage bag/case.

Accuracy seems to be good based on the readings I get on this vs. my other scale. The price is generally in line with similar scales. I'd rate the overall value as average.

It's not an outstanding performer, but a decent, 4-star baby/small pet scale.

title: Good infant thermometer text: This is a good thermometer for infants.
The beep can be turned off so as to not startle them.
The screen faces outward so you can quickly read the results without having to pull it away and turn it around. The screen is bright and the numbers are easy to read.
It's nice to have the option of using the forehead or ear for getting a reading.
There's also a step for calibration of the room temperature.

title: Furniture wall straps are a lot of trouble to install
text: I bought these with the expectation of using them on my book cases but to mount them correctly you have to move the object to get behind them to mount to the wall and the back of the bookcase.  This required unloading them to the point they're light enough to move, attaching the brackets to the wall stud and the back of the book cases, trying to cinch the strap as tight as possible and putting everything back.  This took about an hour.  Since I have 20 book cases, this is a lot of time.  A much simpler and cheaper alternative is to buy 'L' brackets from a hardware store and screw it to the top of the book case and the wall stud.  Total  time 10 minutes. No unloading or moving the book cases.  Mine are tall enough you can't even see the 'L' brackets.  If you have some short object needing mounted where the 'L' bracket would be visible, these would be perfect.

title: Easy to use. Keeping the cat out of the cabinets

title: Uncomfortable
text: It works well if your toddler will be okay keeping it on.  It keeps them from getting too far.  This doesn't mean you can take your eyes off the child since any magnet will unlock their wrist.  For us, it was very heavy and uncomfortable for the toddler.  There is a big gap on the cushion which makes their wrist exposed to the plastic and rubs the skin raw.  The locking mechanism on the toddler's wrist is very bulky and doesn't adjust much in wrist sizing.  Overall, it's just too cumbersome and not worth the hassle for us.

title: Cheap, wish it worked better text: A friend recommended this and we loved it at first. But the more we used it the more we had issues. This nail file is cheap plastic. When we weren't battling the battery compartment from opening, we had to worry about the files pealing off and breaking. We also noticed while we were using it that the file stops spinning if pressed down too hard. If you don't file down evenly it'll leave the baby's nail sharp! We are back to manually filing.

Update: we tried this again after using electrical tape to keep the battery compartment closed. That seemed to help. Also, my baby seems to be less scared of the device now...

Also I like how the zipper is on the bottom for changing but I still have to almost take the whole thing off so poo or pee doesn’t get on it. title: Good for pets too! text: Once installed, these child safety locks are very difficult for a child to open. They are released only by pressing the release button on the bottom, something most young children won’t be able to do. For an adult who knows how to operate them, though, they are easy to open with one hand. The adhesive seems to hold securely.
What I like about these: no screws required, do not leave permanent marks on cupboard doors, easy to install and operate.
What I don’t love: They are on the outside of the cabinets so are very noticeable (we’ve installed others that are behind the doors), single use (as far as I can tell, I see no mention of replacement sticky pads), price is reasonable.
Full disclosure: I ordered these to keep a particularly crafty dog out of the cupboards. So far, so good, so I can recommend these not only for toddlers but for pets as well.

title: You can rely on the Graco name for anotehr great product!!!
text: I am a huge fan of Graco products, own several to have at the house for when my grandchildren come to visit. Quality, durability and last for many many years. You can rely on Graco as a safe, quality product for children. I love this Jetsetter, I set it up relatively easily (and trust me I am not technically capable for many items to put together). This took me about 15 minutes to assemble out in the yard. I love the fact that I can actually put the canopy on it to keep the sun of my grandson when he is playing in it. I do agree with others, I don't see this too much as a portable device unless you are relatively strong. I believe parents would capable of carrying this around (my daughter-in-law amazes me sometimes at the things she can cart). I, on the other hand, struggled with the 20+ lbs and had some difficulty trying to get it in to the carry on bag (my son had to help me. Outside of the weight, I love this playard. You can use it for naptime inside, bring it outside to keep baby safely occupied while you do chores. Would make a great baby shower present for the mom to be.

text: Material is nice. We bought the medium size. Almost bought the next size down because my baby was about 12 lbs when this was bought. I'm glad I didn't. It fits so snug. To the point that it didn't seemed like it could be comfortable. We almost had a hard time zipping it up. There's no way a bigger baby could've fit into this. To be fair, it could all be baby's preference, but this did not work for us at all. We didn't get any sleep the one night we tried it.  Very disappointing considering how much it was.

title: Great for Toddlers & Teenagers!
text: My teenage daughter wanted a travel pillow to take with her on marching band bus trips. I looked at several different toddler sized pillows before settling on this one. This one was priced reasonably and had lots of good reviews. It's soft & fluffy without being too flat or too firm. She LOVES it & can't wait for her next band trip! So even though it's considered a toddler pillow, it makes a great travel pillow!

title: Easy build and sturdy

title: Hard to slide around clip and squeeze- falling apart text: UPDATE: My daughter is now 6 and still struggles to get out of her 5 point harness with this. It’s also falling apart- the rubber on the top of the clip where she pushes/squeezes. My 7 year old son often removes it from the buckle and unbuckles her instead to get ready in the car rider drop off line.

My 5 year old is fairly petite, so I thought this would help for the car rider line for kinder this year. We’ve tried it SEVERAL times, but she gets frustrated after a couple of minutes. She is able to slide it around the buckle, but she has to loosen the straps first. It is difficult to get it positioned just right. She also has a very hard time squeezing it to get the buckle to unbuckle. It’s not even close to what I was hoping- will update if we yield better results this week.

title: Sturdy

title: Well Made, Generous and Soft
text: This is generous, well-made and nice and soft. The bear design is really cute. The package was perfect for gift giving. Although the color in the picture is smoky blue, it’s really grey, but an attractive grey. Very pleased with it and would recommend.

title: Easy to use
text: The drawer locks have strong adhesive , it can be easily applied to cabinet, besides, it has adjustable length.

title: Horrendous design, awful to use
text: I have the travel system with car seat, car seat base, stroller base, bassinet, and stroller seat.  I hate it. The car seat is difficult to get in and out of the base which is awful if you’re trying to do it quickly or the baby is sleeping because you need to wiggle the car seat fairly violently to remove it.  The strollers wheels get stuck making it frustrating to navigate wherever you go.  Its embarrassing when people hold the door for you and you can’t get the stroller to start moving forward because the wheels are so jammed up.  Never mind that the back set of wheels are really wide making it difficult to get through doorways or department stores.  For the stroller seat, it doesn’t incline well and it is horrid if you want your child to sit up.  They end up slumping to the side since it’s so poorly made.  Oh and the buckles are awful!  You have to thread the top through the sides before clicking into the centre buckle ever time you buckle them in.  The cup holder is a piece of garbage  as is the cell phone holder.  I bought a stroller organizer instead.  Any pros with this stroller do not out weigh the cons.  I’ll be getting rid of this as soon as I can!

title: Nice basic digital thermometer…
text: Seems to be accurate.  Easy to read, too.  Good value if what you want is a good no-frills thermometer.  I use it daily (I live in an assisted living situation where we’re super careful about possible COVID spread) and so far no quality/durability issues at all.

title: Use screws not just tape!
text: This product is great for securing general cabinets you want to keep you baby baby's out of! But, if they grow up any at all I really don't like the idea of just having tape on locks locking the cabinet with say medicine in it!  So these still worked I just put a couple of screw in each one once they were set in place! Just to make sure they were just a little harder to get open. It makes me feel better anyways! Hope you find this useful!

title: Junk text: I purchased this scale to keep track of the weight of my cat, who is a little overweight. Our vet recommended a baby scale. I ordered this Salter Model because it got quite a few good reviews.

However, if I could give this scale a rating of zero, I would. It just plain doesn't work. When my cat was at the vet last week, she weighed 12.2 pounds. I tried to weigh her several times on this scale, and she consistently weighed 5.6 pounds. And, she just curled up in the top cradle, so she was fully cooperating. It's just ridiculous that something this simple shouldn't work properly. I kept checking to make sure I had it on the "LB" setting, as I just kept thinking I was doing something wrong.

I did contact Amazon customer service, and they issued a pre-paid mailing label so that I wouldn't have to pay for return shipping. Thank you Amazon for such great customer service.

title: Perfect! protection for both, security and peace of mind!! text: What can I say this is a jack of all trades’s… And what’s crazy, I’m not even the mom! I’ve been tasked with watching newborn nephew and providing “auntie daycare” two days a week. With covid19 around every corner- and quarantine crisis, it’s my job to keep this little guy safe on my watch!! I ordered this as a baby in tow, germ/weather cover for when he’s with me.. great baby gear idea!!

• I’m loving the universal fit over what I’m sure will comply with almost (if not..) every carseat. I keep this at my house if ever needed to go out. As baby grows and carseat adapts.. this boasts the room to do the same!

• I am loving the zipper!! WE WANT LIFE EASY AM I RIGHT..?!!! Putting baby in a protective cocoon by just the slide of a zip- it’s so easy to give you peace of mind.. baby can be covered away from any noise, germs, sunlight, dirty hands- and that helps me feel better. It’s also completely easy to do a little unzip… And take a peek. This is helpful without disturbing the little guy!

• Material it soft and has ample stretch, it’s washer machine safe. I washed on delicate and chose to air dry.. (better to err on the side of caution the my time) Although, I’ve only washed this x1- it washed and returned to fit with perfect expectations! Sure.. Maybe a tad wrinkly- but, that even seemed to work itself out once stretch back into action!

•added security- I’ve found if the little guy is strapped in and fussy- And Just by covering him, removing outside stimulation can help so much.. he can calm himself and feel that security these little punkińs crave!!! After all, let’s face it they came from a tiny, dark, secure place- and tend to find comfort there during hectic surroundings.

•Print is universal- I ordered in gray/white arrow print and it is nice, rich color and could be used for both, boy/girl. I realize options could match this item to the specific sex of the baby- however, if you choose neutral you can utilize with any future children- universal works with everyone ha ha.. and with the quality of construction.. I feel confident this would last for more then one baby use!

• As advertised, this has many uses- but, in my situation they didn’t apply. My need was very specific.. after reviewing the instructions/options- they seems very straight forward and easy to use! The instructions provided very step by step and user friendly.
I hope this info helps... feel free to let me know!'

title: The perfect lunch bowl for me
text: The perfect lunch bowl for me.  I have to go down one floor to use a microwave and back up again.  So far, containers used have scorched me even wrapped in paper towels going back upstairs, and many times, the lids, even though left laying light atop the bowls, when put down, would seal so they could not be undone without spillage or burning myself.  Now I have a bowl with a HANDLE and it has a steam release valve you open and close, so no spillage.  Eureka!

title: easier to put together than take down text: First let me say this is a playpen only! No balls included.

I'd say this is sufficient size for kiddos up to 2 or 3 years old. They do provide a carrying case, so you can take it to the park but we did not do that as it seemed tougher to take it all down than put it together somehow. Plus, there is no cushion, it is only a plastic fabric between baby and the floor. With stickers and rocks, we decided it'd be best not to take outdoors.

That being said, I feel that it is very sturdy and provides a small play area to keep little ones entertained and away from the adults while they clean, watch a movie etc.. keeps em out of trouble lol.

The pouch is a nice touch, as well. I think for this we will have to purchase some balls to make that awesome ball pit they show in their photos.

title: Sturdy Gate That's Easy to Install text: This is a very nice gate that's perfect for blocking off stairs or containing a dog. I got this because my dog kept going into our entryway to chew up our shoes. This gate was easy to install and it solved the problem.

The gate fits perfectly in a standard doorway. It comes with extensions if you need to fit it in a larger space. To mount the gate, you place four plastic pieces on your wall. You can either stick these pieces on the wall or screw them into place. The gate comes with a template which allows you to make markings on the wall.

Once the plastic pieces are in place, you insert the 4 threaded spindle rods into the gate and place the ends into the plastic mounts. Then you finger tighten the wheels until the gate is secure. Mounting only takes a few minutes and the gate is very sturdy.

The gate latches securely and is very convenient to open and close. This gate features a much more durable construction than other gates on the market. This is an excellent product that is durable, functional, and attractive.

title: EASY TO USE & WORKS GREAT
text: My daughters cat likes to go out on the porch with her at night. So I got her this baby gate to use on the railing. She is in a wheelchair  and the traditional gates are too much for her to use. She said this has worked out very well. It is lightweight and very easy to use. It is mesh so you can see through it. It is very easy to get set up . It is very well made.

title: Difficult Install, a bit unsafe.
text: Joshua Garfinkle:  We purchased this to use at the bottom of our stairs to keep our daughter safe and to keep our dogs from coming up to our bedrooms.  It was a very oddly designed unit that was difficult to install and always felt flimsy, even with a proper install that has the gate pushed to its tolerance limits for small spacing the door can easily be pushed open by a leaning child. It is installed properly, but using a pressure system with a series of tightening devices in four locations to make the fit tighter, we have it at its tightest and still the door opens. Its only good feature is it looks nice.

title: The most stretch I’ve ever seen in a diaper!
text: [[VIDEOID:e922b7c435cecf95870af509dd0f4ba0]] If you are looking for a diaper with the most stretch and mobility these diapers fit the bill! They have more movability and stretch than any brand of diaper I have used for my kids. And I have used soooo many brands! My daughter (15 months) has had no leaks in these diapers. They stay on and she seems comfortable in them. Me personally, I felt Little Snugglers by Huggies fit her body style a little better than these. She doesn’t have much extra on her so the stretch isn’t needed as much. And they were a little baggy on her. But thinking back to my first daughter who had thicker legs I feel like these would have worked better for her. Need more stretch and give. All in all they work great. They have Mickey on them which is fun! There is def as always a better quality you get with a huggies compared to cheaper and no name brands!

title: Not exactly for a toddler's little hands...
text: This is a nice little set of utensils for kids who are learning to use a fork and spoon.  They are easy to clean and are visually appealing.  The problem is the design.  The handles are just too large for a toddler to manage.  They end up holding it in a weird fashion, just so they can get their hands around it.  My nephew, who is pretty darn bright for his age group, ended up flipping them upside down in order to get a better grip and got confused about why the food wasn't staying on them.  The fork issue is that toddlers and small kids don't usually grasp the concept of stabbing a fork into their food in order to get it to their mouths.  The idea is great but the execution, and target audience, is way off.

title: Great for what we needed it for text: Kiddo has been begging me to take him on a train ride down to San Diego to visit Grandma. Problem is that once we get there she doesn't have a car seat for him (he's a very petite 7 yr old). This worked great as a travel seat, much easier than trying to lug his actual car seat around, and way safer than just having him buckle up without one all together in Grandma's car.

When not traveling, I keep it in my trunk incase we need to give one of his friends a ride somewhere. That way we have a seat for them as well. California kid seat laws are pretty strict so I feel better having this on hand just in case.

What I dont use it for is everyday use though. I can't speak to durability or long term comfort, just that it is super convenient as a travel or back up seat.

The box doesn’t measure quite at 13” square.
The front/back of my box is 13 1/8” wide x 13” tall - it can be squeezed to fit 13” square.
The sides of my box are 13” wide x 13” tall.
There are no handles on the sides of the box, it just has a pull tab on the front above the back of the alligator’s head.
It would be nice if there was also a pull tab on the back of the box so when my kids outgrow the alligator I could easily flip it around and continue to use it as it’s so well made.

title: Good quality; folds easily; cleans up well text: Overall, this is a nice changing pad. It has everything necessary to perform well: it feels (and looks) well-made, it's easy to clean, and it folds/unfolds without any undue fuss or bother. The size is pretty good -- it's certainly more than fine for a NB to 24 months, but I don't think it would be ideal for 24+ months. Workable for sure, but a little bit additional length and width would ensure a more usable pad for a wider age range.

4.5 stars, rounded up to 5 since, other than size, it hits the mark squarely on all other points, and is a decent value for the price.

title: One Heck of a Conditioner!
text: This marked the first time I ever tried an Honest brand hair conditioner.  I tried it based on the excellent reviews it received and I agree with the rave reviews. Fantastic conditioner. Lightweight, easy to apply, easy to rinse out. Doesn't weigh hair down; quite the opposite, it adds some much needed bounce and shine to my hair.  Hydrates and softens my dry, damaged hair as well.  Has a nice, light scent as well though it doesn't last long in my hair. This isn't just an exceptional conditioner, its exceptionally priced as well.  Gentle enough for daily use. HIGHLY recommended!

title: Perfect Size

title: Fantastic Diaper Bag
text: This diaper bag is definitely solidly built.  It has so much storage and pockets for easy access.  We bought this for our daughter expecting her first baby and I am so glad I grabbed this one.  Absolutely worth every penny, not cheaply made at all.  Seems very durable, great for travel with baby and lightweight, but it doesn't feel cheap at all, not even a little cheap- feels like it should be more expensive.  The color is really nice too. The price tag attached is more than reasonable and I wouldn't hesitate to buy this one again for someone else, so yes, I highly recommend it.  I hope you find this review helpful!

title: Love this diaper bag text: This is a very nice diaper bag. It has a lot of pockets and function that are all very useful.

In the front it has an outer pocket in which there is room for 3 bottles. On the inside there is a small zipper pouch for smaller items. On the outside of that pocket is another storage area for smaller things. There is another zipper pouch for more storage in the front. On both sides of the bag are water bottle holders which is great.

You have two straps to carry the bag with and on the top are two straps as well that you can grab. The can be combined with a little strap so they don't separate when the bag is in use. The bag closes with a nice little zipper. On the inside you have a few side pouches to keep things nicely organized and a large compartment where your items go in. Since this bag opens on the top and can be fully opened it is easy to access all your items.

On the bag of the bag you have a strap that can be attached to luggage. You also have another zipper compartment for smaller more important items that you want to keep a closer eye on. There is another zipper that actually allows you to access the main compartment of the bag.

You also get 2 belts that allow you to hang this bag onto your carriage. This is a fantastic bag that is super well made. It allows you to keep everything nicely organized with all the little compartments it has. I love the nice color I got. And once your baby is no longer a baby, well this is a perfect bag for travel.

title: Very detailed markings
text: These breast milk bags are thick, medical grade plastic and have very detailed markings on them. Multiple measurement types (oz and ml), designated writing areas for name, date, time, and volume. They come factory sealed so it is is nice to know they are sterile. You remove the piece of plastic on the top to open, then reseal with the zipporlock seal. At 30 bags, this is a nice bulk purchase at an affordable price.

title: Good Sunblock Stick
text: This sunblock stick is decent. It is gentle on the skin. It provides adequate protection. It doesn't clog pores. I like it. My only complaint about the stick is that your skin has to be completely dry to get it to rub on. It is so thick that the slightest amount of sweat makes it incredibly difficult to rub on. You have to dry your kid's face completely. I also tried rubbing it on my hands and then rubbing it on the baby's face, and that didn't work out so well, either. You just couldn't get it thick enough in your hand to spread. You really need to use it directly from stick to dry skin. But really, those are the limitations of this particular application in general (sunblock sticks) and not the product itself.
