text: Didn't realize it was just one long piece of stretchy material which I should have guessed. Had a pretty hard time getting on even with instructions. Nervous to have 1 month old in without holding her bottom. Need to watch YouTube and see if I can make this work!

title: did not agree with my colon, Aqueous Flatulence text: How do I put this nicely? First of all, I did like the flavor, so I ate a bag. Then later, ( here it comes ) I started having gas, a lot of gas. Now gas is nothing new with me and I will proudly blast one out. I let one rip. WAIT a minute, that did NOT feel right. It was WET gas! I had never experienced this problem before. The Aqueous Flatulence lasted all day. The gas kept coming and I had to sit on the toilet to let it out and this happened many times.

Now don't say it was probably the probiotics because we take a big variety of probiotics in our home.

I am scared to try a second bag and even more scared to give them away LOL Oh well, I guess they will just go in the trash.

title: Quite Sturdy text: It’s important to note, right off the bat, that the mattress is not included. Nor is the bedding, of course.

This is a sturdy piece. . . after you get it all put together. It comes in quite a small box, but there are lots of pieces, so you’ll just need to take your time. The one I have is white (Bianca) and pretty much looks exactly like the picture. It’s nice that it’s low to the ground, so easy in/out for your child. It is Made in China.

title: Might work for some. . . not for me
text: There was not anything like this teether when my children were babies.  I tried using this for my grandbaby hoping that it would help with her teething pain. I think this is a great idea and feel certain that this should work well some babies; it did not work for my grandbaby.  I was counting on the design aspect of it having the shape of a pacifier with the ridges of a teether.  I even tried putting it in the freezer to cool it off and was hoping that might be the ticket, but that did not work either. It is too small for a baby to hold, even if they like it. I think that sometimes that you have to try different things before you find the right one for any particular. This was not the one for mine. It’s Made in China.

title: Wonderful seller and products
text: The product is wonderful and the seller actually emailed me to make sure I was happy and to thank me for buying it.  I would definitely order from her again.  The personal touch makes her a step above the rest and was appreciated

title: This fits the mattress well and protects the mattress. ...
text: This fits the mattress well and protects the mattress.  I put an additional sheep on top, for a little more comfort, but it is not necessary.  It washes well.  The color is true to the photo.

title: Highly recommend!!! Helps tremendously with teething pains
text: These teething keys are awesome! Baby loves them so much! The best way to use these is to freeze em & give to little one when the teething pain strikes, they really soothe those painful gums. I recommend getting two or three of these so that you can refreeze one while using the other.

title: Very gentle cream text: Great product. Very gentle for a skin protectant, or to help a diaper rash
Does a good job for both. Will order it again.

title: Four Stars
text: This is easy for adults to use yet toddlers can't use it.

title: lightweight but dense, excellent absorption, adhesion is fantastic- no falling off, bunching text: Really nice sposies. Good size, thin but dense material, and excellent adhesion. Every part of the adhesive side is sticky, and they adhere very very well. I'm tempted to use them myself, haha. For moms that are curious-- think of a panty liner that you may have tried. This has a similar appearance, slightly different shape. The material has a dense feel to it-- like it would absorb really well (and does). Yet is thin. The adhesion is impressive.

Have tried other sposie products, and they are stellar (in my opinion).

title: Perfect!
text: Got this car seat for my nephew and glad that he loves it! It's safe and he feels comfortable sitting on it. My nephew and I are very happy with this product.

title: A big hit
text: I have a four-year-old who's fascinated by all things related to space, planets, stars, etc.  And he loves his new moon.  It's sufficiently bright and easy to hang up and use.  It cycles through the moon phases and turns itself off after 30 minutes of inactivity.  It really does look like the moon.  And it took my kid around ten seconds to figure out the remote control, which works from all angles and from across a typical kid's room.  It's not a precision optical device but it works fine for what it is.  Requires 4 AA and 2 AAA batteries.

title: Great for a baby shower gift text: Ordered and received: Black/White stripes
My friend is having her 3rd boy and I had gotten one like this for another friend last year and she absolutely loved it. I got black and white striped because she actually had this on her baby shower registry. So, that was perfect. Its stretchy material makes it super easy to put on the baby car seat. Also, can be used when shopping for the grocery cart. My other friend uses it all the time for that.

I highly recommending this cover for any baby shower gift. But wait! there's more.... You get 2 drool bibs as an extra bonus. They are a little thin in my opinion, but they are cute though.

title: Fabulous except....
text: I bought these for my son when he went up to the lake house with his grand parents this summer and they were fabulous. They didn't bulk up and swell like a regular diaper. Just one note of caution they pull-up like training pants so if your little one poos in it, you'll have to cut them off with scissors or risk getting poo everywhere while trying to pulling them off. I don't know too many people who go to the beach with a pair of scissors packed in their diaper bag. Thankfully for us, we're right on the beach witthin walking distance and was able to make it home to cut them off the little guy. Highly recommend these as they are great. They won't keep the sand out but your little one will be much happier in these then walking around with a 10 pound swelled up diaper.

title: Very nice
text: These are all used now so I can say that these worked great. They are soft and absorbent and are just as good, if not better, than the brand name products. You will not go wrong if you order these.

title: Two Stars
text: Way too small for my needs.

title: Wipes
text: I would recommend

title: Love these
text: They arrived ontime and they have the best auction on them and so easy to clean. I use them so much and I love the colors and Thy come with lids which are very handy to preload with food for ready to eat meals

title: Great barrier
text: Love this! It’s exactly as described, seems pretty sturdy. It came with screws and wall bumpers to attach to frame if you want it to be a more permanent solution i have it on my bedroom right now to keep the dog in but be able to let the cat come and go. It also came with an extension section for a larger door frame.  Glad I purchased it.

title: In all Respects Excellent
text: superb is the perfect adjective for this travel system. Each component is well made and designed for the safety and comfort of both the baby and parent. While safety is my primary concern I really appreciate the ease with which this is assembled and used. some systems seem designed to trick and torment you: not selling points when you are rushed for time and juggling a baby or two. Installation is simple. When they say click and go they mean it. The stroller ride is superlative. it is smooth. Padding is more than adequate and there is plenty of storage. The handles are not adjustable,a surprising oversight in a system of this calibre but not a deal breaker. It is sturdy and durable. Great system.

title: Comforting for babies
text: My baby like this bounceRoo. She liked to rest there. It is comfortable for her to sit in. I like that it is not too heavy so I can move it from one room to another. I also like that you can machine wash the fabric. I am not a huge fan of the mobile - I think there are better mobiles on similar products. It also doesn't play music, while many similar products do. Overall not too bad but not necessarily the best out there, especially since it is more expensive than many of the similar products.

title: Gorgeous, Durable & Strong
text: I absolutely love this gate! I have been using the standard plastic child gate for many years and I always hated it because it was so ugly plus to get past it I would have to either step over it and risk tripping or removing it then putting it back. This one is wonderful. It looks gorgeous and once it's up it's up for however long you want it to be. To get through it all you have to do is slide the switch and it opens up in either direction. The only thing I don't like is the metal bar at the bottom because I have to remember to step over it but that I will get use to. It looks great and now I don't have to worry about my dogs knocking it down as they are trying to get past it. I use this to keep them out of my room. I guarantee they will not get past this gate. It is durable, strong and secure I don't think a bear could knock this down. This was also very easy to install. The are extra bars one on each side that you can add to the gate if it is not big enough for your doorway. I didn't need either of them because it fit my doorway completely. The picture and description are honest. This is made with high quality materials. I'm so very happy to have this I will never go back to using a boring plastic gate again.

title: perfect storage option!
text: More off-white than white, but still a pleasing neutral color.  Love the leather look handles.  The weave of the baskets is sturdy and they are not floppy.  I love these for storing things in the open and also in closets.  I have a ton of them from different brands and these measure up, quality wise, with what I already have.  Good for categorizing things.  Really, no complaints and no regrets.  Very much recommend.

title: Great for warming pumped milk in the bag or bottle.
text: This warmer works so well! I use it when babysitting and it is perfect for warming milk in the bag or in the bottle. It takes longer to warm milk in a baby bottle because of the thickness of the bottle..

title: Best brush!
text: I love this bottle brush. It's definitely wearing down with all the use it gets daily and I'll be ordering another soon with baby #2 on the way. The sponge at the ends gets into the bottom of the bottle really well and gets any other milk residue out. Also works well for water bottles.

title: My Grandbabies Love This!
text: This little toddler toilet seat is just perfect for when my littles are here. They love to climb up on it themselves and it has been a big help to encouraged their desire to use the toilet rather than a diaper. It's well made and durable and is easily folded and put aside when not in use. For us, anything that encourages a little person to take that big step from using diapers to using the bathroom is well worth the investment. A Very Good Product!

title: Not a utility bag
text: Five stars for style, zero stars for functionality. Inner pockets bunch because the material is too thick, outer pockets are not large enough for a baby bottle. But I kept it because the style is really to die for!!

title: Great!
text: I used this in place of a gift bag for a friend's baby shower as the nursery theme is dinosaurs. Super cute and seems durable! She loved it.

title: A bit cheesy
text: These are glossy and cheep.  They are dollar store quality.  I don't hate them, but they could not seriously be displayed on your wall without looking kitchy and cheep.  Also not as large as I thought.  Again, I don't hate them.  I put it up in my bathroom hall, but only temporarily.  They will not last long.  These would be great for a temporary decoration, like an event or party.  Something temporary, but not permanent.

title: Disappointing Quality text: After reading several positive reviews for this product, I was very disappointed when my package arrived.

The edges of these cloth diapers are frayed and the seams are loose and poorly sewn - leaving long threads pulling from each diaper. The part that concerns me most is that weave of the fabric is very thin and loose on the sides where they were folded. If my intention was to utilize these as cloth diapers, this would be completely unacceptable. My plan is for these to serve as burp cloths and protective sheets for my changing pad. That said, there is still some utility in these despite their poor quality (hence the two stars!)

If you are looking for an inexpensive, higher quality alternative, I recommend OsoCozy 6 Pack Birdseye Flat Unbleached Diapers. You can purchase these from Amazon, and the per unit cost is actually slightly lower.

title: Something wrong with this listing text: I ordered and got gas and colic relievers. Now the listing is changed to wipe warmer. That is unethical in my opinion, getting reviews for one product, and changing the listing to another product.

However, they do work fine. It's unpleasant to use them, but they get the job done and the baby is happy afterwards. Make sure you throw away after a single use!!

title: Peace of mind! Pretty decent quality! text: We have a three year and we were always worried when he plays in balcony. After installing this guard, we feel safe. Still I can't let my son by himself in balcony, but with this even if you have to step in for few it should be okay. My son was always trying to put his head through the grill, this prevents him from doing that.

The installation was pretty easy. Was able to put it in my balcony with 15 or 20 mins.

I read few negative reviews about this product. But for the price I paid for this product, I find it to be worthy. And I recommend it.

title: Five Stars
text: Works great!!

title: Not the best taste
text: My twins eat a couple baby food pouches each a day. They aren't picky at all and are willing to eat just about anything. They were not huge fans of these pouches. The baby food doesn't smell very good so I imagine the taste isn't super pleasant either. They did eat them, it just took a bit of convincing.

title: Small but satisfactory, lightweight and white
text: Made of 100% Polyester with Polyurethane coating, the [[ASIN:B00EDIISBS Munchkin 6 Count Waterproof Changing Pad Liners]] were received in two plastic packages, each containing 3 nicely rolled and displayed waterproof liners.  They are described as having, "neutral design blends with home decors," and they are indeed neutral - white with a well done narrow bias trim edging of black on white.  They were made in China.  Because their corners are quite rounded, the pads offer less protection than more square corners would, but they can be rolled into a more compact form with this shape.  Since they are very lightweight, they are good for travel and they can also function as a bib or burp cloth when necessary.  I am currently using one for my 12 pound dog to protect her new bed although it's a little small for that purpose.  These pads are not intended to be as protective as the pads we used for Mom for the past few years of her life, nor are they large enough for a typical adult's bottom, but they can be used horizontally underneath the baby's rear as they outgrow the space provided when she/he is positioned on the pad vertically.  They are made very, very well, the packaging and presentation are well done, thereby making this a great item to include in a newborn baby's gift ensemble.  Their size is most suitable for a young infant and they are definitely gender non-specific.  I like them but would prefer they be a few inches larger in all directions.

title: Leaks, leaks, and more leaks
text: These diapers leak horribly. I chose them as part of the Amazon diaper promotion since they are a well known national brand.  I will never use them again.

title: Good basic teether
text: This is a pretty basic teether. That said, I like that it is not too large - some are just big to easily fit in baby's hand/mouth and that is not the case here. In addition, it has a good ergonomic shape.

title: Great for messy eaters!!!
text: Super easy to clean all you have to do is rinse it off and it says fast. Also my son loves chewing on things now that he had teeth and they hold up great! No more ruining cloth bibs!!!

title: Great item for the price! text: The Breast Feeding Starter kit was a gift basket item for a soon to be new mom who plans on breast feeding. She has received one other starter kit for breast feeding thus far, and tells me that this kit has a lot going for it. (That made me feel good as it is relatively inexpensive.

- There are 12 day time disposable breast pads and 6 night time disposable breast pads to keep you dry and comfortable during the day and through the night. They seem thick and very absorbent (especially the night pads), and there are adhesive strips to keep the pad in place (definite plus).

-- Dual usage: Warm use - to stimulate milk flow and cold use - for soothing and relief; Comes with 2 extra soft sleeves for added comfort. There is also a bra clip to remind you of the side you last fed from.

-- A feeding diary is a great peace of mind tool, especially for new mom who are obsessed with tracking and record keeping.

--Items come in a washable zippered pouch to hold all your breast care must haves.

RECOMMENDED based on product and price.

title: Cute Decal
text: Cute little decal. Was a little goofy to put up as it didn't come with the transfer paper attached. Took a while to get as it shipped from China, but is a cute way to dress up the light switch in a kid's bedroom. Easily modifiable as well (see picture).

title: Simple and sturdy!
text: Perfect for a toddler when washing hands, brushing teeth, and using the potty! It’s nice as it has a non slip surface to stand on and it’s super sturdy. Lightweight so it’s easy for your child to carry from place to place.

title: Perfect
text: Perfect

title: Wonderful ingredients!
text: I actually bought these for me and my family, we struggle with getting good fresh organic fruit where we live, and I needed a way to be able to get the benefits from the fruit that we need in our daily diet. These work! And they taste really good to us. We weren't look for sweet or fake, we were looking for wholesome and fast, which is what these are. My 16 year old daughter can suck one of these down on her walk to the train for school in the morning. Super fast and easy way to get what we need. The taste is like all natural applesauce, can't taste the spinach at all. I will continue to buy these for the rest of my life honestly. Sure beats buying all that organic fruit that is bad the very next day! 5 stars for these and thanks for making a product with everything we need and nothing we don't!

title: Messy
text: The formula just POURED out of the nipple when I was trying to give my grandson a bottle. It practically sprayed in his face and he had a hard time swallowing because of the rapid flow.

title: GREAT blanket
text: LOVE this blanket.  It soft and rich.  My favorite baby item I have.

title: You live and you learn… text: Their slogan is true. I used to be a pampers only Mom. When I had my daughter 9 years ago, I only tried pampers and Huggies. Huggies leaked, so Pampers was the winner in my mind.

This time around, I tried several more brands. All the major ones and several smaller ones. Some leaked, a few caused constant rashes, and two worked well. Pampers and Luvs. Obviously we went with the cheaper option. I’m just mad I didn’t give them a try our first time around the baby block.

title: Excellent teether but this is not a 2-pack as advertised text: Unfortunately, there is only one BPA-fre silicone teether in this package instead of the two advertised. It is for this reason, this gets a 2-star rating. Otherwise, this teether is excellent. 

The silicone is super soft. I consider this cute and engaging. This is easy for the baby to grab and hold onto. It has no sharp edges or parts that can fall off. For the most part, this is perfect as a teether and is one solid piece. As is typical, always supervise when the baby is using this and sterilize before first use.

This is made in China. The current price of $12.34 ($12.99 minus 15%) is reasonable for this if it came in a two-pack as that would be $6.17 each. However, as a one-pack, this is about $7 more than others are being sold for. Overall, I consider this a great teether and the baby is less likely to drop this. However, if these are being gifted, then I recommend buying [[ASIN:B0B1J9KJWK these]] which come in a box and are not squished into one plastic bag.

title: Great products
text: Great size for my 3yo. The straws are a plus and the little bags are cute!

title: Great looking product!
text: Looks amazing!

title: No.
text: Complete waste of money. Great idea but just impractical.

title: This is a great size bag and has all the appropriate pockets for ...
text: This is a great size bag and has all the appropriate pockets for a mom and baby!! I went ahead and said 5stars but i have yet to use it!! I havent had time to transfer my stuff!! But its made with great material and its got a life time warranty!! How can you go wrong?? Most companies wont offer the lifetime warranty unless they believe in their product!! The products material and functionality have already sold me!! Highly reccommend.

title: Keep the car seat cool text: Having kids get in a hot car in the summer is so hard. The buckles can be hot and hurt the children when they get in. Luckily that is not as big of an issue now that most of the buckles and belts are plastic or fabric, so you don't have the huge issue like when we were kids. However there are metal parts that can brush a leg by accident (wearing shorts in the summer) that can hurt, so it's better to avoid it.

This is a stretchy fabric cover that goes over the car seat and covers the whole thing. It's winter now so I could only test it in up to 40* F weather right now on a good and sunny day, but it did seem to keep the car seat a little cooler than the rest of the car when the sun was shining in.

It stretches pretty good, it popped off a couple of times when I was trying to get it on, so be careful when you are putting it over the seat. It's hard to do with a toddler in hand so I will probably only use it on extremely hot days. I do feel better knowing I can keep it cooler for my little one.

*I RECEIVED THIS PRODUCT (IN ORDER TO TRY IT AND REVIEW) THIS DOES NOT GUARANTEE A GOOD REVIEW OR CHANGE MY OPINION ON THE PRODUCT, I AM HONEST AND UNBIASED, ALL OPINIONS ON IT ARE MY OWN AND BASED ON THE PRODUCT ITSELF. I HAVE TRIED THIS MYSELF AND EVALUATED IT ACCORDINGLY

title: BEWARE Only 1 cup out of 2 is truly leak-proof
text: Super unhappy with this product. The blue cup has a tiny dent on the rubber part of the lid. It is almost invisible when on the cup, but obviously when taken apart and inspected on its own. It creates enough of a gap that water leaks through this tiny opening, rendering the cup unusable as it leaks on our daughter's face.

title: Great for kids projects!!!!
text: My boys used these as a project! They used these mini stars, glued them to black construction paper (not included), and made glow in the dark constellations! We hung them in their room!

title: Works ok but tends to run off when you apply it text: KeriCure's Natural Seal Wound Barrier is an interesting concept, basically a liquid band aid that helps when you have a smaller wound to protect it and allow it to heal. This is especially meant for issues like cracked skin and such to help lock in the moisture to allow it to heal.

Obviously like with any wound you have to make sure it is clean first since you don't want any dirt in there to cause any kind of infection. Then you just shake it up to make sure it is mixed well, spray on a thin layer, wait a couple of minutes for it to dry and remove the excess from the edges. Don't rub it in or anything since that is not how this is supposed to be used.

I found when you use it, it is just slightly tacky to the touch and is a bit flexible just like you would expect and hope it to be or else it would just crack and then you would have no protection again. It is very easy to use really but the layer you get is pretty thin. It does have a tendency to run away before it dries so you really can only apply a little bit. So if you wanted a thicker layer you would have to apply a thin layer at a time. They also recommend reapplying it up to 3 times a day, which to me indicates that they also realize it is not very resilient to normal wear and tear which is what I have found.

It works well for a quick making something that is open, add this on it to give it a protective layer for a bit but then that layer does wear off and you let nature just run its course or put a band aid on it. I just don't see myself grabbing to this one much at all unfortunately. Even though it is easy to use it does tend to run off making it a bit of a strategy game to figure out how to place the area in question to avoid run off.

title: Fine Product - could be more durable, but they work.
text: First, this is the second time I've bought these, so they are a good product. I use them a lot - and they take a decent amount of  punishment. After one trip, I discovered the TSA officers had cut one open to check the contents and did not attempt to reseal it, so I was lucky the bottle didn't break. Another wine diaper - a heavily used one - the inside is torn up and falls out . The final one - I decided to bring back a half-drunk bottle (great wine) - the cork leaked a little, but the wine was caught by the diaper material. So they do work.

title: Works great!
text: Works pretty good. I was afraid it would rip through the sheet rock with all of the animals we have hanging on it but after 2 years it is still going strong. The only think I don't like about it is that the clips break apart occasionally & the surrounding clips or animals fall off when trying to adjust one of them. Still, it is  a great solution when the toybox is full. ;)

title: Fun and cute
text: Put these on the boy’s wall (he is 10) and he loves them. Really makes his room look cute and they are easy enough that he hung his own, which was fun for him. They stick really well so far. No idea how easy the removal is, as they are not coming down any time soon

title: Main bag okay; zippers not great; cup/phone holder & shoulder strap terrible - 2.5 stars text: I really thought I was going to be impressed with this carriage organizer but I am not. The central compartment is decent and has four folder pockets and one mesh zippered compartment. The exterior back has one zippered compartment. The front has two zippered compartments and a bottle folder pocket and there are also two tiny folder pockets on the outside of the central compartment where the Velcro straps are for hanging on the stroller.

The compartments are good but anything with a zipper is chintzy. The zippers feel cheap. This also has a shoulder strap option and the shoulder strap is horrible; it is thin and cuts into my shoulder when the bag is full.

There is a plastic stroller cup/phone holder combo cup included. Unfortunately, that does not secure onto my stroller correctly. It does not grab onto the handle well no matter how I unscrew and then tighten it. It just flops down as can be seen in my photo.

On the positive side, this bag is roomy enough to hold wipes, keys, phone, a couple of bottles, etc. Two of the folder pockets in the central compartment can hold baby bottles or small water bottles.

In summary, this is a low-end stroller bag because of the cheap zippers, lousey shoulder strap, and useless cup/phone holder. I also feel the current price of $29.59 ($36.99 minus 20%) is overpriced for this due to all the negatives.

title: Bolt into wall for best results
text: We have a hallway where we put a gate up to keep our dog out of the kitchen and trash while we are out. This gate has 2 options to make it secure: Bolt it to the wall or use sticky-tape pads to adhere sockets to the wall, both of which are included in the kit. Because we just painted and this gate isn't a permanent installation, neither of these options work for us. We tried to use just tension minus the mounted socket/cups on the wall and he can knock it down. Our dog is a medium 45 lb dog.  <shrug>  Not the companies fault, but clarification on how it installs prior to purchase would have led us to another product, one that is tension mounted only with rubber caps on the ends.

title: If you are a nursing mother, this could be helpful
text: Not all nursing mothers want to show others that they are nursing. Some are self conscious and don't want their body parts exposed. This is a good idea for helping solve that problem. Mom gets to stay conventionally covered and baby gets to nurse. The material is like a t shirt, soft and cottony. It is easy to wear and easy to wash.

title: Cardboard
text: Not a fan of these diapers. They feel like cardboard and they gave my newborn a rash after wearing them for the first time. Double fail. There are other much better natural diapers.

title: Nice design, sturdy.
text: I'm actually using mine for dog-poop bags outside the house, but it's held up in all sorts of nasty weather, and does a good job of keeping the smell contained.  Holds a decent amount too.

title: Great bag that keeps you organized and is amazing for traveling text: This is a very nice diaper bag. It has a good amount of pockets that keep you nicely organized.

In the front it has an outer pocket in which there is room for 3 bottles. On the inside there is a small mesh pouch for smaller items. On both sides of the bag are water bottle holders which is great, or you could use it for like your umbrella or your phone when you charge it on the external charge port (note you need to supply a battery pack).

You have two straps to carry the bag with and on the top are two straps as well that you can grab. The can be combined with a little strap so they don't separate when the bag is in use. The bag closes with a nice little zipper. This one comes with a flap that goes over it to protect the zipper which makes it look super cute. On the inside you have a few side pouches to keep things nicely organized and a large compartment where your items go in. Since this bag opens on the top and can be fully opened it is easy to access all your items.

On the bag of the bag you have a strap that can be attached to luggage. You also have another zipper compartment for smaller more important items that you want to keep a closer eye on. There is another zipper that actually allows you to access the main compartment of the bag. You also get 2 belts that allow you to hang this bag onto your carriage. This is a very nice bag that is super well made. It allows you to keep everything nicely organized. I love the nice red color I got.

title: Five Stars
text: Works well!

title: Great scent but just so-so performance; thin liquid that you need to use a lot of per use text: I'm not all that impressed with this bottle wash. On the plus side, the formulation is great, with it using plant-based cleaners. The scent is citrusy and very pleasant. It's a noticeable scent but not overpowering. The dispenser bottle works well with minimal leakage at the spout.

However, the actual cleaning ability is so-so. It gets the job done, but I find I need to use more than expected to get the level of clean I want. The issue is compounded by the fact that the liquid is rather thin. Given how much I need to use per use, the cost per use is above that of other plant-based cleaners.

Taking everything into consideration puts my rating at 3 stars (average). It's an OK cleaner, and it does smell quite nice, but the overall value makes this something I'd not get again.

title: Pretty good text: Overall good. Not bad diapers but they leak sometimes. Have to make sure they’re sitting right.

Still had some sensitivity issues - not perfect but better than a standard diaper

title: It’s too big for a kid that the water pressure may get them painful text: It smells when I open it but it’s fine after hours.
It’s larger than my palm. It is really too big for a baby that the large volume of water may creat big water pressure and hurt a baby. It has wide open mouth and all the water can be dumped at the same time so the wide water fall really creates high water pressure, my baby even cried out. It’s just a very big cup to hold water and it doesn’t get water drops slow, I don’t see the necessity to buy it.

title: GET IT PLEASE!!
text: I got this for my god daughter as I am becoming a god mother soon and her being baptized is the most amazing thing ! I didnt know what to get her and I've loved bunnies my awhole life and used to say this prayer as a kid and thought this is such a good gift for her to keep forever! I would recommend so hard it's cute and loveable! Beautiful packaging ♡

title: Made for the minimalist in recordkeeping.. text: This was a gift for a mom who didn’t think she wanted to keep a baby book as, a 38yr old first timer, she didn’t feel the desire. She felt she would record the information via photographs and online keepsake journaling. So, this is where the simplicity of this Particular baby book came in handy! Yes!! Believe it or not there are people who don’t feel the need or desire to scrapbook… And this is definitely for the minimalist in that category.

This is not for anyone who likes to keep detailed records, diary or, has a love for spending hours creating pages of scrapbooking, memories and such. This reminds me of a place to put the bare bones 411 that a child may want to know one day.. after all, what child doesn’t like a peek back into their own baby book?!!
Pages are single question with an option to answer a writing prompt on a single line or two. There is blank background space that would allow one to add a photo or card, name tag, paper… Even hand/foot prints- IF.. they so choose to use the blank space around the question itself (or, one could even use the back side of pages as, these are single sided.) Yes! This does ask the vital statistics- and for those who doesn’t like to memory keep on paper but, chose to keep a trinket.. keepsake pockets are provided. A minimalist recordkeeping book is best way to define!

I appreciate the spiral-bound style book but, one will be careful not to overfill- spiral itself is not The strongest. This is unisex and could be used for either boy/girl and will adequately cover babies first year and anything else.. is just a bonus. I suggest keeping recipient in mind before ordering-
To be sure this will fit the need.
I hope this info helps… Feel free to let me know!

title: 5 year old was comfortable but forward seatbelt install interferes with Linear side protection (LSP) text: This is definitely a nice car seat. My 5 year old (42 lbs and 44 inches tall) fit in this just fine.

My experience:
- Crotch strap didn’t sit too close to his genitals. He never complained about it hurting him.
- Seatbelt lockoff is simple to use, thread belt through, tighten strap and pull upward to lock into place. No issues tightening down seatbelt or getting seat in position as to not move more than 1 inch at belt path. Actually one of the easiest I’ve used. Seat cover pulls forward easily to see belt pathand lockoff.
- Since my son is over 40lbs, the latch system can no longer be used. Seatbelt must be used to install in forward facing harnessed mode.
- The LSP system (linear side protection) which states that it should only be used with an outboard seat and only on the side closest to the door interferes with the seatbelt. While the seatbelt is in lockoff it lays over the LSP on the side of the seat (see photos) which caused some slack in the seat belt and if the lockoff were to fail the seat belt would loosen. I didn’t like that.
- Underneath the seat pad has storage specifically for latch system, which is push button style, not like the tether type clasp.. Very easy to use.
- Harness straps do not have to be removed when converting seat to booster mode. They sit behind the padding so they don’t get misplaced.
- SensorSafe plugs into the OBD2 connector in your vehicle and emits a series of beeping noises when you turn the car off. This could be an issue for anyone with a sleeping infant in a rear facing seat. Good idea if you are worried about possibly forgetting your child in the car. Not so great idea if you don’t want a cranky infant because the sensors woke them up mid snooze. Personally, I do not value this aspect but for busy moms or not usually part of the routine dads, this could be super helpful.
- The magnetic harness clip holders probably won’t get used. This isn’t a feature I would put high on the list. Maybe for an infant this would be useful but not for older children close to booster transition.
- Most car seats have an expiration 6 years past the date of manufacture. This Cybex seat does not expire for TEN years. That’s a long time to not have to buy a new one!
- 6 recline positions, arrow on side on seat shows position selected.
- No rethread harness. Easy handle under headrest allows you to easily move up and down with height.
- Headrest has 3 positions to recline back and forth as to allow your child’s head to rest up against it without slumping over when they have fallen asleep.

Personally, I find an infant carrier style car seat easier and more convenient for the first 5-6 months. This would be great for a child at 5-6 months old. At that age, you’ll know this seat will probably be the last one you’ll have to buy for your child.

title: You will love this stroller, it grows with your family and it literally expands
text: This stroller is fantastic, especially if you have an infant and a toddler. It is also compatible with click connect car seats. This stroller really had engineers think about what is needed for growing families. Each seat can hold up to 50 pounds. A child up to 50 pounds can also stand on the platform and baby can either face them or face the world. The first seat can turn into a bassinet when you want to use the stroller as a bassinet. You have 11 ways to position the kids to most suit you and your children. The canopies are big and do a good job at keeping sun off baby and a second child in the second seat. Just with the out of the box stroller, you have 11 different configurations for strolling your children. With the addition of the click connect car seat, you have 11 more configurations. You will love the one hand fold. It is a bit on the heavy side at just under 23 pounds, but it is able to do so much that you will love it. As your family grows, this stroller can be extended by 11 inches! How many stroller do that? Like I said, a lot of thought went into this system and if you have ever gone to Disney, you know your older child gets tired of walking and the platform is perfect to keep them comfortable.

He is still using his toddler bed, so now I have to buy another mattress for him. We should NOT have to go through 3 mattresses in 4 years for one child. That is crazy! title: Best baby shower gift!
text: Bought this as a gift for a friend as a baby shower gift.  They was super stoked about it.  I personally have the cup, the travel dishwasher drying rack and snack cups.  The snack cups are awesome.  My kids are 3 1/2 and 22 months and use them still to put cereal or crackers for on the go.  Great for stroller rides or the car.  The drying rack is great for pumping mothers.  Are used it everyday at work for cleaning my pumping parts and bottles.  I still use when we travel for my kiddos cups and sippy cups, etc.  The transition sippy cups are awesome because it teaches them how to use a cup versus this sippy.  We used this to teach my son how to drink out of a cup as we struggled for months until we got this.

title: A good small light weight mosquito net text: This net has helped my DD to sleep well at night. She is a mosquito magnet. They don't bother me. I rarely get bitten but if there is one within 100M she will get bitten multiple times. The price was reasonable and it was very easy to install. No bites since we put it over her bed at night.
Now for the critique. The net does not close well over a twin daybed so we have to tuck the ends down on the side. I feel it would fit well over a regular bed with only a headboard, but hers is a daybed and we have to stretch it over the frame. The net hits the ground, Barely. It Might be more of an issue of how small the hoop holding it out more than the design of the net. Second quibble, it is Very easy to pull the long cord loose. Since it is only a friction button over a thin nylon cord (not a loop or tie) if she hits it at night she has pulled the canopy down low over her bed in her sleep just by rolling and catching the net. This isn't a horrible issue for us, but I do have to adjust the height most evenings. I will be swapping out the cord for a more secure and stable loop.
However, the product is sturdy and help up to multiple catches, a dog jumping on it (its a mini poodle so not heavy) and other things that have snagged and ruined other nets. I love the ribbon edge finishing on the openings. Much better than a surged edge. And if I were traveling the button friction hold is a good idea rather than a fixed loop you tie. Overall this is a great product, with only a few minor issues.

title: Great blankets!
text: I got these for a close friend having her 4th child and FIRST girl! Flannel receiving blankets of this quality in such pretty colors and designs *and* in a multi-pack are so hard to find in stores. As always, I turned to Amazon, since they've never let me down when searching for a quality item. She was absolutely thrilled to receive them, and when taken out of package, they were so thick and soft, some of the nicest of this type of blanket I've ever checked out. Gerber always put out high quality products when my kids were little some 35+ years ago, and unlike many formerly quality brands, they have not only maintained the quality they were known for, but have exceeded it in my opinion. And the price for these was incredibly good as well.

title: Tangy mango curry flavor

title: Seem sturdy and well made text: We got this potty for when my niece visits so we can reinforce the potty-training that she is getting at home. We are still in the early stages of this and I've never tried a different product for this, but this potty seems to work well. My initial impressions are that it is sturdy and well made. My only complaint is that some of the packaging stayed stuck to the side when I was pulling it off.

The potty has a handle cut-out on the back so you can easily move it around when it's empty. The chamber pot (or bucket, as they call it) is easy to remove for emptying or cleaning, easy to put back into place, and stays in place while in use. The potty measures about 12" long by 9" wide by 9.5" tall. The chamber pot bowl measures about 5" wide and 6" long near the rim. It's 3" deep at the sides and 4.5" deep at the front. Made in Mexico.

Care instructions: clean the bucket with a mild soap and water solution. If desired, a solution of household disinfectant can be used. Rinse with clean water to remove soap residue.

title: Leaves Skin very soft & moisturize for Babies & Adults. Love this. text: Very moisturizing for babies, (grandbabies ) and use for baby shampoo . Be careful not to get this in your babies eyes.
I have also tried this Baby Dove Wash, and love, love it .
As I get older my skin gets dryer, even though I use a good body lotion. After using this my skin is softer, and not as dry.
I'm not sure if this too mild for me. There is not allot of suds in this which I think is good. More like a wash moister lotion.
Sometimes I also put a little liquid adult body wash on the same wash cloth as the Baby Dove wash for me.

There is no scent, which is healthier for babies . I personally would like a scent for me.

I received 3 bottles, one pump was broken.
I do like pump bottles, which make them easier to use when your holding a baby with one
Arm, and trying to wash a baby with the other.

That said, these pumps need to go back to the drawing board. There too short, and the pump is not consistent with how much it pumps out, or could I have gotten two bad pump bottles!!
The pump is the reason for the 4 star, and not the 5 star.

title: Squishy Deer Night Light text: This squishy deer night light by Anmones is really cute. It’s great for kids, but I think plenty of adults would like it, too. I know I do!

I used the night light for three nights, about eight hours per night, on one charge. The night light can be used while plugged in, which is a plus. I have a similar style night light that won’t work while it’s charging, so I was happy to see this one can still be used.

The night light has a few modes. It can be set to be on for 30 or 60 minutes, via the button on the bottom. In the timed modes, the color can be changed by tapping the deer’s head. The options are yellow, red, dark blue, light blue, purple, and white. Sometimes the color switching doesn’t always work, it can be a little finicky.

The third mode is a breathing night light that won’t turn off until switched off. The only color for this option is yellow. I personally wish I could have it blue or purple all night long, but this doesn’t seem to be possible.

The night light is made of a soft, flexible plastic that is the sort that picks up every speck of dust and dirt.

title: great light crunch, natural cheddar flavor, excellent alone or with a dip/hummus text: I like these a lot for myself. Crunchy baked, slightly puffed peas with cheddar powder flavoring. They're good! Very similar to other snacks (marketed toward adults) that I have purchased but better because the ingredients are simple and just better quality. Not salty, not artificial tasting. Just a yummy crunchy snack. Holds up to use in dips (ie hummus!). Love a pack of these with some sliced apples and hummus.

These are little bags. Five bags per box, 6 boxes total. They have a bit of air, which can help protect the contents from being smashed. Products like this are sold by weight not by volume, so understand that the little bags do not contain a lot (they are marketed for little kids, after all), and then add in settling, the bag will look nearly empty. It's fine. I find a handful of these is perfect for a quick healthy nosh by adults or kiddos. I love the natural, easy flavor.

title: NOT FOR NEWBORNS text: I made the mistake of believing that diaper covers could actually be "one size" fits all! It sounded like a wonderful dream that would make my venture into cloth diapering so easy and convenient. Unfortunately, these were way too big for my little girl.

My daughter was born at 7lb 4oz, I used a prefold diaper WITH a Snappi and then tried to use these just as a waterproof cover. I mean don't get me wrong, you can put the thing on the baby but I would say it is a long shot from "fitting" in any sort of way on the smallest setting. Which leaves you open to leaks. I'm sure these will be wonderful in a few months when my girl is a little larger, but just bear in mind that this probably won't be useful until 3 months unless you have a healthy 10lb baby (maybe even more...?).

Can't speak to wear and tear, ease of use, etc. yet. Will update later...

title: Gentle diapers that do not leak! text: My daughter is two years old and currently wears a size six diaper. My daughter has been known to have sensitive skin to the point where I can only use Tide Free and Clear laundry detergent. For this reasons (and possibly others), I am very brand loyal and have only bought Huggies diapers. On the other hand, I like to save money so when I was provided with the opportunity to try these diapers, I took the chance! We started out with alternating between these diapers and the Huggies diapers just in case my daughter had a reaction. When she didn't have a reaction, we decided to just use these diapers. Her skin continued to be clear and free of rashes! I was excited to see that she did not have a physical reaction to these diapers.
As for the absorbency, they are great! She wore this diaper overnight for a period of 12 hours and it did not leak!
I would say that these diapers are comparable to Huggies. I would definitely buy these for my daughter.

title: Hardware-wise Probably the Best All-in-One Solution - ADDING a Star for Good App Update! text: This is five star hardware. Video, audio, and air quality monitoring are great, and my original review focused on that. I deducted one star because the apps were not so great, and it was hard to do anything without getting hit with a sell trigger for Withings' "enhanced" monitoring. I even bought another unit.

And there's where the "air quality" starts to get funky. I signed up for the free trial of the enhanced monitoring but I could not get it to work. There's no ETA on when it is supposed to work, either. Hopefully by the end of the free trial, I guess. UPDATE - The most recent app update fixed a lot of what was wrong with the enhanced monitoring. It is not perfect, yet, but it is getting there.

To put this in perspective, this is much better hardware than the Canary, the WeMo cameras, and the D-Links.

Belkin Wemo cameras are not as high quality, but they set up easily, and their customer service and apps are user friendly and well-adapted to their intended purposes. They also add features - even for older cameras - in their updates.

D-Links cameras and apps are not easy to use, but their customer service is excellent.

Arlo (Netgear) is the easiest and best of all. Customer service is A+ level. If it had audio and air quality sensors, it would be perfect.

The bottom line on the Home? The hardware is terrific, but the actual monitoring does not work as advertised. Yet. It IS getting better! Good enough that I am keeping both units I have and probably buying a third.

title: More comfortable like a wrap, easy to put on like a structured carrier. text: I've used a bummer of wraps and even though i love the comfort, they are so complicated that I can't wrap my baby without watching the video, which means if wet are going anywhere i put the wrap on first and wear it without baby under my seashell until we get to our destination. Maybe I'm dense but i don't know how ladies do wrap carriers without enough sleep to think clearly.

Because of that, I've relied on soft carriers like the ergo and lillebaby because you just put them on and they work. This jj Cole one combines both in an inexpensive carrier that I like, but that had some obvious dumb design flaws which make it less comfortable, though not less functional.

You basically put it on like a softy structured carrier, and put baby in like you would a wrap. Is pretty self explanatory, unlike my lillebaby which took twenty minutes to set up!

I like the wide and comfortable piece of fabric acrid the back. It distributes weight well and avoids issues of the straps falling off or being to be crossed or adjusted. However, i think it could have come down even lower on my back for a mild improvement in comfort.

The real thing i dislike is the back of the waist strap and the arm straps that tighten one of the front pieces. While the waistband in front is generously sized, for some reason they have this skinny strap that cuts into your back fat in back. It would be so much better if that were a wide, padded strap with lumbar support like so many carriers.

The under arm, side straps are the same. I was feeling ok about my postpartum body until I saw how much these straps dug into my plump places. Not comfortable, not flattering. WHY not pad the straps to distribute the weight??

The real test was when I tried my 5 month old girl in it. She was happy as a clam, seemed secure and cheerful, and didn't fuss for an hour while I made phone calls and did small chores.

So overall it gets four stars out of five. It functions well and is about 70 percent as comfortable as my expensive soft carriers, but is a third the price, which means it's a pretty darn good value.

If they'd make the straps wider and padded and add lumbar support, it would be, in my view, on par with high end carriers.

title: Fold-Up Storage Cube text: This fold-up storage cube is 13 by 13 by 13.

It has a pale gray background with largish medium grey circles which gives it a modern, geometric appearance which would suit many gender neutral gray nurserys or playrooms. Gray is a popular color now - almost considered neutral - so this would go with many modern decorative interior design schemes.

This is sturdy, and folds up flat when you're not using it.

It can go on shelves or on the floor.

Good for some toys, magazines, mittens, books, socks, and other smallish items you want to organize or keep together.

It looks like it would wipe off somewhat, but it is made of polyester and cotton.

It is designed in the U.S. and made in China.

It has handles sewn on the sides. The interior has a grey, small mesh feel and appearance.

The interior thick bottom is separate. You push it down in over the fabric bottom which helps to create the cube shape. You pull it out to have the cube fold up.

This is a cute cube and seems like it would hold up - especially if the items inside are fairly soft and not super heavy.

title: Super cute, super soft.. sweet little monkey face blanket!!! text: Soft, sweet, but.. smaller than expected!! This is a fun “security blanket“- pacifier holder combo.. its so soft, and cute as can be! The character (and we all know, some of these can get a wee creepy to say the least..) but, this monkey is just stinkiń cute- his little ears and face are absolutely adorable.. and both, blanket and holder have a monkey head attached... Sounds super weird- But, it works! (I included a picture show size as well!)

Somewhere along the way I missed expectation of what a “security“ size blanket would be?! I pictured a receiving blanket- only, after seeing in person, it makes sense! These are made for ease, comfort, security and ability to tuck in/cuddle up.. Hence, the name!! So, know this is just about size of a burp cloth (or, a kitchen dish cloth.) these aren’t made for warmth/coverage in any way... got it! It may be nice if you can “assign” what will be their go too.. at least for a little bit- The size may be nice with all the other paraphernalia you must bring along.. and the familiarity for infant will bring added security- ha!!
My own kiddos, always fell in love with their “gi-gi” but, it was from a blanket we used and they’d naturally come to prefer. Which btw- always was biggest or, most obnoxious to lug around- Ha! (ie. My son fell in love with the hot pink/lime polka dot..made for his sister. So, he went to college with it- hidden in his pillowcase!!) With this blanket, you can pick color/animal and it is soft enough to become a favorite.. *The corners with the tied knots, I’m sure will be a favorite!! We know how much they love to stimulate with their fingers..
we picked the monkey as a gift for my nephew, his daddy is a native of Ghana- and used decor of an African safari.. so, this was a hit!! Bonus, color won’t show wear/tear as much so.. love the brown- it looks so good on his skin tone!

The material/softness gets better over trips thru the washing machine.. I’ve watch our little guy x2 wknds and washed it daily.. (corona virus is out right now and I must keep baby germ free...) Each time I retrieve from dryer- he looks/feels softer!

TBH, I’m not 100% certain how much use the pacifier holder will get? I appreciate you can swap out the pacifier provided. Only, the weight of animal seems to pull/dislodge pacifier from babies mouth- Also, the Velcro may be failing bc, of excess washing? **Hack: last time he was here, we hooked little monkey to car seat handle by his Velcro tab.. Looks super cute and as he grows.. it may entertain him?!
I wasn’t impressed with packing this came in.. it looks like grocery store wrapping! I suggest taking out of plastic wrap and putting in cute gift bag.. for the price point- I feel this should be in a nicer packaging. But, it’s an easy fix- So, if looking for a fun baby gift or, addition for your baby- this is sweet and could be a really loved security blanket for any infant!
I hope this info. helped.. feel free to let me know!

title: Will be great for the first few months... But, what about when they get active? text: I wasn't exactly sure what I was getting into when I ordered this Baby Monitor, Smart Baby Sleep Monitors with Mat by Derson. Quite honestly, I don't think the concept will work for a 3-4 month old, let alone an 18 month old.
It works well now, and gives us great security while the baby is still a newborn, and likely during the first few months. It tracks breathing and heart rate, which you can see in the app without any issue. It is easy to set up the app, and you get alerts if there is no breathing or heartbeat for 20 seconds. It is plenty loud enough to wake you in the middle of the night.
My concern comes when the baby starts to move around. No baby is going to lie flat in the cradling nest, on the mat, without moving around. After the first few months, babies start to migrate all around their cribs, so I don't see how this can continue to be helpful after that time.
It is well made, easy to use when a baby is a newborn, and the app works fairly well. The time I feel it will be useful just doesn't justify the cost. Especially, when it is designed to only work in such a small area of confinement. It says it will work till age 18 months. I don't see that being even close to possible.
This monitoring mat may give us peace of mind for a few important months, but when you are paying for 18 months, it makes a difference. It works pretty well for now, since the baby is still in the first few weeks, and sleeps in the cradling nest without a problem. If that is all the time you are looking to use it, then I would recommend it. Otherwise, invest in something longer lasting from a reputable company.

text: I am using this on my skin, and it is great! After showering and towel drying, I put this all over my skin. It absorbs quickly and goes to work hydrating my skin. There is no scent, and it isn't greasy in the least. The lotion is lightweight, but very moisturizing. My skin looks and feels moisturized at least 24 hours when I use this.

text: Every Toddler's nose needs boogie wipes to contain the snot! These are gentle and moist and the Saline scent helps open the airways. title: An excellent & adorable anti-drop teether but there is glue around the connection to the rod text: There is one BPA-free silicone teether in this package. The silicone is super soft. I consider this an interesting looking koala that is also engaging. This is easy for the baby to grab and hold onto. It has no sharp edges. There are also nubs on the opposite side to soothe the gums. This is easy for the baby to grab and hold onto. I have given many of these types of teethers to my neighbor's and friend's families' babies and they all love them. In fact, these anti-drop type teethers are a favorite.

Note, however, the rod that the baby holds onto in the center is glued around the interior edge on both sides (see photo). Most teethers I've ordered previously have a rod that goes through a hole in the teether but no glue. I do suspect the glue is food safe, as I had a vendor (with a name similar to this one) contact me previously saying they use food safe glue. Also, the baby is unlikely to get this glue near their mouth. Nevertheless, even though I feel this teether is excellent, I recommend supervising when the baby is using this or any teether for that matter.

This is made in China and is rated for infants 3 months and older.. The current price of $8.99 is competitive. Overall, I consider this a great teether that is drop-resistant. The baby can definitely drop this if they let go but it is definitely not as likely to be dropped as others.

text: This gate was easy to install (once I read the directions). We do not have children (the gate keeps dogs out of the kitchen), so we leave it unlocked (there's a tab that holds the handle down for small children). The gate stays open until we push it closed, but the latch does not slide home by itself; we have to lift the latch to finish closing the gate. The handle stays up until we push it back down. This makes it easy to bring the groceries in, but families with small children will need to *remember* to close the gate.

title: Perfect for wheelchair users
text: [[VIDEOID:ce1d66ba68aacc32f1cdd3068cd16c91]] I bought this for my friend who is having her first baby.  She is also a wheelchair user so she has needed a few accommodations for the nursery.  I was thrilled to find this because it didn't need to be modified at all.  You can use it on any flat surface so she can put it on a desk that she can roll up to or use it on the floor if she wants.  It's sturdy,  but lightweight so it's very easy to take with you and use it on the go.  It has a removable toy bar to keep the little guy entertained while he is changed.  You can remove or add the toys periodically to keep it interesting.  There's also a seat belt for added safety and a washable cover.  The changing pad itself can be wiped clean.

title: Durable, easy to use, but hard to write on
text: Hubby and I both like the Nuk bags over the Medela bags, which are the ones we started with. They are durable and freeze well. (And defrost well.) Hubby likes that the top of the bag is wider than Medela, so there's more room and he doesn't touch my milk when opening the bags. He says they are easier to open, too. I like that they have a double zipper, which makes me feel more confident that the seal is truly sealed - so I don't lose my precious liquid gold. I find them easier to close, too. I also like that the bottom of the bag opens wide with ease. With the Medela it took some effort, like trying to open a plastic bag and you can't find the opening. I am buying this product again and it will be my go-to bag. The only thing I don't like, which is why it's 4 stars instead of 5, is that it's hard to write on the bag in the writing area. Medela was so easy - I wrote date and how many ounces. I still haven't found a good way to do that with these bags.

title: Perfect

No diaper rash either, and they seem soft enough that they're not bothering her skin either.  Good buy.

title: Made in USA, safe and unbreakable
text: Purchased for safety and Made in USA. Very sturdy. Unbreakable. They stack without suctioning to others. They are about the perfect shape to help avoid spills. Haven’t had any so far. Purchased the plates and cups also. Love the mermaid colors. I highly recommend these not made in foreign country.

title: Great bottles that work with Spectra pump
text: I have used Avent bottles with my Spectra pumps and they have been great.  My daughter has had no problem going back and forth between the bottle and me, though I never moved her past the newborn nipple (she is 10 months old).  They are sturdy and, most importantly, easy to clean.  My only complaints are 1. that a tiny bit of milk always gets stuck in the lip at the top and 2. you have to buy the caps separately so you can seal the bottles.

title: Stable and the handles are very useful
text: This one actually works great. Not the case with some of the others on the market. The handles really help my two year old and it’s very stable.

title: Cute! Gets the job done.
text: Got this because i was tired of using my wipe warmer and get the big bags of wipes. It gets the job done, no complaints.

title: Perfect for us text: ** UPDATE... We've had this for about 3 weeks and it's been a game changer for us. This has honestly been one of my favorite and most useful purchases this year. The grandkids love it too. The second row in my suv is two captains chairs, no console. So when the kiddos need to go when we're out and about I just set it up between those 2nd row seats so they can have a little privacy if anyone is nearby. Of course if one goes they all "have to" go. But hey, we're already stopped. So no big deal. This little potty is solid. Even the 6 year old has sat on it with no problems. I love how small it folds up so it doesn't really take up space. The Blue Snail bags for the potty are heavy duty. No leaks or drips. I did run out unexpectedly the other day so I grabbed some small (4 gallon) trash bags at the dollar store and they worked too in a pinch, but I've got to say I prefer the thicker Blue Snail bags. The trash bag felt so flimsy in comparison and I don't want leaks on my upholstery. The potty came with a roll of bags and I ordered extras, but the extra bags were at home that day. If you have young kiddos (or little grands like us) this product is perfect. I cannot say enough to express how pleased I am with this purchase. Thanks to Blue Snail for giving me peace of mind (and our littles a place to "go") during these uncertain times.

** Initial observations... Y'all, I'm obsessed with this little potty to keep in my SUV for my little grands. I didn't feel safe taking them into public restrooms during a pandemic. Gone will be the cries of "But I have to pee!" Mamaw has got you covered now babies!! It folds up into the tiniest thing, but it seems very sturdy when open.

title: Perfect For The Car!
text: Useful potty for on-the-go. It’s smaller than a typical training seat, but it’s enough width for my kiddo to sit comfortably. The base works like one of those collapsable cups—When it expands it locks in place and is surprisingly strong, but it easily collapses back down with the correct twisting motion. My only gripe is how thin the included bags are. I’d be sure to double bag or get your own thicker bags to ensure the waste is securely contained. This seat isn't as robust as a typical training seat (no handles, not as wide, no actual toilet bowl), but it's really handy to keep in the car!

title: Light weight!
text: The Maxi Cosi Mico 30 car seat is awesome. It is so light weight, even with the base attached I can easily carry this. The base is so easy to install in the car. I love how big and airy the canopy is. The material is very soft on the seat. One of my favorite small details on this seat is that the strap you pull to tighten the harness is hidden beneath the fabric. I think this is a must, since little babies kick a lot. I have had my older kids cut themselves on other seats because of this, so Maxi cosi really did that right! I like the infant head support shape. One of the things I dislike is there is no infant insert for the body. I wish it had included one, or at least the option to buy one with the seat for extra. The seat is east to adjust.

title: Good deal
text: Real deal. Good pampers. Never had a blowout.

title: Great product text: These are a great product. O ly reason I gave 4 not 5 stars is easy of use. I found a bit difficult to pin on my 15 month when she wriggled. I used regular pins so maybe with the plastic snaps would be better.
Otherwise awesome product

title: Starry night!
text: Wonderful for the price. The pink color is super cute too! My partner and I used to have stick-on stars on our ceiling that would glow in the dark, but when we took them down to move apartments they left residue. We wanted our stars back in our new place, so got this instead. Super happy with it, it’s super pretty! And it has an app to control it too!

title: Diapers Work. Stiff and Heavily Scented.
text: The shape of these is rather square which - for my chubby babies - doesn't work out as well as more contoured diapers.  It creates gaps at the back and tops of legs which result in some really bad messes.  They're also heavily scented with a floral powdery scent that seems to persist no matter how long they've been opened (we keep our diapers in an open basket).  On the plus side they are extremely thin which is sort of nice when you're dressing baby in layers during colder weather but they're also sort of stiff.

title: Keeps Baby Nice and Dry
text: We've had a fairly recent addition to our enlarging family, and I get to do a LOT of baby sitting these days.  I have used all sorts of diapers over the years and most work out just fine, including Pampers Swaddlers.  They go on easily, stay secure and hold things nicely until the next change.  I haven't experienced a "blow out" yet with these diapers but that'll probably happen eventually.  I don't think any diaper is blow-out proof, but so far I am very pleased with these.

title: Top pump broke
text: Love the product but not the pump, cheaper plastic broke on the first one sent. Recived a replacement that broke after one use.

title: Five Stars

title: Our touch control doesn't always work well
text: I got this for one of my children to have a light in the night when needed, but it's handy to have around for anyone. I used it one night for reading when our power went out for several hours during a storm. It gave me just enough light to see the pages, as long as the light was close. You can charge it up, and then be able to use it without it being plugged in, which is wonderful. Our only complaint about it is that the touch control isn't that great. Sometimes, we have to put in quite a bit of effort to get it to do anything, so for us, it's not a simple touch control. It can get annoying and frustrating. Otherwise, we've been pleased with it. (Note: To turn it completely off, there's a switch on the bottom. Also make sure that it's turned on, or no matter how much you touch it, it won't come on. Ours struggles even turned on, though.)

title: Love this car seat!
text: I really love this car seat.  I had another that was twice the money and was really a great car seat;  I liked it just fine.  I LOVE this one though!  Great fabric, easy to unbuckle (a lot of them require far too much pressure for those of us dealing with post-natal tendonitis), and soooooo easy to take out and put back into place when using it as a baby carrier.  Plus, this design is really cute- pictures do not do it justice.

title: One tiny (wet) flaw....
text: I bought this carrier for a puppy with megaesophagus which means she has to be kept in a vertical position for 30 minutes after each meal. Since I can't take several hours out of each day to sit with her, I wanted a more mobile solution and this carrier works great! I can use it as a free standing chair to feed her in or carry her with me while I do chores or take my evening walk. The child harness holds her securely in the carrier and even my vet was impressed with how well it works. I find it very comfortable to wear, especially with the mesh back panel, although I had to play with the adjustments for a couple of days to get the hip belt right. It's also easy to over-tighten the shoulder straps which does make them very uncomfortable and shifts the weight too high. I am 5'6" 135 lbs and have a rather short torso and I have the waist belt on it's lowest vertical setting so I'm not sure how well this carrier would work for a taller person. Another big plus is being able to carry the puppy's food and other necessities right in the pack. The only drawback that I found is that when the puppy had an accident (she's not completely housebroken) the carrier design neatly funneled all the fluid right down my lower back and legs; something to beware of whatever species you happen to be packing around in it.

title: Lights stopped working after a week

title: Super handy to keep around.... text: I like having these handy, especially through the fall and winter months. We never know when a sickness will invade our home. My husband also drinks them on occasion, especially in the summer months when he's worked outside and sweated a great deal. He likes the taste of them. These are sweeter than he anticipated, with the usual slightly salty taste.

I like that these are individually packaged. That way we can use them as needed and it's more convenient and sometimes less wasteful. Each packet needs to be mixed with 16oz of cold water and then sipped.

There are 6 packets per box, so 18 packets total. Per packet there are 50 calories, 0g fat, 650mg sodium, 12g carbs, 12g(added) sugars, 0g protein, 370mg potassium, and 840mg chloride.

title: Tommee Tippee

However, we're able to fit 6 bottles at a time! It's so easy to use and the 30 minute drying cycle dries all the bottles. It's quiet and looks great on our counter. This is well worth the money and I'm glad we bought it.

title: Very well made text: I was very impressed by the quality of this product. While it could have more sounds and a true white noise generation capability, the features it does have are more then adequate. It has helped with my sleep especially when I am traveling.
I typically don't like noise when I sleep but there are times when you just need to block out other sounds and this was great for that. I was kind of hoping it would be able to prevent people from hearing inside a room using white noise generation but typically those devices are much more expensive. I mean it can be used for that but true white noise shouldn't be audible to anyone and this device wouldn't be capable of that. I really like the lighting it provides and my daughter loved it and has stolen it from me. I would really like to see them add a downloadable database of sounds that can be added because it has a limited amount as is. For the price this is a great little device to have. If you live alone and have trouble sleeping due to strange or unfamiliar noises in the house this would be a great product for you especially if you don't have to worry about security. While there is still room for improvement I believe this is defiantly one of the better products out there in it's price range. One more thing the buttons and materials are very well made and the instructions are well written and easy to follow.

title: Convenient, but Temperature Readings Can Vary text: Taking temperature can be a pain- no pun intended. If you’re using a traditional thermometer, you have to make sure it’s clean, then hold it in place under the tongue for a while to get an accurate reading. It’s annoying enough when you’re an adult, but it’s even more frustrating when trying to get an accurate temperature for a child.

With so much trouble using a traditional thermometer, alternatives are often sought and one option to think about trying is the Braun No Touch Plus Forehead Thermometer. With a device like this, you don’t have to worry so much about sanitation or positioning the thermometer just right in one’s mouth. You just touch it to the head and wait for a readout. Because of the way it works, you can even use it on children while they sleep and, using the built in features, you can check the progress of a fever and see if it’s dropping or getting worse. What could be simpler than that?

If this sounds to you like something a little too easy and convenient to be true, well, in some ways you would be correct. The reason I say this is because you cannot always trust the reliability of the temperature readouts. Touch it to someone’s forehead, get a readout, and then try again. The temperature will often change just a little bit. It may not sound like a big deal, but when you’re checking for a fever, every fraction of a degree counts. I noticed that other users have complained about even larger discrepancies in accuracy. I didn’t notice anything like that, but there was definitely a difference and for that reason, I recommend using it a few times when checking for a fever, just to be sure.

Other than that issue, this thermometer does have its advantages. The convenience is its strongest point, but I also like that it’s lightweight and ready when you need it. Including something to store it in would have been nice, but I guess I can accept that small oversight.

People get fevers and temperatures need to be checked. Braun’s No Touch Plus Forehead Thermometer is an okay device that has many advantages, but is a little flawed in the one quality that matters most: The accuracy of the temperature readout. Still, it is reasonably close to accurate and the convenience and other factors are enough to convince me to rate it average overall.

title: Returned these!

The pluses are you can put the adapter on it to hold your cosi carseat and it rolls smoothly.  The basket at the bottom is a nice size.  The cup holder is awkward and not very sturdy. title: Nice set with a couple quirks text: The design of this stroller has a lot of options. I like that the seat can face either way. A couple of points to know:

-The stroller seat has to be installed to use with the car seat; when folding up the stroller, the seat has to be fully upright or it has a hard time opening afterward.
-The infant seat has to be tipped forward slightly to get it to lock into the stroller seat
-It has an automatic locking clip when it is folded into storage position, this can take some getting used to, especially if other strollers you have used do not have this feature.

Overall great value for the features it includes, but could take some getting used to.

When the weather gets cold or if he’s cutting a new tooth, he will end up with redness and chapping in the area the pacifier covers. . I saw this style from NUK and decided to give them a try hoping that the open design would help. He took right to them, which was a miracle since he’s so particular, and  has been using them for about two weeks now. In that time, the chapping and redness have gone away completely not come back. These binkies are lightweight and shaped nicely. The airflow they allow really makes a difference. Anything that makes life better for my little man gets my highest recommendation!

title: So cute and great for little slobber buckets! Label says 8 bibs ☹. text: These TotAha Super Bibs are, well, super bibs! I love the cute colors and they go well with most any little outfit. These are great for twin slobber buckets! They absorb a good deal, are made well, and the stitching is spot on. They are quick and easy to fasten, cover a good area, and absorb quite a bit.
They come in a plain plastic bag, and have a cute paper band around them, but it says that it contains 8 bibs - minus 1 star for this discrepancy. It makes a difference when gifting these. title: Staying Dry and Healthy text: These are wonderful diapers for baby...and parents/caregivers.
Most important, they are some of the lowest irritant diapers I've found. Less rash, happier baby and healthier baby.
Of course, that's good for parents, but as a caregiver I really like the indicator. Slipping a finger in or peeling the nappy back gets old.
And since you can know right away, you can avoid your precious one wearing a wet diaper any longer than necessary.

Our burner knobs are easily turned on,not to full ignition, but worse...gas emits from the burners and can fill the house..obviously unhealthy for everyone. These knobs ill prevent that from ever happening. They're surprisingly easy to work with when cooking.
