title: A Road Trip Must Have text: This is a brilliant concept that once you use it you’ll immediately think - why didn’t I think of this.

For years I tried to stuff a pillow between my head and the door on road trips so I could nap in between times when I would drive. Inevitably my head would tilt away from the pillow as soon as I fell asleep and I would wake up - or if I did fall asleep I would wake up with a terrible neck ache.

This simple, yet brilliant device, fits around you car seats headrest and provides a pillow headrest to either side of the headrest. In order for this to fit I believe you will need a headrest that raises and lowers. The majority of fixed head rest seats will not accommodate this product.

This has proven a must have for road trips with my family.

title: Very basic mini baby bag; no room for a chaining matt unless folded text: This canvas bang is a versatile diaper bag but is very small, meaning there is no room for a waterproof changing pad. However, it can also be used as a regular backpack.

FEATURES
- The front of the bag has one small zippered compartment.

- The central compartment has one "cooler style bottle sleeve" which does not have a floor, so that it goes through--hence a sleeve. Also, there are two folder pockets on either side of the central compartment.

- The central compartment is spacious with room for several diapers and other incidentals. Due to the squat size of the bag, I do not feel a waterproof diaper pad can be carried in here unless it were rolled up or folded.

- The back of the bag has rings for the shoulder straps. Note that the shoulder straps are somewhat long and cannot be cinched too tight. Someone who is really skinny will have the bag fall down near their backside because of the long straps.

- There is a snap cloth that holds the handles together.

In summary, this bag is durable as the material feels like canvas. It looks like a regular backpack and works like one too but doubles as a diaper backpack. It is very small and perfect for a day's worth of diapers but not much else. The current price of $24 is competitively priced for this.

title: Good For Anyone With Sensitive Skin, But Packaging Could Be Better text: I generally like Dove products, especially the soap bars. This baby lotion has a stronger scent than I would like, but it's fairly thick and creamy, so you don't need to smear a lot to moisturize, which is good. Though aimed for babies, baby lotion is also great for anyone with sensitive skin. I have dry patches on my knees and elbows, so the feel of this is very soothing.

While the shape of the bottle is a little unusual, my big thing is that I would much prefer a pump. The container is wide at the bottom and narrow at the base, so while this allows it to have a firm foothold wherever you put it, I find that it's harder to use when you're halfway through the bottle. Holding it upside down, the lotion comes out slowly, like ketchup in a Heinz bottle. Except for the packaging, I have no complaints.

title: I HIGHLY recommend this to parents of multiples!!!
text: This is a must have for any new parent....especially if you have twins like me! I cannot stress the importance of staying on top of cleaning the unit though. You have to clean the part where the formula dispenses into the bottle daily and the rest of the parts need to be cleaned once a month (per manufacturer's recommendations!). If you don't clean it as recommended it sometimes clumps up where the formula dispenses out of, causing the bottle to lack the full desired amount of formula/oz. The water stays heated to a warm temperature. There are different settings to use for different formulas so you need to keep the guide as a reference in case you end up switching formula (like we did). Some have complained about mold in the unit. I have to say that I have had this for almost 7 months now and haven't noticed anything. I do stay on top of cleaning the unit though per the manufacturer's recommendations. The only thing that I don't like is that it only makes bottles in 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 ounce increments. So, if your child takes a 5 oz bottle (like mine currently do) you end up wasting an ounce if he/she doesn't drink it. Luckily, I have twins so we make a 10 oz bottle and split it into two. I use this A LOT! Never had any issues with it. I think it is well worth the money spent on it!

title: A well-built car seat for small babies, though has a few inconvenient design flaws – love the click connect feature text: This is a serviceable, if not overwhelmingly awesome, car seat for newborns. Since it fits 4 through 30 pounds, it's great if you are planning for a possibly small baby, or prematurity as in the case of many twins. However, realistically speaking many babies will outgrow the height restriction before they reach 30 pounds. My son was 30 inches tall at about 25 pounds. The advantage here is that you are completely covered no matter the birth weight of your child, and it seems to fit newborns snugly - the last car seat that I had back in my first son was born went from 8-35 pounds, and even though he was born at 8 lbs. 8 oz., it definitely felt overly large at the beginning.

However, given that my new baby is measuring particularly small so far, I'm glad to have an updated car seat that covers a smaller size baby just in case. I expect that we will move up to a convertible car seat when she has outgrown this one, either in height or weight.

I like the unisex design that could be used for another baby in future or pass down to another family with a baby either gender. The seat is lightweight enough that it is easy to carry inside if baby falls asleep or if I just need to run inside someplace for a quick errand, though obviously you'll never want to leave the baby sleeping alone in a car carrier as the position can cut off oxygen as they rest.

I hardly ever use the canopy, given that I live in a mild coastal climate, but if you live in a hot climate, you may want to invest in a model that has a sturdier canopy as this one feels a little flimsy.

By far my favorite aspect of this is just the click connect feature. I have a click connect jogging stroller, and with my first baby, I had a different brand of car seat. We tried strapping him into the stroller facing forward, and he was terrified of it until about six or seven months old, so I pretty much was stuck carrying him, even if my back was tired. The click connect feature is fantastic, we can use our existing stroller and just set this car seat facing up towards my face so me and baby can commune as we walk. She can get some fresh air and enjoy some of the blue sky and tree line as we walk, and we can converse and smile at one another. The fact that this makes my jogging stroller useful much earlier in the process and eliminates the need for a traditional pram or similar device is fabulous.

The car seat was easy to install and adjust, though you should be aware that unfortunately you can only adjust the straps in the back, which is a design choice I'm not a big fan of. However, my last car seat, which was a hand-me-down gift from a close friend, also had that downside, so it's not a dealbreaker for me.

Overall, this is a decent if not stunningly great car seat for small infants, I appreciate the lower weight range given that she is seeming small on her ultrasound and that I already own a convertible seat to upgrade her into as she grows, and the click connect feature that works with the whole line of strollers including my existing jogging stroller is a fabulous way of making it easy to bring baby into the grocery store or for walks outside to get both of us some fresh air. While it is a little bit flimsy and inconvenient in areas that don't really matter, the safety and sizing of it seems solid, which is the important thing. And it's also nice that it is gender-neutral.

title: Neat Product text: I wish they'd had these a few years ago when my youngest was still a baby. I made his baby food, so these would have been so handy to have. I use them for myself now. Due to diet changes, I've been eating a lot more homemade nut butters. I don't want to have to mess with a spoon, especially while traveling, so I needed a solution. These popped up in the search results, and the included funnel sold me on the product vs. others.

It's easy to use, and the funnel makes it easier. It's fairly easy to clean, though you might want a bottle brush, or something to get in the corners. Make sure you open the expanding flap at the bottom to fully fill the product.

It works well with nut butters as long as they have a smooth consistency and aren't too thick. The picture on the right is homemade sunbutter, which works well with these. The picture on the left is of Wild Friends Chocolate Coconut Peanut Butter, and it is super easy to suck out of the pouch.

I've discovered they also work well with yogurt, applesauce, juice, and smoothies, if you're on the go. They would probably work fine with pureed soups as long as you cooled them off some first too. I haven't tried that. You might get some funny looks sucking on a "baby food" pouch, but do you care? I don't. :)

Bottom line: Convenient, fairly easy to fill (don't lose the funnel!), pretty easy to clean, and works well with items that have the proper consistency. I'd give 4.5 stars since cleaning the "neck" is a bit of a pain, but highly recommended, and not just for kids.

title: Good to wrangle my child for meal time
text: With trying to get my daughter to start eating like a civilized human being and not a mad animal (toddlers  are wonderful arent they:)) we needed to get her something that we could use on our tables and when we went to restaurants.  For some reason, my daughter hates high chairs so we figured we would give this a go.  It works well for having her sit in.  I'm not going to like I was worried about it gripping the table and not falling but so far it has proved to be a champ.  The one thing I would warn about is that tables more than 3.75 inches thick will not work with this so choose your tables correctly.

title: AWESOME!! text: This thing is awesome. it's small yes, but so is a child's lap. I went with this one over the others because it is thick, doesn't bend and has a cup holder.

My daughter is 2. this was great for our road trip, we actually didn't have to stop as much cause she had a tray to eat on. She was able to play on it, she was much more entertained having a play tray.

It is very easy to wipe down. My daughter spilled her water in it and it stayed in the tray. She also found that the cup holder made a great pacifier holder as well.

I have also used this in the care for shorter trips around town when there is a need for snacks on the go.

highly recommended.

title: Relaxing.... text: I love this bubble bath, and so do my 3 little boys! I had to stop using bubble bath in the past, due to reactions that I was having. (I tried to simplify everything that went on my body.) This bubble bath has been wonderful, and I've had no reactions to it.

The scent is nice, but mild. It's just enough to not be overpowering, and I've found it incredibly relaxing. It doesn't take much at all to create a tub full of bubbles,so I love that it will last a bit longer than the average bottle of bubbles this same size.

If you or your children love bubble baths, but need something gentle, this Honest bubble bath is the way to go!

My 3 month old child now uses the matress for sleeping in our room overnight until he transitions into his own room. It has held up well and it's still firm. I purchased a 2nd matress for naps at his Nancy's house in a pack and play. They're easy to wipe down. In regards to it being noisy, I would say it's mildly crinkly. I use a matress cover and sheet over it and I think it's fine. It hasn't affected either of my kids sleep which is most important. For that reason, I gave it 4 stats because I'm sure there's better out there that are super quiet and more bed like, but obviously for a premium price.

title: protect facial skin moisture barrier text: Sorry I can't add any information as to how it works on a baby's butt. I do however occasionally use it on my face. I have red, sensitive, dry skin that is currently being addressed to help add back hydration. I bought this to protect my facial skin moisture barrier. I didn't want a typical product that relies on petrolatum/mineral oil. I also didn't want to spend a lot as I would not need much of it nor would I need it every day. Many people recommend diaper rash cream for it's benefit from zinc, and ability to seal in moisture on damp face (or out, as would be needed for a diaper rash cream on a baby's butt)however the rest of the ingredients are not favorable to me, especially not my face. Yet I looked into more naturally based diaper rash creams to see what I could find. I went with the Honest company due to its nourishing ingredients as well as its availability in local stores (but I still ordered from Amazon). I think it was about the same price here. Upon use, it is evident that it is moisturizing. It goes on smooth and spreads easily, not thick and not too thin; there is no drag against skin. There is a scent, not sure what it stems from as I can't quite identify it. From what I can tell from the label, it isn't an artificial/synthetic fragrance, but it is a scent, so keep that in mind when making a selection if you or your baby are sensitive to that sort of thing. If you are using this on face, be sure to moisturize and/or apply on damp face as the intention is to keep moisture in. If you are using it on a baby's bottom, be sure the butt it totally dry before application or you will only exacerbate the problem. Diaper rash creams act as a barrier, so while I want to keep the moisture in for my use, you will want to keep the moisture out with use.
Besides my face, I also use it on my hands.

title: Glides smoothly, looks attractive and well made. text: Love this swing. It glides smoothly, feels comfortable, *by my touch*, no jerking motions. It's sturdy and it looks nice.

Easy to assemble. Needs batteries.

title: Safe and light spoons for toddlers with good grip; perfect for adults to take along in a cooler text: I ordered these for me to carry in a cooler. It is great not to have to fuss with full-sized utensils and perfect for travelling with a companion.

They are lightweight and the handles have a good grip. I ate with these and they work perfectly and have good mouth feel and are functional even though these are made for toddlers. There is a notch on the back of the handle so that the spoon rests nicely on the table. The stainless steel is thin but still good enough. I assume these should be washed by hand.

The product page is not up for these spoons so I have no idea how much they cost. However, I would pay $8 or under for this set of 3. If one is looking for a more higher end toddler utensil set, I personally prefer the [[ASIN:B07L4BK3JS Munchkin Stainless Steel Toddler Fork, Knife and Spoon Set]]. It is higher quality and feels a little more substantial than the thin stainless steel of this set. One also gets the three different utensils, instead of three of the same utensils. The price of that set, however, is currently $19.99.

title: 100% recommended

title: A great kit for little ones text: Aquaphor is the gold standard in baby skin care. We recently had an opportunity to try some alternative product (from a different brand), and they work but this is still the best. I love that this comes as a set with a tube and jar- you'll definitely want to keep some with you in a diaper bag so the tube is great to have, and the tub is good for keeping next to your changing table at home. So, you get all your bases covered in this kit!
Aside from the diaper skin treatment, aquaphor is great for excema and other dry skin irritations- my older kids sometimes use it as well as the baby. Every household with kids should have this stuff around, highly recommended!

title: Jacob’s ready for daycare!
text: Mom worried about Jacob going along with napping, but now, that will not be a problem.  He loves his “bedroll” with a little handle, and he’s practiced rolling and unrolling it up.  He’s ready.  Loves the pillow with the elephant - and the colors are all so calm and soothing.  What a great idea!  Everybody in daycare will want one!

title: Love the pump option....
text: This is classic Johnson's Baby Shampoo. It smells  the same and is tear free. It works well on babies, children, and adults. I use this for my children and even my own hair occasionally. This particular packaging is a large pump bottle, which I love. A pump always makes bathtime easier around here, for some reason.

title: Poor design. text: I really and truly wanted to make this work for us. The idea of having a tiny kiddie seat to flip up and down easily is perfect- but in practice this Mommy's Helper is a mommy's pain in the neck. The hole for the child to use the bathroom through is quite small, even for my low (height/weight) percentile three year old. He complained that he wasn't able to clean himself, or would somehow sit on his hand and would cause distress.

The pee guard is flat on the back, so if my boy peed while sitting, it would hit that and would spray all over, including ONTO my toddler. And the wall. And the cabinet. Then the underside of the thing would be a filthy disgusting mess, requiring a thorough cleaning of all cracks, seams and crevices after each pee and spray event while dealing with a crying boy. Flipping the seat up hardly worked as well, even with all adjustments it stick out from the top strangely and tries to poke you in the back, or just falls right over.

Even if the other problems were fixed, I wouldn't buy this based on the uncomfortable shape/size of the hole. My two year old refuses to use this as well.

title: Adorable baby nail clipper set; cute and functional - 3.5 stars text: This is not a high-end set but it is cute, functional, and overall adorable. There are five implements in the set that are held tight by a foam piece inside the penguin body.

INSIDE THE PENGUIN"
1. Baby Nail Scissors: - suitable for 0-1 -year-old baby
2. Baby Nail File - suitable for 0-3 years old baby
3. Baby Nail Clipper - suitable for babies over 6 months old
4. Baby Earwax Removal - suitable for babies over 6 months old - NOTE THIS LIGHTS UP
5. Baby Tweezer - any age group

The scissors are sharp enough but not so sharp as to be dangerous. The nail file is a glass file and works reasonably well. The nail clippers are sized for babies and are cute and functional; they even worked on my nails. The earwax removal tool lights up but the battery is not replaceable. I guess it will work but I am not one to recommend digging in a baby's ears. The baby tweezer has a round edge and is not very functional, in my opinion.

This set gets 5 stars for cuteness and 3 stars for functionality; hence the 3.5 star rating.

title: Super cute mobile, but requires you to assemble it and the presentation is not impressive as a gift text: This mobile comes in a tiny, six-inch by 12 inch by half-inch flat cardboard package which looks like it should house a few cards or a bit of stationary. It certainly doesn't look like an expensive mobile. If you're giving this is a gift, you should be aware that the amount of money you spent on it will not be apparent from the packaging.

While it is a beautiful mobile, it is made of paper. It's also not assembled when it arrives, so I had to spend over a half hour folding and fiddling with it before I could hang it. I love to do origami, but with a newborn, that is certainly not how I would've chosen to spend my time. If you give this gift to somebody who is not crafty or not good at making tiny, precise folds in paper, this gift might fall flat.

Also, because it is made of thin paper, this is clearly not built to last. If a child actually grabbed it, it would be destroyed.

Though it is an absolutely gorgeous, delicate little mobile once hung, I think that for the price it should have come fully assembled, and should have had a better gift presentation in the packaging. It kind of hurts to spend so much money on a few little pieces of paper.

title: Works great for me
text: Works great for me, and keeps the sun from baking us while we are driving. This is a great product from a great seller. I'm overly impressed with this product.  I enjoyed testing out this product. This is a product that I'd gladly purchase again. I am a satisfied happy customer. I was given the opportunity to purchase this product at a discounted price in exchange for my unbiased review.

title: Well made in America. A good value. text: Going on it's second year of guarding the entry to my front porch year around, still working and still looking good. It is a little tricky to get used to latching and unlatching, but once you get the hang of coordinating the dropping of the hook into the lower ring while squeezing the upper latch to fasten it, it's actually quite easy. And with my arthritic hands, that's not a small thing.

The fact that you can open it from either end and either open it like a swing gate or push it all the way open accordion-style is another plus. If you need the entire opening to move a large piece of furniture through, it's also very easy to completely remove it and then replace it.

I like the fact that's it is well made in America. And the fact that the only thing plastic is the guard that encloses the upper portion of the gate to prevent fingers from getting pinched and add stability. That is a fairly sturdy piece of plastic. We don't have small children, but, with five dogs, ranging from 90 to 30 pounds, it's done it's job.

title: My favorite part is the easy installation using the seat anchors ...

title: Not just for car seats
text: I realize that this is supposed to be used with a car seat,  but I bought it for a very special little girl who uses a wheelchair.  She has a desk attachment at school, but they are ridiculously expensive.  I'll be honest and say that I wasn't really expecting much.  I thought that for the price this would be fun to play with on occasion.  This turned out to be so much better than the regular wheelchair tray.  The adjustable sides kept her from dropping puzzle pieces or other little toys and the cup holder was very handy.  I was concerned that the strap would not reach around her big power wheelchair, but it can be adjusted to a very large size if needed.  The side pockets are great for storing toys or snacks.  Although it doesn't really effect how one uses it, she loved the pink color and the nice texture of the tray.  I think she is going to get a lot of use out of it and will be the most stylish wheelchair user around.

title: Powerful little clip fan for on the go text: We adore this little but power fan for our summer walks with our daughter. It clips easily to the visor of our Britax stroller and stays secure the whole walk (even when we get a little bumpy). The fan has 3 power/speed settings controlled from a single button on the bottom. We haven’t run the battery down just yet so I can’t say how well it uses up the battery power but it is a very powerful little fan!

The color is a light pink that is quite attractive. The settings are quite cool/cold and it makes very little noise. Excellent travel fan that fits in the pocket of our stroller when we’re done.

title: Great update!!
text: The Britax Grow with You Harness-2-Booster Car Seat (newer version of the pioneer) is great!! We had the pioneer a few years ago and I loved everything about the seat except it was so hard to tighten the harness straps. I am happy to say that that problem seems to be fixed! On this car seat, I have my almost 6 year old, 45 inches in height, 47lbs in weight comfortably harnessed it this! It has a cup holders that are easy to wipe clean. The black material is so sleek and soft. I love that this can be adjusted for booster mode up to 120lbs. It is easy to install with the cars seat belt.  You will have to put your weight into the seat and pull the cars belt tight when installing with the seat belt. Britax also has has a steel frame which gives me piece of mind on safety. The harness/headrest is so easy to adjust because it is not a rethread kind. You just push a button and pull up.

title: Great quality bowl set
text: Decent quality. Spoon is strong enough to mash pressure cooked carrots. Also works really well for feeding or just use as teether. It made feeding so much easier that I don't have to hold onto a bowl to scoop. Came in a plastic shell case which also makes it appealing for gifting.

title: Hard to get water out
text: 6 month old can barely get a few drops of water upon pulling hard. Maybe he’ll be able to use when older but it’s not a great starter cup.

title: Protects my son very well! text: With how the straps on my son's carseat lay, he is almost always getting pinched on his neck every time we buckle him in. I wanted to by some strap covers, but didn't want to spend an arm and a leg since I would need to buy a few... these are great. Nice and cushy, but not too bulky. They are soft and do a perfect job at preventing my son from getting pinched.
My only complaint would be that since they are made from muslin, they tend to pill and get dirty easily. I think they're easily washed, but they don't look good for too long with all the pilling.
That said, they do the job and do it well. And my son doesn't have to worry about being pinched, so that makes life a little easier. If I could recommend anything to the seller, it would be to change the fabric. Other than that, it's a great product!

title: Love this lid for my Healthy Human bottles
text: These lids work great with the Healthy Human bottles.  I purchased 1 of these for my 2 bottles.  They work well, don't leak, and attach easily to a backpack.  I liked it so much that I bought a 2nd lid. To clean them, I remove the rubber gasket, then put the gasket and the lid in the dishwasher.  This week, I made hot coffee early in the morning, put it into my Healthy Human bottle, screwed on this lid, then forgot to take it to work.  When I got home at the end of the day, the coffee was still very warm.  That was 9 hours later.  The bottle and lid together are great.  I struggled whether to give this 4 or 5 stars.  The 4 stars is because you should not have to spend money to buy this lid.  There should be an option to buy the bottle with this lid instead of the other lid.  I threw away the lids that came with the bottles.  Such a waste. The functionality of the lid is great, but the additional price is too expensive. I am happy with the purchase, just not the extra price to buy this lid.

title: Baby bed set.

title: sturdy, attractive, deep basket that holds a whole load of laundry text: Lovely soft basket. It is quite generously sized. The base is wider than the opening at the top. It threw me off the first few times I used it, but I have been happy using it for laundry. I think overall I prefer a shorter soft basket or a basket that is also wide at the opening. However, it does seem like never ending space inside and it comically holds a lot. So this may very well be just what you are looking for. The main thing for you to know is that this company has different style options, size options, AND the baskets are of really good quality. They look good, are dense, are sturdy (they don't feel like they would fall apart).

Excuse the mes sin my pic, but I snapped it while doing laundry. The basket has the entire contents that I took out from dryer. Normal full sized loads of mixed clothing. Handles make it easy to carry.

text: AS more of the mini-cribs are becoming more popular because they save room and baby can use them for quite some time, sheets are a requirement. These sheets are 100% cotton. It is recommended to wash them before first use. You machine wash in cold water, using a mild detergent on a gentle cycle. Then they can be tumbled dry on low. Remove immediately and fold to help prevent wrinkles. If you are going to put them on the mini-crib, it will be fairly easy with 5" deep gusset to work with all mattress types for baby.

title: Excessive packaging, but my toddler with eczema likes the wash text: You would assume a brand focused on being organic and eco-friendly would have done research on their consumers and realize that this level of packaging is too extra! People say it’s good for gifts, but a high density shoe box full of paper Easter grass is way too much for one body-wash. Then there’s the extra plastic leaf clip to close the scrub.

Aside from the packaging complaints, the product itself works well. My son had eczema and this didn’t bother his skin, or his eyes when it got in them. It got off all the grime from playing outside with the hose. It’s very handy that it can be used as a wash and shampoo. It smells wonderful too, a light honey scent. I was a little concerned because sometimes fragrance bothers his sensitive skin but this one was fine.

title: Super portable and slim for easy storage
text: This baby walker basically arrives fully assembled. You only need to pop it up into the locked position for operation. When fully stowed away it is less than 4" thick. The wheels are easily removed by pulling if you are worried about the dangers involved with this type of product if left alone. There are specific instructions not to leave your child alone in this and you should follow those. The height can be adjusted to multiple locking holes, you only need to squeeze the metal rods and pull the seat into position. The actual seat portion is fabric and can be removed for washing. This is a pretty cool, portable feeding station or walking bouncer.

title: Clean very well
text: These wipes clean very well. There is just enough texture to them so they grip and wipe bottoms totally clean. They are on the small side, but actually clean better than larger wipes without the texture. They have a neutral smell.

title: I love how it doesn't have a cloth stain-magnet cushion that ... text: I'm not about to sacrifice aesthetics in my home just because I'm having a baby! The Tripp Trapp matches our dining room set, and doesn't have that tacky look that you see on plastic high-chairs. I love how it doesn't have a cloth stain-magnet cushion that goes with it either. It's sleek, real wood, and has a tactful finish. This was my favorite "splurge" item because choosing a regular high-chair was giving my anxiety (Oh no, is my house doomed to become full of pastels, monkey prints, and plastics? Nope!).

The price point is worth it because it grows with the child and from what I understand it withstands the test of time well and will look just as new with a second or third child since it's so easy to keep clean.

This Boppy 4 & More Multi-Use Cover folds up super small and takes up minimal space in the diaper-bag. Of course it has other uses too for carseats and nursing cover. We are past that stage but it will definitely get lots of use when out to eat at restaurants or out and about shopping!

title: Ok walker
text: My neice used this item, she is 7 months old. It was very easy to assemble and only took a few steps. It has three adjustable height points, which is good for it to grow with baby. When I moved it around on my hardwood floor, the back wheels were a little stiff, they are pretty rugged wheels. The front wheels are smooth and rotate 360 degrees, but the back wheels are rugged wheels that go back and forth. She isn't walking yet, just sitting in it, so I'm not sure how easy it will be for her to manuever it. In order to let it down, you have to remove the pink sides and attach them at the bottom, basically a lot of work to do versus the other walkers with the cross bars where you press a button and it goes up and down. Although, this could prove much safer so it wont collapse on the child. I saw some people saying the kids got their fingers stuck, but I havent had that problem. For $40 though, I may go with a different walker, if I had the choice.

title: Perfect mat to create the infant to toddler “utopia!” text: Absolutely the real deal…I’m in love with this find!! Its a perfect blend of both, quality and usability- And just what I was looking for. Wow..!!

Being tasked with the new role of “Auntie-Nanny” to my sisters little one.. After 17 years of being out of the game, I found myself searching the options to create a perfect “infant-toddler utopia..” with travertine tile on most of my main floor sent me searching for a safe solution- this is the perfect mat to grow with our needs from infant to toddler, providing tummy time and all movements up too toy exploring- all while providing comfort and peace of mind to safety!
I chose the largest of the mats which is perfect for our front room TV area. Yes! Being larger also allows room for the adults to sit next to baby and as they play around on the mat. With larger mat I can accommodate plenty of toys making this an oversized play arena of sorts! The gray is a light solid cover without creases (which I love because, nothing can get into a crack to hide and be in harms way of baby putting item in its mouth! ) I’ve found with all the “scientific” influence of babies only seeing black/white or, overkill busy prints- This is not one of those! It will not cause the front room in your house to look like a play barn!!

The comfort is amazing with this mat! The intelligence put into this design; to create the right layers of cushion all ergonomically mastered for safety, comfort and longevity.. A trifecta of goodness! Sold at a higher price point it should be top quality and it is! This has the ability to go the distance of child rearing , if cared for and stored appropriately. Truly, NO detail was left out of the quality/comfort department- this is best described as a thick padded gymnastics/tumbling mat. It performs more in line with a commercial/Olympic quality.. but, with the ease of using in your own home! Definitely an investment worth making!

I hope this info helps… Feel free to let me know!

title: Why do these contain xylitol? Get fewer for more cost than other brands text: I'm trying to figure out why these wipes are so much more expensive than the others we buy regularly. There's nothing special about these when compared directly to the Amazon Basics Sensitive wipes. These are not the same size, they are the same thickness and just as moist. The ingredients look pretty similar, though the Basics wipes are easier to decipher. One question I have is why do these wipes need xylitol added? It's a sweetener - that just makes no sense to me.

These wipes do their job, but at a budget breaking cost. The Amazon Basics wipes cost less and you get 480 wipes total, but these are just 150 wipes total in the 6 pack. That's a pretty significant difference for no functional upgrade.

title: Portable sound machine w/timer & 12 soothing sounds; takes 3 AAA batteries text: [[VIDEOID:334994622f0ac340580f7feeaf762b07]] This sound machine comes with a total of 12 crisp sounds that sound more like lullabies with only one nature and one wave sound. This is battery operated but requires 3 AAA batteries (NOT included). It comes with the unit itself with an attached carry loop for hanging on a carriage and an instruction pamphlet.

Operation is simple as per my video. All the controls are located in the front with an ON/OFF button, volume up and down, and track forward and back. There is no light or headset jack. The timer does not offer continuous play but can go for 15, 30, and 60 minutes. The notes are crisp and clear but the limited sounds are just okay and sound mostly the same.

In summary, this is not worth the purchase due to the need for AAA batteries. Also, the current price of $18.74 ($24.99 minus 25%) is expensive for this unit. If looking for a portable rechargeable unit, I recommend either [[ASIN:B0B259KS9B this]], [[ASIN:B0B5H4TXZM this]], or [[ASIN:B09WJ1HC3N this]]. One of my favorite non-portable plug-in models with 34 sounds is [[ASIN:B09YRZ53JS this]].

title: Decent Bottle text: I don't really care for the type of plastic these are made of. It does seem that the newer bottles showing up are made of the same thing, but I guess I'm old fashioned in that respect. They are BPA free, so I won't complain too much. This particular bottle has a yellowish tent, which I don't really care for, either. It makes it look kind of dirty. The plastic SEEMS like it's less durable, but I haven't had any issues yet, so I'm not taking off any stars for that.

My boys(so far) haven't had any issues with gas or spitting up that bad, so I can't really say how effective they are as far as that issue goes. I'm grateful that my boys haven't been too picky about what type of bottle we use with them.(now pacis are a completely different story). We just swap up whatever is clean. Since they don't have great issues, my favorite bottles are the ones with less pieces to keep clean. This one has 6 pieces, so honestly, it's a last resort!

Overall, I have no reason to recommend these over any other brand.

title: Easy to negotiate 4 inch curbs even with 2 todlers on board! text: This stroller is well designed and perfect for the grandparent strolling two grandkids. It is very well engineered. There is more than enough leverage to hop sidewalk curbs even when fully loaded. The wheels steer well and easily negotiate going up one inch height differences at driveways without having to raise the front wheels while pushing.
Due to the size, and because we have ample storage, we do not fold it up. We just cover it with a sheet and store until ready to stroll to the park at a moment's notice.
The wheel locks work easily for resting at inclines.
Plenty of room for adult accessories, including a drink cup holder.
We have not yet tried the child stand-up feature.
If there is a problem, (and no problems expected) additional comments will be provided.
This stroller is a pleasure to use. And the neighbors enjoy watching, too.

title: AWESOME snack cups.... text: I love these snack cups. We have a set of the munchkin cups, but i always feel bad because it seems like my 20 month old is scraping her fingers on the hard plastic. I went searching for something that was a little more forgiving, but would still have some protection against her tipping it over and showering my car with goldfish. These are perfect.

The top is silicone, so it's soft - no scraped fingers. Yet, she can still reach in and get her snacks easily. When turned upside down, the snacks don't fall out. Now, eventually your little one will figure out how to hold one side of it open and shake all of the contents out. That is sort of inevitable and a downside of just about every snack cup a kid can use on their own.

All in all, I think this was a great buy. We'll use these for our snacks for some time to come.

title: DermaSav Barrier Cream and Skin Protectant, 4 oz. text: I use these types of barrier creams for myself. I'm a perfectly healthy person, it's just that I like to stay active by hiking and playing tennis.....A LOT. I usually get some sort of friction rub especially when hiking, due to the length of the hikes, the heat, humidity and needing to relieve oneself along the way. After a day or two it can get a bit tender. I have used and continue to use several different brands of diaper rash creams and they all work quite well (except for Desitin - it stings, remember that if you use it on a sore baby's behind) but the DermaSav is especially good. I went on a hike this weekend and used it BEFORE and after I got back and was quite happy that I was not sore at all!! It does leave a barrier that seems to stay a bit longer than the other diaper rash creams, but I wouldn't say it was heads and tails above them. Actually, it does about as well as the others but does seem to last a little bit longer. I don't know if the tiny amount of Calamine lotion does anything but give the cream a pink tinge. It's in such a small amount (1%) that I don't see it as contributing anything beneficial.

Overall, this is a very good skin protectant cream, though I cannot say how well it will soothe someone who wears incontinence underwear, or is bed-ridden.

title: The same as the organic one? text: This is kind of “odd” because this is the exact same swaddle. .including picture listed. . . and price. . . of the “organic” swaddle. (see link below). One shows organic cotton, and one does not. So I’m not really sure if there is indeed a difference here.

SwaddleMe makes really nice products. . . and this one is one of them. The organic cotton is a very “neutral” color which can be easily used for both boys and girls. It washes well. SwaddleMe makes items for all different “stages” as you will see above. I really love their print swaddles, though they are not “organic cotton”. The packaging, which can be different depending from item-to-item (and even for the same item), is always nice and easy to wrap when giving for a gift.

The only thing I wish they would change is where they make the items. They are Made in China, and it would be great if they could make them in the USA.

title: It took 2 3/4 cups of water before these leaked! My niece loves, loves, loves the princesses when she visits & fit is comfortabl text: I was having a conversation with my barely three year old niece about her upcoming visit to our house and she proudly informed me that she now wears "big girl pretty panties" instead of diapers. Her mother translated later for me that my niece is now in training pants full time, so I decided my guest suite supplies ought to include something suitable for my niece. These Cutie Princess Training Pants turned out to be the right choice.

My niece is utterly delighted with the princess images and we had to give her a pair to carry around with her to show off to her Granny rather than showing the ones she was actually wearing. These fit her fine, her mother says there aren't any red marks from the elastic or leg areas. The Velcro type closures on both sides are working fine and reattaching with no loosening. My niece thinks my house is magic because we have princess panties here. :-)

I tested the leak factor by taking one pair and pouring measured water directly into the liner and then twisting until it leaked. It took two and a half cups of water with no dampness to the touch and no water wringing out. Two and three quarters cups resulted in a bit of water easing out of the sides. That's a lot of liquid and I am impressed with how much these hold. The image on the front of the pants does fade by the way, but you don't really feel any wetness.

title: Didnt work.
text: When my baby turned a year old I switched him to milk gradually, like over 4 or 5 days. Three days after his first birthday I brought him to the doctor, & she noticed 2 eczema rashes on his belly, which weren’t there before (probably due to the milk proteins). So I bought this lotion & applied it religiously every day, 2 or 3 times a day. Didn’t do anything to the eczema rashes. This went on for almost a month. One day I tried some Aquaphor Baby on the rashes instead. I noticed they were less red the next day, & that was after just ONE application. I’ve only put on the Aquaphor Baby four times and his rashes are gone, GONE I TELL YOU! I like Cetaphil products but this one was a waste of money.

title: My Child's Favorite Toy! text: This is without a doubt the BEST toy I've purchased for my daughter. I can't say enough about the tremendous versatility of this toy. When it comes to baby gear, my biggest peeve is how quickly they become obsolete. Interests change as children grow and they quickly become bored with toys. The Kick and Play Piano Gym grows with your child!

I purchased the Kick and Play for daughter when she was 2 months old. It was an immediate favorite for her and a complete lifesaver for me. Between kicking the musical keys, gazing into the mirror and reaching for the hanging toys - it could keep her occupied long enough for me to make dinner or knock out some chores. This held her interest for months. Now that she can sit up independently, I've flipped the keyboard so that she can strike the keys with her hands - she LOVES this. Although she's not yet walking, the keyboard is detachable - so once she's "on the move", her piano can go with her!

The Kick and Play is solidly constructed, adorable and it provides enduring entertainment - an uncommonly good purchase!

title: Battery-operated sound machine w/timer & 16 sounds; highly portable text: [[VIDEOID:283666599e57962c113551ad3e73d2cc]] This sound machine comes with a total of 16 sounds. It is battery operated and is packaged with a USB cable, the unit itself, a circular clip, and an instruction pamphlet.

I charged this for about one hour before use. Operation is simple as per my video. Press the ON/OFF switch on the side. There are seven operational buttons on the face of the unit. The white noise button is where the four white noise and four fan sounds are located. The lullaby button is where the eight nature sounds are such as chirping birds, a train going over the tracks, thunderstorm, etc. The timer feature goes from 30, 60, and 90 minutes or can be turned off to play continuously. There is a pause button and a light button with two brightness levels.

The unit is really lightweight and highly portable. There is no headphone jack. The only major negative I see is that the ON/OFF button can be hit accidentally when the unit is being carried since there is no lock feature.

The current price of $19.43 ($21.59 minus 10%) is on the high side of competitively priced for a portable unit with only 16 sounds and no lock button.

title: Beware, this product is composed largely of castor seed oil, the source of the notorious toxin called "ricin" text: I have been avoiding any use of petroleum jelly (petrolatum), ever since I learned it can contain carcinogenic aromatic hydrocarbons, if they are not distilled out. BabyGanics ointment is an "all natural" alternative to petroleum jelly, but without the petroleum toxins. The first two ingredients listed in the ingredients of BabyGanics Protective Ointment are "castor seed oil" and "hydrogenated castor oil". Wikipedia states "All parts of the [castor] plants are toxic, but most dangerous are the seeds...The principal toxin of castor bean is ricin, which...may comprise up to 3% of the seed weight..." and that ricin is a nerve toxin, which can be fatal in even small amounts. Petrolatum and this "all-natural" alternative product both seem to me to be potentially too risky to use.

Update: Ricin is so toxic that production of castor oil for human use relies both on the water-solubility of ricin, and on the fact that ricin is denatured by heat. No substance is infinitely water-soluble and zero oil-soluble. Solubility is measured by the "partition coefficient", the ratio by which the solute dissolves in water versus oil when the aqueous solution is shaken with the oil. Some trace of ricin will be found in oil which is cold-pressed from castor beans, especially if there is any alcohol present, since castor oil and water both mix with alcohol. Aqueous ricin solution must be boiled for 10 minutes before the ricin is denatured.

Summary: If any alcohol contaminates the production process, and if the castor oil is not heated sufficiently, trace amounts of ricin could persist in the castor oil. How much ricin is needed to kill a person or cause nerve damage? Trace amounts. I am not willing to take that chance.

Reference: Barnes DJ, Degradation of ricin in castor seed meal by temperature and chemical treatment, Industrial Crops and Products 3/2009; 29(2):509-515.

title: cute and helpful
text: I do really like this mirror. It is a great idea to have something that catches the babies attention and keeps mommy from distractions.  The mirror is a nice size so the baby can see himself in the mirror pretty easily, and think he likes to look at himself! It is surrounded by a nice cushion, which I really like and really helps add  to the safety factor for me.  It has a remote control, at first I thought why would you want a remote control, but it is amazing. You can turn it off or on if the baby is sleeping or gets fussy. It does not have to have lights and sound all the time, which is great if you need more quite in the car. The batteries in the remote last a good long time, which I appreciate as well. I took away one star because it does tend to move around a lot, like I said, my son likes to look at himself, and when it moves and he can't see himself he can get fussy. Also because the remote does not let you choose lights only or music only, it is all or nothing. But overall, this is a wonderful product and great if you have to be in the car for more than just a few minutes with your baby.

title: Case is awful text: After comparing all sorts of pregnancy pillows, I decided to go with this one which is one of the most expensive out there. I was hoping to find a more comfortable way of sleeping on my side than surrounding myself with multiple pillows. The pillow does the job but it's not perfect. After only a few weeks of use the cover started pilling and is turned scratchy, which I find terribly annoying. It is also very thin. Note that the cover isn't 100% cotton but a polyester blend. I can understand why they can't produce a higher quality cover, this is so you buy another of their mediocre and expensive cases, which I refuse to do. So now I'm just using a regular pillowcase over it, so the part where I put my head is covered. Another issue is that it gives me a stiff neck.
On the plus side, I didn't find that it gets too hot (it's summer and 95+ degrees here), I was hotter when I had to sleep with four pillows around me. I also like that you can shape the pillow in different ways so I can also use it as back support when I'm sitting on the bed.
All in all, I see the Snoogle as a necessary evil in the third trimester, given that I have to sleep on my side. I do think it's overpriced.

Baby loungers should never be used for babies due to risk of death; so I use loungers as pet beds. This cover provides me with extra protection for the lounger and can be washed. I would not put this cover in the dryer due to the slinky material. I do wish it felt more like cotton than spandex, however.

Note that this is a cover only and a lounger is NOT included. Also, this is designed specifically for an hourglass-shaped baby lounger but can be stretched to fit others, although it will not look as good.

title: Simple & large shopping cart cover with instructions text: This is a large-sized cover that will fit larger shopping carts appropriately and loosely fit smaller ones too. The photos are of this on a ShopRite cart. What is extremely refreshing is that instructions are provided.

This cart cover is easy to install. I just put the patterned side up and flip over the material that goes around the handles and the back of the seat. There are two hook straps (one on each side) to secure the back in place to the thinner rungs of the cart (see photo).

There are holes for the baby's legs and there is no strap to secure the crotch area in the center area as on another cover I tried. However there are straps to secure the baby in place, which are adjustable and secure.

In the front, there is a window pocket to store incidentals such as ID, cash, or iPhone. There are also no extra straps. pockets, or loops for pacifiers or toys like some other cart covers have.

Overall, this is a great, loose and large shopping cart carriage cover. I suspect it will fit a highchair but I really think it will be too loose for that. I love that this is simple and easy to set up. I also love that there are picture instructions. The current price of $29.99 is on the high side of competitively priced for this. I actually like this cover the best of all that I tried due to its simplicity. This gets 4.4 stars round down to 4 stars from me.

We can see our entire back seat, blind spot to the right, and more of our rear view window.  Note that you may need to take it down for night driving if you're sensitive to too much light.  Highly recommend!!!

title: Overall it's a good gate
text: I purchased the dark "farmhouse" gate because it's a bit taller. I have a standard sized goldendoodle and wanted to use this to "attempt" to block off specific areas of the home while he's still a puppy. I purchased this specific brand/type of gate because I really liked it when my son was a baby. It's cheap, effective and easy to use - no installation. I was really confused when it arrived and the little latching mechanism appeared to have changed. Now, all of the parts that were previously metal (other than the wires of the gate itself) are plastic including the latch. Previously it was metal and you could just push it down and you were done. Now it's a plastic thing you have to pinch down the tab and slide it. Not a big deal really but I am hoping it holds up as well as the metal. I can see how this helps make it more toddler proof because it's hard enough as an adult to unlatch it. One handed is not really an option anymore either. I'm taking a star away for that annoyance and wish the would go back to previous design - but overall its still a nice cheap gate that works.

title: Great idea Bad execution

The gate is long enough but the quality is terrible. I had to purchase wood glue because after the first day, the gate began to fall apart at the seams. The wood is an unfinished type of wood and can be painted to color or stain, which I like. But the hassle of applying glue to all of the seams was time consuming for me. It does serve its purpose so i will be keeping it. They need someone kind of quality control check with this item. It can be a great product but it has its issues.

title: This mattress topper has been perfect for what we were looking for--something to provide better ...
text: This mattress topper has been perfect for what we were looking for--something to provide better airflow when our son sleeps facing down and also to provide some cushion to his slightly hard mattress.  As some other reviewers have mentioned, when he sleeps with his face down, he will wake up with the weave pattern slightly indented on his cheek.  Personally, this has not bothered me much--the inprint goes away quickly and is worth the peace of mind vis-a-vis airflow.  We also use very thin cotton sheets (the mattress topper is visible through the sheets) so I wonder whether thicker sheets would help with this problem.  The cushioning has been great--although I would have liked even a little more cushion, but I do understand that this is not the purpose of this item.

The picture I have of them in the dark is right after I "charged" them up. I put them right next to the light. This is why they look so bright. They still glow very lightly in the night just not as bright. Either way, a great feature to have!!

title: Reliable Gate
text: I bought this gate to keep my dog out of the kitchen while we're eating, since he does nothing but scrounge to the point of pushing us and the table around trying to get the tiniest of crumbs. We also use it to keep our son blocked off from the rest of the house, since he is able to get out of his own bed and use his own doorknob now, and we use it to keep the separate the meaner of our cats so that everyone else gets a chance to eat. This gate works very well for all of these purposes. We also had to buy the extension, and despite the fact that this is stretched to its very limit (53 inches in a 52.5-inch gap), it still works well and holds up. The metal is a bit soft, though, so when we let our dog out and he ran back into the room, he ended up bending the side of where the door is and it wouldn't close. But we bent it back into shape and it works again. We may be the exception to the rule, though, since our dog has a history of bending metal that may have no bearing on how other families may be able to use their gate.

title: Basic, Easy to Use Video Monitor with a Few Extras text: This is one of the easiest to set up baby monitors I've come across. The instruction manual reflects this simplicity - there are almost no written instructions, just a few pictures to show you how to plug it and get it working.

That said, the picture is fairly sharp and records the baby's movements well, though it's not as good as your standard video camera. But it's good enough for focusing a static image of the baby in the crib. I was a little disappointed to find that, while the monitor can be adjusted at an angle, it doesn't swivel around or have any pan or zoom features. It's designed to stay put in whatever position you leave it in. The night vision is fine, nothing extraordinary.

Extras included the temperature feature, which is kind of neat, and a battery-saving "peep" mode.

The only area that concerns me is the sound quality - you get an annoying "echoing" effect when you change the volume and a brief ringing that disturbs my eardrums. This also happens when you try to increase the volume on the microphone as well. Once it settles into the new volume level, however, it's OK.

Another area I'm concerned about is the casing. It's made of cheap plastic, which makes me wonder about how long this device will function smoothly. However, if you're looking for a basic, relatively inexpensive video baby monitor that is very easy to set up, this one fits the bill well.

title: A Slight Wipe & Slightly Dry
text: I was using the Nature Babycare diapers that I considered pretty good, and definitely better than the 7th Generation diapers, so I figured when these wipes became available that I would switch from the Earth's Best Wipes, and maybe even save a little bit of money.  That was a great thought, until I opened the first package.  My first disapointment was that they are such dry wipes, and my second disappointment is that they are so flimsy, then the third and final disappointment is that they were just a tad bit bigger than my hand, which does not do well for the dirty diaper clean-up.  So, I am making this one of my first reviews, so that others know before they make the switch.  I guess if these are the first wipes that you have used, then you wouldn't know any better, but trust me, the Earth's Best are much better wipes.  I think I gave away a few packages to needy mom's, who can truly appreciate them, then I switched back.

title: Interesting but poorly executed, don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed. text: Interesting and useful product with some curious design decisions. First among them the peculiar screw adjustment, this thing has a set of jaws which adjust via a red plastic screw cap at the bottom, it moves in or out as you turn the screw in or out. Not a clamp like I'd think of, but millimeter-by-millimeter adjustments. Unfortunately, this means that the MINIMUM clamp is about 2 1/2". I had hoped to attach this to my iMac, but it's not thick enough, so I put it on a 2" marble square paperweight so I can see people approaching behind me as I work.

It would be OK in the car to keep an eye on your toddler in the back seat. The mirror is not great quality but it is sufficient.

Rethinking the clamp seems kind of obvious. The thing is lightweight overall and rattles a bit -- you need it tighter to help stabilize the reflection. A neat idea, but one which could stand some refinements. It's more of a novelty at this point. Clever but far from perfect.

title: Nice baby wash & lotion set; soap does not sting eyes; lathers well, etc. text: This is a really nice set that is packaged well enough for gift giving at a baby shower. I used the soap as both a shampoo and body wash and it did not sting my eyes. It also has a nice soft fragrance and lathers exceptionally well, which I love. The body lotion is moisturizing but does take a while to absorb. The only negative is that the tubes dispense the product too quickly. I had to be careful to press lightly on them because if I did not, a lot of soap or lotion would come out.

Other than the quick way this dispenses, the soap and lotion are wonderful both for babies and adults.

PS This company sells this same body wash and lotion but WITHOUT the boxed set for a higher price [[ASIN:B07MRSWN91 here]]; so I would buy this set over that since as of this writing that one is $21.98 and this set is $17.97.

title: So big! Well made, and the cute mat is very much appreciated. text: This Derson Baby Playpen, 79"X71" Extra Large Play Yard with Play Mat is exactly that, Extra Large! It is really big, but we love it. It is a bit finicky putting it together, and it would not be one that I would consider easily portable. 
I appreciate the two little "doorways". I'm only 4'11", so I can go through them easily or make an unbalanced climb over the side, if needed. I also love that it comes with a mat with cute pictures all over it. I like that everyone in the family can actually get inside together to play.
All of the corners, and anywhere that could pinch or be a hard knock, are well protected. The sides are sturdy and do not feel wobbly. It is also so easy to clean up any messes that are bound to happen. 
All in all, this is a great playpen and it is very nice and big. It would be good for one little one, but it is super wonderful for twins! This will give them plenty of room to move around and play. It is well made, plenty big enough, and comes with a cute and entertaining mat. Highly recommended!

title: Great for use when riding horses
text: This tiny travel size bottle of baby powder is handy. I'm using it out at the barn to ward off sweaty feet and calves on days when I'm riding multiple horses. The powder helps me get my tall riding boots on and off comfortably during hot, humid conditions.

title: Great to help transition
text: Another Win for Dr.Brown's !!  These are so great ! Using with my 8month old grandson right now for his "sippy" drink with his baby food.

title: Love this! Baby took about 2-3 times wearing it ...
text: Love this! Baby took about 2-3 times wearing it to like it but she sleeps really well in it now. Great for transitioning out of swaddle.

title: This fence/gate is great!!
text: I bought a "fancy pink one" that was way more money than this one and had to swallow the loss bc it broke within the first week of using it.  This gate has lasted 20 times longer than the more expensive one.  I use it to keep my dogs on the back patio  - they get the lower deck when company is over and this gate helps keep them - although I do have one small dog that she is a master at escaping and she's learned to "Flat Stanley" herself and go under the gate.  The reason she can and does do this is because it doesn't hurt her.  All in all, that's fine with us.  The gates work, they retract perfectly and if it kinda jams just stretch out and slowly allow it to retract.  I've had to do that maybe 5 times.  My only advice is do NOT just allow it to "roll up" on it's own, guide the gate - it doesn't take but a second.  My son just being the crazy kid he is just allowed it to snap back on it's own - ummmm....don't advise you do that.  It can be undone but someone could get hurt.

title: Comfortble and light weight blanket for toddlers.
text: My son's loves this dainosaurs blanket. It is very comfortable and light weight blanket for toddler to carry .

title: Strong and durable, gentle on skin, three bags of wipes in the box
text: This is a giant package of wipes. There are three big re-sealable plastic bags in the box with a little over 200 wipes in each one. We put a bag in each bathroom and the kitchen and refill the wipe holders as needed. These are pretty strong and surprisingly durable, I use them to wipe down the sink & even a quick swipe of the tile floors when the dogs come in with muddy paws. Heck, I have even used these to wipe off some dog paws. (There are times when you don't want a Clorox wipe)

title: Excellent pacifiers with storage & hollow one for self-feeding text: There are four regular pacifiers (two orange & two green) in this set with their own case. In addition, there is one "self-feeding" food-grade silicone pacifier with an extra tip. The self-feeding one is excellent as well because the tip is hollow with a "netted look" where cut up fruit can be inserted from the top once the cover that covers the opening is removed. It also comes with a cap for travel.

It is important to supervise when the baby is using this as it is with any other item.

The current price of $14.99 comes to $3 each pacifier if I count the extra self-feeding tip and all the plastic storage cases freebies.

title: Grandson's Favorite Toy!
text: I purchased this for my grandson at 6 months as motivation to become a steadier sitter. Little did I know that this would become his favorite toy at our house!  He's now 9 months and is using it to stand.  Additionally, the buttons, keys, and shapes keep him entertained.  My only con is that the back wheels still slide a bit in the locked position.  I bank it against a chair  and sit by him on the floor to keep him from sliding and falling.  Also, I'm wondering on a daily basis how to get the  "Welcome to our learning farm..." song out of my head!  It's a little too catchy of a tune!!

title: too small

title: These REALLY help with retention
text: My wee granddaughter has had trouble keeping liquids down since birth (no distress, just mess). We found the Dr. Brown's system by accident (ran out of other bottles in a pinch), and with the very first bottle, they made a difference - there is a nice description of the physiology and development of this system on their website. We didn't know they even made plastic till we looked online. These are very durable, and tolerate lots of drops by self-feeding child. Just a very nice product all round. And we prefer glass to plastic, so that makes perfect now. Really, really great.

title: Amazing product! you get what you pay for! text: You can't beat these diapers. They are just the best and my favorite. There are never any leakage problems and so far no diaper rashes. It keeps your baby's skin protected throughout the night which means you have a happy baby in the morning and that means you will be happy too. Currently in a size 2 but we all know they grow fast!

These just fit right and there is a reason why Pampers have been around for so long, keeping babies and their parents happy!

title: Worth the money
text: This is a baby bathtub that is definitely worth the money. It has the infant bath like I used when with my first baby, but he quickly outgrew it. This set takes you from infancy to toddlers, plus it keeps you from having to bend over to bath the baby. This tub has saved my back. It can be used in the kitchen and raises the baby to a height that is more comfortable, but I use it mostly in the bathtub and I use the bottom section to sit on and again keep my back from hurting. I just turn the baby tub upside down in the “big tub” when not in use and it is ready to go for next time. So you have an infant tub, a toddler tub, and a stand that fits under the bottom to raise it higher or can be used as a stool. As the baby grows older, the stool can also be used for the child to stand on to reach the bathroom sink for washing hands or brushing teeth.  This is a great update to baby bath time for the child and the parent.

title: Dependable
text: These are the most dependable as well as the softest diapers we have used. Love the wet indicator stripe! Three of my grandchildren (siblings) have been solely diapered by these saddlers and have never experienced any leakage. The pkg states twice as soft and yes, compared to other brands, these really are soft.

title: Great upgrade - Our new favorite diapers! text: What a great upgraded diaper by seventh generation! Their previous diapers- not to soft (papery feel) very small almost not existant hip straps, and ok absorbancy.

That is why i was pleasantly surprised at this new version!

I have tried so many diapers on my daughter - honest, huggies, earth & eden, pampers, naty, Amazon brand, and more! We always use a more natural diaper, when we are not using cloth.

These are probably one of the softest diapers I've ever used. Very comparable to Huggies Special Delivery line of diapers. They are also very stretchy which is great for adjusting it to different sized baby bellies and legs! They seem very comfortable overall for my baby between the softness and stretchiness. My daughter is 16m and so far we have not experienced any leakage or blow outs! I think these are our new favorite diaper!

title: We purchased 5 Lifefactory 9oz bottles, total, after ...
text: We purchased 5 Lifefactory 9oz bottles, total, after purchasing a number of 4oz bottles for our baby. All of the 9oz bottles have what appear to be a crack alongside the bottom that zig zag and splinter. I sent Lifefactory an email with the image, and they told me it was a seam but it is quite clear that this is not a seam with the unusual shape and splintering. They answered only 1 of my 2 questions and after two tries to communicate with them, I just gave up. Will be researching other glass bottles instead of repurchasing Lifefactory bottles to replace these.

title: Good for my dogs! text: I ordered this gate for when I need to leave my dogs alone in the house so they don’t go to the carpeted area.
It works perfectly. It is sturdy enough to keep my big dog puppy out, even when she leans on it.
The installation was easy and straight forward.
The only issue to have clear is that you need to drill the wall to have it up. So if you can’t or don’t want to do that, then this is not what you need. Otherwise, you can always fix the wall after you finish using it.
It is a more “permanent” gate just because of the drilling part.
It looks nice. It is like a modern look.
For us is been very useful.

title: Yes but text: Two cups is my ideal plan-overs size, square or rectangular shapes are more space efficient and I tend to think that the latches will last longer than those on rounds.
I chose these particular containers because they're vented. Be warned, reheating in these, even with the vent open (and isn't that the purpose of the vent?), will cause some warping resulting in the lid doming. In this instance, it had gone from the refrigerator to the microwave (NOT the freezer) and contained oatmeal. I heated it for 90 seconds, so there was no boiling liquid, no steam. It's barely noticeable when looking at it, but if I put another container down on top of one which is warped, it doesn't sit solidly.
My intention when I bought three of these was to buy more, but the lid warping after one brief use in the microwave means they're considerably less useful than they should be.
A shame

title: Wipes are reasonably sized & moist for a baby's nose & face only; pkg size not marked; pricey text: These baby wipes are a little over 7" x 7" which is reasonably sized. They are sufficiently moist and are scentless. They also work well and hold up to use without getting holes as long as one is not too rough. These are for a baby's nose and face only. Below are the ingredients as written on the label.

INGREDIENTS: WATER, SODIUM CHLORIDE, GLYCERIN, PROPYLENE GLYCOL, ALOE BARBADENSIS LEAF JUICE, TOCOPHERYL ACETATE, POLYSORBATE 20, POLYAMINOPROPYL BIGUANIDE, DISODIUM EDTA, CHLORPHENESIN, SODIUM CITRATE, CETYLPYRIDINIUM CHLORIDE, 2-BROMO-2-NlTROPROPANE-1 , 3-DIOL.

no alcohol • no parabens no phthalates • no sulfates

Note that the wipes are folded small, so they have to be unfolded before use. I found them easy to unfold but it might be difficult if holding the baby in one arm while using the other to remove the wipes.

These come in a resealable package with a flip top and adhesive flap underneath. There are 6 packages of 30 wipes for a total of 180 wipes. Note that the individual packages are not marked for the number of wipes, which I do not like.

In summary, these wipes are good for the purpose specified but the current price of $14.39 ($17.99 minus 20%) for 180 wipes comes to $.8 cents each wipe which is expensive for this.

title: Slim profile, dimmable, and soothing nightlight for any room text: This is a two-pack of nightlights. Each light measures 3 x 3 inches square. There is a dimmer switch on top which allows the user to reduce the already subtle brightness. If the switch is moved all the way to the right, the light turns off. The glow is soothing because it is not glaringly bright. The third picture shows its full brightness. In the last picture, I dimmed the light most of the way.

This draws minimal power of 0.5W. There is a built in sensor so it turns on automatically unless one has the dimmer switch all the way to the right. The lifespan is rated up to 20,000 hours. The one pictured is in my kitchen room.

text: This is the second electric nail filer we've owned. It works fantastic for newborn nails that are much softer and more attached to the skin. Typical nail clippers are more prone to pulling rather than cutting newborn nails. This filter has multiple sanding discs of different grit to quickly and painlessly soften the edges of nails. The tips are easily pulled off and changed, and it comes with many extras. Great for new parents. It takes two AA batteries to run, but lasts a long time. It also comes in a convenient carrying case.

title: Free of lotions, parabens, fragrance, latex, or chlorine bleaching text: These diapers do not leak. We started out with Huggies and they would leak with poopy messes. These diapers absolutely did not leak at all. One box lasted about three weeks, so that is good. We used them for overnights too, and they did good. The only odd thing about them is that some of them kind of stick when you try to undo them, like the tabs are stuck down. But as far as performance, they work very well, are soft, and didn't cause any rashes.

Size 1 is for 8-14 lbs (4-6 kg) and size 2 is for 12-18lbs (5-8 kgs). I appreciate that the diapers are free of lotions, parabens, fragrance, latex, or chlorine bleaching. They have a hypoallergenic inner liner and a premium cotton enhanced dryness layer.

title: Domic Car Seat
text: My 2017 Ford Escape seat didn't have enough padding and I was dealing with sciatica as a result.  This car seat cushion has resolved the issue and made my car fun to drive again.  I highly recommend this for helping to build up a car seat and relieve pain from inadaquent seat padding.

title: Stiff, doesn't taste good.
text: My two daughters, ages 5 and 1, didn't like them. I tried one and found it a bit difficult to chew. The taste wasn't great; not bland, but too the taste of oats overpowers the fruit flavor. My one-year-old will eat anything, and so will I, so the fact that we couldn't finish one bar each means we won't be getting this brand of bars again. They're a great size for toddlers, though.

title: Picky Toddler Approved!
text: While I did not taste the banana pouch for myself, my toddler daughter LOVED it! She made the pouch as flat as a pancake in 30 seconds and asked for another one right away (but I only gave her one). The price is a bit more than I’m used to paying for fruit pouches, but these are obviously a delicious choice for my picky toddler’s palate. The sugar content is high (19grams), but it's not added sugar and comes from the fruit only (a little easier to accept). A winner overall!

title: Nice concept
text: I like the idea of this container. It works relatively well and the wipes stay moist. All you have to do is buy the refills for it. The wipes feel fine on the skin, and are kind of stretchy.

title: Easy to put on, but made of thin material text: I love the born free bliss nursing pillow, but the one thing I didn't love is that despite the high price tag, it didn't come with any kind of a slip cover it all. Especially considering that the hard newborn mat seems like it would not go through the wash very gracefully, I was dismayed to find that I would need to put a blanket over the top of the pillow every time I used it.

This cover solves all of that. The cover is easy to put on and take off, uses Velcro, so it's a snap to take off, wash, and put back on quickly, even when sleep deprived. This is in stark contrast to the cover I have for the my brest friend nursing pillow, which takes ages to get on and off.

It's cute, and stylish, and I appreciate that it is unisex.

The only thing is that I wish the cover were just a little bit thicker material. If your little one falls asleep and drools milk out the side of his mouth, even a small quantity such as a half teaspoon of milk would soak right through the pillow case cover and into the pillow below.

title: Cooler bag pacifier holders that can be used as change purse or other carry bag text: There are two pacifier holders in this set as I ordered the Green Leaves + Leopard two pack. There is a cooler-style interior making these water resistant. There is also a clip on the outside to hook onto clothing, a stroller strap, etc. These can also double as change purses and hook off someone's purse. They are very versatile.

The current price of $12.25 ($12.89 minus 5%) comes to $6.12 per holder. This is more of a nice to have option but not a necessary accessory. One can purchase a clothing clip like [[ASIN:B0B883PJYR this]] instead to hold a pacifier. Of course, most pacifiers will remain in a baby's mouth.

text: My daughter loves the 360* cups. She is 16-months-old and prefers these over a traditional sippy cup any day of the week. These are super easy to use and clean. The lids can keep the cup covered while in the bag or car. My only dislike is that if I fill them up and she throws them across the room, they will pop open and spill. The trick has been to fill them only halfway so if she happens to do a diva toss, the lid stays on. These twist in, unlike the other brand, so they are more difficult for little fingers to get open.

The adhesion of these is average and comparable to other brands. It's nice that these can go up to twelve hours without changing, but I personally would be hesitant to do that!
