title: Works great
text: Nice foam playmat. We folded it in half and put it under a gymnastics bar we have in our toy room. Makes a nice soft spot underneath the bar. It is a lot lighter than I expected and easy to fold, store and transport. Cute design and appears well made.

title: Great diapers text: We've been using Pampers for many years. We are very happy with them. They work pretty well. The Swaddlers are the higher quality line of the diapers. They work very well.

The fit is fine, but depending on the baby, they may not work for the highest of the range. They protect pretty well. Nothing is perfect but we didn't have too many leaks.

They feel soft and have cute prints on it. Baby seems to find them comfortable. I would recommend them.

title: This is a fantastic easy to install car seat text: Love this car seat!! I had an older version of the Pria with my first daughter and this version is so much better!! The chest buckle slides on top of each other which is actually so much easier than the old buckles I’ve used before! Love that this has two cup holders that are easy to clean. The one that I got was a very nice blue color which is a nice change from the black and gray I’ve always had. The seat seems well cushioned and comfortable for baby. My daughter has liked this one better than our last car seat. It seems to sit her up better. The latch buckles slide in easy and lock well. The car seat was so easy to install.
The only downside I can think of is it is quite large and takes quite a bit of space. I have a van so it’s not a big deal.

title: Great for Cloth Diapers too!
text: This is a great diaper pail. I use it for my cloth diapers. It is made of steel and seems very durable. The rubber seals really do hold in smells. So, unless the pail is open, I really don't smell anything. I have been using it with my planet wise pail liners but I imagine it would work well with most cloth pail liners. The one negative thing I can think of is that it is fairly small but I haven't found that to be a problem. I wash diapers every other day and haven't had a problem yet. I actually kind of like that it is small because it makes it easier to remember that the diapers need to be washed. If you wash diapers every 3 days you might find that it gets too full.

title: Very good quality text: Very impressive diaper bag, but also perfect for use as a travel bag or briefcase.
The quality is very good on this bag. It’s made with heavyweight nylon that will resist rips and tears and that can be wiped clean. As a diaper bag, it has everything you need with lots of useful pockets and compartments, as well as an included changing pad, yet it doesn’t look like a diaper bag. Perfect for men or women who prefer a diaper bag that’s a little classier and not obviously a diaper bag.
Take out the changing pad, and the bag is ideal for carrying back and forth to work or school with a compartment for a laptop. The interior pockets hold your phone, glasses, charging cords, pens and pencils, a water bottle…whatever you need. Also good for an airplane carry-on.
The bag comes with an optional shoulder strap.
The only thing I don’t love is that the top doesn’t zip closed. The flap folds over and is secured with a plastic clasp and mostly covers the top, but the ends remain open meaning the potential is there for small items to slip out. When I buy a purse or other bag, I always seek out those that have a zipper on the top.
Still, this is a high-quality bag for a new parent, or for anyone.

title: It's Amazing text: I got this item from the amazon warehouse deals for $33. It can't be beat.
The wheels are like larger sized roller blade wheels giving us quiet fast zipping through the airport while our son stays safely strapped in his carseat. It makes traveling super easy, and dare I say, fun.
The strap stays secure and tightly in place and the carseat which is quite big stood on the platform foot with no issues as others claim. Yes the bottom platform is small but if you hook it up properly it works for any sized carseat. Those having issues are just not hooking it up right.

It's made with quality and my amazon warehouse deal one was even slightly used, and we still had zero issues so far.
It's a blessing if you're traveling with little ones.

title: Better Than I Expected text: I don't normally give 5 stars to baby formulas because so many of them contain high fructose corn syrup which leads to all sorts of problems, especially childhood obesity. This formula is sweetened with fructooligosaccharide (FOS) which is much better than high fructose corn syrup and even sugar. FOS are used primarily as a low-calorie, alternative sweetener. People can eat and drink products made with FOS instead of those containing sugar, which spike glucose levels in the blood, and cause weight gain. FOS may also be preferable to artificial sweeteners, some of which have been linked to everything from weight gain, to diabetes. If your child has an intolerance to fructose then this would probably not be a good product for her/him to drink because it could cause gastric problems - bloating, diarrhea, etc...

This product has vitamins and things necessary for healthy development. It contains soy and milk product so it is not for those who are lactose intolerant, but should be healthier for a growing toddler than cows milk.

title: Good teethers that are less likely to be dropped; rod is reinforced with glue text: There are three BPA-free silicone teethers in this package. The silicone is super soft. I consider these cute and engaging. This is easy for the baby to grab and hold onto. It has no sharp edges or parts that can fall off. For the most part, this is perfect as a teether and is one solid piece. As is typical, always supervise when the baby is using this. This is rated for three months and above.

The only thing to be aware of is that the rods are reinforced with glue. I assume the glue is food safe. I had mentioned this on a similar teether and was told food safe glue was used. Nevertheless, the baby is unlikely to get their mouth on this part. I have given several drop-resistant teethers to my neighbor's baby and also a couple of other babies and they are a hit.

This is made in China. The current price of $13.86 is reasonable for this as that comes to $4.62 each. Overall, I consider this a great teether and the baby is less likely to drop this.

title: I must have problems others don't notice
text: I put together lots of things and what I had trouble with were the cotter pins for the one set of wheels.  The cotter pins are tiny, the hole to slide them onto is reasonably sized, but the wheel is so close to it that I spent over an hour trying to get ONE of the two cotter pins on.  Not good.  The stroller folds up easily, though I do question the placement of the mechanism since it is right where your hand(s) would be when pushing a child in the stroller.  Folded, it fits in the back of my SUV, but if I had a regular sedan, especially one of the smaller ones, I'm not sure how well this would fit.  I bought this to have for my use when I babysit for some friends so they can have a date night.  It will work for me as a part-time kind of stroller.  Not sure this would be the one I would want if I had a new baby and needed a stroller full-time.

There's only three steps for installation and you'll know for sure when you've done it correctly. The safety features are top notch. The customer service is very helpful should you need it. This item makes an excellent baby shower gift. I highly recommend it.

title: Light as a feather
text: This rolling shopping cart/buggy is light as a feather. It’s amazing how light it is! It folds so easy too. I have a very bad neck and back and cannot push traditional shopping carts or even baby strollers. This cart is so easy to place in the car and easy to take out. The only negative, which is kind of a big negative for me, is that the handle to push the cart is too low. I am only 5’2” and it’s even too low for me. Someone who’s tall would struggle with it, so be warned. I use this cart for light shopping trips only. You don’t want to use it for heavy duty purchases like cases of canned sodas or 2 gallons of milk, etc. unless those of the only items you’re buying. It’s great for shopping the farmers market and for small- to medium-quantity trips to the grocery store. If you put items that are too heavy in it I don’t think it will last long. I believe it’s made out of light-weight aluminum, the same material the lightweight steppings stools are made of. I bought the canvas insert bag which attaches with Velcro. The bag is really nice, fits well, and even zippers shut. So if you buy the cart I highly recommend the bag too. I would give this cart a five star easily if the handle was adjustable or taller. Hopefully the makers of this product will see this review and heed this message because it really is a big flaw that i’m sure will prevent many taller buyers from purchasing and/or keeping this product.

title: Great for chafing. Creamy, with a very very light scent.
text: This Medcosa Adult Care Cream works very well for chafing and heat rashes under large busts. It is the only cream I've found that really helps. It's nice and creamy and has a very very light scent. It absorbs into the skin quickly and easily, and does not leave a white residue on top of the skin, like you get with some other zinc type ointments/creams. It protects the skin from chafing and sweat, which helps to heal and ward off irritation and odor. I really like that it is easy to use and does not stain my clothing. It certainly helps a problem that is not so pleasant. Not only is this cream great for chafing and heat rashes, but I'm certain it will work wonderful for diaper rashes, as well. I would highly recommend it!

title: Great, versatile, sturdy seat! text: This is our THIRD seat like this, through no fault of the seat itself. We bought the first when my little was 4 months old. He far preferred it over his infant carrier, probably due to being at a slightly better angle to see out of the side window of the van (still rear facing, of course.) Then we were rear-ended without the kids in the car, and I had to replace the seat due to manufacturer's suggestions. TWICE. (Memphis drivers- grrr.) We are now on seat number three and I really like it. It is easy to install, when you have read the instructions. It is bulky, but moves easily from one car to another. It is super padded, seems sturdy and the cup holders are convenient for cups and pacifiers, small toys and lovies. We intend to keep him rear facing as long as the weight limit allows, and at the current rate of growth, he may ride that way until he's 18 lol. It's super sturdy, durable and the cover feels like it will hold up to inevitable washings due to illness, spills, and general toddler junk smeared on it.

I have not tried any of the other features other than a rear facing infant seat, which was the selling point for me. It is likely that I will replace it before we are ready for the booster option, but it is nice to know that the choice is there.

title: GREAT LIL LOO!
text: I purchased this for my 2 year old grandson, who already has a potty that he will not use. The first day he got this, he was taking his diaper off and using the Lil Loo. He was so proud of himself that I rewarded him with giving him a dollar for him going to the bathroom in his new toilet. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who has a toddler in the house. I know it's not just this product, but yet it seems to be more effective than his character Elmo toilet. I am very pleased with my purchase.

title: Perfect toddler pillow or good for when one needs a tiny pillow cushion; a bit pricey text: This is a thin, soft, tiny pillow that is about one third the size (in both fluff and sizing) of an adult standard pillow. It comes with a nicely safari printed pillowcase that has a hem for the pillow to be "hooked" into so that the case does not fall off.

This pillow arrives in a small roll-sized package (see photo) and expands to its regular size in a few minutes.

This is both perfect for a toddler or for any adult who needs an extra back cushion or a larger-sized travel pillow.

The current price of $17.99 is a bit pricey for this thin poly fiber filled pillow with case. This is the only reason I took off one star.

UPDATE Oct 10, 2021 - This pillow expanded a little more in size but it was only after some use.

title: More comfortable fit, but milk gets sucked into backflow protectors text: I bought these because I got the spectra 2 breast pump and the flanges that came with it were too big (size 28 and 24mm) I just had my second child and currently breast feed and pump in between. It's amazing how much of a difference it makes when you get the right size flanges. For my first baby I had a medela freestyle and used the flanges that came with it not knowing that much about pumping. it used to suction part of my areola and was painful. This time around with the right size, is so much more comfortable.

These flanges work well with the spectra 2. the suction is good, they are pretty easy to clean. The only thing I dont like is the narrow part on the opposite side of the flanges is hard to clean and my milk gets sucked into the backflow protectors, not the best design but that's my only complaint! Thankfully it doesnt get sucked into the tubing.

title: New favorite!
text: I am really impressed with these diapers. They fit my baby perfectly and so far no blow outs! Winning! Some people said they run small but if you make sure to pull out the extra protector around the leg when you put them on they are not small. Fit true to size.

title: The worst of the Pampers diapers I have tried text: These are the worst of the Pampers diapers I have tried, and I have also tried Swaddlers and Cruisers. The size 4 in Baby Dry seems like it's a size smaller than the size 4 in Cruisers or Swaddlers, and I think it's because the side tabs are made smaller. I bought these to see if maybe my son wouldn't leak in the middle of the night, but nope, he still leaks, and his wearing these during the day causes them to constantly break apart. Oddly enough, the crystals don't fall out as easily as they do with Cruisers, but the seams are still split open and threatening to leak the contents all over the floor. I often go to change my son and can feel the hard crystals in the seat of the diaper that are still there, so I don't think they absorb very well. Maybe I got a bad batch, but I'm never buying Baby Dry again and am going back to Cruisers after this. My son will still leak in the middle of the night, but at least the diapers are somewhat more durable. I've never wanted to finish a box of diapers so quickly than I have with this box of Baby Dry - and I even had to pay nearly $10 more for a box of lower quality diapers. Very disappointed. I just wish I could find something that he wouldn't leak through.

EDIT: So upon using these for a bit longer, I've realized what the problem is: I keep looking for an all-purpose diaper from Pampers, and there just isn't one in existence. The Baby Drys do keep my son drier during the night, but if he wears them during the day, they break at about two hours in (sometimes less), and he gets very upset, saying "Diaper leak! Diaper leak!" The best I can see is that these need to be paired with Cruisers, but even those break, too - just not nearly as often as the Baby Drys do.

title: a decent product
text: Everything present and accounted for. Typical instructions I expect from off-brand items that take a little more time and attention.  Attractive.  Sturdy.  Once together goes back in the bag fairly easy.  No complaints or regrets.  Nice all in one item to have that will grow with baby.

title: Great Toy, Wish It Came With Music! text: This toy is cute. The design is close enough and it functions great. The light on the ceiling could be brighter, but it works in a dim room. My only complaint is that it doesn't come with any music. I mean, there's a ton of public domain kids music that they could have stuck on there with zero cost, but instead it comes blank and until you add your own music it can't play. A product designed by a parent would have included some music because when you have kids you just don't have time. Sometime next year I'll get around to loading music on this, until then it will just light up the ceiling.

BTW, bonus points for the rechargable battery... That's a huge plus! I was going to take 2 stars off for the lack of music, but that feature deserves an extra star!

I can only assume that they are changing their name. All of their products are Made in China. . so I’ve always said they should change their name to Chinese Baby.

title: LOVE!
text: I, like most others, was worried about the narwhal tooth. However, I am so glad I got this toy. We hang it from my daughter’s car seat and she loves it. The colors are soft to the eyes and the narwhal itself it soft. The tooth is also soft and bendy, with no issue or danger. When you pull the ring, he shakes and vibrates. It gives my daughter something to do when we go on drives. My daughter likes to pull on it and chew it. Overall cute and good product.

title: Still A Great Diaper text: I'm amazed at how strong diaper loyalties are. I have had an opportunity to use a lot of different brands and we have always chosen Pampers as our fall back. We are a Pampers family. I'm also amazed how many tweaks the brands make to minimize material and make little updates to Velcro and leak guards. These have gone through a small revisions with the Velcro tabs and outside material, but they still have the same consistent functioning I have come to depend on both back with my own kids and now kids in the baby room. This will still be my go to.

What I really like about this packaging is the shear amount you get. I wish we had month supply packaging when my kids were of these age.

title: Very cozy
text: Very soft and warm. This product makes outdoor babywearing much easier and I feel like my baby is protected from the wind.

title: light weight
text: I picked this up for a friend, she loves it. It's easy to fold up and take out. It drives really smooth and turns great, Great and safe stroller.

title: The most versatile of the cabinet licks so far.
text: A simple tool that does the job. I’m using it on knobs and handles. Easy to remove and when I don’t need them anymore, they don’t have to be uninstalled, I’ll just take them off.

title: mom and baby both will love the comfort of swaddling
text: Moms and babies will love this swaddle blanket. They get the closeness and comfort that only a swaddle can offer. This should work for any newborn and also work for any new mom, dad or grandparent who doesn't know how to swaddle a baby. Baby gets the swaddling and it isn't too tight. If you place hands towards the top, baby can self soothe. This is a small and is good for infants from 7-14 pounds. The blankets are made of 100% cotton knit and can be machine washed on warm. You will want to connect the Velcro prior to washing so that they don't get stuck to other items.

title: Love how subtle it is and it is not obnoxious
text: Purchased this as an open box item. Love how subtle it is and it is not obnoxious, but appealing to baby. The animals hang so baby can see their faces and not their bottoms. Love the projector feature and it was easy to install on crib. The only thing u didn't like is the remote doesn't work through the door, I have to point it at the mobile for it to work, whereas I ideally would've liked not to let baby know I came into the room.

title: Excellent Balm text: An excellent balm for babies. Just don't expect immediate over-night results, but it does work.

The scent is quite neutral to sensitive noses.

Excellent but rather spendy.

title: Easy to use
text: Quick setup, holds things nicely. I doubt it would hold up to rough play, but it would make for a nice toy storage bin at grandma's or an office setting where the kids wouldn't be running rampant. I have my Halloween decorations in mine.

title: Very big and Looks great
text: It is big, drains water amazingly (no place where water can get stuck and sit and mold). At first I hung it using only the tape, but I do know nothing sticks to my bathroom tiles, so after it fell I just screwed it in and am super happy now. Best bath toy storage I bought and I bought about 5 different ones this year.

title: Not impressed, don’t recommend
text: Wasn’t simple to set up too much for toddlers

title: Cute!
text: Very cute! Perfect for my child's room. It is sturdy and I see my daughter using it for years to come.

title: Weird Shape text: I've been a breastfeeding mom for more than a decade, so I've gone through more than my fair share of nursing pads. First, these are not very soft. They're much rougher than other brands I have tried. They also "ruffle" around the edges and those kind of irritate the skin. Second, the shape is weird. They are eye shaped. So weird. I don't know why you'd make them that shape. I liked Avent pads before they got bought out, so it isn't that I don't like smaller pads. These are shorter, but just as wide as other brands, which I think attributes to the ruffling. Third, why is the branding different? The box branding and the branding on the individual pads is different. Same brand name. Different fonts. Different colors. Different look. Why would a brand do that? It is just so strange.
Overall, these are absorbent enough for me. But they aren't the most comfortable material and shape and I will not rebuy this brand.

title: Buy it
text: It was perfect. You can make it small to little bigger and it easy to put together.

title: You can't say enough good about this
text: The Britax travel system is one of the best systems I have had the pleasure of working with. There is a lot of safety put in the manufacturing process. The car seat meets FAA standards. The seat has double layers of side protection. The seat has a base that is also made to be safe. The stroller really shines. It has 50 UV protection to keep your little one from getting too much sun. It also has smooth and swivel rolling wheels with brakes on the back. The brake operates both back wheels. When you are through walking your baby, you can then easily break the stroller down with one hand. The stroller is also lightweight. When using the car seat, it can accommodate a baby from 4 pounds to 35 pounds when in the rear facing position. When using the stroller only, it will accommodate a child from birth to 55 pounds. The star of the show, after going over the features, is the cow camouflage design on the inside of the car seat and the inside of the canopy.

title: Very soft!
text: Sooooo soft! I looked for hours for a rug that was soft and fairly large and this was economical and turned out to be amazing. The shape is great.

title: Perfect crib addition
text: Soft, vented and does not make the bed hot.

title: Corner guards
text: These corner guards are appropriately priced... you get a lot of them and dont have to spend too much money. They are durable. The material is very clear and it isn't soft, but isn't hard either. They're soft enough that they wouldn't hurt if you fell on them or bumped into them (better than hittin the corner of something). They're bulky and you wouldnt feel the corner of the item if you bumped into it. They stick well and the paper that covers the sticky part comes off easily.

title: Great addition to my pump parts!
text: I love Boon products and this is no exception.  It is a great little drying set for pump parts.  I love that it gives me an easy place to dry my pump parts and it even comes with a great little case.

title: Can't beat baby wipes for convenience. A fresh container would have been nice too.
text: I use HUGGIES Refreshing Clean Scented Baby Wipes for everything from general hand cleaning and elder care to cleaning the doggy's bottom. You really cannot beat them for convenience. Each case contains 3 large zippered bags that hold 208 wipes and each bag measures 9" L x 7 1/2" H x 4" D. The wipes are about 6 1/2" x 8" and big enough to take care of most little messes. I can't imagine living without them. Buying bulk refills is a great value, but throwing in a fresh empty container would have been a nice touch because the containers need to replaced every so often. They are not sold as a separate item and since the wipes are so inexpensive...  I get it. I use these wipes in several locations, including the bathroom, so I will be buying more wipes to get a new dispenser.

title: keeping our godson safe
text: My godson will be able to sit safely in my wife's lap when they go out in her wheel chair.  His mother will be able to carry him around a lot easier also.

title: .
text: Havent used these yet, but I like the fact they are clear so it's not an eyesore.

title: Could be better
text: I haven't been able to use this yet.  If it works, great.  However they damage easily.  My cat walked on one and now there are a few claw holes on it.

title: Five Stars
text: Works well!

title: Delightful text: I love these baskets! High-quality value for money.

Better than advertised.

title: the smell is fabulous text: this lotion reminds me of my childhood. I looked for it everywhere. The actual Baby Magic Lotion. IT SMELLS GREAT.
THANKS

title: Actually a great product - was skeptical
text: I never used this until my 5th child - it was SO MUCH EASIER to deal with cradle cap than ever. It's hard for a baby gadget to impress me, but this delivered. I would buy this again and recommend it to anyone who is dealing with cradle cap

title: Worth every penny
text: This is our sons favorite teether! It's high quality and seems very durable. We've had it for 5 months and have had to issues with durability. It's nice that just the top part will freeze so he can hold onto the handle and not get frozen hands. Definitely worth the price, which is a good deal!

title: exactly what I needed
text: This worked great for the storms we got blowing over during the 4th of July fireworks. Fit onto our graco stroller nicely and kept everything dry.

title: Bum brush
text: My husband and I love using these Bum brushes. We have 3 of them. Highly recommend!

title: Comparing this to baby K’tan.... text: I tried baby K’tan in two sizes and two styles. I liked what it had going for it but it wasn’t as comfortable as I knew it could be. Then came along JJCole with the agility. I would say that it is way easier to get in (and the ktan wasn’t hard don’t get me wrong, this is just better) and it doesn’t bunch up and get twisted. My biggest complaint with the ktan was bunching and twisting. I am free from that here. I also love the back support. The ktan was supportive but this is WAY more efficient and effective at distributing the weight because the straps don’t bunch and twist and they lay as designed. My back immediately felt the difference!

I don’t know how diverse it is for carrying in other positions, better luck with other carriers there, but for forward and back facing it works perfectly.

The fit is as expected, I bought a medium and a large and the fit was appropriate according to their size chart. (Fits same as Ktan)

title: Totally easy to assemble and the toys are enjoyable for the little ones
text: This walker is very easy to assemble you might not even need to read the instruction manual! My little one loved playing with the toys. My only issue with this toy is, it doesn’t grip that well on hardwood floors. Keep your eyes on your child when playing with this walker at all times. The phone is prone to get lost as it doesn’t have any string attached to it.

title: Sturdy, great design, easy to clean, and easy to put together!
text: A baby sit station! This is adorable! The fabric is super easy to take off and clean it comes with two toys that can be easily taken off to clean. It’s sturdy, well-built, and good quality. I would recommend. My baby has not used this item yet, but as a forth time mother I can tell this will be invaluable. If I feel any different in the coming months, I will update my review as I always do.

title: Twist, shake, and press the lion for songs and melodies
text: [[VIDEOID:7068e5afd4b8fb093efdcc9878aeac92]] This Explore Lion is made from a hard plastic and requires one AAA battery. The toy is somewhat heavy (especially for a young baby to lift). It measures about 6" wide, 6" tall, and 1.5" deep. When you turn on the power, the heart button lights up. It makes noises and songs when you twist the head from side to side, rotate the tail, shake the lion, and press the heart. Both the tail and the arch between the feet can act as a handle. The green leaf on the handle between the feet has different textures and is apparently soft enough for teething. The songs are simple and catchy. The toy will automatically shut off if not touched for approximately 35 seconds. It will turn on again when you press the heart button or turn the lion's mane. Twisting the lion's mane will trigger sounds and the light will flash. Pushing the heart button will play songs, melodies, and phrases. Twisting the tail produces a clicking sound. Shaking the lion causes it to play sounds and the light to flash. There are 3 short songs, 15 melodies, and several phrases.

title: Deterrent text: We really enjoy this gate.
I wouldn’t recommend it for someone who needs it to prevent a child or animal from getting through, but it is definitely an effective deterrent.
We put this at the top of our stairs and with enough effort, our small dog was able to get the fabric to move enough that he can get under.
Our 1 year old figured out how to unhook the sides fairly easily.

Installation took us longer than it should have. There are multiple sizes of the same pieces to accommodate different baseboard sizes, but the instructions only show diagrams that are very small and have no words.

We will use this retractable gate again.

title: Handy, small easy to travel with
text: This is a great size and all in one easy to use. It's great for traveling and in fact stays in the car for 'trips' that turn out to be longer than expected. Very handy to have. Folds up small and has gotten a lot of use. Still holding up after one baby is out of diapers and another is still in.

title: Suction no good.
text: Very cute plate... but the suction lasted a whole 20 seconds with my 2 year old. I used water to help for better suction and it maybe lasted 30 seconds. I'll be returning, sadly. It would probably work well for a younger age. Seems like a good quality plate though.. I can see it probably lightly staining with red sauces but other than that the quality is there for just a plate. No hash chemical smells or any residue smell/taste on plate after wash. I gave 3 stars for the quality of the actual plate itself and it's cuteness.

title: Luxurious Cotton & Polyester Blanket text: Features to note about this blanket:

* the blanket is about 4 feet by 4 feet square

* one side is short pile faux fur - 100% polyester

* the other side is a white background with small gray print - 100% cotton

* it has a soft gray binding

* the whole blanket is super soft

* blanket comes in plastic bag with snaps - good for storage in closet

* blanket looks and feels luxurious - would make a great gift

* gray accent color will look wonderful in most modern child's gender neutral nurseries and modern decor which often has gray elements

* you can spread this out on carpet with cotton side up for a baby

* made in India

* machine washable and tumble dry on low heat

One improvement would be to use 100% organic cotton. Otherwise, this seems like a pretty perfect blanket.

title: Which is great considering my little one is quite the wiggle worm
text: They don't catch ALL the food, but they do get most of it. Which is great considering my little one is quite the wiggle worm. She likes to turn her head a lot to watch the cat and dog on the floor while she's eating and these keep the food from getting all over her shoulders. The velcro is good and holding up to washing. So far she has yet to tug them off (even though she has tried). We wash them once a week and air dry, scrubbing them down with dish soap in between washes. No stains or mold so far.

title: Adorable
text: This as adorable, exactly as pictured. The material is soft and seems to be so comfortable for baby. The small one, which I got, is rather small. I think it would fit comfortably up to about 15 pounds rather than the 17 pounds promised. But then, some babies like that snug feeling.

title: Easier to use and bigger cup size
text: These are easier to use than some others I have purchased (the food is easier to get out after frozen).  Also the cup sizes are a bit bigger which is nice when my little one is eating more in one sitting so I don't have to cut one in half or thaw 2 and possibly waste some.

title: Will stay on for those active babies!
text: My nephew has used Pampers since birth since it's the most reliable from all the trial and error we did with the past 2 kids. This stays on for those learning to crawl..walk..run. The bands are thicker to not dig into baby's skin, and can be tightened but has some give to stay comfortable. Most importantly..Doesn't leak! Highly recommended! Especially for new parents. Look no further.

title: Perfect for babies and adults
text: Super quality and does not make the baby break out like others. Another reliable and natural product by Babo!

title: It's alright. text: Pro: installation is very effective and easy (once you know how it works)

Cons: as stated in other reviews, crotch space is tight. Even when you move the center piece out. My child is on the small side on his bottom half and it's still very tight. Too tight? I'd say yes.

The main reason I chose this model, besides top safety ratings, is the higher back for longer rear-facing, especially as my child is tall. But there is so little leg room I had to turn him forward facing looooooooooooong before he reached the height indicated.

Overall comfort for my child in this chair is only passable. The Safety First seat from Costco in his dad's car was 1/3 the price, weighs less (which is nice for times the chair comes in and out), of course still meets safety standards, and is obviously more comfortable. But it is also a lower quality seat, and after awhile it's hard to tighten the straps. My next car seat purchase will be a Maxi Cosi; I've heard good things from friends and they look comfortable. If it happens I'll try to remember to put an update here. Took 2 years to put up my review here (but at least you know my opinion of the Britax Marathon has been stable).

title: Good space saver
text: Good space saver.  The tray is a bit difficult to move on/off, but for the price, I'm not complaining.  We bought this to de-clutter as our daughter hit toddler age, and it's been great.  she feels like she's part of the family because she can sit at the table during meals in the same chair as mommy and daddy, but it still keeps her secure and prevents her from accidentally sliding off of a regular chair.  Daughter is 18 months old, and it's big enough that it should work for quite a while... I'd guess probably at least another year (if she still needs it by then).

title: Very good product!
text: I love this product!! Highly recommend to others. Great product for its price. Worth spending the amount for this product.

title: Happy Tot Organic Stage 4 Pouches
text: Happy Tot is the only brand I will buy. Great quality!

title: Worth the money
text: Absolutely LOVE this bag!

title: Five Stars
text: this was a gift and they are very happy comes off easy and fun

title: For My Office
text: I used these to decorate my office to teach kids about space, the moon and stars. I’m surprised how many missed those lessons during COVID-19 lockdowns.

title: Keeps wipes warm
text: It's a good warmer--tall enough to contain a full stack of wipes, keeps them warm but not too hot, and has a little nightlight as well.  It is possible to open the entire top with one hand as long as you slide back the little hinges on both sides--necessary for the intense diaper changing experiences...

title: Grandson
text: My daughter requested this for his birthday.  He is 24 lbs and starting to stand.  I like the activities which I'm sure dad is eventually taking the batteries out.  It will go to sleep but the slightest touch or bump reactivates it all over again.  As far as pulling himself up on it, the babies are using it to pull their entire body up, it comes down on them.  When it first came in I was checking it out and I thought to myself this is not good for pulling themselves up.  Its just another toy in his house.

title: High Rated Mattress
text: This is a highly rated mattress and it seems to live up to the rating

title: This seat helps little kids feel more confident.
text: Bought this for my grandkids to use in their own home and it is such a good seat that I bought another one as well to have in my own house so that when they come they have the seat here as well...

title: Great size plate.
text: The Munchkin Food Adventure Splash Toddler Dining Set, Includes Plate and Stainless Steel Utensils, Blue is pretty awesome. The plate has nice siding for kids to get food on their utensils. It is top rack dishwasher sage and has held up pretty well. The utensils are nice and sturdy feeling. I really like the slip grips on the bottom.

title: The colors are pretty and it keeps baby attention
text: Baby LOVES this toy! He loves touching it and hearing the tiny beads travel through the wheel. The colors are pretty and it keeps baby attention. I like taking this out too when we go out to eat. It keep him occupied

title: TOO Big for tiny mouth.
text: The spoon is super big and wide for tiny mouths.  The fork is not sturdy enough to actually fork or puncture anything. Decent teether I guess.

title: Great diapers and wipes
text: Love these diapers and wipes. I normally buy Costco brand diapers and like those as well, but these are a nice change and work just as well. I like that they are more natural. They are soft and we haven’t had a problem with leaking. The prints are also nice. The wipes are nice as well and work as expected. I have tried a lot of products from the Honest baby and beauty line and have loved them all.

title: Great for Cuddlers
text: So in love with this pillow but not because I'm pregnant but because I'm fat and love to cuddle with pillows. haha Seriously though, if you love to cuddle pillows this pillow is great. It fits perfectly under the arm allowing you to snuggle and cuddle the pillow which is super comfy, soft, but also firm. It's the perfect pillow for cuddlers.

title: Nice pack of bows text: This pack of bows has every color imaginable in it. Nice and soft so won't hurt the babys head.
These look so cute and now I have a cute bow to go with any outfit I put on her.

title: Does not leak
text: I've tried other brands of diapers and Pampers are the only ones that did not leak

title: Thin, Cheap Diapers
text: I was really disappointed to find that these diapers have changed a lot since I bought them with my son a few years ago. These are so thin now and not nearly as soft as they once were. I found my daughter was constantly having leaks and blow outs. I hate to waste diapers so we used these just during the day and used thicker diapers at night.

title: A trusted brand and stylish design.
text: Graco is a trusted brand for baby items so I knew I wasn’t going to be disappointed. For this price point, it is pretty standard. It is so easy to install. The straps are durable and will keep your baby strapped in nice and secure. It has a cup holder in the right arm and is perfect for baby’s drinks. It has thick padding for comfort and the black with white trim is a stylish design which looks great. It will grow with your baby up to 65 lbs. but it does not turn into a booster seat. I am pleased with this car seat and will get a lot of use out of it. I hope this review is helpful to you and your choice to purchase.

title: Five Stars
text: Great product

title: So thin
text: I bought these in error thinking they were regular diapers. They’re much more like a training pant than diaper. They don’t hold much and the top band leaks. Also a total pain to get on. Definitely not buying these again.

title: Great for shopping text: The kids love to walk when we go shopping. Was always a headache for me because I had to constantly look to make sure they were still right with me.
With this wrist leash I can hook them right up to the stroller or the shopping cart and relax.
With summer coming soon, this will be so nice for when we go to the zoo.
Wrist straps are nice and comfortable. They don't seem to pinch the skin at all.
The length of the elastic is long enough for the child to walk around but not long enough where something can happen.
So nice being able to look at outdoor scenery instead of always having my head down looking at the kids.

title: Not worth it
text: Not worth buying

title: Very Nice Piggy Bank
text: I love piggy banks!  This one is especially nice since it's so big and can hold a lot of coins.  The belly has the plug where you can shake the coins out from.  I like the pure whiteness of it too - it comes with stickers but I like it the way it is.  It's made of good ceramic and should please anyone who wants a piggy bank.  It well packed in box ready to wrap for gifting.

title: So cute, and encourages potty training text: [[VIDEOID:39712b29b1a4a22c3f0d806632f4a090]] Such a cool little toilet! Makes toddlers feel like they are using a regular big person toilet. The style and features are encouraging to use the potty and makes potty training easier and almost fun. My daughter loves how it "flushes." It features a splash guard, and a wipe holder on the back of the toilet that could also be used to hold small books. The toilet bowl is easy to remove and the material is smooth and very easy to clean. The size is great and fits conveniently behind our bathroom door against the wall and out of the way.

Please let me know if you have any questions about my review, or if you have found it "helpful" to you.

title: So cute and perfect!!
text: This is adorable and it fits the pad so well!!  It is also very soft!!  I love it!!

title: Perfect!! Just what I ordered
text: Perfect!!  Just what I ordered!!  Thank you!!

title: Makes feeding baby food easier
text: Makes feeding baby food much easier. Loved using this for my baby

title: Dimensions are incorrect and/or shrinkage is a problem here text: I purchased this sheet to fit on our [[ASIN:B004JU0H6O Dream On Me 3" Playard Mattress, White]]. According to the dimensions given for the mattress and this sheet, it should be a nice snug fit. The mattress is allegedly 38x26. The sheet is 39x27 - so it SHOULD fit.I washed the sheet and dried it (according to the label you should be able to do this - and it's a play yard sheet so it's useless if you cannot) then tried to fit it on the mattress just to double check. I am glad I did. There was absolutely no way this was going to fit on the mattress. It was about 2/3 the size of the mattress. It was nowhere near fitting - not even close. Now since I didn't try to fit it before I washed I have no idea if this was due to shrinking in the wash or if I got one that was defective and the wrong size. Amazon was very helpful and had no complaints about taking it back. It's too bad, I expected better from Carters.

I ended up ordering the [[ASIN:B001KZH692 American Baby Company Organic Interlock Pack N Play Sheet]] to try instead of this one. Accoring to reviews, it will fit the play yard mattress we have but we'll wait and see I guess.

title: I love the feel of this Maxi-Cosi Stroller. Fine quality! text: This is my second Maxi Cosi Stroller! And I love the feel of the frame and how light it is. I love the way it rolls, with a light, easy flow. It feels good, looks good, and rides good. I like that the stroller has the front wheels that can either be set to roll straight, or 360 degrees. Plus, more important is that there are two stops on the back wheels, to prevent it from rolling away if not guarded.

The cloth is washable, and there is a large basket. The basket is best reached from the side. I like that it is also easy to recline. One thing that I noticed on a ride with grandson, is that there is no peek window on the hood.

I rolled this at the mall, an outdoors mall, and it rolls beautiful. I is easy to maneuver among the crowds. Love this.

title: Works
text: Got this on lighting deal. Wanted a thermometer that was 21st century instead of the mercury stick one I have been using the last 20 years. Lol.  Am happy with my choice.

title: Looping a lap belt through the back is not as nice as the clicktight system text: Having used this one really makes me appreciate our Britax as far as installation goes. Looping a lap belt through the back is not as nice as the clicktight system.

The harness strap holds don't work that well.

It is nice to to have the shoulder straps adjust with the head rest. The cup holder is a good feature.

Good, not great. Okay for the price.

title: Hard-to-find size!
text: I bought this to protect my Japanese-sizes soba pillow. A perfect fit, and it catches any soba husks that works their way out of the pillow.  Did not shrink in the wash.

title: Works well
text: Don’t fit on every toilet. Have a look to see how smooth the sides of your toilet are first if you are planning on getting them for that specifically. Otherwise, work great. I didn’t quite understand how to adjust them so my first try was nearly a fail as I snapped the adjustable part into position too early. The directions could be a little more clear…or I just need to pay closer attention.

title: A very good plush toy!
text: I bought this as a Christmas gift to one of my grand nieces to which she loved! great to look at and played,A highly recommendable product specially when it's a product of sanrio.

title: Good diapers text: These diapers were very good. I thought they did a good job preventing leaks. They were comfortable to wear. They felt more like real underwear.

These were pretty discreet. You could not tell them were on under the clothing. The fit was pretty good

The quality was very good. They were reasonably soft and comfortable. They did a decent job preventing smell. Overall, we were pleased and would recommend them.

title: I got this as a gift for a new mother
text: This has four carrying positions and can hold a baby up to 35 pounds:  newborn front face-in, front face-in, front face-out and side-hip carrying. This gives the baby neck and back support, which they need, especially when newborns. This requires three steps to put on:  3 simple steps: click, strap, tie and go. Baby and you will like the cooling mesh panels.

title: Soft, Sturdy and Beautiful
text: It does what it needs to do. Helps my kid sit comfortably while using toilet. The adjustable height makes it easy to fit and the stairs make them easy to sit for the kid. I am happy with this product and have no complains.

title: These might be great cups for certain children but our granddaughter cannot get ...
text: These might be great cups for certain children but our granddaughter cannot get them to work for her.  She becomes very frustrated.  So up in the cupboard until she is older I guess.

title: I'm sure the product is fine, but I paid for wrapping
text: I'm sure the product is fine, but I paid for wrapping, and this is what I got. Thanks, Amazon!

title: Prevention more than treatment
text: Didn’t really do well on my baby’s diaper rash. This product is more on the preventative than a treatment side. I use this only when my baby’s diaper rash got better.

title: We Really Like 300 Thread Count Percale Crib Sheets text: I really like this Pinzon by Amazon 100% Cotton 300 Thread Count Percale Fitted Crib sheet. I ordered white as it looks great in our new baby crib of wood slats in white and gray that we have for our new grandson's visits.
However, this is a fitted MINI crib sheet that measures 24"x38"x5" deep. It will fit mini-crib mattresses up to 3" thick. So check-out the size prior to purchase. Since it's cotton, you can machine wash and tumble dry on low for easy maintenance. However, I always wash all new bedding prior to using as the manufacturer's put a coat of "sizing" on the fabric that babies and some adults are allergic to. This particular percale sheet is crisp and is more durable. It actually softens after each washing and is great for the hot summer months as cotton will wick away moisture from babies skin. We only purchase bed sheets for ourselves that are 300 count or higher. So we wanted our grandson to have the softness we enjoy too. The higher the thread count, the softer the fabric is. This mini crib sheet has met high safety and environmental standards and is just a better quality sheet than some others. Makes a wonderful baby shower gift too!

title: Six pack is a good deal

title: Second and fourth ingredient are sugars, recalled due to bacteria text: *update: this product has been recalled due to bacteria! I threw them all in the trash!

What I like about this product:
- good food replacement (especially for picky eaters)
- product is organic
- product is non-gmo
- provides 12 grams of plant based protein

dislike:
- As mentioned in the title the 2nd ingredient is brown rice syrup (which has a very high glycemic index [98] so this will spike blood sugar) and then 4th ingredient is agave syrup (agave is ok, GI is 17)
- doesnt state how much sugar is in one carton
- doesnt state the Daily value % of each vitamin/mineral
- carton states to use under medical supervision which is concerning to me. i don't recommend letting your child having more than 1 of these a day due to unknown DV's and possible vitamin/mineral overdose (especially iron for kids under 6)
- contains coffee berry/ green tea extract so I'm guessing it contains caffeine as well?
- product page doesnt list ingredients and doesnt mention brown rice syrup (only agave syrup) which to me is misleading/ dishonest.

Based on my experience, I would not order this product again.

title: Not for the Weak text: A few things to consider when buying this jogging stroller. First, while it is definitely built to last, the stroller is HEAVY. After my "last child" turned 5 and entered school full time, I gave away my 7 year old Baby Jogger.

Well. Fast forward a few years and along came one "last" child. I thoroughly researched the new generation jogging strollers and settled on the Mountain Buggy Terrain for two reasons. One--it accommodates newborns. Two--it's ergonomic design and adjustable handle (I am 5 ft tall) were important.

When it arrived, it was clear that this was a heavy duty stroller. After some assembly (the manual needs to be improved) I put my then 3 1/2 month old in and went for a test run.

While it had been a long time since I had run with a jogging stroller, I was in great cardiac shape from maintaining a healthy exercise regime during pregnancy and post partum. It was much harder to push than my Baby Jogger.

The Second thing you should know before buying is that there is a strong "TRACKING" issue that is extremely irritating and may lead you to return the stroller. On my first test run and every other run since, I have had to adjust the front wheel since it constantly pulls to the left. I occasionally had to do this with my Baby Jogger. Occasionally, not frequently!

The heaviness of the stroller combined with the tracking issue has left me with a sore wrist. This is not the stroller for jogging and pushing it one handed for most of your run.

That being said, I can compensate for the weight of the stroller. The tracking issue is not easily remedied though. I tried using the wheel in the swivel position to evaluate the tracking issue. It pulled so badly to the left that now I only use it in the locked position.

I would have given this stroller five stars if the tracking issue was easily adjusted. It isn't. As for the weight of the stroller, it is built like a tank and thus it is meant for rough roads and trails (where it performs beautifully). That is the trade off that is made compared to my Baby Jogger ---that I loved using on well maintained and paved paths.

Despite the weight and tracking issues, this jogger is designed with safety and comfort in mind. The buckle requires 2 hands to unlock. Perfect. The sun hood is awesome. Regardless of the time of day, I can adjust the hood to protect my baby from the sun and wind. The adjustable handle is a must. Many of the joggers on the market have a fixed handle and are just too high for shorter people. The water bottle holders are a great addition; the basket and zipper pouch are as well.

As for performance, the ride is extremely smooth. My Baby Jogger was definitely made for speed and smooth paths; however that meant a lot of bounce on more bumpy rides! The Mountain Buggy has very little extra bounce on he bumpy-dirt trails. One more thing, this jogging stroller is not easy to tip over. While it is less nimble than my Baby Jogger, the MB Terrain is not likely to tip when making a sharp turn (a turn requiring a lift of the front wheel).

I have not taken the Terrain on a run longer than 6 miles yet and cannot comment on long distance performance.

My baby typically sleeps well during our runs and seems quite comfortable and content in this stroller.

Overall. Great design. Needs a permanent fix for the tracking issue.

title: Initially Frustrating to Adjust, but Very Workable text: We take long car trips on occasion and I selected this with the idea of being more comfortable in my vehicle. I made a mistake in my understanding of what this product is and how it’s shaped so it doesn’t meet the need I had in mind (which is on me, not the product or the manufacturer – I though it was an adjustable cushion), though it is still useful and it is a good product. Now that I understand it better, I see the real value in it. My main complaint is in the adjustments, which were not clear at first and led to some frustrations until I figured them out.

This is a harness of sorts, which is suitable for preventing head side-tilt when resting. This idea here is to help one from developing neck pain from head tilt. It is more comfortable than it looks, and it is adjustable to handle different heights. It is sturdy enough to accommodate larger individuals without straining. It does a good job of keeping one’s head/neck straight while in use.

It works by attaching around the headrest of a car, so that it is fastened securely to the seat. My issue with this unit is that it was initially very difficult to figure out how to make the adjustments so that it could be attached properly. Specifically, it was unclear how to make the arms wider to fit; I discovered the latches eventually, but even with the markings on the frame of the unit I needed some trial and error before I managed to get the thing adjusted. It’s easy now that I know how to do it, but it was very frustrating up to that point.

While I did not get this harness with proper understanding of how it is designed, I have come to appreciate it for what it is. It does a good job of preventing neck pain in the car that results from slumping over when sleeping on a trip. My only real complaint is that it is initially frustrating to adjust; once past that hurdle, it is a very usable and helpful harness.

He’s had both accidents in these and they hold everything great!
He’s also worn these overnight without any leak issues.
He feels pretty grown up with these Easy Ups and I’m hoping it will convince him to use the potty more.

title: Practical and easy to clean text: We used to use the cute plush changing mats, but they’d end up in the wash after like every change, urine would soak through it, and then we’d have to wash the pad. It got old fast. These little pads are way more practical, they are compact and easy to store or to bring in a diaper bag.

The PVC backing can handle the washer and dryer, and prevents urine from soaking through onto the actual changing pad. They fold up or roll up and can be stored next to the changing pad in a diaper caddy without taking up much space. If they get dirty you just pick it up and toss it in the laundry.

They are kind of small but so are babies...they cover about 18 inches, but they are not the decorative whole pad covers.

title: light, flat puffed rice biscuit, hint of banana flavor, low cal, product of China text: I'm going to review these based on how they are packaged, what they taste like, and the ingredients used. But I will say upfront, in case this is something you avoid- these are a "product of China". If you avoid that, then these won't cut it.. If it isn't a concern, then know that these are labeled as "free from Gluten and GMO". Also, no milk, nuts, eggs, no artificial ingredients or preservatives. Made with premium "Japonic rice flour". Also,

100% BPA-free packaging, produced in a peanut free facility, and carries the trademark of the national foundation for celiac awareness.

There are 4 boxes of 12 wrapped Rice teethers contained in a sealed bag. This is nice, as it makes it easier to take it on the go and to keep it fresh. Each packet contains 2 elongated rice snacks. A serving is 4 rusks (or biscuits), which is actually 2 full packages, making it 6 servings per box. The shape reminds me of a surf board. They are a light, flat yet puffed mild tasting rice biscuit with a hint of banana flavor. If you ate the whole serving (2 packages of 2), it is just 30 calories with 20 mg of sodium and not much of anything else.

The ingredients are: rice flour, potato starch, sugar (<1g per serving), banana powder, sea salt, natural banana flavor.

Sometimes I have grabbed a similar product off the store shelves for my consumption, especially when I have been dieting and just want something to nosh on. I elected to try these for the same purpose. I thought maybe I would share with my two labs, but I aim to avoid any products made in China with them. Me, that is a different story.

So while they won't last me long once I start eating one, I imagine it would take a while for a teething kiddo to work through the rice snack. They have some give, while also maintaining firmness.

I included pics- I had already started eating one when I thought to take pictures.

title: Great!
text: Wanted new kick mats for our new van. Our previous van had dark brown seats, so we just had black ones in there. Our new van has beige seats, so the black just looked tacky. These blend in pretty well. The light tan is still a little darker than our seats, but it looks WAY better than the black would! The quality on these is amazing. They feel nice and thick, but not overly thick. Just thick enough to feel like they won't be easily ripped or anything. Our last ones lasted perfectly through 2 vans (only for about 5 years though, but still). These feel nicer than those so I can only imagine they'll last as long as we need them. I like to keep every surface of my van protected because while it IS a minivan, it's not a run-of-the-mill van that you saw in the 90s. We got a nice one, and we want it to stay nice as long as we own it. I highly recommend these! I will try to remember to come back and add a picture as soon as they're installed!

title: all purpose family wipes text: For four years, we've had a subscription for Huggies natural wipes. We've used them to wipe off soiled bottoms, unicorns painted on faces and sandy hands before eating and so forth.

We saw these and wanted to compare the two. Description wise, they are virtually identical. They're both the same size. They're also scent free, alcohol free, etc....

Here's where we think they differ. The naturals feel softer whereas these are a little stiffer. The naturals feel like they have a little more water in them. And the naturals are a little denser as shown in this side by side photo that I took.

Overall, I'm sure these would get the job done and the differences are great enough to really consider one over the other. I would say price would be the deciding factor.

title: Enfagrow Next Step Ready to Drink, Vanilla Flavor text: I drank one as soon as they arrived and thought it tasted pretty good. I gave a couple to my neighbor who has a 1 1/2 year old and he drank it down without any hesitation. As far as the vitamins, probiotic content and Omega DHA - all good stuff.

Easy to hold, pack and if it didn't say "Enfagrow" on the outside in big letters I'd let my older kids take one in their lunch to school. title: Fisher-Price Kick & Play Piano Gym Perfect For the New Baby text: Fisher-Price Shakira First Steps Collection, Kick and Play Piano Gym is great for your baby's development. Piano Keys play various tunes that the baby can wiggle and kick to. There is a power/volume control, but it can play up to 20 minutes. There is a soft mat where your baby is placed. There is a bright overhead "mirror" and bold vividly colored toys in different shapes, materials, and textures for him or her to try and grab onto. Some of them make sounds too. This Kick and Play Piano Gym will give the baby an early play time to help stimulate development of motor skills. It can enhance early hand-eye coordination. Besides giving the baby a fun play time, it can give the new parents a few minutes break.💜 Parenting can be a very intensive roll, and from time to time you might need a break to sit down and have a snack.

The piano does detach, so when the child is older, it can still be a fun toy.

title: Beautiful but had to buy twice
text: First time using anything like this. I didn’t realize in my stupidity that some were decal stickers and others were like a vinyl transfer. The first time I ordered these I tried pulling them away from the paper first like a sticker and ruined everything. Watched YouTube video and realized what I did wrong. Instructions were not clear with this at all. Cut out the vinyl first without pulling anything off then peel off backside exposing sticky. Place sticky side on wall, firmly place and press down all over. Then pull other side of transfer tape slowly down while holding one hand against character to keep in place as you pull down. May sound dumb but I wish I had seen another review like this so I wouldn’t have wasted $120 on these and did it right the first time. Once I figured it out it was easy for me 😹 they are great quality and really look like someone painted them on. Very happy

title: Infants or pets can be safely contained provided they are not very active or destructive text: The Summer Infant Pop 'n Play Portable Playard is not only for infants, but small pets can also be contained comfortably and safely if the child or animal is not overly active. Designed for children from 6 to 24 months or a maximum of 35 inches tall, the 14 square foot area is much greater than the playpen I used for my daughter years ago. This playard is incredibly lightweight and as simple to assemble as can be. The one I received has the neon green base and all black parts with the exception of the top protective dark gray pads. You just open the metal parts and the playard snaps right into place. Be sure to secure the netting by drawing the straps underneath each of the six legs and securely snap shut. When strapped, the netting remains in a taught state, adding containment and security while allowing your child/ren or animal/s a 360 degree visibility of the outside world. Nuts and bolts on this are a shiny chrome and I have felt no rough or dangerous surfaces. Sewn into the netting is a pocket for keeping the enclosed written materials, but this is really very simple and needs no detailed instructions. I keep it in the pocket in the event that I need to contact the company or want to share the information with passersby who are interested in obtaining a playard themselves (already has happened)! I do feel strongly that this needs to be supervised with older toddlers who are more ambulatory because it is very lightweight. Its design is for transport and occasional use either inside or out, having a single sheet of water resistant fabric as a base. Warnings are included on the product to not put pillows, pads, mattresses or other such items inside the playard. I also would not use this if any of the items break or the net rips because it could viably cause harm.

We've enjoyed this on the hardwood floor, on a carpet and on the lawn, but haven't taken it to the beach, so I can't yet describe how it functions when in sand. My impression is that it would be great, but I'd obsess about cleaning it afterward to remove sand and salt. It can be wiped down with mild detergent and warm water, then towel or air dried, so if baby messes up, it usually will not be permanent. I personally assure it is dry before placing it inside the carrying case to keep it fresh and not create a medium for mold.

I was unfamiliar with Summer Infant products when first offered this product, but have since then done a little research on the company. Located in Rhode Island, they support local nonprofits as well as national groups. They also sell a canopy which can be placed on top of one section of the playard and it seems like that is a desirable accessory, especially for younger infants who would not be moving away from the shaded area. The price of this product is less than many other pack and play items I've seen, but the quality of its construction is top notch. It is well worth the price and I can recommend this to those who need an easy to move and carry containment product for infants or small pets. When used properly and abiding by the age and height restrictions, I think it would last for more than one child. If used for pets, I would also pay attention to the personality of the animal -- if it's very active or destructive, the netting will not last, despite the secure metal sides/legs. For newborn and young puppies or kittens, I think it would be outstanding.

title: A bottle that works for colicky infants
text: The Advanced Anti-Colic bottle for infants is a big help if you are a new mother with a colicky baby. With this bottle system, you get a 5 ounce bottle with an award winning breast-like nipple, which ensures that baby will accept the bottle. On the inside, is a straw that is heat sensitive and by color, shows you if the liquid is too hot or cold. The anti-colic technology draws air away from the milk. On the bottom of the tube, is a star shaped piece that prevents milk from flowing back up so you don't get spillage. Definitely worth giving it a try if your baby is colicky. Once you try the five ounce and are pleased with the results, then you will want to go to the bottles with more ounces and nipples with more flow,

title: Daughter loves it!
text: I was curious to try these toys out, as I had never had anything from this company. My daughter is 8 months and loves them. They fit well in her hands and are small enough for her to hold and turn them without them being too big and bulk. They are easy to clean them and easy to toss in the freezer. Overall love them.

title: Very nice set text: I am impressed with this crib bedding set. I know it is at a little higher price point than many, but I think you get what you pay for. I am very impressed with the quality of the sheets. They very very soft and nice. Many crib sheets look nice but then are stiff and these are nicer, as is the blanket.

The design is simple but attractive. It is obviously for a boy, but it would fit in with many rooms. It is a lot more elegant than some of the others, and I could see using the blanket past when the child is just a baby.

I really like the bed skirt. One thing that is really need is that you can adjust the crib skirt for different heights. This is really great since people have different sizes of cribs. We like to put bins under the crib, so it covers that up nicely and gives it a nice look.

The set does not come with a bumper, but in my opinion that is actually a plus. Those are considered a suffocation risk and most pediatricians advise against it, so I am glad not to see it here.

I was very happy with this set.

title: Great gift idea. Very easy to wrap. Nice packaging text: If you’re planning on giving these as a gift. . .You’re in luck! They come rolled in an open cardboard box. Quite nice packaging. The box measures 6 X 9 X 2.5”. So it’s quite easy to wrap as well.

These swaddle wraps are cotton knot. The same brand offers Sleeping Sacks in microfiber as well as muslin, but I think all of their Swaddle Wraps are cotton knit. They are quite soft. You’ll see that these use the “hook-and-loop” closure system. That’s really just another name for Velcro. It’s slightly different but works exactly the same.

These are Made in China, so I think they are a bit pricey at the current price of just over twenty-eight bucks. I really like the SwaddleMe brand swaddles, and most are a little less expensive. They offer tons of designs as well. Simply do a search for SwaddleMe and you’ll find them.

title: Smell Bad
text: My little one uses rubber pacifiers exclusively. These came and smelled really bad. They didn’t have a rubber smell, but a smell like fruit loops and rotting fish. After they were boiled, the smell mostly went away, though they still don’t smell like rubber. The rubber on these is very soft and squishy. Other rubber pacifiers we have seen to hold up a little better and don’t have that sticky feeling when squished together. These aren’t bad, they just aren’t the best and I will definitely not buy more of these. My little one also seems to not prefer these over her other rubber pacifiers. She’ll take them if she’s convinced it is this or nothing, but she clearly isn’t the biggest fan of these.

title: Plate suction is mediocre on non-porous surfaces and is not as good as it should be text: This is a nice silicone baby plate that is BPA-free and comes with two utensils, a floppy silicone skin for a top, and a bonus bib. title: Good Diaper Backpack
text: This is a backpack type diaper bag that will hold about as much stuff as a regular diaper bag.  It's well made and though kind of plain looking it has lots places to put baby bottles, diapers, toys, etc...  It can be attached to a stroller but if you can also wear it like a backpack and it has nicely padded shoulder straps.  It comes with a longer strap that can be used to wear it cross body too.  Since it will get soiled like a diaper bag this can go into the washing machine but I would not put it in the dryer.  It looks like you might be able to wear it on your back or front while carrying your baby in the fold out seat  (though I'm not sure it was made to do that so I wouldn't carry my baby like that in it) that doubles as a pouch to hold stuff.  My only concern and the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that I think that after enough uses, the plastic lining the inside will crack and split like it does in diaper bags with the same kind of plastic.  I might be wrong about that but it should easily last until your baby is out of diapers and then some.  Mine did not come with a changing pad.

title: you can never have enough pacis text: My son just turned 11 months so I figured we could get some pacifiers that are sized for that age. Otherwise, the skin in that area gets red and sensitive.
And of course the very important glow in the dark feature when we need to find them in the middle of the night. Of course we've got tons of pacifiers, we just don't know where most of them are. I suspect we'll be finding them in nooks and crannies for years to come. In the meanwhile, these are a great addition to our collection.

title: Perfect for baby's room text: I absolutely love these stickers. They are such a great way to decorate a room.

First they are very easy to put on. Just peel and stick like regular stickers. It was easy to put them on so that they looked nice. You can be creative about how you spread them out, putting them all in one or area or spreading them in different ones.

They are very bright and colorful. They are extremely vibrant. It is even hard to tell that they are stickers and not a painting or a mural.

I love that they are temporary. Kids grow fast and what is great one day is for younger kids the next. These are great because they are so easy to take off. They didn't damage the wall. It also makes it easy to change them out or if you are moving, etc.

They are very unique. The kids love them and so do I. I would highly recommend these.

title: Overall a GREAT maternity pillow!
text: As a pregnant woman, I am overall very satisfied with this pillow! I had to take away one star because I noticed a 2" opening where the seams of the actual pillow, not the pillow case, came apart. Otherwise, it seems to be amazing. I've had this for several months now. I use it on a king sized bed and it seems to take up about half of the bed. I am 5'5" and it is perfect to wrap it how/where I want. It would probably work even better if you are a little bit taller woman. It has a removeable, washable pillow case that's easy to take off and put on. The case is soft and comfy. The filling in the pillow seems to stay in place. I have problems with flattening every single regular pillow I own, but this one holds very nicely.  I am very glad I purchased this to use during my pregnancy. It took me a few nights to figure out the best way to use it for my comfort. But once I played around with the different positions and found the couple that work, it works great!

title: softer than 7th Gen's Free&Clear diapers

title: Perfect Sippy and Snackcup set for toddlers text: I ordered this Nibbles and Giggles Toddler set to have when our grandchildren come over. It is a really great set. The sippy cup is the perfect size for little toddler hands. You can tip it over and it doesn't spill. Which is an excellent feature as they can carry it throughout the house without worry that spills will ruin the carpet.

The blue color isn't quite matching on the set. The snack cup is slightly darker. However, the colors are quite pretty. We love the snack cup with its curved handles that makes it easier for a toddler to hang onto. Not to mention the silicon top that allows them to reach inside easily but when turned over keeps most of the crumbs inside. The top also assures the snacks don't fly out if its carried throughout the house, tossed to the ground or turned upside down.

This would be a great set to travel with. Overall, for the price and quality we would definitely purchase more.

title: Great!  Slim but still protective!
text: Purchased to tame the corners on a custom glass dinner table protector 1/8" thick.  The glass is something to sit on the table and protect it from my 9 year old and daily wear and tear.  Removed sometimes when we have dinner parties.  The corners of the glass were not rounded as I expected (fabglassandmirror) and were quite sharp.  I was not prepared to attempt filing or using sanding emulsion on the corners of tempered glass - so this was the solution.  As you can see from the pics, these are quite well suited to the task.  They don't extend too far and have good thickness.  Product consists of a large number of corners and separate pieces of 3M clear double-sided tape.  Place tape on protective corner and place both on table.  If you get air bubbles you can try again (you can see a few air bubbles in one of the pics).  Highly recommended!

title: Five Stars

title: A nice trio...
text: This is a really pleasant lotion.  The oatmeal isn't drying, but I wouldn't say it's incredibly moisturizing either.  Just moisturizing enough and not sticky.  The scent is very, very light and the texture isn't too runny or too thick.  It absorbs into the skin rather quickly so there's no worry about it feeling greasy and slick.  The color is well, oatmeal colored (a light tan shade).  The price for a three pack is great, especially given the size of the bottles and the fact that, as an adult female, one pump does my entire leg.  The bottles will last even longer on a baby.  I tested this on my skin and had no negative reactions whatsoever.  The only concern is the fact that this contains alcohol, which some sources say shouldn't be used in products applied to a baby/toddler's skin, especially those who are prone to rashes or deal with eczema.
