title: My kid doesn't like them
text: My kid didn't like them

title: Very happy!
text: I love this stroller!!!!! I spent a LOT of time researching different jogging strollers. It came down to this one and the BOB. I live in Alaska and needed an all terrain stroller that could handle the roads here but that would work for running as well. I`m a runner, but usually run my long runs alone while the hubby watches the littles. So I figured this one would do the job and the price was right. I am VERY pleased with it!  The color is beautiful, the stroller is very sturdy and I love that it already comes with all the accessories (cup holder etc...). It really does have a great sun shade and I love how when you fold it to put it in the trunk, you can easily pop the two back wheels off to make it more compact. It is bulky, but that`s to be expected with a jogging stroller. It`s very roomy, my 6 year old loves it and the baby carrier snaps very easily in it. I really don`t have any complaints about it at all! Now, if I knew I was going to run a lot more long distances with it, I think I might have gone with the BOB. But this one was awesome enough that there was no justifying the price difference. I highly recommend this stroller for anyone looking for an all terrain jogging stroller.

title: Nice Gate
text: We're fostering a dog right now and we set up a few gates in the house to restrict him from parts of the house. We have this gate at the top of the stairs. We like that it has an option for no-screw attachment since the dog situation is just temporary. Installation was fairly straight forward. My husband did not run into any obstacles putting it up. There are straps/buckles to keep the gate in place rather than screws. It doesn't look as nice as a permanent attachment would be, but for our purposes, we're pleased. One of the first times my daughter opened it, she pulled the whole gate out of hinges by lifting it too high. We have other gates by the same brand and for those we have to pull up slightly to open them, so that's what she was doing with this one. This one does not require that at all and she hasn't had any problems since that one time now that she knows it's not necessary. The gate is pretty sturdy. Our staircase goes up straight and then it turns for four more steps. So even if the gate fell and someone fell down the stairs, it's only a short drop. I would be more wary of it if we had a straight staircase AND a little child. Since we have neither, it doesn't worry me. Overall, it's a nice gate and is allowing doggo a little more freedom in the house.

title: Really pampers?
text: I just used this product after having posted a good review. I have used these wipes on and off for years. I had no idea how much they skimped and changed them until now.  They are so thin you can see through them. You'd better use at least 2 per wipe unless you want poop on your fingers. Some things Americans are willing to pay more for. I'd rather pay a quarter more for a quality wipe. We save nothing if we must use 2 or 3 wipes at a time. I hope the CEO of this company is caught out with their grandbaby, a huge blowout and only 2 wipes left. Shame on you!!

title: Nice, kind of "no frills" car seat
text: I like this car seat because it is simple, no frills, light, and safe.  All of the straps are padded in the areas where they make contact with baby. It has additional padding around the baby’s neck and head to secure it in the seat. It has a handle that is easy to use for carrying the baby back and forth to the car. It folds back behind the seat while in the car. This seat has a canopy with a flip-out visor for extra UV protection. It also has a lower anchor strap to hold the baby in securely. Overall, this is a very functional, durable car seat.

title: Great value
text: Cheap but still work well

title: So fresh and so clean clean!

title: Can act as both a diaper bag or regular backpack; changing pad included text: This diaper bag looks beautiful but the material it is made out of feels very cheap but strong--almost like raincoat material. However, this bag is versatile because it can be used as a regular backpack or as a diaper bag with a small waterproof changing pad enclosed.

FEATURES
- The front of the bag has one small zippered compartment below the handles on top. I find it difficult to get my hands in that compartment but it is large enough to hold keys or a small phone.

- The front bottle compartment is "cooler style" and can hold two bottles. There is also a mesh folder pocket inside that compartment and a central area for some small storage. The envelope closure is via one Velcro strip.

- The central compartment has four more bottle pockets. There is one on each side and two in front and one of them is "cooler style." a folder pocket in back, two shorter bottle-sized folder pockets on the other side, along with a zippered pocket behind that. Also, inside are another two small zippered pockets large enough for some cash or a small phone. One pocket is located on the top and the other is located on the bottom of the back "door." There is also a strap with clip that can hold keys or a pacifier and it has a clip that can be detached for removal without having to unclip the keys or pacifier.

- Inside the central compartment is the thin waterproof diaper changing pad and another separate bottle bag that can be carried by itself or hung on a stroller.

- There is an exterior access door in the backpack shoulder strap area of the bag with access to the central compartment.

- The shoulder straps are well-padded and are very comfortable to use.

-There are two stroller straps on the top of the shoulder straps. They can be unclipped and hooked onto the stroller handle. I really love that they are attached and cannot be lost.

- On the outside sides of the bag are bottle pockets, one of which can substitute for a wipes pocket with a flap through which to withdraw the wipes.

- There is also a carry handle on the top of the bag if one does not want to use a shoulder strap and that has a pink fake leather closure to secure the handles together.

In summary, this bag is durable as the material feels like a strong waterproof fabric but that makes it feel cheap. I love the beautiful floral design. It looks like a regular backpack and works like one too but doubles as a diaper changing backpack. For the current price of $49.99 I would have expected a USB cable port to be included for use with a battery pack and one is not.

title: Great pump even after much use text: I bought this pump after getting the S2 from insurance, so I could have one at home and one at the office. It also gave me the extra set of pump parts I needed without having to buy them separately. I have been using them for over 10 months (5 times a day during the week) and have had no problems.

I leave this one at home, where I sometimes use the battery for convenience, and I don't need the battery at work, where I only pump at my desk.

The only real difference I have seen between the two, othan than the battery capability with the S1, is the S1 is slightly noisier, though not enough to make a difference. When the tubing is not connected, the S1 (but not S2) is quite loud, so I thought the first one I got was defective. Once you put the tubing on, it is fine.

The only downside for me has been that when I have needed to order additional pump parts, I could not just buy them in a store (or even the city breastfeeding center). I assume that will change as Spectra becomes more common, but for now, ordering from the manufacturer is the only real option for replacement parts. I did buy another company's duckbills, though, and they worked fine despite looking different.

title: Pampers Swaddlers Addict text: My favorite diapers for my two kids have been Pampers Swaddlers. I would give those five stars. That being said, I like these honest diapers. A few areas where they don't quite add up to Pampers are
- there is no wetness indicator
- there is no way to easily distinguish the front from the back since it is the same pattern throughout
- the side tabs are less stretchy than Pampers

Granted these areas are not that big of a deal for a night time diaper that you only have to put on and take off once a day, but still I find them not as ideal as a Swaddler.

The sheep pattern is oh so adorable. The softness feels almost identical to Swaddlers, almost, but there is still nothing exactly like the blankie soft Swaddlers. I won't comment on price since that fluctuates all of the time on here. These are nice diapers, but I will stick to Swaddlers myself.

title: Crispy, crunchy and tasty; appealing to all ages text: I'm pleased with this snack on all areas. It has good taste appeal across the age spectrum (the recommended minimum age is 2 years according to the manufacturer). Adults liked the crunch and non-greasy nature of the snack; kids said it tasted like cinnamon crunch cereal.

I like that it's baked, plant-based, and has a decent nutritional profile. I also like that it includes probiotics, although the potency level (200 million CFUs) is rather low even for a toddler-targeted snack. Still, the fact that it has any probiotics is a plus.

Each pouch is a single portion, with a low (45) calorie count (which was more appealing to the adults than the kids). The serving size is reasonable for a child's snack.

No complaints. It's decently nutritious, and has good taste appeal. Can't ask for more than that in a snack item.

title: Excellent Configurability! text: I am thrilled with how these remotes can be configured to work. I got the set with 3 outlet controllers and a remote that has 5 sets of on/off buttons. I later added a fourth outlet controller to the set. I originally bought it to control a lamp across the room at night. However, after getting it, I decided to use it for three other lamps I have as well. Now I have everything set up to any combination I could ever want!

On/Off Buttons 1 - lamp 1
On/Off Buttons 2 - lamp 2
On/Off Buttons 3 - lamp 3
On/Off Buttons 4 - lamp 4
On/Off Buttons 5 - lamp 1, 2, 3, and 4 simultaneously

So not only can I turn each lamp on and off individually, but I can turn all the lamps on and off as a set! It doesn't matter what button I used to turn them on. Even if I turn on the lamps individually, I can easily press the Off Button 5 to turn off all the lamps at once! I love this!

The instructions were not very detailed as to how to configure the remote control. It's actually very easy. So let me include some basic instructions on how to program the outlet controllers with the remote control.

To pair an outlet controller with a remote:
'(1) Plug the outlet controller into the wall socket.
'(2) Press and hold the learning button until a light begins to flash, then let go.
'(3) Press the button on the remote that you want to control the outlet controller.

That's it! So simple! Repeat the steps above for any remote button you want. Each on and off button works independently so you can configure it any way you want.

You can pair any button on the remote to any outlet controller, even if the button has already been paired with another outlet controller. For example, if you want the On Button 5 to control two outlets, simply repeat the steps above for each one. You don't have to do them together. Just do them like normal. Then when you press the On Button 5, both outlets will come on!

Canceling a pairing requires that you reset the outlet controller. It's also very easy to do.

To reset an outlet controller (cancel all pairings) so that no remote button will control it:
'(1) Remove the outlet controller from the wall socket.
'(2) Press and hold the learning button.
'(3) While still holding the learning button, plug the outlet controller back into the wall socket.
'(4) Continue to hold the button for 5 seconds or until the light begins to flash, then let go.
'(5) Once the light stops flashing, the outlet controller has been reset.

The only drawback I can find is that you cannot plug two outlet controllers into a wall outlet due to their size. You can, however, plug the outlet controller into the top wall outlet and still use the bottom outlet as normal. I don't find this to be a big problem.

I wish I had found these long ago. I am certain I will be buying more!

UPDATE: I did buy more! I added another lamp to the room so I bought another outlet controller. I now have the remote control managing all four lamps. I could not be happier with this product!

One big con, and the reason I gave it four stars instead of five, is that it does not come with a travel changing pad like most other diaper bags, which is really a necessity. You could technically unzip it to use it that way, but that means taking everything out of it which is inconvenient

title: Lots to keep baby busy text: This is cute and functional, with lots of buttons and toys to keep baby busy. Once three AA batteries are installed, the keys turn into a piano, producing different tones and lighting up. Two smaller buttons near the top, when pressed, cycle through melodies and tunes.
As far as a walker, I found it to be good, not great. The design means the handle is long without any support. If pressed on hard, it bends and gives a little. It doesn’t tip easily, but with a bigger, stronger child, it’s possible the handle could be pressed too far and either damage the toy or possibly cause it to tip. The wheels function well, though, and the design offers plenty of open space for baby to walk without having to straddle any parts of the toy.
As far as using as a play mat…also good. The pad is thin and the wording, “Happy Childhood” is a little odd, in my opinion. That said, there are lots of things for baby to grab and pull and rattle.
Overall, this is a good walker/toy, just maybe not the sturdiest you’ll find.

I love that they can just be pulled and down like regular underwear, or they come apart easily on the sides thanks to the "velcro" strips on each side. title: Rechargeable batteries increase my rating
text: This is my first baby monitor and I think it's terrific.  I don't know that I would have normally selected the [[ASIN:B00E9RMHD8 Philips Avent DECT Baby Monitor with Temperature Sensor]] because the temperature sensor seemed unnecessary, but it has turned out to be an asset to its functionality.  This system was quite easy to set up and operate, the sensitivity is great, and I really like the neck cord and don't mind wearing it for short periods of time, like brief times outside of the house but within range of the transmitter.  Being that electricity can sometimes go out, I appreciate the batteries, especially since they are rechargeable.  The lullaby option is fine, but we don't really use that one for now.  I did notice that there's another model called the [[ASIN:B003YC0W8G Philips AVENT DECT Baby Monitor with Temperature Sensor and New ECO Mode]] which is about the same price as this one and I think I'd recommend checking them both out in a store to see how they compare before purchasing one.

There are two mesh pockets on the outside and two open pockets and a zippered pocket on the front.

The bag can be a backpack, stroller bag, hand carried bag, cross body or over the shoulder bag.
The backpack straps are padded and adjustable.

The stars make this diaper bag adorable but also get it a diaper bag feel. If not for those
this would be a cooler bag that someone would comfortably use years after their child is out of the baby stage.
This diaper bag is perfect for picnics, zoo trips, amusement park visits, or anything like hikes with the family.
You could easily add a bag organizer insert if you were wanting to have more compartments inside the main area.

I decided to keep this book, because of the cute design.

I think this book would be great for someone who doesn’t want to spend a lot of time making a “baby book”. I am an artsy, crafty soul and I love to keep mementos and add my own stuff. With that in mind, this book didn’t work the way I wanted it to, but it is an easy way to keep track of baby’s first year (and first 5 birthdays).

I might recommend to mommies with more than 1 baby, because it is not as tome consuming as a traditional “fill out every sentence” book.

title: The 3rd BOB I’ve loved text: I am a stroller fanatic and I love having the right stroller for the right occasion. A few years ago I bought a Single BOB Revolution for my first child, then bought the Duallie Pro when I had my second child, and now I received this Single Flex 3.0 for my third child. We have also owned a Baby Jogger, UppaBaby and Maclaren stroller, and BOB is my favorite to use and my preference for anything outdoors.

Starting with unboxing and set up. This is very simple to assemble. I had it unboxed and together in about 10 min. Simply open it up, remove plastic, unfold stroller, pop back wheels on, slide axle through front wheel and fasten the nut to secure it in place.

To fold: Squeeze the two levers on the underside of the handle to fold the top half down. Then pull up on the red semicircle to fully collapse the stroller. There is a red buckle to secure it in place if you want. To unfold, pull up in the handle bar until it clicks into position.

The weight capacity on this is 75 pounds!! In most cases, it seems you will top out on height far before that though. I put my 40” tall 4 year old in there, and her head was up against the top of the stroller. Leaning the seat back slightly was better than when she was fully upright and looked more comfortable for her head. I think she would be ok using this stroller for a little longer, but I think the 44” height max listed on BOBs website is an exaggeration. (The duallie must sit lower on the frame because her head is not skimming the top of that stroller yet.) My 2.5 year old fit just fine in this.

The quality is great. The material wipes down easily. I’ve never had any issues with the tires. They are my stroller of choice when traveling because they are so sturdy, and they’ve withstood being gate checked just fine. The underneath storage basket is not the largest or most accessible of the strollers I’ve used, but it is ok.

This 3.0 Flex does not have a hand brake. (The Revolution Pro is the same stroller but does have a handbrake) —— I do run with my BOBs. I take my duallie out for 4-7 mile runs, and my kids are comfortable and content. I live in a moderately hilly location, and with a 2 and 4 year old in the duallie (which is about 100 pounds) I find the hand brake a must and is why I opted for the Pro Duallie. Even for walks around the neighborhood I find myself using the hand brake on the duallie. However, I never wished I had a hand brake when I was walking or running with my single BOB, even with the hills. I would consider how hilly your area is and the total weight you expect your stroller to get to when you decide between models.

Differences between the 3.0 Flex and Flex - At first they seemed minute, and I wasn’t sure if they justified much of a price difference. After playing with the stroller more, I can appreciate the improvements made. First, the canopy now has a magnetic closure, which I have on a different stroller and it’s awesome and easy to use. It also has ventilation in the canopy now!! The ventilation also seems improved in the top portion of the seat back, and air will be flowing in even if the seat is in the fully upright position. On our older single BOB, the ventilation was in such a way that baby would only be getting some air flow if the seat was pretty far reclined. Now thanks to better back ventilation and added canopy ventilation, it is bound to be much cooler in there, regardless of seat incline. Second, there are 3 more pockets, 2 of which have zippers. There is a zippered pocket on the seat back and a zippered pocket on the flap hanging down where the canopy and handle bar meet. If you don’t have the console, this would be a great place to store a phone and keys. Also if you plan on folding the stroller a lot, these would be convenient from keeping things from falling out. For example, I now store dog clean up bags in the mesh pocket of my duallie, and a key in the hook and loop part of the console, but often when I fold the stroller these items have fallen out. The material is more reflective and more water resistant on this 3.0. The seat padding is supposedly improved too, but it’s not noticeable to me having not sat in either. Lastly the 3.0 has a bolted front wheel vs a quick release on the older model.

As far as accessories go... the BOB Handlebar Console with Tire Pump is awesome. (Currently the bundle option comes with this for $20 more than the stroller alone, making it a good option) I pump my tires up every other month or so, and the roominess and quality of the rest of the console is great. The large cup holders can fit my liter sized Camelbak bottle, and the middle section is secure enough to hold my phone or keys while running. I also purchased the infant car seat adapter for my Chicco Keyfit and used it all of the time with my first child. It also made outings easier to click the car seat in to the stroller and not have to worry about moving a sleeping baby in or out of the main stroller. I also have the snack tray for my single BOB, but did not purchase it again for the duallie. It was a nice addition, but there is just so much room in the seat that I found it just as convenient to tuck a water bottle in one of the side pockets of the seat and a snack cup in the other. So simply because of the price of the tray, I probably wouldn’t recommend it. Lastly I’ve tried the weather shield for my duallie. I wanted to run at cooler temps, but was hesitant to run under 55 degrees or so. The weather shield kept my kids toasty for runs between 40 and 55 degrees. All of the BOB accessories I’ve used have been well made and very simple to use.

Overall, I LOVE these strollers. They are so smooth, and it is effortless to push and maneuver. They handle uneven terrain well, gliding over sidewalk cracks, curbs, grass and dirt. For anything outside - walks, runs, trips to the zoo or park - they are my stroller of choice and fun to use. They have also held up very well despite travel and frequent use. I can’t recommend them enough!

title: cute stroller toy for ages 0+ text: This cute Stroller Sloth has a soft fabric body. Hanging from the sloth are a leaf that makes a crinkle sound when touched, a sun with a mirror in the center, and one of the sloths' arms with a handle for the baby to grip and pull. As the arm is pulled down, the other arm extends...which, when the handle is released, vibrates the sloth as the top arm pulls him back close to the plastic branch that he's hanging from. There is a ring that attaches to this hard plastic branch so you can hang the sloth off a stroller, etc. We were somewhat concerned that the hard plastic might hit my baby niece in the head, but it hasn't happened so far. My 4-month-old niece loves exploring the different parts of this toy, but the leaf is her favorite. My 3-year-old niece also loves this toy, and we had to make it clear that it ultimately belonged to the baby.

title: Well made bag with very high functionality text: This is a nice little diaper bag. First of the material is a bit different, it is almost that of a hybrid of a raincoat and a regular backpack. This makes it very easy to clean in my eyes and wipe down. It has two straps on the top that you an pick it up at but also two straps in the back that allow you to carry it like a backpack. Also on the back is a strap that allows you to attach it to your luggage when you are traveling. It also has a strap that lets you secure it across your chest to take some weight of your shoulders and evenly distribute it and make the weight less impactful. Last but not least there is also a hidden zippered pocket that you can keep some things in like travel documents or your cell phone or something.

You also get additional straps that you can hang it onto your stroller something else if you choose to. On each side on the outside you have pockets for your beverage or your umbrella or whatever else you want to fit in there.

In the front is a larger pocket. In that one are two insulate pockets for your baby bottles but obviously once your baby is larger you can fit other things in there as well. You also have another zipper pocket in there in which you can actually keep wet items if need be since it seems pretty water proof.

The main compartment gets opened on the top and is fairly large. It has some inside pockets that help you keep it organized. The bag also came with another tiny bag sleeve in which you can roll up the entire bag if you want to. They really thought of anything with this one. It is lightweight and does get the job done and then some!

title: Great Product! text: I searched and searched online for a step stool for my 18 month, who loves to be up in the business whenever someone is in the kitchen, doing something on the counter top. We used to use a small step ladder. I saw this type of step stools all over the internet and amazon. The products I liked were either in the $200 and over range, or were not available for sale. I finally came across this one, which is a perfect balance of price and had everything I was looking for. I wanted one that was fully enclosed, good size, adjustable height, wooden, and stable. This came in the box with everything included- parts, instructions, hardware. It was very easy to put together by myself, it took me about 15 min if so. Once put together I liked that it was not heavy, yet feels very sturdy. My 18 month old climbed right in it without needing any help and absolutely loves it. It is very stable, good quality materials, it looks great! My wife loves it too, and she is a hard one to satisfy when it comes to baby products. I would highly recommend this item!

It’s now been almost one year since I’ve had this step stool. My daughter uses it every single day and it still looks like the first day I assembled it. Very sturdy and useful. We love it!

title: Diaper tabs stick to the surface
text: I was really digging these changing pad liners, because they are so easy to throw through the wash and pop a new one on the diaper changer to avoid having to change the cover on it all the time. However, after a week of use, I started realizing how irritating it is that the surface of these is just exactly right to wear the tabs on my disposable diapers want to cling to it. There is nothing more annoying than having a crying, wiggling baby kicking and dislodging the diaper and then having it gets stuck on the changing pad liner. The changing pad liner is at its best when it is completely unobtrusive, and the other blankets and pieces of fabric I've used as changing pad covers don't do this at all. Overall, for the price these are a great deal and they're really good in a pinch or on the go. I love that I can keep one in my purse and a couple in my car for wherever I visit. However, I hope they go back to the drawing board and fix this one design flaw. The diaper tabs really should not stick to the changing pad liner.

Another aspect of this Car Seat is that it has been tested...... if a company TALKS about the test, then I believe they worked on it.

title: A Mother-to-Be needs to be spoiled too!! text: I remember when I was a new mother how no one really thinks about you (and they shouldn’t), but instead focus on the baby. I personally always think that it is nice to give a new or expectant mother a token gift or something just for her. I sometimes make a “Mother Survival Kit” that includes a novel, wine, and other things to celebrate being a mother. But when I saw this bracelet, I thought it would be perfect for a friend of mine who just learned she is pregnant. Giving something like this would give a new mother confidence, especially considering this is a new experience, couple that with the stress of the unknown and body changes. This bracelet (by Diosky) will send just the right sentiment of what a great Mom she is going to be!

The bracelet itself is feminine, made of soft white/black marble, blue and pink beads (so it works for anyone who doesn’t or does know the sex of the baby) with silver accents and a silver (tiny baby feet) charm. There is a sweet, encouraging note to the mom on the inside of the box. The packaging is great for gift-giving and there is even a card that you can address to the recipient. In conclusion, this is a wonderful gift for yourself or someone else. Which makes it a bonus is that it is affordable.

title: durable & plenty damp for full body wipe down, fresh clean scent, no irritation text: "Fragrance Free" means that it has no added fragrance, but a scent can still be noted--more than one would anticipate. Probably because it doesnt contain "masking" ingredients. This has a fresh, clean, pleasant scent. I find that the wipes are plenty damp. More wet than a lot of body wipes, or wet wipes for toilet use. I think they are a good size and strength for doing a quick wipe down of the body as a means to freshen up anytime (especially post workout). I like using them as a "bird bath". I just take 1-2 and do a quick wipe down all over. The wipes hold up very well. No irritation.

I had no trouble peeling off the protective seal. The lid is secure and snaps tight. The internal clip holds a wipe securely, and I find that it helps the wipe to break away from the next one with ease. I seriously just havent had any issues with this at all in any way. I imagine I will use these up way before there is any concern of them drying out.

I dont rate on price (we all have different budgets, needs, values, we can see the price before purchase, prices fluctuate, and more recently prices of things across the board have gone up so I am not going to say what it worth it and what isnt...you decide that.). That being said.. 30 wipes for $10? A little much for me. Thankfully they are plenty wet, and I could get a good wipe down with these. Also, appears to be a healthy products, so if you use stuff like this a lot, it can be good to avoid or reduce some ingredients.

title: Would Love These if They Were Made in the US text: If these were made in the USA, I would give it an unqualified rave review. It addresses almost every concern a parent might have regarding a food product meant for a child: it claims to use nothing but organic rice flour, organic sugar, organic blueberry abstract, purple carrot juice, sea salt, and organic carrot powder. It's gluten free, USDA Organic, produced in a peanut-free facility, packaged in BPA-free packaging and the packets are shipped in recycled cardboard boxes. In other words, it hits almost every keyword associated with high quality, good for the baby and the environment. The box design screams high quality and I can see this selling at Whole Foods. In addition, it tastes good (I sampled one): it is firm but also spongy, kind of like a wafer, shrimp chimp or puffed rice treat.

The catch is that it's made in China. It is certified as organic, however, by a French organic agency, Ecocert SA, which apparently regulates organic facilities around the world. Ecocert SA seems reputable but I still question how a notoriously polluted country like China can manage to churn out any organic baby food when the soil, air and water is so very contaminated. Do they import the organic ingredients from elsewhere and merely use a Chinese factory as the place to put all the parts together? I would be more willing to trust a product like this if the company had taken the time to include a booklet or some sort of information card that would allay my fears.

Until that time comes, however, I will be very cautious with offering this to a child. I tried one and immediately got a slight stomach upset. It's such a shame that so much effort clearly went into this product, but many will shun it because it doesn't clarify how a supposedly "clean" food comes from one of the most polluted countries on earth.

she has a 2 yo, and a 5 month old, and carries Allot of things with her. Also can use this Lassig bag to
take for a couple of nights away from home with the children.

This can also be used for your own personal bag, as a Sports bag, or computer office bag etc.

title: Be careful with the valve, or you could smell soured milk in your car! text: My youngest is still having a hard time giving up his bottle to get to sleep. (I didn't have as much of a problem with my oldest, and no problem at all with my middle!) I thought this sippy cup was worth a shot. The good news is, he likes it during the day(though still not his favorite), but the bad news(for us) is that it still doesn't compare to his bottle to get to sleep at night.

The shape of this sippy cup is easy to grasp for my little one, so that's a plus.

The only negative issue I've had is in connection with the valve. I put milk in this sippy cup(for a short trip to town), and the valve came loose. The WHOLE sippy cup poured out in the seat of our vehicle. Of course, the bag was soaked, too. Since then, I've really pushed the valve into the top to make sure it's good and tight. So far, I haven't had any more leaks. Lesson learned the hard way, though, with soured milk in a hot vehicle. :S

Other than that, my little one likes it.

*Note: This sippy cup with handles is exactly like the one without them. The handles just come right off, and it can be used with or without the handles. When the handles don't line up with the spout, you can easily pop them off, and replace them in the correct position.

title: Easy installation; not secure to wall text: [[VIDEOID:94720c5f1799afb8e70f5a14a91309e6]] I personally like the gave for the purpose I had in mind: keeping two Shih-tzu out of the living room. It is 90% metal and 10% injection molded plastic/resin. I feel that if this gate is used by a single person, and with patience, not hurrying, or forcing the latch, it should work. Because it is a plastic, spring loaded mechanism for the latch, a family of 4 or five, and lots of thru-traffic, I can see that the mechanism would likely fail quickly. I will come back and make an update should the gate fail. There is a registration card for this Gate to register your product.
I would NOT put this at the top of stairs since the pieces that are on the walls are slick, not rubbery, and do not cling. Pressure over 15lbs or so will make this gate move. A toddler, medium dog, or someone trying to get through and losing balance would definitely risk displacing the gate from its placement, and falling down the stairs. If the gate can be placed at the bottom of the stairs, away from the staircase, but blocking access, that would be the best location. The other option is finding another attachments online that anchor the gate to the wall with permanence, like long wood screws or drywall mounts.
The latch need to be worked in two steps. 1. Push a spring loaded button 2. Press a spring loaded button. The springs are hard for arthritic thumbs to work. There are screws on one side of the latch where the mechanism can be accessed and replaced. I like this feature.
The gate can open in two directions, but small stoppers on the bottom of the gate can be flipped down to secure the gate to be only accessible from one side. This is a nice feature for stairs, if you anchor it properly. It is also nice when you have small dogs who want to dart through it. Opening it towards them gives them less of a chance to dart through.
As far as how "sturdy" this gate is, it is as sturdy as it will be treated. If a 100lb dog jumps on it day after day, it won't last. If 5 people are passing through it 25 time EACH every day, it will not last long. However, for pricepoint, and material(not wooden, not all metal, not professionally installed), it is more sturdy than I expected. The bars are bigger in diameter than I expected, and they are welded in place on a metal framed gate door. Many gate have the bars loose, and many have one side of the gate being plastic.
This gate has replaced a piece of unpainted, old, plywood. After a year of moving it back and forth, I decided this was better. The plywood protected the molding from the puppy through teething, and allowed her to scratch to no avail when she was left in the kitchen. This gate will hold her in, and will allow easier access to each room. It took me a total of 20 minutes to unbox, remove the plywood to the garage, place the 4 pressure pieces in place, get all four pressures to work to make the gate frame square, and then to clear away the box, two extra rods and plastic extensions for a larger doorframe. My doorframe is only 29 inches wide because this is an older home, ranch style. I did not need to read the directions to install this gate - it is simple.
Please view the video(not professional, but plain-speak), if you want a closer look.

title: Block finish is imperfect which makes gifting hit or miss; otherwise wonderful - 3.5 stars text: These milestone blocks are lovely and relatively well-made. They come in a nice satchel and are attractive. Unfortunately, they put paper between the blocks during shipping that sticks to the finish and I could not get a lot of it off. Also, one of the numbers was not fully painted and another the finish was incomplete. In addition, they have a slight smell to them. Nevertheless, if they are aired out to cure, that should go away.

In general, these are lovely. There are a total of six blocks--4 small and 2 large. They are used as milestone blocks when taking pictures during a child's 1st Christmas, Easter, Thanksgiving, various birthday's, etc. There are any number of combinations available. In general I love them, I just wish the finish did not have flaws and stuck on paper from shipping that I have trouble removing as that makes them less giftable.

At the current price of $29.99, these should be perfect.

title: Buy this whale! text: My friend bought this for my kiddo when he was just 2 months old - and we've used it every night since! Obviously, at his initial size, the "put it on the forehead" feature wasn't going to work with an itty bitty head. But being able to pour from the CORNER of the whale meant a tiny, controlled spout of water.

And the kid? He LOVES this thing! This is his ONLY bath toy. He can't WAIT to hang out with the Whale.

For my kid, he LOVES having the whole thing dumped over his head in one big WHOOSH so I can't speak to the "no water in the eyes" thing.

He ALSO loves it when Daddy pours it on his OWN head. (Me? Not so much - then I have to mop the floor!)

It's simple, it's fun, it WORKS like it says, and it's easy to clean/hold/pour.

title: will be adding these to our subscription text: We've used huggies nighttime in the past and have recently used honest overnight diapers. I think we just went with the honest diapers because it was convenient to pick up locally when we've needed it. But that diaper is so full by the morning time. So full that my 10 month old gets a bit uncomfortable. So we saw these were available and wanted to give them a try. We still used pampers swaddlers during the day. For over five years and two babies, they've been very reliable diapers for us so we already had confidence in the brand.

Well, these have been working for us and so far, our baby is comfortable in them. They're lasting through the night with out any spillage like we had with the honest diapers. So after that experience, that's about as much as we can hope for. We're happy with these and we'll be looking to add these to our subscription.

title: May not be for every kid, but works for ours. text: The Drop-Ins idea is great in itself, but we're unable to refrigerate these as we can other bottles. The breast milk begins to clot on the sides unless the milk is used right away.
My 2-month old daughter didn't initially like these, but after a couple more uses, we found that she had an easier time drinking from these than Similac or Medela's bottles, which are two of our other options. The Avent ones measure up nicely, but what we like about the Playtex Drop Ins is that our daughter won't suck in as much air as she might from other bottles.

Yes, they can measure expensively in the long run, but we'd prefer that over our daughter, who drinks a ton, drinking in too much air.

title: Love Diaper Genie!!! text: We had a Diaper Genie ten years ago when our first was born and I loved it back then... And I'm even happier with it now! The design has improved. It's easier to change and the capacity is slightly larger than I remember.

Our A/C broke a halfway into the summer; and we've decided to wait to save up for a little while and replace the entire heating and cooling system at once. Because of the heat and humidity, I can't tell you how much of a life saver diaper genie has been.... it's really helps keep the icky smells down! Of course I wish the refills weren't so expensive.... but I consider it a worthwhile & temporary cost to keep help keep my insanity.
Let's be honest, with young kids my house never feels clean. At least the genie helps a lot by removing nasty smells and I think that adds serious value. I honestly can't even smell old diapers when I walk into the room. And if you can't decide on which color, I'd go with the grey one. It blends into the background better in my opinion. I honestly can't recommend Diaper Genie enough!

title: Our favorite cup for water
text: Our daughter is now 2. We used these Avent straw cups since transitioning off of the bottle at 12 months, and they were great. After some time we opted for a spill-proof open cup design, but we realized our daughter drinks more fluids with these straw cups, so now we use these all day long for water. They can leak a few drops here and there, but it's super minimal. Worth noting, she chewed right through the straws of our older cups now that she's 2 (probably because the parts were over a year old), so we ordered 2 new sets (4 cups). These are the easiest to clean and assemble, and don't require anything other than flipping the top to take them on-the-go. Great cups for water!

title: Reasonably sturdy; nice graphics; great size text: I'm pretty pleased with this toy bin. It's much larger than other bins I've used, both in terms of length/width as well as height. The latter is especially valuable since the shorter bins have a problem with larger items. This bin, in contrast, swallows everything up just fine, and I can even close the lid on it when it's loaded up.

The build quality is much the same as other bins, with it consisting of fabric covered cardboard. It's sturdy enough to hold items, but it's not the type of bin where you can fill it up then pick up the bin. This is strictly a bin that needs to stay put once it's filled.

The graphics are nicely done, with vibrant colors. The base is removable so you can fold up the bin if it's no longer needed, or you need to transport it.

No complaints. It looks nice, is reasonably sturdy, works fine as a holding bin, and is large enough to hold a LOT of items. Five stars.

title: 100% silicone bowl, lid, and spoon set work nicely text: We're using this set with a 1.5 year old, and the bowl still works well for her. The bottom of the bowl creates a suction that is activated simply by placing the bowl on a solid surface. This prevents a child from moving or dumping the bowl. To easily remove the bowl, you grab the tab on the base and lift. The bowl has a flexible handle on one side. The bowl is 2.25" tall and 4.5" across and holds about 10 ounces. The clear, silicone lid fits security and is easy to remove. It's the easiest-to-use silicone lid that I've tried. The 4.5" long by 1" wide spoon is two-sided, with one side to dip into puree for babies and the other side a deep-bowled spoon for older children. The silicone spoon might have some internal reinforcement because it has only a small amount of flexibility (which is good).

This feeding set is microwave safe, dishwasher safe, and freezer safe. It is made for 4 months and up. Every piece is made of 100% food safe silicone and is BPA, PVC, lead, and phthalates free. Care instructions: wash before first use. Wash with warm soapy water or in the dishwasher. Do not use abrasive products for cleaning. Microwave, dishwasher, and oven safe (up to 350º Fahrenheit). Keep away from sharp objects. Store in a cool, dry place.

title: another quality product from Regalo
text: I really like this product as far as what I intended to use it for. I have five dogs varying in size from 5 pounds to 100 and wanted to keep them off the carpeting in my home. The gate definitely serves it’s purpose. I feel like it’s somewhat flimsy and actually if one of these dogs were to push on the gate it will probably come down relatively easy. I definitely wouldn’t suggest using something such as this if you’re genuinely concerned about the safety of a small child. I definitely would not recommend using it on a stairway. Overall I’m very pleased with the product. For pets that are not going to try to get through it it’s definitely ideal however I don’t know that I would feel safe using it to restrict a child or a pet that may show interest in trying to get out of the gate. I do have another Regalo gate that blocks off the entrance to my office and I feel that that one is somewhat more sturdy. It’s not quite as versatile as it only opens in one direction but it does seem like a far more sturdy gate. I feel like Regalo provide a quality product for a very reasonable price and I would definitely purchase products from them in the future.

title: Just like the stars I had as a kid! text: I remember having these a Looong time ago, and they’re exactly the same! You stick them anywhere, but the best places are neat light sources. If you go to bed near sundown, that would be windows, and if not, the best places are near lights you turn off last before bed, as they need to “charge” to shine (unless you have a blacklight or UV light on). Anyone expecting them to be super bright without lighting them first doesn’t know how these work—it’s an unrealistic expectation. These work fine if you use them as intended, and of course, if you want them bright, you can alway just turn all the lights on for a few minutes or shine a flashlight close to them for better results.
Fun!

title: It Works!
text: After reading all the reviews I decided to order this and I'm happy with the purchase. I wished I had ordered two of them. We purchased this for my son's Legare Frog Twin Bed which due to the nature of the head and foot board, the bed cannot be pushed up against a wall (I didn't really think about that prior to purchasing the bed OR just one rail). Anyways, after getting the rail I was a little worried that it wouldn't work on a bed without a box spring. My 2 year olds bed has just the frame and a mattress but due to the long "arms" of the rail that go underneath the mattress I was still able to use it. The frame of the bed keeps the rail secure and tight against the mattress. There are no gaps and I can even lean my 103 pound body against it while napping on the bed with my son and feel completely safe. This product is well made. Instructions were a little confusing at first but just following the numbers in sequence and you'll be fine. I don't plan on "hiding it away" so the fact that I don't have it set-up exactly as it should doesn't matter to me. A second one is on its way!

title: It is triple French milled thus very good for sensitive skin and those with skin allergies. text: This soap is perfect for sensitive and delicate skin. I used this for my 5 yrs old son who has eczema. His skin easily dries out and I moisturize it a lot and I am in search for a soap that would not aggravate his eczema. So far, this super mild soap is working for him. This also doubles as a shampoo. The lavander scent is very faint, almost unnoticeable.

The best thing about this soap is that it isfrench triple milled. French Milled soap is known to be the finest quality. Not only is it plant based, but it is smooth on your skin and so gentle that it lathers very easily, even in hard water! The milling process is key to achieve the level of quality and homogeneity. Further, triple milled soap is a type of soap that has been passed through three rounds of steel rollers. This step removes any air bubbles and excess water from the soap, which helps it to last longer and lather better because there is more actual soap than water. Most importantly, French milling removes these traces of lye, and the soap, after rinsing, ensures that dirt and grease is gone. This is very beneficial to those with oily or sensitive skin, or those with skin allergies. Definitely recommending it!

title: Great value!

title: Just right text: What can I say, a nice scent. Feels nice. I like that it absorbs sweat and some BO. Not a total replacement for deodorant, but you can use in places you would not try a stick deodorant.
I use on my underarms and torso, feels good between skin and shirt. In crotch area, again nice barrier for sweat, and rubbing of undergarments.
The corn starch and aloe are nice additions to the talc. Not sure of the vitamin E, but doesn't"t hurt so all is well.

title: I wanted to love this monitor... but I can't. text: It has every feature I wanted: 2 cams, split screen, pan/zoom/tilt, talk, VOX, large (4.3in) screen on the parent unit, night vision, the list of great features goes on- you can even record those precious moments to an SD card. It should have been perfect, especially at this great price. Except for two things- two really important things. 'Thing the First:' the range! The sleek, lovely parent unit would cut out once the nursery door was closed, which is simply ridiculous, as there was a mere 25-30ish feet and an inch thick piece of wood between the signal (cam) and the receptor (parent unit). So there is a giant sized antennae that we popped upon the parent unit and that would be a better signal unless someone walked between the unit and camera. Meaning if I or my spouse crossed the living room or walked down the hall. Very puzzling and disappointing.

Now for 'Thing the Second:' the incessant beeping. O save me from that horrible sound. Every time the parent unit loses the signal from a camera that it feels like it should be detecting the beeping starts. And you can't stop it. You can't mute it. If the parent unit is already on mute the beeping still happens at exactly the same level of sound, despite your desperation to shut it up. You can click through the menu desperately trying to get something to change and the beeping will continue as you struggle to find the beep setting, or get the unit to pair with the camera or anything, anything to stop the sound. I forgot to mention, the only thing in the box besides the units and cords is a quick start guide. You have to go online to download the full manual. So there's no help right off the bat as you fumble through unfamiliar menu choices with the beeping, the beeping, the beeping, ringing through your skull after a long day of devoted parenting. And if you un-pair a camera, it will shut up, but I unpaired the wrong camera and had to sneak back into our daughter's room to press the pair button on the base of the camera in her room while trying to get the window of opportunity correct with the parent unit's scanning for a camera while muffling the horrible beep to keep from waking her.

Well, thanks for letting me vent. One last 'Thing', we use a Vornado Baby air purifier in the nursery as it's perfect for white noise so we can party down while the baby sleeps. (Read 'party' as vacuum, wash bottles and groan loudly as we finally sit down in the evening.) And when I chose this unit I felt the only risk was that the sound of a baby talking or crying wouldn't carry through the unit over the sound of this pretty powerful white noise. I've tried a couple other monitors that failed this test and we have a Summer Infant monitor that is able to make out the baby voice and filter out the white noise nicely, but we are expecting Baby #2 and wanted to upgrade. This Motorola unit couldn't really do that, sadly. The sound would cut in and out more than the video signal and would have been impossible to sleep through as the signal stuttered and translated soothing white noise into a high pitched sputtering. So there you go. Again I thank you for letting me vent about that beeping. I needed to get it out. Oh one more 'Thing:' cam unit cords are a little short.

1) Poor range
2) Shouldn't have to press a 'pair button,' just automatically scan for cams
3) WHAT is up with that incessant beep
4) Should filter white noise better
5) Come on, I need the manual, in paper, I'm just from that generation
6) Please make the power cords on the baby cams longer

title: Toddler / preschool size very sturdy bowls
text: These are great bowls.  They’re smaller than a typical bowl that come win a set of dishes but larger than a baby snack bowl, so they’re a really good size for toddler / preschool snacks.  They don’t suction, which for us is a plus because he’s old enough now he like some to carry his bowl around, sit it someplace and snack as he plays. And the suction ones  will just get pulled-on by him and food flies everywhere but these are just the perfect size for little hands to carry.  They’re also durable enough that they’ve been ran over by him on his foot truck and it didn’t even hurt them at all.  They are super sturdy.  Highly recommended for feeding / snack time for toddlers / preschool kids.

title: The "ganic" part of the name is a little misleading text: Well, I really liked these wipes until I read other reviews.

First, what I liked about the wipes. They are thick, luxuriantly thick. They have a low odor that is fine. They work well, the packaging is fine.

What I don't like is that these don't seem very organic at all. I was looking for anything that clearly said they were biodegradable because we use wipes in the boundary waters and other camping trips. These might be, but I cannot find anything that clearly says they are. Also, the fact that this contains Phenoxyethanol is disturbing. I noticed other reviews mentioning this but was not horribly worried until I looked into it a bit. I was more than a little disturbed to find that the chemical caused testicular atrophy in mice. Also they fact that it was found to cause genetic/chromosomal mutations and a neurotoxin and tocix for babies were a little disturbing. Granted, our modern life is surrounded by stuff at this level, but it is hard to knowingly use something with warnings like that.

title: We use them for everything! text: My favorite brand.
I use these wipes for EVERYTHING. From tooshies to hands to face.

And no worries about the "glass" reports I've never found a single thing and Amazon is amazing at getting the wipes to my door in 2 days!

title: Nice
text: Very nice!

title: Great toddler bibs for my 2yr old
text: Great toddler bibs for my 2yr old! I thought I wouldn't like them when they first arrived; they seemed thin and I didn't think I needed five. I was wrong! They work great, and are really durable. We use them so much it's nice to have a few to use when the others are drying. Sometimes food rolls off the front, it might be nice to have a pocket on the front, but I would still pick these over the others we have tried.

title: Very stylish! Great for an afternoon or evening out. text: This Bugaboo Changing Backpack is a very stylish accompaniment for a stroller ride around the zoo or other afternoon or evening outing. I love the sleek black color, that it repels water, and it being made from all recycled materials is a plus. The front unzips completely, revealing space for all of the baby changing essentials, other items, and even a place for a laptop.
There is a spacious padded, easy to clean, changing mat, along with two pouches to carry necessities, one of which is insulated and great for keeping milk or water at warm or cold temperatures for a few hours. There is plenty of room for several diapers, baby wipes, and even sanitizing wipes.
This is a very stylish and quite roomy changing backpack, and it fits perfectly on our stroller. It has room for all of the necessities for diaper changes, and even a compartment for Mom and Dad, if needed. It is very well-made, nicely stitched, has smooth working waterproof zippers, and comes in practically no waste packaging. It would make a wonderful baby shower gift. I would absolutely recommend it!

title: but she's been tearing up the silicone spout with her teeth so i wanted something more sturdy. I thought this would be a cheap "

I thought this would be a cheap "trial run" cup,  but it has exceeded my expectations.  The price is great,  no concerns about mold because there are 2 simple parts and it is dishwasher safe.  I have 2 at daycare and 2 at home.  Great product!

text: Super easy to assemble and install. The only reason i didn't give it 5 starts is because it still wiggles a lot when clipped in.  Im not sure if it's because i have a leather interior, or if it would happen regardless. My daughter loves the seat and having 2 cupholders is great. She feels like a big person being able to use the shoulder strap! Overall its a good seat, esp for the price!

text: Some people like the softness of these diapers better than the original. I figure that with a baby between 12 and 18 pounds will be able to wear these and will show when the baby has wet. They figure that this size baby will need changing up to 9 times a day. You change them as soon as you know they need changed. You will probably use more diapers than you would expect, because babies are all different. You just want to make sure that your baby doesn't wear a wet or soiled diaper to prevent diaper rashes.

text: I use these with  a rented symphony pump. It's easy to pump right into these bags and then store the milk in my fridge or freezer. They stand easily and the measurement marks are easy to read. I do have to be sure I seal them completely. I've bought other brands, but went back to these.

text: This is a great solution to little hair bows and headbands that ultimately end up on the ground. It is well made and can hold a lot! It has a sturdy hook on top which can be placed in a closet or on a nail. It is also adorable which is a plus!

title: Small Business design with Care. text: This bag is very well made; it's hard to see such workmanship without the dedicated quality control of a company. I am enjoying it alot, it is convenient with good compartmentalization.

And because i forsee myself taking it eveywhere, i was hoping for cleanable material on the outside as well as perhaps 2 more open deep exterior pockets on the back of the bag. An increase of 1"- 2" to the wideness (thickness) of the main compartment will be great too - gosh, jackets & stuff toys are bulky ! Lol! Oh, i am looking forward to your future designs bec you hv such potential!

title: Medium woven basket large enough for two throws, laundry, yarn, etc. text: I love rope baskets and have over six of them.

This basket is moderately tall and not that wide but is big enough to hold two of my 60"x70" throws if tightly packed (see photo with the red and then brown throws). It has a multitude of uses and can hold knitting, beach toys, lots of books, summer or winter clothes, etc. The handles are great to hold and are strong although since they are knitted into the basket.

Any creases in the basket will straighten out over time.

The current price of $21.44 is competitively priced for this.

I don't hate it and will finish the bottle but won't repurchase unless it is ridiculously cheap.

title: Natural diaper option - no leaks and no rash! text: We have always use a different brand of diapers for my kiddos. My two year old daughter currently weighs about 27 pounds and wears size 6 and 7 diapers. These size 7 diapers were a good fit for her. They stood up throughout the day as well as during naptime and overnight. We didn’t have any leaks which a plus!
My daughter has extremely sensitive skin which is why we have been brand loyal. These Earth and Eden diapers did not give her a rash!
I would buy these again if I could use a coupon or get them on sale.

title: Sleek, comfy, and trustworthy. Beautiful design. text: This baby carrier is indeed a miracle. It manages to feel safe and sturdy, while being comfortable and easily customized for size of baby and the person doing the carrying.

I'm pretty fussy about fabrics, but the fabric used on this is both sturdy and soft, and it has padding as well as boning in all the right places. It feels structured yet is so well-designed you can forget you're wearing it.

If you're wanting a comfortable, adjustable baby carrier, but don't like the formlessness of the slings, then this is an awesome solution. Good for newborns 8 lbs or heavier as well as babies up to 26 lbs.

title: Wholesome Ingredients, Cute Container
text: It looks like oxidized guacamole  and has a pleasant texture. Made from organic apples, spinach, avocados lemon juice concentrate, it is not too sweet and . tastes like spinach applesauce. It was well received and tolerated. I like the little dishes. the lids are secure and they can be repurposed. .One the container are the days of the week. There is a small, barely visible arrow (about a quarter of an inch down from the lip of the lid) which can be aligned with the days to track the freshness. sine the arrow is so hard to see, it really didn't work well for me. Dotting the day with a sharpie or colored marker works better. but overall a good food with wholesome, organic ingredients and a unique taste.

The fork is pretty terrible. The prongs are so thick that picking up soft foods like noodles will be a challenge, let alone any harder foods. I gave it to my daughter with her melon and she ended up using her hands instead.

Compared to the OXO utensils we currently use, these fall short. See the pictures to see OXOs nice metal utensils with a generous spoon and great fork prongs. Those are the winner for us and for a toddler learning how to use real utensils. These Beaba ones will be tossed in the diaper bag for occasional use on the go.

The material is kind of rough all considering. It is 100% cotton so it should be a lot softer than it really is, which really surprised me quite honestly.

The blanket is however a good size so that is at least good. It is on the thinner side so you have to use it in layers to really give you some "thermal" warming effect with this.

Sadly this was a let down. It is a layer but not really that warming and if you write "thermal" in a description it should really help you get and stay warm in my opinion. This one would fail in that department rather miserably.

I probably wouldn't recommend this for someone who is going to be using it daily to sleep in, because the padding is quite thin, compared to a crib mattress. but if your looking for something to use every now-and-then, this is perfect. My little guy slept very well in it.

title: Great for wipes; not airtight for long wipe storage; top feels like it will break text: I am a bit disappointed in this wipes container.

This fits baby wipes or antiseptic wipes that come in packages similar in size to baby wipes. They will not fit tissues because the box is smaller than a tissue box. This box is attractive and is made of sturdy plastic. It has a silicone seal around the area where the rim of the box meets the top but there is no such seal around the dispensing hole, so it is not airtight. What really annoys me is that the act of lifting the lid cover causes it to creak. I feel like one day the door is just going to fall off.

The lid only lays lightly on top without a silicone seal, so the wipes will dry out over time. This means that unless one is using the wipes they put in the box on a daily basis, they will have to be thrown out or rewet with water.

I find it best to remove the wipes from the packaging and then enclose them in this box.

In summary, the container fits baby or hand sanitizing wipes. It is attractive but is not airtight. The lid hinge is its weakest point both from keeping the wipes moist and because it appears like it will break easily. The current price of $11.39 ($11.99 minus 5%) is competitively priced for this.

title: Sturdy, Many Pockets, Versatile Bag text: Kopduki Diaper Bag Tote, Diaper Bags with Changing Pad and Pacifier Case, Multifunction Baby Bag for Boys Girls, Large Travel Diaper Tote for Mom Dad, Navy Blue

Very roomy diaper bag. I like the styling of this diaper bag. It looks very sharp. There is a pocket or compartment for everything. Four of the pockets are insulated. The zippers are very nice and slide without any problems. The bag’s handles are long enough to go over the shoulder. The bag is sturdy and durable.

title: Health-conscious parents won't want this toxic stew anywhere near their precious babies text: I am shocked that Cetaphil has made such a chemical stew of a lotion, especially one marketed at babies. Let me just start with this fact: The fragrance stinks and the greasy, sticky texture feels awful on one's skin.

Many people still use "baby oil," which in long-time formulas like Johnson's Baby Oil has the primary ingredient of mineral oil scented with a strong, toxic fragrance. If you are planning to use a baby oil product on your baby, the best possible oil you could use is organic coconut oil (or any other organic, edible oil). I think coconut oil is ideal because it has a wonderful, real coconut smell, none of that awful, chemical fragrance that is so often put in baby products like this one.

There is another benefit of using an edible, food-grade oil as a baby moisturizer: if your baby pops her fingers in her mouth which have coconut oil on them, or you want to moisturize her lips, which can get very chapped from baby drool, you don't have to worry about her ingesting awful chemicals into her body.

Another benefit of coconut oil is that it is antibacterial, antiviral and antifungal, so it is healing and soothing on diaper rash and also helps prevent it.

If you are worried about using a food oil as a moisturizer making your baby's skin greasy or sticky, you won't be avoiding that issue with a greasy, sticky product like this one. One way to get natural, food-grade oil to absorb more deeply into baby's skin is to give her a massage every day when you moisturize her. This is just one example of a book on that subject: [[ASIN:0756602467 Baby Massage: the Calming Power of Touch]]. It's even more wonderful for a baby to be massaged than an adult. It's soothing and healing, and helps bond parent with child and makes baby feel loved and secure.

I usually like to include in reviews of products like this one a description of each of the chemical ingredients it contains but, frankly, there are so many chemicals in this product, my review would end up 2000 words long if I included descriptions of them all! However, if you are reading this review and you have a strong interest in learning more about any of the chemicals in this product, simply ask me about any of them you would like to know about in the comment section and I will post that information there.

In all, there are over a dozen chemical ingredients in this product that I wouldn't recommend that an adult expose herself to, and would never want any of them near any precious baby in my care.

Ingredients: Water, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Sorbitol, Isopropyl Palmitate, Octyldodecanol, Polyglyceryl-3 Diisostearate, Glycerin, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Hexyldecanol, Hexyldecyl Laurate, Panthenol, Caprylyl Glycol, Carbomer, Fragrance, Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Sodium Hydroxide, Dipropylene Glycol, Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract, Squalane, Propylene Glycol, Glyceryl Caprylate, Heliotropine, Tocopherol.

title: Cute!! text: Admittedly, it’s been a long time since I’ve been around pacifiers. According to my mom, as a baby, I didn’t like them. No matter which one she got – I’d spit them right out. Funny story – I spit one across the room and made a “don’t do that again” face.

As I said – that was a long time ago.

Today’s pacifiers have changed – dramatically.

PROS:

** Absolutely ADORABLE designs

** Soft nipples

** “Handle” to attach a pacifier clip/lanyard so it doesn’t get lost (the other end of the “clip” can attach to their clothing)

** STURDY Carry & Sterilizing Case (with instructions in the bottom of the case) that can be popped into a diaper bag, tote bag, backpack, or purse

CONS – Only one to be honest:

** Case COULD leak in transit if NOT completely dry (this is a MAJOR issue in a way)

** Seem a bit small for a year old baby to 18 month old (1½ years) though

I honestly got these for a baby project, but I can see why they are popular.

They’d definitely make a great gift for the mama to be to keep the little one in pacifiers from birth to perhaps 2 years of age (as Philips has a 0-6 month version), or when the little one stops using them.

They look sturdy, so I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend them.

title: Saved my baby's life! text: There is nothing like worrying about your child when it comes to SIDS. No matter how healthy they are, a parent will worry about this baby. This monitor saved my daughter’s life. One night, the alarm went off letting me know that my daughter wasn’t breathing. It was the scariest moment of my life. I rushed to her.. and it was right she wasn’t. I called her pediatrician (I was able to startle her away) and she sent us to the local women’s and children’s hospital where we would spend the next 5 days. Turns out she had reflux horribly and she aspirated on her spit up. While we were not a SIDS risk… had it not been for this monitor, we might not have our baby girl with us today.

This model is great. It is easy to use. The screen is perfect and I can see her clearly. The mat is easy to use as well. You just put it under the mattress and you are good to go. I would recommend this product for everyone. You never know when it can save your baby’s’ life.

The manufacturer used good strong material, a fairly pleasing color, easy to use zippers, lots of generously sized and well constructed pockets. The bag/backpack easy to lift and carry, even full the bag does not weigh you down. This would be a great gift for a new dad or a new mother, students, counselors, bus drivers, truckers, teachers. title: I LIke It text: I've heard about "witch hazel" all my life and even have big antique bottle of it on display in my kitchen with other antique medicinal bottles, but never really knew what it actually was.....until now. Google says: "Witch hazel is a natural remedy made from the bark and leaves of a plant called Hamamelis virginiana. Long used in traditional medicine, witch hazel is usually applied topically in order to treat certain skin conditions. ... By acting as an astringent, witch hazel helps to constrict skin tissue."

I like the Green Grab (weird name) Baby Solution Witch Hazel because it has glycerin in it as well as witch hazel. I have used it on my baby niece when changing diapers and it seemed to sooth her skin some, but her skin was healthy already since I won't let her wear a soiled diaper. I used it on my face and felt pretty good and didn't dry my skin out. I still applied a good moisturizer afterwards anyway but it was a good astringent. The faint scent is also pleasant and not at all over powering.

title: Compact knee / elbow pads that provide comfort during a bath; has many uses text: I tried several kneelers recently and my favorite is this [[ASIN:B08QRQPW2W one]] because it is a lot larger and close in price to this gray kneeler.

These elbow and knee pads are compact and good for those who have a small space. It comes with the non-skid kneeling pad and the elbow pad that lays over the tub and has pockets on either side for toys and suction cups to hold on to the tub. In addition, it also comes with six lovely squeak toys. 
This set does not feel like it is made of neoprene like other sets are. Instead it feels like water resistant cloth which is not as easy to clean.

The suction cups secure tightly to the tub. The mesh pockets on either side of the elbow pads allow for storage of toys and other incidentals. On one side the pockets are more of a netting material and on the other they are more solid mesh. The interior (toward the tub) can be used for toys and the exterior to hold washcloths, soap, shampoo, etc.

This is not only for washing children during bath time but can be used by people, like me, who have to wash out litter pans or pets in the tub and prefer a soft surface on which to lean. Since the knee pads are separate from the elbow pads, they can be used when kneeling is desired when working close to the floor, etc.

The current price of $29.99 ($31.99 minus $2) is competitively priced for this small set. I personally prefer a larger set that costs about $8 more. I have reviewed others and they are usually priced in the $ 26 to $ 30 range. This set works well but it is best for those with smaller spaces or who do not want to spend the extra money for a larger one.

title: Versatile gym; use w/supervision; requires assembly & 6 AA batteries NOT included – 3.5 stars text: [[VIDEOID:a4e21a2880d1b4d37ea1dec1abf49bd6]] This gym comes in 16 parts, 15 of which need to be assembled. The assembly instructions in the manual are horrible and incomplete. I just looked at the box front and assembled it in less than 10 minutes. The pad has little cloth nubs on it that get hooked into the base per my video. A remote is included and both the remote (requires 2 AA batteries) and the gym's speaker face (requires 4 AA batteries) require a total of 6 AA batteries NOT included. All items snap in place except for the batteries which require a tiny Phillips screwdriver.

To get full functionality out of this unit, there is a learning curve. The manual has the image of what all the controls mean on Page 9. However, only Page 19 to 22 are the English instructions. There looks to be about 50 different combinations of controls to play piano sounds, various light sequences, to jazz music, and animal sounds. I just tried the simple stuff.

Bluetooth pairing is available. I paired it with my iPad and then went to YouTube to play a Rick Astley song through the gym's speaker as shown in my video.

I recommend using this under supervision only because the halo that goes around the unit is loose and I would be afraid the rattles will fall on the baby.

In summary, this gym is super simple to assemble as long as one does not even bother to figure out the incomplete assembly instructions in the manual. The user needs to supply 6 AA batteries and a tiny Phillips screwdriver to complete assembly. There are a lot of musical and light features on this unit but there is a learning curve to understand all the features. The unit can be operated via the remote or the faceplate speaker. The faceplate speaker can be attached to a crib without the gym. There is Bluetooth ability that provides one with the ability to play music from their own personal music library or the Internet. In fact, you can even play the news from the Internet for the baby if so desired--although "baby" will probably get cranky with that. Do not leave the baby unattended on this mat for safety reasons. Overall, this is a nice baby gym with many features. The current price of $49.99 is also competitive. This gets 3.5 stars from me.

title: great travel packs
text: I like these eco-friendly wipes, they are soft and durable. They are fragrance free and have aloe in them. However, they are not flushable so I'm not sure how eco-friendly these are compared to the generic version I usually buy. The ingredients are mostly the same except or polysorbate 80 and phenoxyethanol. The thing I like the most is the fact that they come in travel size packets with 20 in each pack. I usually only see travel size packs with ten. I don't have a baby but I use wipes for so many things. They are great for dusting, wiping down the inside of my car, spot cleaning a shirt at work, freshening up on a hot day, removing make-up (they don't bother my eyes, I think that is just a warning that comes on everything). I also use them when my dogs' fur smells a bit off and there is no time for a bath. The wipes have so many uses. I will probably continue to use the generic wipes as they are so much less expensive but I am happy to have these travel sized ones for emergencies.

title: 12,000 diapers tested and approved text: We have trusted huggies as a family for years. When our first child was born (daughter) we were given a package of a different brand in the hospital. We began to realize a rash on our newborns bottom area, outlining the diaper design. We switched to huggies little snugglers and have never looked back.
Our daughter has taken to using the diapers to help her learn how to count. She is so familiar with seeing the new boxes every month. We have the diapers on subscribe and save, they arri e ssme tome every time. Its so easy
Our son (2nd child) is now onto huggies little movers. The absorbancy is great, especially for those longer changing times. The leak proof has stood the test time and time again. The infamous baby "blow-outs" are nonexistent for us with this brand. There is no odor and the material is durable.
We gift these, we buy these. This is not a paid or compensated review. With almost 12,000 diapers tested...We just trust and back this brand

title: Not ready for launch; Update 6/14/17 text: 30 minutes in and still cannot get the camera to stay paired. I have owned 4 arlo pros for 6 months and never had an issue. Why did you rush a product to market with so many issues and bugs?

Update 6/14: Slight improvements, with firmware and app upgrades. This is really a non-HD camera because it only functions decent at 480p. Lag and app start-up time is still poor. Battery is another story, definitely less than 3 hours on IR mode.

As much as I want to love this camera, I feel like a fool for keeping it and hoping things will get resolved with future updates. We the consumers were left to do all the beta testing in this situation. As a new parent I have no time to fight buggy technology. When I turn the monitor on, I need it to work, first time, without delay. I see Netgear has responded to some of the reviews, and asked to connect with users. Curious as to what they are providing, in these situations... support, product refunds/replacements?

title: great wipes
text: They are thick and soft. I read someone's comment that theirs fell apart after washing, which has not been my case.  I have washed my wipes many times and not had a problem yet--they look like new after every wash.  I wash them with purex no dye,no fragrence and oxyclean baby.  I rinse them first before throwing them in my diaper pail, then wash.  I only partially dry in the dryer, then hang dry.  I do this with most of my clothes.  I bought another batch of wipes, the Osocozy brand, which are okay, but not as nice as these.  I would definitely recommend these over those.  I would buy these again.
