title: tired and true diapers text: We've used these diapers on two babies now over the span of five years plus. We tried other diapers just to try new things and ended coming back to the swaddlers for one reason or another.

At 3 AM in the morning with a dim light, it easy to see the potty line turn blue.
The leg skirt, if set up properly, usually keeps blow out contained.
The side tabs work great.
They're plenty absorbent.

There's not much to say except these work great. Years ago when we were new parents, we were thankful that these features were available in the diapers and we still appreciate the reliability of these diapers.

title: Amazing Sound Quality text: I’ll admit to having used a hand me down baby monitor and that it wasn’t the best in the world but, it had gotten us by.

I’ve been totally floored by the Avent and the sound quality that comes through. The slightest coo or gurgle and it’s like you’re right next to them. The peace of mind this has given us is worth it’s price tag. The DECT is great for anti hacking here in the US but isn’t completely 100% but the likelihood of someone using DECT in the US to get through baby monitors seems unlikely at best.

The lighted cosmos are super cute and keeps the little one entertained along with the soft lullabies.

Totally recommend!

title: Works for oversized door openings- longest length I found!! text: In need of a safety gate to fit a wider opening or walkway into our living room and stairway.. it was important to find something presentable being it is the first thing seen when entering in our home!! Also, needing gate just x2 week- I was looking for something easily retractable when not in use. This particular safety gate was the longest length and least obnoxious that I found in my search! So, if you have a wider girth to protect from small children- this is a solid option. TBH, I’m surprised how difficult it was to find a gate fit for a wider opening!

Installation is not the easiest in the fact, you must be precise! Having said that… They do provide all the necessary tools, instructions to let you be successful on the first try!! MOST IMPORTANT HELP I FOUND was the “how too” video smack on the product page itself. It wasn’t until I watched quick video that everything written made sense. Don’t overlook this as a valuable tool if you're struggling to interpret instructions. You’ll receive needed hardware (screws and extra wall mount bracket- a nice touch!) and your template paper.. YOU must provide tape measure and screwdriver (or drill) to complete the install- total time 30 minutes.. post reading instructions and viewing quick video!

I appreciate the gate is minimalistic in design using straight, sleek lines with minimal bulk- and a thin panel hides gears and mechanics. Made in white this blends best placed on a wall of like color- for us, we have painted walls so, this is pretty blatantly just there.. Truth be told- I missed this needs permanent Application as I mistook template for adhesive.. just know you will be drilling into baseboards and sheet rock! Oh how I wish someone would invent the baby gate that didn’t leave a mark!

Keep in mind if you have an aggressive toddler this isn’t full proof, it’s a fabricated screen and therefore- when in place children will be deterred but, they still need a watchful eye! As of now, I have confidence this will hold the little 18mo old in safely.. Something to keep in mind for your need and age of child needing protection. Love how this has retractable screen with lock mechanism and can be done x1 handed.. mechanics seem to work perfectly and as one would hope.

Definitely an option that can step up just as it says it will- A few things to consider prior to purchase and if it will fit your criteria! Hoping this info can help your decision.. stay safe!

title: Does the job text: This mobile was gifted to us in April 2020 for a May birth. For our daughter's first 18 months, it was her steady friend in falling asleep, to the extent that when the batteries ran out and had to be recharged, she would cry and have trouble going to sleep.

By 12-18 months, she took great pleasure in working the switches herself. By 18 months, she no longer seemed to want it on and would shut it off herself.

Great mobile. Well worth the money. Thank you for your service, little mobile.

title: Works perfectly! Wished I'd gotten this ages ago! text: My boyfriend wanted a thermometer to tell what temp the water is at and where I didn't NEED it, I figured it's a fun simple gadget so got it and installed it very easily.

The screen part spins freely around it which is nice because if it didn't, you could instell this and have your screen facing somewhere that'd be impossible to read. But when you install it, you can spin it to which side you want and then the screen also spins around to face you. That all probably sounds confusing but just know the screen position is very adjustable and you'll be able to point it to where you are.

Function wise- we got our wireless thermometer and put it up next to this and this seems to be very accurate! I don't see a battery spot so believe it's probably powered by the water moving thru it which is nice.

title: Nice. But do not microwave or use with hot liquids.
text: This is a 2 pack of Click Lock Bite Proof Trainer Cup. One is pink, and the other is purple. The spout is made of silicone. The sides of the cup are hard plastic, but it is BPA free. The top of the cup screws on, and you hear an audible click when the lid is secure and will not leak. The trainer cups are for 6 months and older. The cups are 5.25" tall and hold 7 oz. The part of the handle where the child holds it is just over 1/2" across and is wavy to help create a secure grip. The spout is "reinforced bite proof," but you are still cautioned to not let your child chew on it. Also, "do not microwave or use with hot liquids." The cups can be washed on the top rack of the dishwasher or hand washed in warm, soapy water. So far, these trainer cups seem to work well. The hourglass shape makes it a little harder to wash and dry by hand, but otherwise it's fine.

title: Love these diapers text: We used Pampers Swaddlers exclusively when my son was a newborn because we had gotten both the Swaddlers and Huggies newborns and the Huggies always caused leaks. Well when he grew out of the Swaddlers, we went to Pampers Baby Dry. I tried the Pampers Cruisers as well but found they weren't much better than the Baby Dry and cost more so I stuck with the Baby Dry. Well during that time I tried the regular Huggies just to be sure I wanted to stick with the Pampers and the Huggies used to leave this crystal, gooey stuff on my son's skin. We immediately stopped using those and I figured all Huggies were like that so I stuck with Pampers.

I got a sample of these, the Huggies Supreme Gentle Care, and found they had better stretch around the legs (didn't dig into my son's legs and leave indents), had good stretch around the back and went up pretty high to help prevent anything from leaking out, and held a lot! We used to use seperate Night Time diapers but after using these, this is the only one we need. These have never leaked! We had the Pampers Baby Dry leak a couple of times during long car drives when we couldn't change often and a few times during the night time. These diapers are wonderful and now these are the only ones I use.

If you haven't tried these, give them a try and see for yourself. They are nothing like the regular Huggies. They fit much better and hold a lot more.

title: Changes Colors and Sings but Quality is Questionable text: Everyone with little kids knows that youngsters love anything that lights up and makes sounds. These types of toys are so beloved because they stimulate the senses and a relevant example is this sheep from Wow! Stuff CoComelon Toys.

Lots of toys light up and make sounds, but this one is unique. You place the sheep on a specific color, and it lights up to the same color. Then, it starts to sing a song and it says the name of the color within the song. This is above and beyond other lighting and sound- producing toys and it is a cool concept for certain.

As much as the qualities of this toy sound impressive, it does have a flaw or two. The greatest issue I have is that the included color strip is nothing more than a piece of paper with different colors! The problem is obvious: it’s only a matter of time until the paper rips, gets lost, gets crumpled, etc. It would have made more sense to have laminated this, but I guess the manufacturer wanted to save a little money.

The success rate for the sheep is generally good. Sometimes, it is slow to register when it’s placed on a different color and it may or may not change color as a result. You may need to lift it up, then place it back down again, to get it to register the exact color you want.

It's cool that this CoComelon toy lights up with different colored lights and states the name of the color because it can help young children learn. But the cheap inclusion of a paper strip and the spotty reliability of the color- changing mechanism convince me to rate this toy average overall. It’s a great idea, but needs some updates to improve its rating.

title: Very uncomfortable and bruised my shoulder, but decent if you find a better shoulder strap solution. text: 3.5 stars

I use another Skip Hop bag for regular outings, and I LOVE it, but this one looked like it might be a better option for some of our slightly longer outings, like trips to the park or field trips(Adventurous, aren't we?!). ;) Having an insulated spot to keep water cold was appealing, along with being able to wear it messenger style.

After using it, I have to say that I'm a bit disappointed.

First of all, the strap is horribly uncomfortable. I'm amazed that a shoulder pad wasn't included. Depending on how much you put into the bag, it can bruise your shoulder! It did mine. We tried this bag out at the park, during a nature walk. I put a few *mini* bottles of water in there, a few sandwiches, a couple of notebooks, some art supplies, and the other necessities(allergy meds in case a wasp stings my son, phone, keys, lip balm, etc...small stuff). It really hurt to wear! If you use the hand straps, it might not be so bad, but I wanted it for the messenger style feature.

The insulated part is small. I was only able to *stuff* a few mini bottles of water in there. It will only hold one regular sized bottle. You don't have to use it as an insulated spot. It comes with 3 little containers that screw on top of each other. One of them includes a formula cap, which doesn't have to be used and can easily come off. These are great for snacks, and unless you put cheese or something cold in there, it wouldn't have to be insulated. The insulated pocket is rounded for these to fit perfectly in there, though. The top canister has a little handle attached, so it is easy to grab the whole canister set, and move about.

Another feature of this bag is the fact that you can unzip the front to see everything in the bag, and it's not so dark digging around in there. This is a great feature, but make sure when you take advantage of it, you prop something up in front of the bag, so it doesn't tip over. It does so easily, and all your stuff will come falling or rolling out(that isn't zipped in a compartment).

As a regular, everyday bag, this one is on the huge side. My children are now 3 and up, so I don't have a baby, but I wouldn't have wanted to carry a bag this big when I had little ones. For outings, it's decent IF you find an extra shoulder strap solution and pack light. There are lots of little pockets and spaces to put things, and until you get used to it, it'll take you longer to find what you're looking for in all those little hidden away spaces. If you develop a system, though, and remember where things are, it's actually pretty nice to have a specific spot for everything.

Overall, this bag has some nice features, but I'm amazed it was left without shoulder padding. This is really a huge problem for it.

title: A GREAT solution to a real problem- novel concept!! text: This is a great solution for anyone without a dishwasher or separate unit made to sterilize their infant bottles and accessories. These are the type of brainchild products we love to see.. something that gives one a solution to a problem- by utilizing items we have in the home.. The common denominator needed is the microwave and an easy order of these sterilization bags!

These baga allow in reality for five bottles, nipples, neck and spill caps to truly fit into one specialized pouch at a time. The good news is, most infants won’t usually use more than 5 bottles give/take in a day… Allowing sterilization to take place each evening and be ready to fill bottles again for the following day! At least this is what we have found to be true…
I Purchased these for my baby sister who is a first time mom, living in an apartment as a newlywed- and all without a dishwasher! Something she’s has never missed except, when it came to washing and deep cleaning their infant bottles… for someone who lives on a very tight budget, these bags sold for approximately $8- Will give her 180 sterilizations, before needing a new box- that is a deal, a solution.. and peace of mind to her and those who are helping to guide her!!

Do not be intimidated by instructions or the “how to” with this product! The information is broken down into very simple steps and what I appreciate most, each step is accompanied by a simple explanatory picture.. so, one doesn’t even need to know how to read! You can simply follow the instruction photos and do this no problem!!

As for outcome- in reality it’s difficult to say that it’s doing it’s job without a litmus test. However, I can tell you the temperature and physical process alone gives me great confidence. This is a great solution for any who need a way to sterilize baby feeding products. **Hack: when certain baby toys are put in mouth on every occasion- A really good way to sterilize is placing on the top rack of your dishwasher. Any toy without metal, could also be sterilized in these bags… Giving the same results for germ free baby product! I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Contains corn syrup solids text: It’s funny, doctors and nutritionists would freak out if we suggested feeding 7-Up to our nine month old, yet this toddler formula has corn syrup solids as the third ingredient. Why in the world is this necessary? I have had issues with milk supply, and have had to supplement with 1 to 2 bottles per day to make sure my baby got enough food. So many of these brands contain corn syrup, especially the ones for babies who have a sensitive stomach, but I have been using the Enfamil brand of premium formula, which doesn’t contain any corn syrup products at all. So I was disappointed to find that when transitioning my baby to a toddler formula, this same brand expects me to feed him such junky food.

Since I personally avoid corn syrup and a lot of the types of oils that are contained in this formula in my own diet, I fail to see why I’d want to feed my toddler this stuff. I hope this company will take note, and develop some toddler formulas for people like me who would like to avoid feeding her baby unnecessary junky sugars. Lactose is the type of sugar that is in milk. Why not just include lactose?

That said, this stuff does mix up easily, smells better than the premium infant formula I have been using, and doesn’t leave any weird greasy residues. Plus, I’ve yet to find any toddler formulas that don’t contain corn syrup products, so given that, I’m glad this brand does have a product to transition from infant to toddler formula if I find that necessary.

title: Just say no
text: I can’t believe people use this as a toy box. It is so flimsy. I was looking to store sweaters in it since I would not need to access them all year but I could stack them in a way I could see them all by just opening the hinged “door.” This won’t last me very long so it will not stand up to child use. The stitch and loop attached top doesn’t even stay on. You would be better off sticking fabric onto a shipping cardboard box and using that as a toy box. It would last much longer. Definitely not worth the investment.

title: I was skeptical
text: But the little one loves these! We hang them places, she chews on them, throws them around - great toy and has the little nuby texture to help with teething.

title: Great product with amazing smell!
text: The smell is amazing. I love this body wash for the kids when I give them a bubble bath it is very bubbly. You really don't need to use a lot a little goes along way. I recommend this product it is environmentally friendly and we'll priced

title: Huggies Simply Clean Fragrance Free Baby wipes, Refill 600 count text: Love the product, and what a great buy, 600 wipes!!!! These go faster then you think, cleaning dirty bottoms, spit up, and drooly chins.
It is the right thickness to clean effectively and the lack of fragrance, helps not to irritate the baby's skin.

Carolyn G

title: Gentle and unscented, but very watery; odd packaging that causes more issues than solutions text: I'm not all that impressed with this baby shampoo and body wash. On the plus side, it's unscented. There's a bit of a "soapy" scent to it, but it is so faint that it's accurate to call this unscented. It is gentle and has not caused any irritation whatsoever.

On the downside, it's quite watery -- it's almost as thin as water, which makes it harder to use than thicker washes. You also end up having to (or inadvertently) use more than you would with a thicker consistency wash.

The packaging is odd. It's a plastic bottle, but it comes wrapped in a thick cardboard-like shell. Packed inside the shell (if you peel it off) is a package of seeds (Sweet Basil). To my eye this looks like a manufacturer that is trying to focus on packaging waste, but going about it in a "trendy" manner that causes more waste.

I could see the benefit of the cardboard wrapper if the soap was contained in a flexible pouch that uses less plastic than a bottle, but this has the waste of both a conventional (but somewhat thinner) plastic bottle and plastic spout plus the waste of the cardboard. Since the seed package was not mentioned on the label, I'm sure that a lot of the packets get tossed because the customer didn't even know they were there. More waste!

The cost is quite high for such a small amount of watery cleaner. While it's a five star product for the lack of scent, overall formulation, and gentle nature, the watery consistency, poor value, and misguided packaging puts my score at 2.5 stars. It's not something I'd get again.

title: Great Cruisers!
text: These cruisers are perfect for my toddler niece and she seems to have no problems with them at all.  I babysit her often and keep all sorts of diapers, toys and items for her.  When these came up as an I item I could review I jumped on them and am very glad I did.  They work very well and I feel comfortable when she sits on the carpet that there won't be any leakages.

title: Not only a play mat, but a flexible educational toy text: These types of soft play mat are almost a required accessory for those with babies or toddlers, because they spend so much time crawling, rolling, and sitting on the floor playing that it is nice for them to have a softer surface, especially for those of us with hardwood or linoleum floors. I also love it because I have a Summer Infant Pop 'n Play Portable Playard which is a large playpen where the bottom sits directly on the floor, so if you put it down on carpet it is fine, but not so much on linoleum, where if baby trips he can really bonk himself. I appreciate that I can set up this mat in a corner of the kitchen and put his play yard on it to have a softer play surface.

I really like that the colors are simple solid colors that are easy to use for teaching. We can talk about the yellow square, the orange square, and the blue square, and it is helpful for him in learning his colors. The colors are more muted than shown in the photo, which I think is of benefit. It is an attractive set and does not make my home look like a preschool exploded on it.

But what really surprised me about this mat is just how much fun we have had forming 3-D foam cubes and playing with it that way. My son loves picking up the foam cubes we make and carrying them around the room. We also have some lightweight foam building blocks, and my partner has actually started piling those foam building blocks inside of some of the foam cubes we are building with the set, and our toddler is just ecstatic when he figures out how to open up the cube to get his foam building blocks out. He also likes shaking the foam cubes and hearing the blocks rattle around inside. We even built him a little wall for him to hide behind out of foam cubes, and my partner made himself a helmet to wear out of the foam squares, which delighted our baby.

While I thought this would be an item that we would use for a very specific period of time when our son was still a baby or toddler, the fact that you can actually build 3-D foam shapes with this makes me feel that this has the potential to be a flexible educational toy for years to come. I received this item as a sample for review, but I'm so pleased with it that I will certainly be checking out more from this brand.

title: Toddler Undies
text: I bought these for my 2-year-old daughter. She is 23 lbs. and the 2T fits a bit loose on her. I don’t know why these are “boys”, since they are essentially the same color scheme as the “girls”. They’re all blue, pink, yellow, and white. They are sewn the exact same as the girls. They don’t absorb a full on accident, but will stop a tiny leak from getting on their clothes. My daughter loves them.

title: Soft but not much of a scent

This has helped a lot, because she isn't able to flip over her bowl or drop it on the floor.  This suctions to the highchair tray and it stays put until I remove it.  It is also very easy to clean,  because it is dishwasher safe.

title: Handy product to have around.....
text: This is like Vaseline, but a little softer. I like the creaminess of it. I use Vaseline for my children's lips in the winter. They tend to get chapped pretty bad at times. Even though their lips aren't chapped right now, I tried it out on them and all 3 of them liked it for a lip moisturizer. It doesn't take much at all! I also like using it on my feet on occasion, which is the first thing I did with it when this arrived. I just rub it on my foot with a paper towel(or just toilet paper) and then put a sock on. (This comes with 4 containers, so you can keep one container in the bathroom just for feet.) It makes my feet softer and it's relaxing for them. This is a handy product to have around and I've been pleased with the Solimo brand so far. This ointment is no exception.

They are leak proof unless your toddler hurls them at the ground then a little may splatter out. They are a lifesaver when teaching your little how to tip back for drinking out of a cup without dumping it all over themselves/the floor/the chair.

We will be keeping this in our car and only using when we are out and about. Seems like the material will hold up well and we'll use this for years to come since there is room to grow (our daughter is 10 months old).

These are really cute because of the variety of colors that they come in. You can match them to so many different outfit combinations and it adds just a tiny touch of extra flair. The hanging hook is a great idea... the tub has a place to dry without dripping water on the floor or any other place you might store it. Also, the toys are fun... My 7 month old niece loved them. title: BPA-Free airtight plastic storage for milk powder or other foodstuffs; dishwasher safe text: This is an airtight plastic storage container for milk powder / baby formula. The enclosed scoop holds about two teaspoons--it does have a tiny hole on the bottom of the scoop. The scoop can be seated on the inside cover as shown in my photo. I personally love the handle on this because it makes it good for traveling.

The little tiny "shelf" or scraper can be removed if desired. This is normally used to level the scoop. Note that this is BPA-free and dishwasher safe. I do not use the dishwasher, so I cannot vouch for that.

This works as designed and can be used to store more than baby formula, such as loose leaf teas, coffee (of course hole in scoop may be a problem), snacks of nuts or dried fruit, etc. Since there is a hole in the scoop, some formula will fall through and that is to be expected. The current price of $11.68 ($12.98 minus 10%) seems on the high side of competitively priced for this.

The instructions are perfect and it is a quality unit.  The color(brown), matches the existing railing so we'll, it looks as if it was there all along.  Would definitely recommend!

title: Great size, piano adjustment is easily broken
text: This is a great size for a playmat that provides ample room for tummy time. There are QR codes that link you to a video guide for assembly, as well as an instruction booklet inside the package. There are packing instructions on the box, which means they make sure you get all the required parts. The loops attach to the mat via Velcro and slide through an attached loop on one of the hoop arms (I missed this and thought I didn't get it, it just slid to the bottom of the arm). It comes with four visual and noise making teethers that have plastic hooks to attach to the arms. The piano needs AA batteries to run and connects to the mat via the fabric hooks. The piano mounting mechanism is one flaw that is easily broken. There is a small plastic piece that is supposed to lock into the multiple angle positions. If you force it at all it snaps and then will glide freely between the positions without locking. I did this on one side, luckily not the other. So it still mostly works in each of the angle positions. Otherwise this has good built quality and is cute. Excited for my newborn to start playing with it.

title: Hard pass!
text: Quite possibly the worst thing I've gotten from Amazon and a complete failure for my son.  We have a standard toilet that came with the house and is only 2 years old and this thing doesn't fit in the slightest.  First, the legs are too short so that the stair is practically under the bowl.  Then there is the issue that the step is too narrow as well and makes it impossible to turn and sit down.  So pretty much the only usable part we had was the handles, but then that becomes useless as it keeps my son sitting upright or slightly leaned back so he pees right over the teeny tiny lip onto the bathroom floor.  Highly recommend you avoid this product if you have a normal sized toilet or a boy.

title: Perfect travel bag
text: This bag is cute and a nice size to shove into a backpack. I've used it on a camping trip and tossed it in the wash after. I think it could be useful as a "laundry" bag while traveling to store dirty clothes as well, which is a step up from my usual plastic grocery bag.

title: Favorite sleep sacks!
text: Favorite sleep sacks. Easy for kids to wear, warm, soft, safe.

title: Reliable, secure, no-wifi required monitor text: I was looking for a monitor that explicitly did not connect to the Internet - Most companies making these cameras have little experience in keeping customer data secure, and the number of times I've seen monitor images leak onto the Internet over the years made me steer clear of those. Besides, 99% of the time, if I want to use the monitor I'm in the house.

The DXR-8 does not require wi-fi or an Internet connection, and provides a secure digital link between the camera and the monitor. Great.

We've been using this monitor since our son was born, now over 2 years, and it's been in constant use without issue - The picture/sound is everything we need at night or day, the pan/tilt feature of the camera works well and is silent. The battery life on the monitor is also good; certainly enough for an evening.

After 2+ years of 365 day/year use the USB charging socket on the monitor developed a fault, but Infant Optics kindly offered to replace it free of charge, even though it's outside warranty - Their customer service is outstanding and the turnaround was swift.

In short, if you're looking for a non-Internet baby monitor, this is it. I've bought 3 or 4 as gifts over the last couple of years so prevent friends having to make the same decision ;-)

title: Boppy Cover
text: A boppy is a necessary baby item and it is well advised to have a few covers. Because you know what babies do on feeding pillows? They spit up on them. This minky cover is super soft and adorable. It has a different fabric on each side, not inside out each side, but top and bottom each side. Zipper works well. The only problem with minky is that it isn't super absorbent when it comes to spit-up, but that does keep the boppy pillow itself from getting soiled.

title: Saves your wall

title: The best mobile - nothing compares.
text: This is so cute, you almost wish you were a baby!  The plush animals are so well made and detailed;  it's difficult to choose the one you like best.  The leaves glow as they rotate, and, along with the stars on the ceiling, and the moon, that's almost enough right there to lull baby to sleep.  The tunes are clear and soft - my personal favorite is Brahm's Lullaby.  Again, these things alone would make you want to buy this.  But, add the remote control, which enables you to turn the mobile on and off without entering the room and disturbing the baby.  I like the fact that the control panel can be either inside or outside the crib.  Have I forgotten anything?  The nature sounds...again, it's difficult to choose which is more soothing, but the baby will make that choice.  I can imagine this mobile keeping a baby occupied for a good long time, or encouraging sleep when baby is ready.  This is, hands down, the best mobile I've seen, and I've spent time shopping around for the little one due in November.  I'll amend this review when my great grandson is ready to give his review!

title: Great for storage text: These things help save time (which is much needed since it takes a while to pump). I use the liners to pump to store for other feedings and to freeze. To freeze a stash I used someones advice on here to freeze the liner with the rings on.Once frozen I put that liner (and any others from that day that are froze) intoa freezer bag without the rings. This way I can store a stash without using a ton of rings.

A tip with this method: If your milk freezes and you cannot get the collar down,pinch the top of the liner and come from the top. I froze a couple and though I had to just defrost and use right away since I couldnt get the collar off. Once I became rested enough, I realized that I should just take it off the other direction :)

One other tip. Use the walmart brand liners. I tried Playtex, Target and Walmart. Not only are the walmart brand ones the cheapest, but they are the most sturdy! I am able to put the liner with no bottle attached upright with any amount of milk in it. I had problems with the other ones if there was only a little milk in them. The bottom of the walmart liners appears harder which might be the reason why they can support themselves better.

title: Best white noise machine for babies and toddlers!

I love that it has an infinity feature because our daughter wakes up when it shuts off. Almost every other white noise machine we looked at only had 30-90 min of play time before it auto shut off. It even helps me when I have boughts of insomnia.

title: The only option that made sense to me at the time text: I wanted to buy one bed, not seveal progressivly larger beds. Expensive

title: microwave safe
text: I love it! The thickness is great, I love that when the kid is trying to fork or spoon the bowl and plate aren't moving around. They can go in the dishwasher and microwave. yay!

title: Works well; nice display; easy to use text: I'm pleased with this baby scale, especially due to the display. It's not the largest out there, but it's decently large and quite clear -- perfect for grandparent-age eyes. No need to squint at all.

The overall build quality is good. It feels substantial and sturdy, and the baby cradle is removable so that, down the road, the scale can be used for other purposes. However, while the display is excellent for when you're looking at it up close (e.g., using it as a baby scale), it's not great for older eyes should you stand on it and look down (e.g., using it as a conventional scale). It's nice that it has versatility, but I'd consider this mainly as a baby scale and not an adult bathroom scale.

Operation is straightforward and doesn't require referring back to a user guide to figure out how to work it. All in all, it's a good choice not only for parents, but also grandparents who are helping out.

title: We switched from Pampers because the Huggie's price was better and you got more for your money
text: We switched from Pampers because the Huggie's price was better and you got more for your money. However I was not impressed with the product performance. In 4 months of using Pampers we might have had one or two leaks. With the Huggies (in only one month of use) the leaks have been frequent, which means dealing frequent outfit changes throughout the day. The diaper itself was bulkier too. We've moved on to try another cost effective brand.

title: Best natural sunscreen that actually works! text: UPDATE 6/29/18--

The babyganics is still my tride and true sunscreen but will note the spray sunscreen is now my favorite. My kids are now 4yo and 6yo and we just got back from Florida and my fair skinned children were the only ones that didn't burn. I will note that I don't use this on myself anymore except on my legs as the formula will break out a teenage or an adult but works great on my small kids. We also use Babyganics stick for the kids faces. If you don't want your kids getting burned and something more natural, this is the stuff for you!

UPDATE 11/4/2016--

We used this sunscreen all summer again on my two fair headed children as did I. We went Florida and as long as we were wearing this, we didn't burn at all. Does leave white marks if not rubbed in good enough. Note, you won't get much tan as this stuff really does the job. Also, they make a spray version of this that I actually love better for those touch ups. This version is thicker than that but both work nicely if you don't want a burn.

Favorite Sunscreen for the kids! My kids have super sensitive skin and I also like to use more natural and eco-friendly products so this fit the bill. I was really hesistant as I've tried other natural sunscreens and haven't had as good luck, they either break out my kids, leavy a greasy film or just don't really block the sun. I even use this on myself when we go to the pool now. It really does block the sun. My friend and I went to the pool and we lotioned are kids up around the same time and hers managed to get sun where mine didn't get burned at all (might I add both my kids are extemely fair skinned with one of them being a red head). I am very pleased with this product and would totally recommend this to anyone ane everyone.

text: This floor “mat” is super cute, but I have to be honest in that there’s nothing about it that's similar to cushioned mat. It’s simply a lightly filled blanket with an attached pillow case that rolls up and is portable with the attached clips to keep it all in place. It’s perfect for my preschooler to snuggle up on the floor and watch a movie, but it’s not exactly cushioned in the way a mat would be. It’s definitely overpriced for a blanket with a pillow attached. I really love the look of it though and it's cozy. I also washed it before use (I removed the pillow inside first), and it came out great.  If a thin memory foam layer or extra padding were on the bottom portion, I would have given this a higher score.

title: Fun for babies text: My daughter is in this as I write this. It is a great toy for the kids because it entertains them and gives me a minute to do something without holding the baby... like eat or go to the bathroom. My daughter seems to like it.... she'll stay in it content for a while. You're not supposed to keep your little ones in these things for hours and hours, but we keep her in for a few minutes here and there when I just need some time and it really is great.

It has a lot of little toys. Everywhere she turns, something moves. It's very interactive, which she likes and which is good for her. It is bright and colorful and would work for a boy or a girl. The seat is adjustable so it can grow with them. Of course they don't spend years and years with a toy like this but for how much they use it while they can, I think it is well worth the money. In fact, we keep two similar things - one for each main room of the house.

It worked okay and felt well made. I would recommend it.

I tried it and it left my teeth feeling smooth. The xylitol may be objectionable to some and makes the wipes excessively sweet, at least to an adult palate. Babies and toddlers enjoy the sweetness. In addition to infant use, these are an option for the elderly and infirm. They are a definite convenience, easy to use and effective.

It never made it past me because I didn't feel it washed clean of my skin and the ingredients looked questionable.

Ingredients: Water (aqua purificata) purified, PEG-80 sorbitan laurate, Cocamidopropyl betaine, Sodium trideceth sulfate, Guar hydroxypropyltrimonium chloride,PEG-150 distearate,PPG-2 hydroxyethyl cocamide,PEG-16 macadamia glycerides, Benzyl alcohol, PPG-26 buteth 26, PEG-40 hydrogenated castor oil, Extracts of anthemis nobilis (chamomile), Avena sativa (oat kernel), Calendula officinalis (marigold), Methylisothiazolinone,Fragrance.

title: Does not slip much, lightweight pad is soft and not very noisy
text: Much lighter than the vinyl type bed pads we used for Mom and Dad or the baby's changing table, this embossed pad is very suitable to place between the mattress and the sheet in the Pack and Play.  Where the embossing is done, the thickness is very thin, but this is because the light fleece in applied with a seal.  Think of how a vacuum sealer flattens the two layers of plastic bags when sealed and you can get an idea of the dots that make the embossing on this pad.  I have no problem with this, but do find that if your baby is like the Princess who is disturbed by the pea, this may be bothersome as she tries to sleep.  For playing, I don't think she would be bothered.  Since most babies are not like that storybook princess, I think that this pad is a nice addition to help maintain the mattress.  This can be machine washed in cold water and dried on low temperature but I do not dry mine since in my experience, that reduces the effectiveness of the waterproof ability.  The circumference of this pad is finished with a machine done overlock stitch.

title: Waste text: My daughter has sensitive and dry skin, as well as allergy-induced eczema. I'd heard that calendula cream was the best for all of these conditions, so I purchased this product expecting great results.

Boy, was I disappointed. I didn't notice any difference in her skin, even after applying it to her entire body. And the smell...it wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't pleasant.

And my daughter didn't it like it either. I don't know if it was the smell or how it felt on her skin, but she hated when I put it on her and was extremely cranky afterwards.

Needless to say, I have a full container just sitting in her room and I wasted all that money. Luckily, I found something that DID work and we will just stick with that.

title: Excellent hollow pacifiers with caps for self feeding text: These "self-feeding" food-grade silicone pacifiers are excellent. There are two of these. This is good for an infant between 4 to 7 months old.

It is important to supervise when the baby is using this as it is with any other item. This is not rated for dried or preserved fruit as that can cause bigger holes in the pacifier or cause the baby to choke. 

The current price of $12.99 comes to $6.50 each.

title: Beware misinformation text: I have not actually purchased or used one of these; I just feel the need to respond to one reviewer‘s assertion that the location that you choose on the forehead naturally makes a difference in the temperature reading. Based on the reviews I’ve read and the video I’ve watched, that is the case with this thermometer, but that does not indicate a temperature variance from one spot on the forehead to another, but a wild fluctuation in the readings that this thermometer is giving. I have a no-touch body temperature thermometer of a different brand that I’ve had for the better part of a year and found to be pretty accurate and I just now used it to measure the temperature at six different spots across my forehead, from the center to the temples and at different distances, and every single one read 98.5°. If your thermometer is giving you different temperature readings based on where you’re pointing it on the forehead, that’s not a problem with how you’re using the thermometer – that’s a problem with the thermometer. It’s just not accurate or consistent in its readings.

I had only to read a few of these reviews and see that video of the woman measuring her child’s temperature at different points across her forehead to know perfectly well that this thermometer is junk and not at all to be relied upon to give an accurate reading.

title: Kids love it text: This is an excellent, sturdy cot for children, from toddler age to early elementary-school age. It is surprisingly lightweight, making it easy to store lengthwise in a closet to get it out of the way. I got this cot through Vine, and the one I received is blue, assembled, no castors (wheels), and standard size 23" x 52" which is about 2 ft x 4 ft 4 in. This should be long enough for most children even up to age 7 or 8. It holds up to 75 pounds.

The cot has steel poles, making it very strong. The bed portion is made of stretch-resistant fabric which is a kind of meash. It is very easy to clean. The bed is only a few inches off the ground, so there is no worry about a child falling out of bed and getting injured.

If you get a cot without castors, which is the type I got, the holes on the bottom of the cot which are made to insert castors will go unfilled. To be safe, in order to prevent my 18-month-old granddaughter from putting her finger in any of the holes and getting hurt, I put duct tape over the holes to seal them off. For someone buying the cot, I recommend choosing the option of the cot with castors, and the problem won't arrise.

This product is stated as being "certified for reducing chemical pollutants." Be that as it may, this product does outgas, and I suggest leaving it outside (hopefully out of the rain, though that probably wouldn't hurt it) to air out for a few days.

All in all, this is a product that is both practical and a lot of fun. My 18-month-old granddaughter loves playing on it and sleeping on it.

title: He LOVED it immediately
text: Grandma and Grandpa got this for my little guy for Christmas when he was just starting to pull up at around 6.5 m old. He LOVED it immediately. There are lots of things to spin, shake, sort and listen to on the front panel. The wheels lock so it doesn't fly out from under early walkers, and can be released to roll freely for those more confident tikes. It really did help him with his balance, and eventually he was able to weave in and out of obstacles with this. I think it helped him walk a little better early on, and now that he is running everywhere I have retired it to the attic because he has other toys that are stationary that do the same types of things this one does. He took the little barn door off and loved to chew on that thing, it may have been his favorite part. And the phone rattle. So cute! All in all this was a good purchase and very durable. It has good resale value too for you folks that do that at consignment sales or local resale pages. I have picked several up at thrift shops and resold them for around 10-12 each if all parts are included!

title: Bottle / Handle combination - Handles are also sold separately text: By the look of the pictures, with the blue lines going down, you might think that this bottle has straws. It does not. The lines are just part of the “artwork”.

This is both the bottle and handle combination. You can purchase the handles separately, if you already bottles. The silicone handles can also be used for teething. The handle can be removed and used on other, similar, Dr. Brown’s bottles. The spout is also silicone.

Though it doesn’t show in the pictures, there are measurements on the back of the bottle.

The bottle / handle is dishwasher and sterilizer safe. It’s also BPA-free.

Made in China.

title: Takes elbow grease to put together but this is simple and nice; requires 2 AA batteries NOT included text: [[VIDEOID:8dee0cb540c1ff4b614b40c2b19f90fd]] I ordered this for a friend's son's baby. It comes in six pieces. I found the rods difficult to snap together as it takes a bit of elbow grease to secure them in their tracks. In fact, it depends on the desired height as to whether the center arm needs to be installed or not. Although there is no manual that says this, it appears it can be left off.

I decided to install everything. I also had to put in two AA batteries (NOT included) into the music box. A Phillips screwdriver is needed to install the batteries. The plush toys hang from the hook on the music box. The box plays 35 lullabies. There are only four controls on the unit -- ON/OFF, M for the rotation of the motor and play list, and the increase and decrease volume (which is also used to move to the next song). A long press of the M button starts and stops the rotation; a short press plays a single cycle and two presses sets the list cycle play mode.

At the current price of $18.99 ($19.99 minus 5%), this is a nice mobile. The instructions are lacking, so I do not consider this giftable unless one attaches a copy of the operation instruction card on the Amazon site. However, it is a nice, simple set that takes elbow grease to install but works perfectly when it is all put together.

title: SAFE for BABIES - GREAT for SENSITIVE SKIN text: This all natural lotion is thicker than many lotions which makes it require more time and effort to work into the skin, but in turn the moisturizing properties stay within the skin longer.

This product is all natural and plant based. The lavender essential oil within the lotion provides a great scent that is not over powering but pleasant. In addition the therapeutic grade chamomile and calendula essential oils soothes and nourishes the skin.

Parasol obviously carefully chose the ingredients in this lotion in an effort to avoid those which cause the most reactions leaving an amazing, moisturizing lotion.

This is a great lotion for babies or for anyone with sensitive skin.

⭐️As with all Drew’s Reviews, if I discover something new about this product - good or bad - I will UPDATE my review. I believe in creating detailed, unbiased, complete reviews because, like you, I depend on reviews when I am shopping. If you found this review HELPFUL - please click ⬇️ below, to let me know!⭐️

title: Buy an exersaucer instead, it'll last longer
text: We bought this for our second child, wanting to give him a new stand-up entertainment area rather than the exersaucer we had with our firstborn. It failed to meet my expectations. Until he was 9 months old he didn't fit in it properly, we had to put a large, firm, pillow under it just for his feet to touch something (he's average weight & height). He liked the toys and music fine but he couldn't really bounce yet. Once he was 9 months old he was already crawling everywhere and pulling himself up so he hated being restrained and never stayed in it more than 5 minutes. My first child was in an exersaucer at 4 or 5 months and loved it until 13 months (plus, he used a door jumper that he adored). This jumper with my second kid was unsuccessful. They need to like the toy enough before they start crawling to continue wanting to be in it later, which wasn't the case for our son. If you're looking for something to hold your child's attention and last the majority of the time he's a baby, I'd go with an exersaucer, not a jumper.

title: Great for fitting 3 Across text: We were needing to fit 3 car seats across the back seat of our mini-van. We bought 2 of these Evenflo AMP boosters to use with one of our [[ASIN:B009NMO5CK Diono Radian R100 Convertible Car Seat Booster, Shadow]]. These fit perfectly with the middle car seat rear-facing or forward facing. The issue then became the lower seat belt. Because we had three across, it was very difficult for an adult to buckle the booster seats and impossible for a child since the belt buckle was lower than the level of the seat. We bought two seatbelt extenders and problem solved.

I'm not impressed with the quality of these seats. The covers are okay. The cup holders are genius- they are small and out of the way, but easily usable when needed. These seats require assembly, which is not something that made me feel very comfortable. Seems like there is too high of a risk of user error for something so important. The plastic of the back seems very flimsy. Maybe it is because I am not used to these lower end seats, but I was not impressed. However, they do fit in my vehicle and they do properly position the seat belts on both of my boostered children. (7 year old; 48"; 50 lbs. and 5 year old; 42"; 42 lbs.)

title: Cause irritation to front area that was in contact with "cool" text: I had to return these due to them causing terrible irritation to the penis. These turned my son cherry red. He has no known allergies or sensitivities. They do feel "cool" after urination, as gross as it may be I felt the area. It is the exact area that came into contact with his parts...also it did not go away after removing the pull up and is still red hours later. We use Pull-Ups already so it is the cooling ones causing issue.
The design is cute and he loves Mickey so he was excited to put these "undies" on, I recommend just buying some regular toddler cotton Mickey undies. You can use cloth diaper inserts also if you are worried about them peeing through.
If you have a kiddo that is sensitive please skip these!! My tot has none and yet these cause issue.

I could only fit a couple prefolds, one diaper cover, one outfit change, a small wipe container, one paci, and one wooden ring inside. Plus the phone pocket held my phone. title: Overall a nice wearable blanket
text: I’m overall happy with this Burt’s Bees Wearable Blanket. I purchased it for my Niece. I purchased a medium by going to the Burt’s Bees website as there’s no sizing chart offered in the description. There’s plenty of leg room & I expect the blanket will be used long-term. The design was spot on. The material is soft. It’s not heavy, it’s thinner than I thought it would be though. Not as thin as a bed sheet. I expected it to have more thickness to it since it’s described as a “blanket” & “sleeping bag.” She lives in FL so I’m not too concerned about the baby not being warm. It’s unfortunate the zipper design is from the top to the bottom. If changing a diaper in the middle of the night it takes the warmth off the baby by having to zip it down rather than just zipping it up a bit to get to the diaper. The zipper is of good quality though. The material also bothered me as it’s advertised as 100% cotton but the fill is 100% polyester. Yes this is Burt’s Bees a brand loved & trusted. Why not make it fully 100% cotton. I recommend being aware of why I gave a 4 star rating.

title: Have a hand rail? Have baseboards? Read this.
text: Do you have a hand rail? Read this. This product is okay. There are specific parameters that need to be met in order for this to make sense in your situation. This isn't evident or obvious from the description nor the unrelatable imagery used by the seller. Essentially, you will want to have aprox 3 inches of flat and clear wall space, extending from the floor to ~3 feet high, at the top of your steps. Three significant considerations: 1. If you have a baseboard, especially one that might trail your steps and meet at the top of the steps at an angle, you might have a difficult install. 2. If your banister encroaches on the 3 inch area, you will have a difficult install. 3. If you do not have a stud at the install site, you will find the product to be of questionable sturdiness.  4. If you transition from wood to carpet between the stairs and the floor/landing, the support-foot (visible in only one picture, but necessary for the install), will prevent/impede the gate's swing action. I encountered all four of these issues in my installation, and would not buy or install this product again. What appeared to be a simple and straight forward install rapidly became an involved project to trim a banaster, extend the baseboard, reinforce the installation site, and make adjustments due to wood-to-carpet transition between steps and top landing. In the proper install site, I can easily see a better appreciation for this product. However, as advertised, this is not a simple solution for just any household.

title: A very versatile car seat

title: Best thing for Bi-fold doors text: I have cats that will not stay out of my closets. I went on a hunt, to find a way to lock bi-fold closet does. I wanted something that would be easy to use, simple to install and that worked. After trying velcro closures and above the door slides, I stumbled upon these childproof locks—hard plastic, peel and stick, with a latch connector.
I stuck them over the spot were the doors fold out. Waited a full 24 hours to insure that the adhesive set. Six months later they’re still attached, working great, and my closets are free of intrusive cats.

title: Works for fur babies too
text: I need to find a way to keep my fur baby dry now that he is getting up there in years . I found dog diapers on amazon and they looked just like reg baby diapers but worn like a skirt instead of how you put it on a baby . I figured for the price I’d be better off buying these in sz 4 and they worked so well !! They keep my lil dude dry and he can walk around without any issues. It’s so much better than using puppy pads for him to lay on . These work great on my 12 lb dog . I think a sz 5 would work too . He’s built like a little tank . These have the line on them that let me know when he is wet . They smell really good too ! I used these for my kids when they were babies . Still great quality for a great price . I’m super happy with how well they absorb pee . My little old man dog was stinky and needed a bath daily when I was using puppy pads under him to keep him dry but it was not working very well . These keep him dry and he’s not stinky like he’s making Jenkum . Now I can use just the diaper and a fabric Welping pad to keep him comfortable, clean and dry . It’s his golden years right now and quality of life is the most important factor right now . I think it’s cute that my dog is wearing his little diaper wrap that has a bunch of dogs printed on it (paw patrol )  . In my experience these work great on both fur babies and real babies !

title: Great Set, Best Purchased Separate Though text: As someone with sensitive skin, I sometimes have to resort to baby lotions and other products to not only take care of my skin, but other problems as well.

This is a GREAT little gift set with full size products. Each only is individually packaged in this set.

The baby lotion is a bit thin, though not “runny”. It is smooth, lightly scented, and definitely moisturizes. I loved it SO much, I bought another tube. And, at the time it was about $6. That’s a pretty decent value for a name brand such as this.

The rash cream is something that we use sparingly in the home. And, yes … even adults need a cream like this due to high PH in the urine as well as during that time of month if they use pads. According to E! Online, it even helps with razor burn on legs or other areas.

This cream is a medium consistency. It isn’t oily, greasy, runny, or thick. And, a little does the job.

The vitamin cream works on mildly dry hands, but is suitable for the whole family.

In short – this really works for the ENTIRE household.

As far as the price? This set is currently listed at $18.50. The products here on Amazon run about $5.94-$5.99 each, so if you’re looking to shave a few cents off – no pun intended – I’d get them individually.

title: Cloth Diapers
text: I did not buy these to use as burp cloths. I bought these to use as cloth diapers. They are essentially a 28” square receiving blanket folded in half and sewn with the reinforced middle, like a prefold diaper. The width is similar to a size medium red edge prefold, but they are much longer. I just fold the rise down, so it isn’t an issue. The edges are serged, so they do show wash and wear a little more than a nicely finished edge, but about the same as my other prefolds. They do not fluff up like a typical prefold. They stay pretty trim, like a flat. I imagine I’ll switch to using them as doublers when my baby gets a bit bigger, but at 8 weeks old, these are plenty absorbant enough for now. A snappi will hold, but you have to actually try to hook the fabric. You can’t just touch it to the fabric and have it hold. The cotton fabric has been perfect against baby’s skin.

title: Our son loves this!
text: Just bought our second one after two years. The motor that runs the fish around the aquarium gave out. After two years, using it on average twice a day for nap time and bedtime, I'd say we got our money's worth. Some people may think the sound is too loud even on the low setting but I disagree. We use it on the loudest setting and it works just fine for our kid. It seems loud to us but works great to cover up TV sounds and voices from other rooms.

title: Made in China. Overpriced. Nice but a couple of issues. Not completely spill proof. text: It’s a cute little 6 oz cup with handles as well as a lid and straw, all made of silicone. The lid does not screw on. You just press the lid down or pull it off. As your toddler grows, you can stop using the lid and it becomes a comfortable drinking cup.
Two minor cons:
1. There is one confusing thing I haven’t figured out how to solve it. When I put the lid along with the straw on, it always force a little liquid out through the straw. The reason is because there is air inside the cup, and as you press down, you are forcing the air down, therefore it is forcing the liquid somewhere, causing it to go up the straw.
2. My toddler is used to straws but wasn’t drinking from it. I decided to try it and discovered that if I try to drink with the straw touching the bottom, it is like a vacuum seal, like trying to suck a thick milkshake through a straw. You have to lift the straw up slightly to be able to drink it.

Another thing to consider, it is not exactly leak proof. My toddler would tip it over. Sometimes there is a small drip leak near the straw, sometimes not.

Other than that, it is a great toddler cup!

Made in China. At the current price of sixteen bucks it's crazy overpriced.

title: it doesn't close well and can just pop up open easily. It's smaller than the fill size one but ...

title: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! text: AMAZING!! I have this on subscribe and save and just tried this for the first time last month ( April). My son has never had an issue with diaper rash but every so often he gets it and man is it awful. This cream is amazing at stopping and clearing it up. It also is amazing to use with each diaper change to ward off moisture and prevent rash. It smells amazing also. He has no known allergies so we have had no issues with this cream.
It is in a metal tube just so you know, I didn't realize it and it can be hard to get all the paste out as it doesn't bend and squeeze easy. So make sure to squeeze from the bottom always and roll it up as you go.
We have used every brand of conventional creams that are available at walgreens and places. I usually just toss the tube somewhere and say "well let's try another one" because he only gets a rash maybe once a month if even it is bad when he does, when I wandered onto this cream here on amazon I figured there was nothing to lose so....now I will order multiples each month.
Amazing cream, rash gone in hours and excellent moisture barrier with regular diaper changes.

title: Good - Not Great. text: This watch comes with basically no instructions - just directs you to a website video.
The watch isn’t the easiest to use - there is just the one side button and a short press works differently than a long press.
My biggest issue with the watch is that the time is not constantly displayed. You have to press the side button to display the time.
Another issue I have with this watch is there is no default on alarm. So without going through all of the steps, there is no alarms that go off. I would like it i I was able to set the time and then just let it go, then change the alarm settings after that.
The watch band fits an adult - it’s much bigger than it needs to be and it leaves the wrist a little sweaty.
The watch it well made and the band is well designed.
The band buckle is easy to use.
I really like that the watch allows you to easily see how much battery life is left.
I also like that the alarm doesn’t go off if the watch is not on the wrist.

**If you found this review helpful, please click the ‘Helpful’ button below.

title: ... properly carry our little on in the carrier with good support. I can't believe they don't just come ...
text: This worked perfectly so we could properly carry our little on in the carrier with good support. I can't believe they don't just come with the carrier to begin with, because without this, the carrier does not provide knee-to-knee support, which is essential. So, if you have the Britax soft baby carrier, you need this! It'll provide much more comfort, and proper stabilization and bone support to your little one.

title: nice assortment of ingredients, good flavor text: For the more sophisticated babies among us, haha. I kid because I never see anything like this in stores. Ever. These are some fancy flavors, and I think it is really neat to see flavor options beyond the usual bland. Opens up a diversity of flavors, and may be more appealing (and yes, inclusive) to parents that work with these foods as part of their own cuisine. I love this. Thank you.

Probably better to work it in a little at time, or mask the stronger flavors with something that they already like. Or it could be they love it at the start.

So it comes down to preference because the quality seems great. I tried a couple of varieties, and I am impressed with how robust the flavors are, and how I can pick out each flavor; ie I can taste the curry, I can pick up on the mango, celery, etc. If your kiddo (6+ months) doesnt like it, then eat it yourself. Add to a smoothie, or squeeze into some broth or over rice, or in a burrito, etc. Or eat direct from package, use it as a quick snack on drive home. Stuff like that. None going to waste here! Acquired 06/2022 with best by date of 12/2022.

title: Delightful carrier that adjusts to baby's size and temperament!

title: Maybe your baby's like mine and goes back to it later text: My baby is exclusively breast fed and would not take to the bottle at all. I bought a bunch of these bottles based on the reviews, but it was unsuccessful...at 2-3 months. Baby is now 6 months and has been drinking from this bottle or Dr. Browns (albeit very slowly). I bought all of the different flow nipples, but ultimately ended up cutting a bigger slit to help the milk flow (it's very slow otherwise).
If you buy this and it doesn't work, hold on to it and try again later. Who knows? Maybe your baby's like mine and goes back to it later.

title: Fabulous stroller -- easy to put together, easy to collapse, and very sturdy!
text: Looks great.  This was super easy to put together -- five minutes tops and no tools required (although an Allen wrench was included, in case you want to make sure everything is extra secure).  The seat sits up much higher than a traditional stroller, so you don't have to bend over so far to reach the baby  The seat reclines and the recline is easy to adjust by just pulling a string.  Seems sturdy.  High quality Kenda tires -- common on dirt bikes and scooters.  Folds up easily. There is a carrying basket/pouch under the seat.  There's no place for holding a water bottle --  although handle bar accessories are available -- lots of accessories are available for separate purchase, to customize this stroller exactly as you want it to be!

title: Has removable parts that can be swallowed – use with extreme supervision – 2.5 stars text: There are three silicone toothbrush heads in this package with a base body that comes in three pieces. The dinosaur base comes off, the head comes off, and the toothbrush tip on the other side of the head comes off. In total there are six pieces. Although this is a toothbrush for ages 3, 9, and 18 months with a dinosaur storage base, I do not like that the brush can be pulled from the brush handle with the possibility of swallowing it. A parent must use extreme supervision if using this especially since this unit is so engaging. This is just my opinion anyway.

This is made in China. The current price of $17.09 ($18.99 minus 10%) is also on the high side of competitively priced for this.

title: Ergo at 1/4 the price
text: I tried several types of carriers when I had my second baby, including the Moby, Sleepytime, and K'tan. I didn't like any of them, so I thought we'd never be able to find one that worked. I took a chance on this one once my little one could hold up his head, and it was the best $30 I've ever spent. It's pretty comfortable for both of us, even when he's now 21 pounds. We started using it around 12 pounds (though the product says 16+) and didn't have any problems with the front carry. One thing I really like about this design is it is ergonomically supportive for baby's groin, unlike some of the other carriers, that separate the joints too much for comfort. That could potentially impact proper development if you wear your baby a lot. I wore mine most of the time until he started walking. It's comfortable for plus-size. I think the belt goes up to 50" or 52". You can wear it around your hips or waist. This is like a generic Ergo. Not quite as fancy, but works pretty well. I tried out a friend's and found them comparable, with this being $100 less. The downsides: I gave this four stars because-- You can't put this on by yourself unless you're a 90-pound gymnast. It works fine for larger frames, but you're going to always need someone to buckle the strap on the back if you wear him/her on the front, or help settle the baby in the back-carry position. Baby can only face against you, so he can't turn to look out as well as he can in some carriers. I never could get the side-carry position to work. The carrier just didn't seem stable enough that way.

title: The app is a nice feature
text: First of all, I like the fact that this item is not “crib specific”.  It’s not too large, so it’s out-of-the-way.  It’s a very interesting concept to have an “app”.  Though I don’t always like the fact that every single thing you buy these days has to have an app. . .in this case it’s actually a nice feature.  For example, if you hear your baby through a baby monitor, you can turn the mobile on.  It has a light. . . it has movement.  .it has music. . . it has projection.  . It’s really an all-around  nice mobile suited for both boys and girls.

title: Great booster for 2yo + text: I am so happy with this booster seat!
It says ages 3 and up but my 2 year old uses this with no problem.
I love that the sides are raised from the seat because it keeps the kids from trying to “ride side saddle” in their chairs.
The bottom of the seat has grippers to keep the seat from sliding. I didn’t have any movement on my chair.
The lock for the cord is easy to use and does a great job. Much better than the old style clips. It looks clean and is easier to clean.
It can be a little tough to remove- I ended up loosing the cord and then was able to turn the knob easier to get it off. But I think it made me feel like the seat is that much more secure.
There is a hook for the remaining cord that keeps it out of sight which is great.
The blue color is very pleasant and isn’t too babyish or gender specific.
I wouldn’t take this booster on the airplane to travel with but if you were taking a car trip to a destination it could be good for traveling with.

title: Cute way to avoid a big mess text: Like any toddler, mine is at the "I do this myself" phase. This means I don't feed him anymore, but he wants to sit like anyone else, not in a high chair. This means I am usually cleaning up a mess from him either not paying attention, spilling the bowl etc. I have tried regular place mats but the food usually misses it as he likes to hold the bowl.

This however is different. It's a silicone bowl/plate that is attached to the place mat. It's heavier than you would expect, but that holds it in place on the table. The place mat catches most of the food and the bowl can't be picked up from it, so he actually leaves it there while he eats. However, be sure you serve once it's already in place instead of carrying it to the table. It's awkward to try and hold when it's full of food.

It goes through the dishwasher fine, I usually put it on the bottom rack along with everything else and it comes out clean and ready to go.

*I RECEIVED THIS PRODUCT (IN ORDER TO TRY IT AND REVIEW) THIS DOES NOT GUARANTEE A GOOD REVIEW OR CHANGE MY OPINION ON THE PRODUCT, I AM HONEST AND UNBIASED, ALL OPINIONS ON IT ARE MY OWN AND BASED ON THE PRODUCT ITSELF. I HAVE TRIED THIS AND EVALUATED IT ACCORDINGLY

title: Durable, endless uses text: The Miniware Silipods are adorable containers, and great for kids and adults. I was looking for small containers to take salad dressing and other condiments on the go. I didn’t want one-use plastic containers, so for me, the Silipods are great.

The containers are dishwasher safe, freezer safe, and steamer safe. The box also says they are microwave safe! The silicone seems indestructible, so bar some crazy microwave incident, I think these will last for several years.

The lids fit well, though they do pop off if the containers are squeezed. So I would be careful if putting the Silipods into a purse or bag, to ensure they don’t press up against anything hard that could put too much pressure on them and make the lids pop off.

title: Advantages of the GT model over the basic City Mini stroller
text: Baby Jogger 2016 strollers are compliant with the US Consumer Product Safety Commission standards as determined by the Federal government, so this is the importance of the 2016 models.  Yes, the Baby Jogger 2016 City Mini Double and Baby Jogger 2016 City Mini Double strollers are both up to date with safety compliance, something very important to me.  I currently have both models and can describe the basics of both and what enhancements I've experienced with the GT model over the basic model.  Both are the simple black, but they are available in a number of options, each model has one color that is specific to the 2016 models and was not available in previous models. Both strollers are fabulous for a pair of kids under the weight of 50 pounds each and five years of age.  The fabric is UV protected, each seat is adjustable on its own and recline so one child can sleep while the other enjoys the environment.  Bars and trays are available as additional purchases, as are an assortment of other accessories.  Both offer a quick open and close, we find that they do require two hands.  Each has a fantastic five point harness that is comfy for the kids, as are the seats.  Both offer a pretty smooth ride and look good.  Where they differ is that this GT model weighs a few pounds more and is a little larger.  The tires are all terrain, not the EVA as in the basic model.  This model has an adjustable handlebar, a definite asset for us since none of us adults is tall and we can now be more comfortable when pushing the stroller.  The brake is on the bar, not on the bottom area as it is with the basic model.  My critique of the basic model had two things I wished were different, the tires and the handlebar.  With this model, both of my wishes have been granted and more.  The strollers look very much alike and until I pushed the stroller, the difference was not really obvious.  As soon as the tires rolled, I felt that this one was well worth the additional cost.  If finances are a concern, you can spend more for either model in a color other than black or you can get this deluxe model in black and enjoy the additional features.  I say to go for the black and get this GT model.  The suspension is enhanced by the all terrain swivel tires which can be locked for longer rides, just like with the other model.  This is not a lightweight stroller, but then neither are two kids, so we work through the weight carefully lifting both.  Assembling this stroller and familiarizing ourselves with its operation took less than a half hour.  This double stroller is not intended for jogging.  We have had no problem doing some fast moving across the sidewalk and lawns, up and down hills with ease.

title: nice combo for newborns text: I purchased this for my new and first grandbaby! :-D My daughter was thrilled with this choice in carseat and stroller combo. We chose this because Evenflo is a known and trusted brand. Purchasing a carseat is not something to play around with. You want something that is sturdy and works. I guess your mileage may vary and opinions differ but we really, really liked this setup. For a newborn to one year, this combo is perfect.

This carseat has all the bells and whistles. Easy car installation on the base. Carseat clicks in and out easily. Of course there is a learning curve on how it all works, but the instructions are seemingly well written and we found what we needed to find. My daughter likes the SensorSafe feature that lets you know about unexpected unbuckling, unsafe temperatures, the child is left unattended, and the child is seated too long. Personally, it would be too much technology for me, but again, my daughter loves it for her baby. She is impressed by this technology. The little adapter is attached to the carseat with a ziptie if you are looking for it when unpacking.

The carseat with baby is a little heavy but I don't know how you get around that. You want sturdy in an accident and babies are chunk-a-munks. Add the two together and you will be carrying some weight.

The stroller holds the carseat perfectly, snap in, snap out and sturdy. The stroller folds down pretty easy and fairly compact. The stroller will grow with baby to a certain point. Perfect for newborn to one. One to two will probably work. Toddlers will probably need something a little bigger to accommodate them. My girls had a sit and stand stroller which are still around and I highly recommend.

As for longevity. Sorry, we cannot speak for that just yet. So far so good.

I guess that is it. Any regrets? None. I wish they had this beauty when my daughter was a baby. Recommend? Absolutely.

title: Waxy scent; initially greasy but dries silky & is moisturizing; PRICEY
text: This looks like yellow Vaseline but spreads just a tad easier than that. It moisturizes and absorbs well and is initially greasy. However, after it absorbs, the skin feels silky. Although this is for babies, I use it on my problem areas such as elbows, heels, and hands and it works well for that. What I do not like is the waxy scent. Although this is unscented, I smell the ingredients and that scent is not nice. This is another reason I only use this on selective areas that need major hydration. The current price of $15.19 ($15.99 minus 5%) for 2 ounces comes to $7.60 per ounce, which is also very expensive. Despite this, this is very good, super hydrating balm.

title: There’s a difference between lightweight + thin..!! text: Softness is there but, somehow I was expecting more substance… This blanket is described as light weight and that is exactly what it is. However, with that said- I still want to see and feel ample comfort with all blankets. I expect a blanket to make me want to crawl into it.. Only, instead of feeling über inviting- it gives one the feeling of thin. In my book- there is a difference between thin vs. lightweight!!

I appreciate the inside “Minky bumps” it’s probably the blankets best feature.. the top layer is soft- but, feels as if it’s lacking substance.
It’s not like there’s anything wrong with this blanket... it’s just hard to be excited as if there is anything 100% right about it. As for the giving as a gift option- personally, I’d like to find one a squishier quality to gift myself.
This would be a good blanket in their back up arsenal or, tucked into the diaper bag bc, it’s not too cumbersome. I don’t see any baby falling head over heels in love and making it their “special” or, “gi-gi” and that’s the true test!

title: Parents and baby are overjoyed! text: I got this for my friend who has been like a little sister to me, and her beautiful four-month-old son. Mom and Dad are VERY happy with it! Here is what she had to say:

- The base is connected so it’s easy installation and transferring

- 10 point harness makes up feel very secure

- The padding is soft and we know the baby’s head is surrounded by comfort and is secure

- we love that we won’t have to buy another car seat because it advances to all stages

- only dislike is that you cannot transport baby inside of the car seat. Doesn’t come with a canopy or handle.

So this is clearly a car seat that you want to keep IN the car, and as long as you don't have a bunch of groceries to take out with the baby, you should be fine, or if you do have a load of belongings, you have an extra set of hands, or just take the baby inside first. Do not leave the baby in the car. LOL

Other than that, I was intrigued by the idea of a "forever" car seat and it seems like it is worth every penny! It looks amazing, to be sure! I definitely, WE definitely give it SIX thumbs up!
