title: Perfect for our needs and does double duty!! text: This is a smaller size toddler pillow… one made smaller for the convenience and use while traveling yet, it can be used on a day-to-day basis and for a few diff. purposes.

In our house, I am providing nanny care x2 days a week for my nephew and needed pillow small enough to fit inside a bassinet now and transition into the play/pack later. This toddler travel pillow is perfect for my needs.

I am loving the fact this is a firm but, comfortable pillow purposely made without a lot of excess “squish” or, material that could be a hazard to an airway... yes! infants don’t usually need a pillow at all- As, I’m using in place of a wedge to help prop baby at a slight angle (like a rolled blanket or, foam under bedding can do!).. With a bassinet the pillow had to be of smaller size to fit and this is a perfect fit! The pillow can also allow one to help prop a bottle as they grow a bit over time. After a quick few months- I will easily transition pillow into a baby head rest when he sleeps. *Why the reason behind one item performing multiple things.. ?? bc, I don’t need an entire baby arsenal of gear for baby duty only x2 days a week. The least amount of items is best- so, if one item performs “double duty” and can change with baby, it’s a plus.. and those babies we all know, grow really fast! This pillow can now be a staple for us over the next 1yr plus for sure..

Size: don’t expect toddler bedding- Think adult travel pillow.. boom, that is it! With the exception it has been constructed for toddler use and boasts a whimsical print. We ordered blue- and love the fun elephants.. it’s perfect for a baby who’s from Ghana!!

Material: has solid stitching, no loose thread and no hard edges. It has an envelope style closure… Fabric is soft however, has the newness/crisp feeling sheets can have when they arrive. I used fabric softener x3 machine washes prior to use and found.. it just gets softer every time- just like I wanted. I’ve now, washed x6-7 and have had no issue with color fading.. just keeps softening! No exposed or, outside stitched tags either to scratch babies skin..

Purpose: obviously pillow can travel with ease and fit inside most diapers, suitcase or, duffel bags. It’s perfect size to take to grandma‘s house or, hotel! Nursery pillows also add a fun aesthetic to decor in any room.. and this, placed in rocking chair looks fansastic.. not to mention, provides support at small of the back- which, is a big relief in our wooden rocker! I hope this info can help your decision.. feel free to let me know.
*included photo helps show the difference of using pillow to create angle vs. standard flat. As you can see- photo on left has a curve.. travel pillow used created the needed positioning.

title: Great for assisted feeding for your cat or small dog text: I am very happy with this product.

I bought the 10cc size. It came with two syringes, both the same size but with different tips that have different sized openings.
The reason I bought these was to hand feed one of our cats who has kidney disease and had stopped eating from his dish.
We weren't going to let him starve to death because of kidney problems! (Special note... if your cat has kidney disease, s/he also likely has a very sour stomach that keeps them from wanting to eat (sort of like a tummy flu). Ask your vet about something to help with that. There are holistic helps as well as a people medicine that can help, both OTC.)

I was a little worried about being able to squeeze the syringe without overloading food into my cat's mouth.
However, the plunger works very smoothly. Even my hand with two "bum" fingers (repetitive-use cysts on the knuckles) can push the plunger without excessive force.

For pet feeding, the food does need to be liquefied to thinner than oatmeal quality to work. I use the one with the wider tip for feeding our adult cat. It is much easier than the squeeze-bulb style syringe I was using before. The flexible tip is gentler on his mouth and tongue, and I have much better control over how much is given at one squeeze. The measurement markings on the outside allow me to better know how much he is actually getting into him as well. I just put the tip with the plunger all the way down into his liquified/pureed food and pull the plunger back to fill it to the desired level. If you get too much air in the tube, just hold upright, tap, and push a little to force the air out.

The plunger and tube are super easy to clean: just pop them apart, run hot/warm water thru the tube, rinse the plunger, and push a couple tubes of water through it. I then leave the pieces separate to dry out, and by the next meal time, they are dry and ready to use again. I don't advise using soaps if you are using these for pets - many are super-sensitive to soap residue tastes.

The smaller tip has a graduated sizing that gets pretty small at the end. While I don't need this one, I could see it being very useful for dispensing milk to tiny kittens or liquids to even smaller pets, such as a hamster. It is too narrow for foods, so that tip would be good for liquids only. You could always trim it if you needed the opening a little wider, but you'll be losing length, which could affect being able to get it into your pet's mouth.

Both tips are a soft, flexible silicone and are much nicer for my pet than the hard tip of the bulb syringe I was using before.

While I wish I didn't need these at all, I am glad someone makes them! I am very pleased with both the quality of the syringes and the user-friendly function of them. (Anyone who has tried to use those syringes with the black inner tips will know what I mean... they are hard to push and unpredictable as to how far it will glide at any given time.)

Well done, Innovet, and thank you for helping me to help my cat.

Now the bottom would of been a total winner, it offers a lot of space, plus some dividers, but the zipper to get in there is very short. It would of been amazing if it ran the length of the bag. It has 2 outside cup pockets, plus a small zippered area on the back. It comes with stroller hooks and a little cooler. I was able to pack it for my 2 under 2, plus some snacks for my kids. title: Great at first, but can't be used longer than 2 months text: I loved these pacifiers at first, my daughter has a lip tie, and took them right away. I wasnt going to give her a pacifier because we had trouble getting our first child off of them, but it seemed like she needed something extra for soothing; so I gave in and bought a more natural pacifier.

One thing I really liked about them was the color/style of these. They are trendy and different then the common bright/colorful baby designs.

She used them for almost a solid 3 months. We washed them regularly and sterilized them in boiling water (recommended for long term use) Because the pacifier is 2 pieces, water would still get in, which was a bacteria concern.

Just recently one them (that she used the most) has physical signs of wear and has a very sticky feel to it. I thought it might of been from the milk, but I washed it in soapy water and it still felt sticky. It also developed a small hole in it, and what looks like stretch marks around the nipple..

We will be in need of a new one now, and even though I liked these alot at first, i am considering getting a different type/brand that is one solid piece instead.

title: Best Swaddlers Available Today text: The [[ASIN:B005Q3LSDO aden + anais Classic Muslin Swaddle Blanket 4 Pack, For The Birds]] got more use than any other baby product in our house in the first two months after our daughter was born.

These blankets are much larger than your typical receiving blanket, which makes putting baby in a snug swaddle much easier, even for a beginner swaddler. The material is thin, though, preventing baby from overheating. We had a June baby, and these were the perfect swaddling blankets for the warm weather. Baby was in just a diaper, with an Aden and Anais swaddler on, and her temperature was perfect.

Additional uses for this product include a nursing cover, keeping the sun off of baby's infant carrier (draped over, it's an easy replacement for an expensive carseat cover), used as a changing spot when visiting friends and family and even used for a burp rag in a pinch.

They wash and dry beautifully - coming out of the dryer even fluffier and cozier with each wash. This is definitely my new go-to gift for new parents.

text: I am always moisturizing my dry skin and like to use baby products.  This goes on greasy like Vaseline but absorbs quickly & leaves a hydration barrier on my skin. It quenches dry skin. It is also almost scentless. The current price of $16.99 is also pricey for 1.76 ounces.

title: Perfect for twins
text: We have twins so he have to make baby food about three times a day with it. This makes making the bay food extremely easy and we are saving hundreds of dollars.

title: Comfy

title: Love the idea, not the execution...
text: So it's a pain in the butt to add to my existing pieces but I kinda appreciate that because it means both my daughter and my dogs won't take it apart. Its super cute too. My problem is functionality... I use this inside my house to keep my kid and dogs apart when needed and the little door doesn't work well. You open it and it falls down. The handle and hook is fine but how do I make it stand sturdy? Any suggestions?

title: My Grand Daughter Loved It So Cute, Matching Close Is Wonderful
text: I Give This Product a 10

title: Citrus (Lemons and Oranges) Two-Sided Infant Blanket text: Cotton two-sided infant blanket: lemons and oranges on one side, with solid green on the other, It is difficult to find 100% cotton for babes so I was thrilled to find this, and the matching outfit, bib, and hat as well. The blanket is rather thin but that's OK; the pattern and contents make up for it.

I am officially a fan of the Magnificent Baby's brand; their styles are different and I appreciate all-cotton. (Synthetics don't allow skin to breathe).

title: Great Invention and Very Convenient For Travel or Night
text: I bought these for my daughter who just had a new daughter and she really loves them. They eliminate the need to carry around a bulky can of formula, and they fit perfectly into the bottles filled with water. You can toss them into your diaper bag, without worry about them opening up. Just measure the proper amount of scoops of formula, place inside bottle,and when you need a bottle just pour into water and shake the bottle. Very convenient for night time and travel. Would recommend this amazing product by TT!

title: Don't see much difference over "regular" daipers
text: These diapers were designed to allow a baby to sleep for longer periods of time without waking up due to a wet, soaked diaper. It sounds great in theory, but in reality they are no better than any other diaper. They are very nice, with a sweet Disney design, and with an embossed liner that helps keep baby dry. Maybe my boys pee more than the average bear, but these leaked by morning and did not work as expected. They fit snugly and securely with the double grip strips. They do not have added fragrance which I find more acceptable. Overall a nice diaper, but did not perform to expectation.

title: Terrible bags everything else excellent
text: Everything's great until you try to change the bag you push a little bit on the bag if there's any air in it the bag will pop I  you smash it on The ground the bag will pop bad smell and look great but they're weak as hell

title: Baby is entertained while parents are hands free
text: Perhaps not ideal for a brand new baby, a mere few weeks later,  the Fisher-Price Rainforest Friends Comfort Curve Bouncer is ideal for securely entertaining baby while he or she is soothed and parents can be hands free.  Placed on the floor,  the three point strap holds baby who can be gently bounced automatically and with the detachable bar,  two included toys can provide interaction for older infants. It is easy to assemble and takes up little space, runs on a single battery. We love our larger  Fisher-Price swing and really like the portability of this little bouncer, so we have all bases covered. Fortunately,  the very attractive soft pad is machine washable. This is very affordable.

title: 5 Month Old First Flight Life Saver
text: We purchased these headphones for our 5 month old to help ease his first flight pain and it did the trick. Great quality, fast delivery, and a great product!

title: Useful
text: This is very handy for a multitude of uses, but so far just making quick and easy, flexible tie-downs for the car has been a life-saver.  Simple product that almost seems like you should already have laying around somehow...but I didn't (until now!).  Good stuff.

title: Fits 2014 Ford Fusions
text: This installed relatively easily on my 2014 Ford Fusion. When I went to roll the window up the bottom part wanted to come back up with the shade though :/ . I don't know that I would count on this to be able to function with the window rolling up and down but I do like that it is a window shade option that doesn't deal with suction cups. In the midwest we get far too cold and too hot of temperatures to deal with the fickleness of a suction cup on a window so this will probably be the best option for us. I will update this after using it for awhile.

title: Super soft
text: This Waddle Penguin by Alex & Kate is so adorable and super soft! The controls are easy to figure out thanks to the easy to understand instructions. The different sounds are nice and helped my niece fall asleep faster than she had been (she tends to fuss at bedtime). All of the electronics come out of the penguins tummy making it simple to spot clean or launder if needed. Lastly, this penguin is super adorable and extremely soft and cuddly making it a great toy for little ones to snuggle with.

title: Our favorite binkies. I love the openness so drool doesn’t ...
text: Our favorite binkies. I love the openness so drool doesn’t pool against his skin.  I also love that these binkies work upside down because this makes them much more user friendly in the dark.  I find the blue styles easiest to see at night.

title: Don’t waste your money

The night vision light to see the baby is very bright as well, it is like a night light shinning on the kid. But the worst part is that it turns off randomly after about 45 minutes. I want a monitor that stays on until I turn it off

text: Don't wait that long to change them. Naps don't go for 12 hours at this age and they definitely need to wear overnight diapers. These diapers are fine for day time use. Like any diaper, you should not leave them on for long periods. It just isn't good for the diaper or the baby or you. Change often and keep your little one dry and clean.

title: So far so good. WIthin about 30 minutes it had the wipes ...

title: Good lightweight blanket
text: Such a soft and fluffy blanket. It's a bit on the thin side but it keeps my girls tasty warm when cuddled together under it. The donut pattern is bright and so much fun. I love the bright pink, so vivid and a splash of color especially with this dreary weather. Machine washable. The blanket is single layer, well stitched on the edges.

title: Perfect size text: Was easy to get this set up. Needed a larger playpen set up so the little ones are safe when I'm cooking dinner or cleaning.
Playpen is very stable. Doesn't come with a mat. That was disappointing. I had a spare mat here that I was able to fit inside of it.
All playpen should come with everything that's needed for it.
Perfect size, little ones are safe and happy. That's what I look for.

title: Fantastic for safety text: There are a few places I really needed to put these child locks.
In the kitchen where I keep my cleaning supplies. In my laundry room where I have my laundry needs, and for my bathrooms where I also keep cleaning supplies.
With having little ones running around, there are times they can slip out of vision and get into things.
Having these safety locks reassures me that they aren't getting into anything that can hurt them.
These are so easy to install. Just peel the paper off the back and stick onto the cabinet.
Push up in the middle to release the one side so an adult can open the cabinet.
Nice to have these for ease of mind.

title: 18 with Oral Fixations
text: As embarrassing as this is to write, I’m 18 and I get the overwhelming urge to bite something as hard as I can. I normally satisfy my fixations with a piece of hard gum, but this is far better for that. I can bite down as hard as I need without it (or my teeth!) getting damaged. My only gripes are that they don’t smell the best, and they don’t make versions of these with less obnoxious colors. I wouldn’t recommend them ever leaving your house (due to funny looks), but they’re great when you’re at home and you just randomly think: “man, I really need to bite something hard.”

title: Very good produxt

title: Wonderful Stuffed Animal Containment Unit text: This over the door storage organizer is perfect. My son was able to store a ton of his stuffed animals, even large ones like a stuffed snake AND several of his Nerf weapons.

It took my husband about five minutes to set this up and then my son filled it within about thirty minutes.

The best thing about this organizer is that you can see everything in the pouches, no more digging through toys trying to find the right one. I've seen these organizers for years and the only reason I didn't get one was because we were always renters and I was worried that it might leave a mark on the top of the door and that we would end up losing our entire deposit. Well, so far, it hasn't left a mark).

The stuffed animals in the top pouches are, of course, very lightweight, but Nerf weapons are heavy, especially the larger pieces and so far, this organizer is showing zero signs that this is a problem. But, I wonder how it will do with repeated opening and closing of the door.

title: Tasty and organic.
text: My son loves every flavor of this assortment. It is organic and the only ingredient is what is on the label. The carrot is a bit on the runnier side but can be easily fixed by adding a bit of rice cereal flakes to thicken it up a bit. Overall this is the perfect starter kit if you start your child on solids. IT allows for testing flavors. I tried it also and these taste great.

title: great value and product
text: This is a great diaper rash cream.  It works as well (if not better) than the name brand stuff.  We use it all the time for any type of sensitive area irritation.  It is nice and thick and offers great all day protection, and is so soothing for already irritated areas.  I use this to prevent chaffing when I anticipate having to work out in the rain or snow where I could get soaking wet.  This also works great on your feet if they get wet and raw.  We also use it on our granddaughter as she can get a terrible diaper rash at times and this really clears it up fast.  Very pleased with how well this product has been working.

title: Another excellent munchkin cup text: We love the munchkin cups and this is no different. They are leak proof as long as the rubber seal is “clicked” in all the way and they aren’t dropped/thrown. Some might come out if the seal is broken but it has held up to our toddler and several tantrums wonderfully. These are durable and easy to clean. We just pop them in the dishwasher with the rubber seal part on the top rack.

The color changing feature is really fun! It starts out yellow and becomes green when a cold liquid is in it. It is also nice to see how much is left in the cup to refill.

It is very soft and my daughter learned how to fold it herself after we showed her just one time. She loves it and wants to nap in it at home as well.

Additionally the hooks are great to hang on any Pack and play.  Thanks!!

My one year old is learning to use utensils and she rather small so these fit her hand perfect and hold wet items fairly easily.  We use it for things such as yogurt and his helping her learn how to hold and use for self feeding.  I think these little utensils are awesome.

title: Narwhal? text: My son loves animals and is learning to read in school. My wife therefore thought these cute placemats would be a great way to reinforce letter sounds at dinner time. They are actually REALLY cute and better than we expected- he loves to ask questions and try to read out the letter of animals he recognizes. It's awesome.
The one thing that we find funny, however, is Norwhal. I mean, they could have used Newt and shown a lizard, or Nightingale and shown a bird, I don't think I've ever seen an ABC animal chart that tried to use the unicorn-like whale for the letter N. But hey, anything that elicits more questions and conversation is just more of a good thing!

title: I like This Conditioner A Lot
text: I see that other reviewers say that this conditioner has a bad smell.  Honestly though, I can't detect any bad scent at all.  It might have the merest trace of a chemical scent, but it's certainly not anywhere near objectionable.  Maybe they got a defective batch, I don't know.  That said, I used this conditioner and was actually very pleased with it.  I used too much the first time but soon realized that only a small amount is needed.  It had a gel consistency and felt good, but took a little more time rinsing completely out.  It left my hair nice and soft and smelling good.

I was aware of the monochromatic color scheme, but I was really intrigued by the bunny pattern and was not disappointed by the quality of the fabric and construction.  Summer Infant designs these with a velcro attachment system as opposed to zippers or snaps, so it is simple to open and close for accessing the baby and or diaper.  Because we prefer organic textiles for the baby's clothes and bedding, we are very pleased with this swaddle and know that the SwaddleMe products wash well and hold up for more than one baby.

text: We are using these to train my granddaughter.  She has zero interest in potty training even after a few successful potty times.  She has some delayed development issues and the potty training is part of her delay.  She seems to recognize when she messed in these and tells us but can't figure out the connection of the potty and being in wet pants.  She will get it eventually but until then these are pretty helpful.  They absorb well and hold the moisture decently.  THe wash up and dry well with no noticeable shrinkage.  They fit well and stay in place.  Good for daytime use but not really enough protection for overnight use.

title: Nice Stroller
text: This is a nice stroller. It is well made. The canvas is very thick and durable. The leather accents are a nice touch. It comes with a rain cover, which is really nice. The handle is extendable, so it is appropriate for taller parents. The wheels are nice and big. The front wheels can lock, as well. Baby can face you or face away from you. And it is pretty easy to lay the baby back. I like how the strap adjusters work, though it is difficult to get it small enough for a tiny baby. It also comes with a cupholder, but it is the side kind that hold on by one little knub. Water bottles always fall out of those. My only real complaint is the difficulty in folding it. It has a little switch, but you have to maneuver and try multiple times to get it to "catch" fold down. Unfolding it, there is a lock you have to unclip and then it unfolds easily. It also comes with an attachment for an infant car seat. I really just wish the folding was a smoother mechanism.

title: Great idea text: We have an infant daughter and she likes to be swaddled. They like things around them - it's why they will sleep for hours in their car seat but wake up as soon as you put them in the crib (at least mine does). Swaddling with a regular blanket can be tricky. It can be difficult to do and then easily come loose. It can also be an issue because you are not supposed to put a blanket in with the baby in the crib.

I liked these. It made it so much easier to swaddle her. You just put her in it and Velcro and you are done. I still don't put her in it alone in the crib at night, but just to use while I am holding her. It also can make it easier to breastfeed because sometimes she inadvertently loses the latch because she is moving around so much. This seemed to calm her down. It's nice that it comes in a set of two. They were soft and had nice designs. These are a little more boy colors, but I use them for my girl. The whale print is cute. I also think this would make a nice shower gift. I would recommend them.

This is the next step version of the original swaddle for when the child is older. It is nice because you can choose whether to have the child's arms in or out. It is also nice because it has a zipper at the bottom, which makes it easier to change a diaper. Many of these swaddling things are only for the youngest of babies so it is nice to have something for an older baby.

title: Oh my...so soft and simply adorable!
text: Adorable! The gift set comes beautifully packaged in a sturdy, giftable box with the two bunny blankets nestled inside tissue paper. The ends of the blankets that look like the bunnies’ feet feature ties that can be used to attach a pacifier, if desired. Both have floppy ears that will likely find their way inside baby’s mouth, and the larger one has squishy, stuffed fabric arms. Machine washable. This would make a perfect gift for expectant parents.

title: Love these diapers text: We've been using Pampers for many years. We are very happy with them. They work pretty well. The Swaddlers are the more expensive and higher quality line of the diapers. Still, they work pretty good.

The fit is fine, but depending on the baby, they may not work for the highest of the range. They protect pretty well. Nothing is perfect but we didn't have too many leaks.

They feel soft and have cute prints on it. Baby seems to find them comfortable. I would recommend them.

title: High Quality

title: Useful diagram and tool set
text: When I bought my P229 I had never cleaned a pistol before so I bought this particular workbench mat & cleaning kit in order to have a parts reference to look at and tools to do the job with on hand. Since it didn't come with any cleaning solution or lubricating oil I bought (Hoppe's No. 9) separately here on Amazon as well -- and then I asked a neighbor who hunts and shoots often to come over for dinner and show me how to clean a gun.  (HA) That's true, but the important thing is that this assembly allowed my friend to disassemble the P229 despite not having been familiar with that particular weapon before, teach me how to properly clean and reassemble it. So I'm pleased with this purchase and would definitely recommend it (along with buying some cleaning solution, lubricant & patches).

title: Eh

Stays on fine.. only issue is my son can lift the toilet cover even with this device on and correctly placed.. he likes throwing my makeup in the toilet.. but if it’s an item larger than a soda bottle or you don’t mind small items having to be scooped out, you should like this

text: My 2 1/2 year old grandson (and I) love these Huggies potty training pants. First, the colors and Disney design are great and he loves wearing them. Second, they are made very well and look regular underwear. He loves to be praised when he successfully uses the bathroom, but these training pants are great for the times when he 'forgets' . We have used Huggies on and off for diapers when he was an infant, but now that he is older and training, Huggies are the way to go. Super absorbent, don't leak, they are great. We highly recommend!

title: More than a simple nursing pillow, it's a bargain
text: The best part about this firm nursing pillow is that is really does "grow" with the baby as advertised.  As a nursing (or bottle feeding) pillow, the [[ASIN:B00LUBWTOS Fisher-Price Perfect Position 4-in-1 Nursing Pillow]] is an interesting design having a low and alternate high end of the horseshoe shape.  This enables the support to be at the right height for the baby and mother's (or father's) comfort.  With a unique easily attachable arch that holds hanging grab toys, this will do what other pillows will not.  We really like it and also appreciate the gender neutral removable cover.  The colors aren't my personal favorite combination, but the pillow feels good, so it's a winner in my book.

title: What is there not to love about a cheaper option to purchase these
text: What is there not to love about a cheaper option to purchase these!? Being a mom we often seem to find bottles stored in places that we never imagined and although yes it would be cheaper to boil them to get the awesome film that was left from your ever so loving toddler throwing and hiding this under your couch for the price!? Just throw them away and order the replacement. These are always impossible to find in both target and walmart and when you can you often pay the same price for just one or you find yourself just purchasing a new cup. The soft spout I will say was a good in between from bottle to hard plastic sippy cup and I would for sure suggest it to tired moms across the world!

title: I love this baby monitor
text: I love this baby monitor. I've tried a few different ones and have returned them all. Even some other Motorola versions but I've been using this one for more than a year and haven't had any problems. I only hear static if I turn the volume above 3. I never have to do that unless I'm in a noisy environment so I can't hear the static anyways. I love that the lights go from green to red based on noise level. The battery life when disconnected from the plug lasts a few hours. I never use the voice feature or music to they do work. The only things I would improve is when toggling between cameras. But if you zoom one in they both zoom. Also wish that they were able to point downwards a bit more. Great cameras though, they have good pictures in the light and the dark. All around good system.

title: They don't work at all text: Installing theses was easy and I was glad that with just a little effort these stuck to our wooden cabinet interiors.

Tested during installation and they seemed fine. After they were allowed to settle for over 24 hours (per instructions of 24 hour rest before engagement) - I retested.

The results were that if you gently pulled on the cabinet they would stay locked closed. However, of you jiggle the cabinet door, even a little, they latch would disengage and the door opened.

So unless your little one is gentle and only tries once to open the cabinet, these things won't keep them out.

I let my 7 month try and he opened on the third jiggle. He immediately went for the beach in the cabinet. For sure... Not useful.... Maybe even dangerous if you think they are working.

title: Lightweight, short, but wide and functional text: We needed a gate in our cabin to separate the living area from the bedroom without closing the door. I want the dogs kept out of the bedroom until actual bedtime, but still need airflow throughout the cabin.

This gate allws me to separate the space and still shut the door if needed without drama. It is wide enough to create a bit of a curve at the doorway so there's room to maneuver. It attaches directly to the wall on both ends with screws rather than as a pressure mount set up. It is a short gate, so big dogs can easily pop over it if they are so inclined.

The door swings one way with the block in place and is easy to open. The entire gate is very lightweight, so you definitely need to attach it properly - just a simple bump will knock it down. I do like it overall and it meets my requirements comfortably.

title: They like things around them - it's why they will sleep ... text: We have an infant daughter and she likes to be swaddled. They like things around them - it's why they will sleep for hours in their car seat but wake up as soon as you put them in the crib (at least mine does). Swaddling with a regular blanket can be tricky. It can be difficult to do and then easily come loose. It can also be an issue because you are not supposed to put a blanket in with the baby in the crib.

I liked these. It made it so much easier to swaddle her. You just put her in it and Velcro and you are done. I still don't put her in it alone in the crib at night, but just to use while I am holding her. It also can make it easier to breastfeed because sometimes she inadvertently loses the latch because she is moving around so much. This seemed to calm her down. It's nice that it is a neutral color and will work for a boy or a girl. I also think this would make a nice shower gift. I would recommend them.

title: Quality Product
text: I use this for our pug. He wears wraps with diaper cloth pads in our house because he is a marker. The diaper pail locks the scents in fairly well. When a mild order starts in our laundry room. I pour a laundry scoop of baking soda in diaper pail. I purchase the large bags of Baking Soda for our swimming pool and many uses around the house. I just pour the diapers with washable bag in the washer to clean.

title: Another winner from SwaddleMe text: SwaddleMe makes really nice products. . . and this one is one of them. The organic cotton is a very “neutral” color which can be easily used for both boys and girls. It washes well. SwaddleMe makes items for all different “stages” as you will see above. I really love their print swaddles, though they are not “organic cotton”. The packaging, which can be different depending from item-to-item (and even for the same item), is always nice and easy to wrap when giving for a gift.

The only thing I wish they would change is where they make the items. They are Made in China, and it would be great if they could make them in the USA.

title: Very nice! text: These were an excellent find! Several kids in already and I've never had the luxury of owning Muslin baby washclothes before. I found these to be very soft and they seem well made.
They're not the most absorbent washcloth I've ever had; but then again neither are traditional baby washcloths. The others have all been even thinner, terrycloth material too. title: Soft, fit good, but had a blow out! text: These bambo Nature are soft and fit good.

That said, Our 1 1/2 yr. old has been wearing these diapers for over a week now.
She has not had any type of rash, but she usually does not. The fit was good, and seemed comfortable for her.
But she had a bit of diarrhea, and had two blow outs! Lucky she was home.
I do not think if this happened with her other diapers on it would have been messy, like it was with these!
That is the reason for the 3 stars, not 5.

title: Good for Entire Family
text: As I've been trying to incorporate more "natural" products in my house (so long as they're "affordable"), this one made the cut. Regardless of age, some people get rashes. And, some people have "issues" in that area. This works. It's thick, but it works for any kind of irritation on my sensitive skin and those in my household. I've even used this as a first aid cream. Once applied, it does need a bit more "pressure" to wash off. I like the fact it doesn't have a "scent".

title: Hurray. Found it. My allergies make it HARD to find tolerable products text: It has been VERY hard for me to find a scalp care product that did not inflame and crack the skin on my head. My allergies include a number of spices and oils, complicating toiletry scent choices for me.

Finally, I found a whole product line that helps my scalp to heal. While the Honest line is not cheap, it works, and so its all I use now.

Credit goes to the knowledgeable help at Sprouts who -when presented with the long list of my known allergies- pointed me towards the products made by the Honest Company. It is too bad that our local store now decided to stop carrying them in favor of a similar looking house brand.
Im now a loyal Honest customer and will keep ordering it by mail.

title: Almost perfect.
text: I really wanted to love this diaper bag. All the outside pockets are perfect, there's room for my coupons and other papers in the changing mat pocket, zippered pouch for an ink pen and lip glass credit card is fantastic. The one thing I couldn't get past is the extra flaps of fabric that push into the inside because of the hidden side insulated bottle pockets.  If I would reach in blindly all I could feel is that extra flat fabric flapping around and not the toy/book/clothes I really wanted to find without having to look.  Plus, it doesn't really seem like the pockets are insulated-they would be slightly protected from heat because they are completely inside the main compartment of the bag-but I never tested it.  I currently use an older Skip Hop Grand Central which I love but it's wearing and I wanted something a bit more summery.  Anyway, if the insulated bottle pockets were on the exterior (like the standard Duo-not insulated though) and the bottom had metal feet this would be the perfect diaper bag.

title: Didn't Work for my Breastfed Baby
text: Let me start by saying I think it's WONDERFUL of Avent to offer their consumer the option to modify what they already own!  I bought 2 Avent bottles for our son to use while my mom watched him for our anniversary.  He was exclusively breastfed & only used 1 bottle, that 1 time.  When his doctor suggested starting him on sippy cups with a little bit of water (6months), I really didn't want to run out & buy something else that would take up more space in our cabinets.  I bought these guys & the handles.  Our son loves the handles, but has really struggled with the spout.  I would go so far as to say he cannot drink from it.  I eventually caved & bought 2 Nuby 2 Handle Cups with Soft Spouts.  He can drink out of the super soft spout much easier.  I do wish this product would have worked for him because when I screw on the Nuby lid, the spout does not align with the handles.  The Avents *always* align.  To sum it up, I am giving it 4 stars even though it didn't work for our family, because (1) I love that Avent offers a modification for consumers, (2) the handles rock & the spout & handles align super easily, & (3) my baby is exclusively breastfed & has very little experience with bottles (1 bottle, 1 time) - I believe a baby who knows how to drink from a bottle would have a much easier time with this product.

title: Toddler approved

This is a good mattress cover and it's squishy to help pad the mattress some and help baby be more comfortable.

title: Great for Baby
text: I purchased this as perineal oil for my home birth. However, it wasn't needed. So, I'm glad it is multi-use so it wasn't a wasted purchase. I use it on my newborn for that dry newborn peely skin. It works really well. It spreads easily. It absorbs quickly, so you don't have an oily baby. It doesn't stain clothing. It is very, very lightly scented- not at all overwhelming. The bottle is going to last forever, though. One small dollop (about 1/4 dime size) will cover the entire baby.

title: Attractive seat, poor reinforcement
text: Attractive looking seat. Minimum efforts put into it. The foam is extremely thin, you can press down on the padding and feel through the plastic. The actual seat itself, the plastic- is not hard like our other Graco. It is flexible and I can bend, push, pull it. For reinforcement, there are two thin one inch bars. Our other seats have much larger and stronger reinforcement bars. I picture in my head, a large vehicle hitting my baby girl side of the car and this seat does not feel safe to me. We are returning and purchasing the Britax One4Life. My heart says no to this seat. My bank was happy but I don’t feel like this would protect my girl in my sedan. This would be better for an suv, van, truck. But overall please check the plastic and make sure you’re okay with it before you use it for you child. It is a great seat because it has a circular cup holder, it only has one but some have square cup holders! So that’s nice. We purchased because the seat cover removes easy and our daughter gets sick in the car easy but I will invest in a steam cleaner just for her Britax. It does not have a removable cover at all, only the headrest from what I read so that is a downside. The cost with the accessories is $500. This seat is budget friendly definitely and much safer than many car seats you can find at Walmart or other places. Nice seat just not safe enough for us.

title: Great for drawers

title: No shrinking in wash, very soft against bare skin, but expensive. UPDATE 90 Days text: We don't have any babies to burp or swaddle, but we do have lots of other uses for soft little cloths. These are bigger than expected and thin, though I guess as baby cloths, that makes sense. A run through the washer and dryer immediately out of the package softened them up and now they feel wonderful against the skin. Plus none of the three shrunk after the laundry in warm water. I'm using one of these as a brow wipe when I exercise because they are so soft and absorbent. Another is in my truck for a similar purpose. I'm not entirely convinced that these are really worth more than a couple of bucks apiece though - the overall value seems off to me.

******* UPDATE Oct 9 - 90 days ********

After 90 days, give or take a bit, these towels are holding up really well. They are getting softer every time I wash them and they haven't shrunk. I find myself using them a lot and they end up in the laundry a couple of times a week.

title: Such a lifesaver for the midnight- 2AM feeding.. !!! text: Such a helpful and forward thinking little device.. Ideal for any who bottle feeds and has the mid of night shift..!! With all my babies grown- I’m always surprised how futuristic baby supplies have gotten.. This has got to be one of the most useful new gadget around!! Nannying a newborn for a week while parents travel.. I’ve absolutely fell in love with this little gadget it’s a total game changer!

1. For babies kept on a set schedule- either waking themselves or mama waking to eat.. This has clock timer that allows you to be “bottle ready” at your chosen specific time is. WHAAA..!!!

2. For those who prefer a few minutes to change a diaper, situate in rocking chair, go potty.. you start warming process once baby cries out and as you complete tasks- you’ll have “bottle ready” for feeding. WHAAAA…!!!

3. Or those little one who tucker out at the start of a feeding they will need- quick cat nap to gain energy to finish bc we know their hungry.. Choose temp. you’d like to keep milk acclimated too and it stays “bottle ready” thru their cat nap. WHAAA…!!!

Whatever night routine 1,2,3.. this gadget is such a perk!! Instructions are easy + straightforward, control button are back-lit with LED display so easy to navigate in the dark.. i find it white noise quiet and won’t disturb sleep of anyone in the room. The small footprint lets this sit nicely on nightstand or place of choice.. I prefer bedside to truly keep me from going to kitchen to fuss with any of it!! I say let all the perks work FOR you! **Place a protective layer (placemat) under device to keep wood extra safe.. If kept/cared/stored properly- this could be an item to last thru all child rearing years!!

At $40- it’s worth it.. sleep is priceless you get very little of it! Would make perfect baby shower gift. Hoping info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone.

It was 78 degrees with a light breeze in heavy shade when we tried this and there was nice air flow inside - the baby wasn't hot or uncomfortable. However, I definitely wouldn't use this thing if the temperature was 80 degrees or more and darn sure not in the sunshine in summer.

title: Nice screen and comfortable to use, but fussy about placement to get accurate reading text: There are a number of features that I like about this IR ear thermometer. The screen is clear and easy to read, it comes with a nice storage stand to keep it protected when not being used, and the manual is very detailed and specific as to how to use it. It comes set up to use as an ear thermometer but can also be used to take surface temps.

It is powered by two AAA batteries, which are included. It automatically powers down to conserve battery life.

The bad news is that actual usage is not all that convenient. It is a rather fussy thermometer to get it to provide accurate temps. It has to be positioned very carefully in the ear, and the disposable caps must be intact. The latter is a problem since several of the caps that were included (it comes with 2 packs, each containing 15 caps) were not properly formed and had gaps at the tip.

While some measure of care with regard to placement is necessary with any ear IR thermometer, this model is far more fussy than others I’ve used. Unless I placed it exactly so, and pulled (gently) on the ear of my (somewhat) willing test subject to position the probe, I would get readings a little above or below what I should have measured. It was difficult to use even with a (somewhat) willing test subject – it would have been even more difficult with an actual sick person, especially a child.

Given the price point, the fussy nature of this thermometer plus the fact that it can only be used with the HealthSmart brand caps (which can be defective right out of the box) makes this, at best, an average value. The screen, overall ergonomics and storage stand are all pluses, but even with those I can’t see this worth more than a 3-star (average) rating. There are better models out there for the same or lower cost.

title: Protection for your little one.
text: The Bugaboo Cameleon Breezy Sun Canopy is perfect for offering protection, from the elements (i.e., sun, rain, etc) while you take your child on a brisk walk or jog. The fabric is durable and appears to hold up well. The canopy is vented and allows you to keep an eye on the infant while covered. The color is neutral (Artic Grey/pale grey) and can be used for a boy or girl. The fabric/material is easy to wipe and keep clean. It’s pretty light weight, kind of windbreaker material. Overall, I think this is a pretty versatile canopy for strollers and I would highly recommend it. 5 stars

title: What a great idea!
text: We have a new kitten in our home and she has taken over one room when she needs to be isolated.  We have food, water, and most importantly a litter box in that room for her.  Therein lies the problem.  My dog loves the tootsie rolls she finds in the litter box and eats all the cat food she can get her mouth on.  What to do?  I searched the internet for ideas.  Put a book behind the door that I can reach in and move out of the way.  Put a washcloth under the door (didn’t work on carpet). There are some expensive gadgets out there but then I found this one.  It works perfectly.  My only regret is that I haven’t had one of these through the years of raising kittens and puppies.  We can leave the door open just enough for the kitten to go through to eat or use her litter box.  And, as she grows, it’s adjustable to make it longer so a bigger cat can go through and it will still keep the dogs out.  Because it’s just a lightweight strap, you can move it easily with one finger for quick access to the room.  When I work in that room on the computer I can easily reach through the door and hook it so only the kitten can come in.  This is a great invention.  The adhesive is holding tight and we open and close that door many times a day.  I would highly recommend that product to anyone wanting to allow limited access to a room.

text: I like this baby face cream, but I doubt it would be used just on the face and not on the rest of baby's body.  It moisturizes well and has a nice, thick consistency. I don't think I would be smearing this all over my baby because it still has a lot of chemically sounding ingredients such as polysorbate 60, phenoxyethanol, tetrasodium glutamate diacetate to list some of them.  I only used moisturizers on my babies such as shea and cocoa butters - just one ingredient butters and they did a marvelous job keeping my babies' skin nice and soft.

It feels great on your skin, and isn't greasy.

The shea and cocoa butter give it that smooth application, I suppose.

Love this calming natural lavender lotion for sensitive skin. May just have to buy some for the adults in the house, too!

title: WOW! Cloth Diaper Mama Impressed text: For background, I used cloth diapers for 2.5 years with my first plus another 7 months with #2 here. I've used prefolds w/ covers, AIOs and pockets. Personally, I really like pocket diapers and bought a used stash of high-end diapers for my first child. As she was the 3rd child in that set, I knew I would have to buy some new diapers for the stash and replace some very worn ones.

After looking for used high-end brands, I ended up taking a chance on these cause I really needed more in rotation and I have to say - I am blown away! Granted my original stash is used, but these seem to be just as high quality for literally A THIRD OF THE PRICE! After pre-washing 3 times, they have been extremely absorbent already, zero leaks and a lot of flexibility with fit. I thought the inserts may be cheap or shoddy, I have my own I was thinking of using, but honestly they are great too. I use one insert and it even withstood nighttime use. Obviously may need to use 2 as he gets bigger, but I was surprised it worked as well as it did with only 1.

Within days, I have ordered another set. With this price point, I can replace most if not all of my stash. I cannot speak to durability, but even if I had to replace some of these in a year - I am still paying less than high-end new and likely to still come under high-end used.

Also to anyone new to cloth, I love to suggest Grovia cloth wipes. Having all cloth is simpler and they work fantastic as well - some are 3+ years strong.

text: The first gate I received show no apparent damage, but the gate and the frame were 2.5 inches out of alignment (for no apparent reason) and could in no way be brought close enough together for the gate to latch at either top or bottom contact point. You'll still need a rear facing seat, forward facing seat, and booster seat beyond this. But for the tote them around in a car seat stage, this is a good seat. Now, the stroller. I love the colors. The basket underneath is really awesome. I love the multi position seating. I find that many times an older baby will want to face me, not outward as that can be overwhelming for them. title: Nursing Scarf text: This is a great nursing scarf. I own a couple different ones and this one fits the best. I am a plus sized woman and some of these nursing scarf makers seem to think they can make theirs the same circumference as a regular infinity scarf only making it slightly wider and call it a nursing scarf. That doesn't work too well. This one is actually larger than a regular scarf so there is room for a baby in there too. The actual circumference of this one is 68" and the width is 29". It is super soft cotton and has some stretch to it as well. It works really well as an infinity scarf as well. The narrow stripes are a refreshing change to the typical overused Chevron stripe you see in these. I got the grey and blue stripe and it is beautiful. I am very happy with this product. The bonus bandana bib is really cute and appreciated.
I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review as stated here. The discount I received has no influence on my review whatsoever.

title: Adds Cuteness and Lots of Colors text: Bows can be a nice accessory to add to a child’s hair, adding an extra layer of cuteness. An assortment of colors is best because you can find the color you want to match the clothing or occasion. And a wide assortment is what you get with this package of sixty hair bows.

Open the plastic bag that holds these bows and you will find sixty bows total. There are two each of thirty different colors. With so many colorful options, there should be no problem finding a shade to match what you need. Most other hair bow packs contain only the basic colors, usually eight or so, but you get thirty with this package.

These bows hold in place by use of the attached alligator clip. The clips are larger than expected and they hold the bows in place with ease. They hold in place well thanks to their teeth. Some bows don’t have the teeth and can easily slip. You won’t have that problem here.

As for the bows themselves, they are tied into an attractive shape and the soft material is nice enough to touch, although this shouldn’t be a concern since they will be in your kid’s hair, and not touching the skin. It’s a cool set of bows overall and makes an excellent gift for anyone with young girls in the household.

title: Some of these items hit the mark, and some not so much text: This is a really fun gift set, but the combination of items is a little strange given the age range covered. For example, there is a sippy cup and a traveling snack canister, neither of which will really be used until a child is about a year old, yet there is also a traveling bottle cleaning kit that has a brush and a drying rack. It seems a little incongruous, because most kids aren’t drinking so much formula or breast milk at that age that you’d need to carry around your own personal drying rack and cleaning brush. Surely that can wait until you arrive home?

I absolutely adore the traveling baby wipe dispenser, so much so that I purchased a second one so I can keep one in my car, and one in the stroller. I love that I don’t have to keep buying little disposable travel packs of wipes, or keep some huge thing of wipes that is constantly drying up in my vehicle. That’s a product that is useful from day one.

I also really appreciated the little oxo spoon. It doesn’t hold much food at all, so is perfect for baby’s first meals from about age 6 months to nine months or a year.

The sippy cup and snack dispenser are very well designed. The snack dispenser has little flaps to keep the fruit or whatever you put in there from rolling all over the floor if the baby bangs it against something or drops it. It won’t keep all of them from rolling out, but it does a pretty good job. That said, I kind of wish the sippy cup were made of glass or stainless steel so that I would feel comfortable letting baby drink things from it over a more extended period of time. I’m not that big on drinking from plastic containers.

I also liked the stroller hook, which allowed me to run out to the co-op and pick up a few groceries while on the walk with baby, and bring them home easily. While some groceries fit underneath the baby seat, it’s nice to have the option to buy more than just milk and eggs.

I think the baby drying rack and bottle brush is the one thing that I wasn’t too keen on. I guess I just didn’t really see the point. If I’m traveling, I bring enough bottles for the duration of the trip, and when I get home I clean them. Maybe if you go on a lot of overnight trips, this would be more useful. I did appreciate that the brush handle comes off so that you can fit the brush and handle inside the drying rack. But I guess I stick close enough to home that to me this seemed a little silly.

Overall, oxo makes really innovative products and these baby products are no exception. That said, I would check the price carefully and make sure that you’re actually getting a deal by buying all of these things at once, because you may not want or need all of them, and perhaps you’ll save money just buying the few things you will need.

title: Great Cup / Easy to Clean text: We love these cups! Much better than any of the other sippy cups we've used. They are easy to clean and mostly spill proof. If anything should get pressed up against the silicone lip, it can let water leak, so we've had a few leaks in the bag if it just got tossed in. Also, if your kid should sling it to the ground like ours does, it will splatter out a huge ring haha. But other than that, it's great. Better than all the rest we've tried.

As for cleaning, cleans great. We toss it in the dishwasher. There is a tiny silicone ring in between the top lid portion and the bottom cup. It does accumulate mold over time, so take it off and scrub it. But make sure it gets back on. It creates a seal so that water won't leak out.

Update: Now that they've released lids, we got those and you don't have to worry about anything pressing up against the lip and causes leaks. Definitely get the lids for the diaper bag travel!

title: Many pieces you have to put together. Made in China. text: This collection of decals come on 10 separate pages. You have to piece it together. It’s a bit like putting a puzzle together. It would’ve been nicer and a lot easier if it were either on wider paper or on a roll. So you have to use caution and make sure that you assemble the pieces precisely. Because of all of the pieces, this also makes it much more of a challenge if you want to move things around. So make sure you know exactly where you want to place this design before you get started.

Because the different elements and animals are an artistic creation, and not photographs, they are all very crisp. The pieces are made of vinyl.

This collection of decals are made in China and being sold by a Chinese company on Amazon. The same company offers a wide array of different sort of decals like this. All with different themes. You might also be interested in a company by the name of “RoomMates” which also offer decals, and they are Made in the USA.

title: Nice baby monitor text: We've been using this camera since January and everything has pretty much been ok so far. It replaces our expensive Motorola (which died on us and was out of warranty). title: Good for sensitive skin baby or adult
text: Pure Magic Baby Lotion is a nice product. The 8 ounce size will go a long way. I have used it on my sensitive face, hands, arms and legs and it keeps them moisturized. So I know it will keep a baby soft and moisturized. The fragrance is nice. The lotion spreads well and feels good. It has a mixture of organic and non-organic ingredients. I would use this on a baby with sensitive skin. It works magic on my sensitive skin. It has some of the same ingredients that is in some of the products I use on a regular basis (glycerin is one that I find very helpful).

title: Does contain odors pretty well and has kept the dogs out of the bathroom trash. text: I don't have babies in diapers around the house, but I do have dogs who like to sneak around and poke their snouts in random trash cans. My thought was that this Bubula diaper pail would foil them with regard to the trash can in the master bath. It's rather pricey for my purposes on the surface, but considering the vet bill for a dog who has foolishly ingested cotton balls, it's worth it.

This can isn't heavy enough or large enough to really work as a family sized kitchen trash can and it requires too many steps to use efficiently while you're cooking. In the bathroom though, it's pretty darn good. It holds a standard 13 gallon size trash bag and it definitely keeps any odors contained. We tested that function with a small bag of empty tuna cans overnight - no tuna smell at all. The dogs haven't been able to open it or figure out how to get into it yet either. I've included a photo of the opening where you put your trash. That peanut butter jar is about as large an item you can dispose of. Anything bigger requires opening the main lid and that in turn, releases the odors that the can is containing. However, for diapers or smallish stuff, this is a pretty good product.

title: Decent Corner protectors for baby proofing

That may be nit-picky, otherwise they are great. Hold a variety of tall or wide containers. Firm grip on walker and wheelchair bars.
Again a nit picky issue, styrofoam cups can get squished if not careful placing or removing. On the other side of that is, most items that fit into the holder are held firmly.

title: Very thin text: Septic safe* is explained on the Mama Bear wipe package: “Not recommended for use with basement pump systems. Safe for well-maintained sewers and septics.” The safety information on the product page says “flush one wipe at a time.”

I have a feeling toddlers won’t listen to the one wipe at a time instructions.

These wipes are thin. I tore one trying to start the daisy chain when I opened a pack. Parents definitely need to open the packs for kids.

Back to how thin these wipes are -- I used 2 to 3 wipes when normally I’d need one Huggies or even an AmazonElements wipe. At .04 a wipe, that adds up quickly. The wipes are smaller too, which contributes to needing more of them.

Granted, Huggies and AmazonElements aren’t flushable, but I personally wouldn’t flush a wipe in a septic system or sewer.

On the plus side, the wipes are fragrance free and did not cause any skin irritation.

title: Refreshing Summer Treats text: When I was looking for pop molds I found these "Frozen Treat Trays." There are some advantages and some disadvantages to this type of mold. First, you can freeze basically anything in them and I've had good luck freezing homemade juices including lemonade and juices I make in my juicer. The caps on this brand have permanent plastic sticks in them so you don't have to buy wooden sticks all the time. They also sort of catch some of the drips although don't count on it.

The disadvantage is that you can't just pull one ice pop out of a tray you have to put the entire tray in a bowl of warm water to release the pops. I found them nearly impossible to pull out without doing this and setting them in warm water for thirty seconds usually does the trick. Then you can just put all the ice pops in a plastic ziplock freezer bag for storage.

Here are the two "juicing" recipes I've used lately. There is a enough juice for the ice pops and a few cups of juice leftover to enjoy:

Recipe 1:

1 pound strawberries
1 pineapple, peeled
2 Pink Lady apples, unpeeled
2 oranges, peeled

Recipe 2:

1 pineapple, peeled
2 oranges, peeled
2 apples, unpeeled
1 (6-ounce) container blackberries
1 cup grapes

For both recipes cut the fruit to fit your juicer and juice. Pour the juice into your frozen treat trays. There are really unlimited ways you can make juice so you can have fun experimenting all summer long.

You would think this would come with a nice recipe book but only three recipes are included. You can mix yogurt with fruit in your blender or freeze applesauce, chocolate milk, egg nog or puddings.

While these are fun for kids adults will love them too. I went out walking in the heat and it was so good to have some ice pops ready on my return.

~The Rebecca Review

title: Probably easier to install on lever handles that are nearly straight text: Another product that didn't bother to include instructions. I guess it's a fairly obvious what to do: you peel the backing from the base of lock and position the lock so that the handle cannot be pushed down when the lock's arms are out. Test where to place the lock before removing the backing and sticking it on. The distance between the arms is 1.5". The base is 4.75" tall by 2" wide. When the arms of the lock are extended outward, it measures 3" from the base to the tip of the arms. When the arms are down against the door, the lock measures 3.25" from one edge of the base to the opposite side. Each arm can be unlocked and moved separately. They can even be locked in a partly closed position, though I don't know why you'd want to. You press down on a button (which is easy for an adult to work), move the arm to the desired position, and then release the button to lock the arm into position.

Our house is full of lever doorknobs, and we wanted to use these to prevent my toddler niece from getting into certain rooms. They appear to work alright but were a little difficult to position. We have lever doorknobs that curve upward and then downward into a curl. I think these would be easiest to install on lever handles that are straight or nearly straight.

Installation instructions from the product page: "The surface should be SMOOTH....Please clean the door before you apply the lock, then peel off the 3M adhesive film and stick it to the right spot on the door, press it to make it fit evenly and leave it for 10 minutes before you start using the adhesive child proof locks." (I think you're supposed to use heat on the glue part of the locks when removing them? Obviously haven't tested that yet.)

text: This snack holder has a couple of nice features. The first is that you can easily detach the holder from the clamp. The top of the snack holder also comes off. It comes off pretty easy so if your child likes to open and close things then this top might not stay on for long. The drink holder is about 3.25 inches in diameter and has a few pieces of rubber to help keep the cup in place. The only thing you should note is that the clamp is in place. So, you will only be able to attach this to something that is oriented to fit the clamp. The clamp is tightened (or loosened) by turning the knob on the other side. Not bad.  Made in China

As far as washing, the tag recommends a gentle cycle. If that is a concern, I would hand-wash them as they are so light. Since baby items aren’t to have softeners, that isn’t a concern. After hand-washing, I’d pop them in the dryer.

These are best for swaddling as described or for a light blanket over the baby when out and about.

They are from the Burt’s Bee’s collection and can seem pricey. Honestly, I would be very happy with them for a little one.

title: to a more average black but the mat still looks great. Also I loved the little hanging toys that ... text: My husband and I were looking for a sharply contrasted black, white and red baby gym for our son. Young babies can't always see/ focus very well and the sharp edges and contrasting colors do catch their attention. Everything we saw in store was the complete opposite of what we wanted and that was extremely disappointing.
I saw tons of reviews saying that the color on this mat bleeds in the washer turning the mat into a black, pink and red mat and that made me postpone ordering it. Once I finally did order it I put off washing it for fear that the colors would bleed. Then one day my dog marked the rug, foam mat and baby gym all in one quick shot and I had to wash it. The color didn't bleed, I used cold water and a bit of oxy clean to get out the urine. The black did fade in the drier from a less BLACK black, to a more average black but the mat still looks great.
Also I loved the little hanging toys that came with the gym. They were adorable and my son loved them. The singing panda and the squeaky caterpillar thing were favorites for awhile. The arms that hold the gym arms to the mat are now connected by short ties instead of the buttons I had read about in older reviews. I felt that should be included in this review because no parent wants to buy a choking hazard for their child.

title: Awesome Stuff, but Stinks! text: My youngest son(18 months) gets diaper rash horribly and very easily. He’s been teething what seems like forever now, and with it has came so many poo diapers that we can’t keep up with him no matter how much we try.

His little bottom is super sensitive to the diaper rash creams we use. With most, he will cry while we put it on, and even cry and run if he sees it in our hands. It breaks my heart to have to put it on him. With one brand, it actually burned his bottom so bad that I had to remove to cream off his bottom after a few minutes, realizing that he was being tortured by the stuff. We don’t use it anymore!

When I heard about this “no touch” spray, I became really excited my for my son’s sake.

The great news?

My son LAUGHS when we put it on him. :D And, it works! I’m one happy momma and he is one happy little boy.

I went with 4 stars due to the smell. It’s so worth it, but good grief, this stuff stinks.

title: Moved from Costco brand to Pamper Baby Dry text: This is my third child and I don't really get too excited about diapers. If 90% of the blowouts are contained, it's a good diaper. If my child doesn't have diaper rash or some other skin reaction, it's a good diaper. So, then it comes down to quality of materials. Diaper doesn't tear or tabs stick when applied . . .

I have never had a problem. I had relatively few problems with Costco brand diapers, as well. I switched because I can get home delivery FOR FREE at the same price as the warehouse diapers for a brand name. Win-Win!

I've switched everything to subscribe and save (wipes, evening diapers, toilet paper). It's nice not to worry about a trip to the warehouse before diapers run out.

This is a stress REDUCER and who doesn't need that. All products can be managed. I can move or move back the shipping date to meet our actual needs. We usually run out of things every 6 weeks, so we fall between 1 and 2 months for most items.

title: smooth ride!
text: The gb QBit+ All-City Stroller is a great little stroller! The material is very soft for the child to sit on. It pushes very easily and feels like a very smooth ride. It has a pretty decent compact fold. You just press 2 buttons on the handle to fold and unfold it. The basket is easily accessible, but is small, which is fine! It has a nice recline to it and the canopy has decent coverage. The leg part can either come up for a smaller baby or fold down. I love that the shoulder pads stay in place on the shoulder!! The adjustment piece is also under the pad and you can roll the excess up in the shoulder pad. Brilliant if you ask me! I definitely recommend this stroller to anyone, whether you travel or want to use this for every day. It comes with a rain cover and infant car seat adapter for a cybex car seat.

title: A project at bathtime if, there ever was one..!!!! text: 100% not a fan… And maybe I’m just too old school? After raising 4 kids of my own and bathing newborns in the sink… I stepped up as nanny daycare for my nephew- not to cause horror of bathing my sisters baby where I do my cooking, I decided to get this- if people are looking for ease and convenience, this isn’t it! For those that don’t know any better… They’ll appreciate it just fine, I’m sure.

I didn’t like the idea of bathing a baby in a “glorified bucket“ personally, I had a hard time filling the tub itself and that may be just my own issue with the faucet too close to the wall!? But, it’s how my bathroom was made! I see the logic behind it it just takes so much work to make this happen… By the time I have it set up I could’ve had the child bathed and dressed- so, it’s not time worthy.

The sling idea is a novel concept and that I do understand… You also need the outer ledge of the tub basin to clip this on. Well, If we can send a man to the moon why can’t we make a sling for the regular standard tub?? That would be amazing.. A defect with the sling, is the head rest! This creates a bump that naturally tends to push baby down and that gets their ears under the water- as a daughter of an MD that’s a no go in newborn world!!

I’m sure the next phase with the upright seat will prove to work better… But, if they can semi-sit on their own then, I just assume hold them upright in the tub itself. This getup could be beneficial for those who have a hard time getting up/down at the edge of the tub and maybe Best suited at grandparents house or, the likes. **I can also see this being mandatory IF.. one has a house without a bathtub -then, it is not the worst option around..

I do appreciate the accessories included… The watering can helps rinse babies hair and nothing in the toys is soft sided squeaky to retain water inside it. For those who don’t know- these suck up water and begin to grow mold immediately! Then, when played with the next time… Yuck and the gunk joins baby in the tub it’s horrible! No soft sided rubber duckies- no!! As for the toys in this set- here is a hack for you.. you can thank me later. Every few uses, run them through your dishwasher and they’ll be clean and disinfected- you’re welcome!

I gave this three stars for the fact: some people may not have options for bathing baby.. and therefore, this could solve those issues. It has its perks and in the end can get its job done.. just not in the fashion I want- Quick, effective, efficient!!
I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Terrific
text: These only have a couple of semi-questionable ingredients, versus most of the major brands. I compared them to Seventh Generation and Earth's Best, and the Naty brand is way better than both. It feels a lot softer than the SG brand and is much sturdier than EB (though I use EB diapers and didn't like the Naty diapers). Naty are sturdy and durable, and the aloe seems to soothe redness before it can become a rash--though I buy the regular kind too, depending on what is in stock. As a bonus, they usually come out of the package pretty easily. On the downside, the soft-packs tear easily, and I've noticed if you put them in a plastic container, they dry out more quickly. I just check the packaging every day, and if one rips, I pop the pack in a resealable gallon storage bag. I do wish Naty had distribution in a local store, but I've never seen them, even at Babies "R" Us. The Subscribe & Save option makes them affordable through Amazon, and it's convenient to have them delivered every other month without having to go to the store, so I guess it's not a deal-breaker for me that they aren't locally available.

title: Review for the DETANGLER not 3-in-1 wash text: We may have received the detangler by mistake, but I am honestly so happy that we did (the order form says this was supposed to be the 3-n-1 wash).
So my daughter has incredibly long, curly, and ridiculously knotty hair. She was born with a full head of luscious curls, so It is something we have been struggling with since she was a baby tbh. She's 8 now and so I have tried nearly every detangling product on the market. Brushes, sprays, serums and shampoos. You name it. I was always willing to try anything new. Even spent lots of pretty pennies on the more kid friendly salon quality stuff.
So with that said, I can definitely say this detangling spray is one of the best we have ever used. It really has been great so far. Plus the scent is very nice. A two-pack of spray is going to last us a while; but I am certain that I'll be back for more. I really am happy with this product, so much so I'm going to go buy the body wash and shampoo now too! We're very happy and grateful!!!

title: Good, but not tear-free necessarily text: As a baby wash, I'd say this is a very good alternative to the more pricey J&J brand name stuff. It cleans, it doesn't irritate baby's skin. However, I'd avoid getting it in your eyes. I have a family member who had been told by a Doctor to use J&J baby wash on her eyes while she was recovering from something, since it wouldn't irritate her eyes and would help it heal faster.
The real stuff really doesn't hurt her eyes. However this brand left her eyes red and burning. So, I'd say as a replacement soap for baby this is fine, but maybe don't trust the tear-free part.

title: The only wipes we will use! text: The Huggies Simply Clean Frangrance Free wipes (yes, that specific) are THE only wipes we will use in this house anymore. Here's why we love them:

- quilted thick, so nothing breaks through to your fingers
- big enough that often only one wipe gets the job done
- NO fragrance, for real
- not sticky at ALL like some other wipes
- not too wet, but not too dry

We used these on our newborn, and they're gentle enough to use on face messes even.

title: Fun for baby...!!! text: Ordered the sloth and he’s Super sweet! This is a great snuggle for infants- as it has the creature features to make baby happy/content!

Material is soft. It has a 2 sided texture that babies seem to love. on x1 side its a fur like material with the tiny “animal head” popping out in the middle.. X2 side is a fun, striped soft cotton material (truly, I would have preferred this to be silky/satin, in leui of plain cotton.. babies seem to LoVe that feel so much- mine always found the satin trim edge on any blanket and would rub it raw!!)

Character is docile!! (Some of these animal faces can look a bit sketchy or, possessed.. and not in a good way! this guy is not like that.. he’s actually got a distinctive but, sweet sloth face!)

Love the knotted corners. As babies learn to explore- these types of touches and textures do matter! I loved these knots are tiny for even a newborn hand to grab onto as well..

Size matters!! This is equivalent in size, to the size of a burp cloth.. This makes it easy to carry, pack up and keep it light enough in weight to take anywhere. But No!! It is not a security blanket- in no way does this provide any type of blanket coverage.. just so you’re aware! (I’d hate anyone to think they ordered a blanket.. only receive a doll house version!! Trust me- That’s something I would do🤫..)

Washing: it’s been posted to hand wash item only?Tbh, I did not see that anywhere in my instructions or, on any tag..? So, I chose to try it in the machine. I’ve only washed x1.. and did so, on my “hand wash only cycle..” I did place this inside a lingerie bag- (my HWO cycle runs 13min. total w/ minimal h2o and LOW agitation/spinning..) results were as you’d expect a wet stuffed toy to look- However, one dryer cycle on delicate.. he came out fluffy, new + clean! *I’m sharing this in case, anyone is stuck in the y/n of machine washing.. it worked for me! (X1 knot was pulling loose but, easily fixed by a quick re-tie!)

$$ is compatible to similar items.. I chose this snuggle because I needed the particular animal- the sloth! Hopefully, this info can help you as you make your decision on your purchase.
If this helped out in any way.. feel free to let me know..!!

They stick on via 3M strips and line up so they are incredibly easy to install! It took seconds and we were good to go! The cabinet locks can be turned to always lock when closed which is a nice feature to save us time when getting into cabinets and keeping her really out of the ones she shouldn’t be in.
