title: Large & exceptionally well-made child's playpen; 45-pc assembly easy but requires strength text: For the current price of $99 ($129 minus $30), this playpen is an exceptional buy. It took me 1hr 15 min to assemble and then disassemble the playpen. I really wanted to see if it was portable and, although it can be easily carried around, I do not consider this portable.

There are a total of 46 pieces (not counting the manual) and 45 of the pieces have to be assembled. The 46th piece is the supplied carry bag. There are 8 each of the small, medium, and large rods. There are 8 T couplers, 4 top corners, and 4 bottom corners with suction cups. There are 4 colorful pull-up straps and the playpen itself.

I watched the video on Amazon to get hints about the assembly but the manual provides a good idea as well. All I needed to know was which bars went where and I had no need to read the instructions. The 8 medium bars get installed in their channels on the short end of the playpen (meaning the width). The 8 large bars get installed on the long end of the playpen (meaning the length). The 8 short bars get installed vertically (meaning these are the bars that hold up the walls of the playpen). The suction cup corners are for the 4 corners that meet the floor. The 4 plain corners are for the top and the 8 T couplers are for the center connections.

Installation was simple but it did take strength and sometimes turning the couplers to get them to seat into the hole. The last bar should be installed where the zippered channel is and once it is installed, the channel can be zippered up.

There are 4 colorful pull-up straps and they just snapped over the top bar around any area of the playpen I desired. There is a mesh toy pocket on the outside of the pen for storage. There are also two zippered doors. The zippers glide open and closed easily as I tested them several times.

I broke down the playpen in reverse (zippered channel first). Uninstalling the pen was easier than installing it. However, the entire process of assembly and disassembly took me 1 hr 15 min. All items easily fit into the carry bag.

In summary, this pen is large as can be seen in my photos. It took up most of my boyfriend's parlor. The pen is well made and very sturdy once assembled. There are two entryways. The zoo motif is also very attractive. Overall, I love everything about this playpen. It is exceptionally safe and the edges are covered for protection. Both parents will be able to fit in the pen. I consider this pen an excellent buy and the baby I got this for will enjoy it for several years.

title: Strong, does not fold, has chemical smell and add furniture pads on bottom text: I received the Kinbor Baby Kids Step Stool for my 2 year old daughter that loves to help me in the kitchen. It came packaged securely with instructions to build it yourself. It was very easy and took about 15 minutes to put together. The instructions don’t get a step-by-step breakdown but you honestly don’t need one. It comes with the screws plus an Alan wrench. When fully built, it is 3ft tall and 16 inches wide. It is fairly heavy and I was worried it was going to scratch my floors so I put felt furniture pads on the bottom which helps protect the floor plus making it easier for my daughter to push on her own. It is sturdy and safe. The platform can be adjusted to 3 separate heights. I have it on the bottom level which puts the backing about mid torso so no threat of her falling out. It can’t fold up so you do need a good amount of space to store this out of the way.

The other issue I had is the smell. It was omitting a strange, almost chemical like smell, the moment I opened the box. I do have a sensitive nose and it is so strong that I have to store it in the garage. It is getting better and not nearly as strong but I can still smell it after a week of receiving.

title: Seems to work

The padding is polyurethane foam. The pad comes with two 5/8" long screws. You're supposed to screw through the two nylon straps that are along one side of the pad and into the changing station (or furniture) to hold the pad in place. There is a snap safety belt to secure the baby on the pad if needed. The fabric on the pad is soft yet has a waterproof backing. The stitching is neat, and the pad looks well made. title: GREAT FOR TWINS AND TRAVEL!
text: We love this gate.  We have twins and take it to the in-law's home because they are not child proofed and have a wood stove to keep babies away from.  also we use it out on our deck, in the yard, and when we were replacing our carpets with wood flooring.  we have the octagonal gate because we bought the extensions.  the gate broke twice, once when I tripped and fell on it over a large toy and snapped it between me and the toy, and once we left it outside in a windstorm and it blew  off our deck into the neighbors yard which is a downhill drop.  we got the gate when they were under a year old and now they are almost 2 and we still use it.  it's big enough with the extension that we can all get in there to play, and in the yard they have fun in there but stay out of the road (we are a corner lot with no fence.)  We have also used it as a room divider. if you have a slippery floor (wood, linoleum) just put it on top of a big blanket or some of those foam puzzle mats.  it works great and won't scoot.  It took us several months to finish our floors and this was so helpful because they could watch us work on the floor on one side of the room while they played right there in sight.  One reviewer stated he wanted to set it up into a square, which is a bad idea: it is not structurally as stable as a square (if you buy the two panel extension, which I highly recommend) because the middle joints of the square shape don't have leverage when flat like they do when bent out. even a slight bend in the joint makes a huge difference. this is really a big play space, my husband and I are both tall and we can both get in there with the kids and play with them one on one with toys and when we have them in there alone it's really  enough space they don't care unless of course, they would rather be out doing what we are doing.  But when you need a safe space to put little ones in while you are doing something else, this has really been a great solution for us, I'm so glad I bought it.

title: The baby ergo soft structured carrier seems to work better for us now and keeps her more secure text: Got a lot of use out of mine, however once my daughter turned about 10 months or so, it didn't work so well for us since she would always try to wrangle herself (untuck?) out of it. The baby ergo soft structured carrier seems to work better for us now and keeps her more secure.

For smaller babies, this is great though for people that don't want to have deal with the wraps, like me. Mine does seem to stretch but goes back to original size after wash but I would go one size smaller to make sure you have a snug fit. If it's too loose, it's no good.

title: Super easy to set up out of the box. text: I ordered this 'Evenflo Pivot Xplore All-Terrain Stroller Wagon Wayfarer' for review some time ago and after some time with it myself, and then having my Sister-in-Law put it through it's paces with her 2 year old AND Newborn I would like to share my thoughts.
So this is an amazing stroller. It's very well constructed and super easy to set up and take down. Though the Wayfarer is big and roomy it folds down surprisingly compact for it's size which makes for easier storage. The wheels are very nice and push smoothly over just about any terrain. There is plenty of room to spare, even with both the 2 year old and newborn riders. Now it is a bit heavier than most strollers at almost 35 lbs, and that can be a much to lug around for a quick trip to the grocery store. However, the Wayfarer is absolutely perfect for the beach or Saturday Market and even just a little Picnic at the local park. The handle is nice and cushioned and with how effortlessly this pushes or pulls, even fully loaded makes it actually enjoyable to use for long periods. Overall this is a quality product that has great value for those in need of a reliable well designed stroller wagon!

Nonetheless, I was glad I had gotten it as I preferred the flatter, smaller size. The scoop dispenses exactly as much creamer as I want for a single cup of coffee. title: After testing for a day, we got rid of a portable crib and a portable play yard text: This is fabulous! It's the first truly portable solution we have found. My eleven month old wants to get into everything and be near all the activity. This is great because with almost zero effort, literally, three seconds. I can unfold or refills and pick up to take this into another room.

It has a series of straps at the base that you clip to the edges so the floor is taut, but I don't bother with those because it makes the yard less portable. You can't fold it with the straps snapped to the edges. So the floor for us just wiggles a bit as Talvi walks or scoots, which is no big deal.

It's also huge in comparison to other play pens. Twice the square footage. We leave it in the kitchen with a couple small lightweight toys and can easily fold up to bring into the backyard on the lawn or into another room.

Someone commented on the screws on the sides but those are not particularly rough nor do they stick out far, so I don't think it's a safety hazard.

You should know that this doesn't have a firm bottom, which is why it is so easy to transport. The bottom is just a flap of fabric do maybe can't lift the thing and leave, but there is no cushion or mattress and baby sets right on the ground, which is fine on lawn or carpet. In the kitchen you will want to only use it with older babies or a folded blanket down.

I love this and wish we'd known about it sooner.

title: works on our wood floors, gets stuck on thick rugs. text: This might be the easiest assembly I've ever done for any baby stuff. Everything clicks together easily. Most of the parts have quite a bit of flex. That being said, it feels a little on the flimsy side compared the baby einstein walker we had.

The height adjusts tabs are easy to use. The front wheels on this on are tiny. The rear wheels are little stiff. This walker has far better mobility on our hardwood floors than on our our rugs.

I read the other reviews about babies getting their fingers pinched in some of the toys and decided against installing them for now. It doesn't take much imagination to see how easily that could happen. You can see the design difference comparing this to the other safety 1st walker where the similar toy has more room.

One thing that I do like is that the corners have a lot of surface area for adding a foam bumper. That should help us with a little of the base board repair we had to do after the last one.

One last note, there a few hard edges and excess material shavings that have to be removed where the parts where cut.

Update: There are a few tabs that are used to hold attach the seat to the walker. These tabs are a bit long and they have sharp edges. There are two in the front right where the thighs are and can scratch the baby's legs.

Update: My nine month old has been using this for a while now. We're on the second notch. Works good on our stone tile floors. I just have to pick up the rugs otherwise it gets caught immediately. We're using all the toys minus the battery. No issues in that regard.

title: Five Stars
text: Very adorable for 1st birthday!

title: Great Set
text: This little silicone feeding bowl is great. It is entirely squishy silicone. The bottom sticks to the table. You can break the seal by pulling the little tab, but it really sticks hard. The spoon is also made of chewy silicone. My 6 month old likes to steal the spoon as a teether. It is hard to get it back. The bowl has a lid for travel or storage. It also has a little handle edge that makes holding it while feeding the baby much easier. Very useful little bowl and spoon!

title: Just get it text: I wanted this with my second baby but didn’t want to pay for it. Now I’m pregnant with my third and second is still in diapers. I wish I would have had it this whole time because it’s so easy to use!! Easy open, wipes stay wet, one wipe at a time. I use the Kirkland brand that comes in bags. Once you get to the bottom it’s hard to dispense at all, let alone one.

Is this a “need”? No. You can definitely survive without one. But it’s really nice to have and makes wiping tiny butts that much easier. After babies are done in diapers I’ll use it for flushable wipes.

title: Better Than Expected text: I’ve been using a baby carrier for the last 5+ years.
I love them!
I love the 360 carriers like these that work for all babies in all positions.
There are a few issues I’ve had with my existing carrier that this carrier solves:
- my other carrier has a Velcro around the waist - it’s great for quick on/off but it sometimes sticks to my clothes and ruins them - this carrier only has the heavy duty clip.
- my other carrier can get pretty warm in the summer - this carrier has built in panel to allow for better airflow.
- my other carrier doesn’t have a place to store a spare diaper, keys and my phone - this carrier has a pouch that zips to store those items in.

I was very skeptical about the pole. But man- it really does make a difference.
The pole is helpful when getting the child into the carrier.
I don’t use the pole on a daily basis when using the carrier, but what I do use it for is when I’m out with the kids and I know I’ll be standing around a long time - parades, amusement parks, ball games - these are times when the pole is awesome! In the past I’ve propped the seat of the child up on a fence or rail, sometimes on the back of a chair to add some relief. With the pole I tote around my own relief. Each section of about 8” folds down/up easily making it easy to assemble and store.
This is a well thought out carrier that is high quality and good, useful features.
I’m able to haul my 2.5yo and 5yo around in this carrier much easier than without it!
I tend to have a sore lower back and I can carry my kids around in this carrier much longer than I can without it.

** Thank you so much for taking the time to read my review.
I hope the information that I've provided helps to make your decision a little easier.
If you found this review helpful, please click the ‘Helpful’ button below.

title: It has the perfect amount of fluff for his little neck
text: My 16 month old toddler loves this pillow! It has the perfect amount of fluff for his little neck. He won't sleep without it now. I would definitely recommend this product to others!

title: Easy to use
text: I like that they fit just right into my baby’s mouth. They are also easy to clean and easy for him to hold. They are very sturdy and don’t look like they will tear or break off.

title: Well made text: This is a well-made diaper bag with lots of room. The inside has several pockets, two that are insulated. A changing pad is included. The top zips shut, although if you unsnap the sides to expand the size of the bag, you will have gaps at the both ends of the zipper as shown in my photo. However, that makes it easy to reach inside to access the two interior side pockets. There are two pockets on the outside, one of which zips.
The bag is cute with different teddy bears stitched and accented with gold trim’ the zipper and hardware are gold. The jacquard fabric is strong, it will not easily tear, but it does make the bag somewhat heavy, and that’s before it’s loaded with baby gear. The straps are shoulder-length and are not adjustable. Rivets on the bottom of the bag will keep it from sitting directly on the floor.
A nice bag that looks more like a tote than it does a diaper bag.

title: ... am a mom of four and these are our favorite diapers. When I heard they were made by ... text: I am a mom of four and these are our favorite diapers. When I heard they were made by the same people that make Pampers it was a no brainer to go with this more affordable option.

My children have almost never had a diaper rash, and my youngest daughters physician was checking her out the last visit and commented that it was the cleanest looking diaper area she's ever seen. No redness, irritation, and my babies seem to like them.

I also love that you can get these in the subscribe and save. It costs almost the same as Target, but the convenience factor is worth so much to me that I still prefer amazon if I plan ahead!

title: Put this on at night
text: I put this on at night just before going to sleep so it wouldn't be so greasy. The oil spreads easily and eventually soaks in, but if you are worried about getting oil on your nice clothes or upholstery I would do it at night. When you do, you will be rewarded with VERY soft and hydrated skin. My legs haven't felt so smooth in a very long time. It is very lightly scented, if at all.

title: Timeless Value and Use
text: We have had a household of up to 11 cats and some required weight monitoring so we purchased this online to avoid trips to the vet.  This scale is still going strong at over 3 years and we continue to put our kitties on it even today - some seem to be gaining a few extra pounds around the middle.  It is very accurate and our vet weighs in at almost the exact same - we think his scale may be off a bit.  I would recommend this to any cat owner who has a need for a scale. The scoop base has been perfect and seems to keep them on the scale just enough longer to get their weight. We have had 3 sleep in it at various times if we forget to put it away. Great product.

title: Sturdy and so very pretty! text: I can not say enough about this awesome basket. The size is perfect for my towels and it looks so good in my bathroom, it would also look great in a guest room for extra light covers, or even your craft room for yarn or fabric storage! The rope design is gorgeous and would fit with any decor.

The basket is woven in a wonderful secure fashion, there are no loose seams on the edges so there are no holes, no loose threads around the handles, they are secured and sturdy. I am not worried a bit about them breaking or falling apart. I love the rope basket look because it's rustic and this one really is a beauty. I am super happy to have it.

Overall, wonderful in crafting, secured handles, awesome size, very sturdy, and really attractive.
I have nothing negative to add at this time.
I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review. I was not paid for this review, this is exactly the way I feel about this item after using it.

title: A unique home surveillance/baby monitor solution text: A unique home surveillance/baby monitor solution in that it doesn't require an Internet/WiFi connection or a smart phone or the traditional RCA plugs and a television set. The unit is about the size of a smart phone and both the Parent and Child units are shiny Star-Wars-looking shiny white plastic. The picture is quite good, and there's a two-way microphone should you want to speak with someone near the camera unit. The camera requires a 120V outlet to plug into. The Parent unit has a battery pack but also plugs into a wall socket -- the manual tells me that the Parent unit will operate on battery power, but for a short time only. Perhaps so you can slip it in your pocket as you walk around your house? I'll have to sift through the manual to figure out the intricacies of this VTech camera and monitor, but judging from the quick start guide it's fairly robust and simple to understand. You can add additional Child units (up to four total) and then use "Patrol" mode which will go from camera to camera. The Child units also report on the temperature where they are. Very impressive overall. Ships with a mounting bracket, which is a nice touch, and the Parent unit has a little kickstand that allows you to place it on your desk.

Quite unique and impressive.

title: Gottem at a great price
text: Love these cups

title: not the best text: These forks are built great and work great in toddler hands. However, the size of the fork itself makes picking up food difficult. I understand it needing to be wide, but the way that they are built makes my toddler frustrated in attempting to use.

They are a great mix of “adult” and “baby”, to smooth that toddler transition. The grip and handle work great, and they are easy to wash. I love the feature of the stand under the handle that keeps the germs off the fork, and the food off my table.

title: A nice support seat for babies learning to sit up
text: Finally, something other than a Bumbo. This seat has adjustable legs to accommodate growing babies. I had a Bumbo but it didn't last long because the baby's little legs outgrew the leg holes. I like that this is cushioned and repels liquids. It also comes with three toys and side pockets. You can also add more toys with the extra loops. The cover is removable and washable to keep the seat sanitary. This seat helps babies sit up but you should always be present when using this seat or any seat.

title: Looking for a nightlight, you just found it!!
text: This is truly an awesome night light. Brightness levels, color options, and a remote to boot. I found that this company offers many different styles and sizes. I believe I got the larger one and it’s still a great buy. I’ll be getting another one later for my son. Thoroughly impressed with this!!

title: Cetaphil quality
text: Quite satisfied. Nice moisturizing. As advertised.

title: Well made
text: Great idea. Tall enough to unzip. Needed it to keep him in the crib. Product was very well designed otherwise. Very sturdy. Quality. Really nice.

title: Works good
text: Easy to stick. Liked it

title: It does the job
text: Not quite as street as it looks in the picture but it does the job

title: A very high quality product text: I am super impressed with this crib skirt. The color is true to the photo, and it has a very crisp, clean look that goes perfectly in my nursery. It fits on my standard size crib and hangs down just enough to give a classy look to the nursery. It is obviously made of very high quality fabric and is woven tightly. It also washes well and doesn't shrink in the wash.

Overall, I'm not sure what else to say about a product that is exactly as described and high quality in every way. The sedate color has not faded in the wash, and the fabric quality and color are just what I hoped for.

title: Dogs are finally out from underfoot!
text: Got gates to keep two medium-size dogs out from underfoot in the kitchen  Wanted ones that could be extended temporarily and quickly taken down; retractable was definitely the way to go.  The Smart Retract model is the longest one I found here, and was needed for a large entry.  We also got another, smaller one (different brand) for the other entry and are happy with both.  It seems pretty substantial and sturdy.  Will see how it lasts over the next few years.

title: Great clips
text: Great clips. Giving 3 stars because the picture is misleading. The shadow makes it look like your getting 3 clips, but there are only 2.

title: Ride up the butt text: These diapers fit my 5 and 3 year old but oddly.
They seem to ride up and give them a wedgey.
I put them on my 3 year old to see if the wedgey wouldn’t be an issue but it still was.
They do provide great leak protection day and night.
They seem like the bottom front is wider than it should be (helps with absorbing) and the back bottom area is not as wide as it needs to be (causing the wedgy).
Due to the width upfront they look awkward under leggings.
These diapers are heavily scented as I’ve come to expect from Pampers.

** Thank you so much for taking the time to read my review.
I hope the information that I've provided helps to make your decision a little easier.
If you found this review helpful, please click the ‘Helpful’ button below.

title: Attached easily to the mirror text: So I got the mirror for my car but thought it was hard to see my baby at night.

Got the light from the same brand as I thought it made sense to easily attach the mirror to the light. This was correct.

It worked great. It was easy to attach. It’s got a lot of light options and brightness level.

It’s easy to control and adjust. I like it a lot.

title: Not sturdy at all.
text: My German Shepherd can give this have a good shove and it’s pushed out of the doorway 😑 not very happy with this at all.

title: Great basket!
text: The basket is well made. The ropes are sewn together nicely. I like that it’s made of cotton rope. I use it to store my yoga straps, massage balls etc.  It is the right size for my use. The handles are nicely placed and it’s easy to carry around. I like the color and look. It is a perfect decorative piece in the yoga room. One can freely drag it on the hardwood floor without having to worry about leaving scratches. I highly recommend it.

title: Purchased this as a replacement battery for my IQ America ...
text: Purchased this as a replacement battery for my IQ America Wireless door bell Camera. I was a preface fit and less that 1/3 the cost of the original replacement battery.

title: Keeps booty clean
text: Always keep a pack of these in the rr next to the toilet paper.  Keep yo booty clean.

title: Great for dry skin young or old
text: It aveno so you know its quality stuff.  I love all aveno products as they are so gentel and non irritating.  These 2 are no different. Made for babies but honestly they work on adults or kids.  Great for those dry skin winter days or those allergy riden summer days.  So soothing on dry skin. I love there is such a mild scent that you barely notice it (i think its just the natural aveno scent as it smells like all their other products).  This one is another winner

title: Five Stars
text: My baby girl loves these sippy cups, and would buy again!
